translated_text: I explain that I'm taking music and also biology algebra English and French music. He's North.

text: POP IT'S A COURSE
translated_text: Pop, it's a course.

text: HE DOES AND FOR ONCE I WIN A ROUND I KEEP MUSIC FOR THIS SEMESTER
translated_text: He does, and for once I win around, I keep music for this semester.

text: I'LL BE LUCKY IF I HAVE TIME TO BREATHE
translated_text: I'll be lucky if I have time to breathe.

text: SOMETIMES SCHOOLS DO LET KIDS TAKE A LOT OF SOFT COURSES AND THEN THEY'RE OUT ON A LIMB LATER HUH
translated_text: Sometimes schools do let kids take a lot of soft courses, and then they're out on a limb later. Huh.

text: SO HE CARES HUH
translated_text: So he cares. Huh.

text: BESIDES SAYS TOM HALF THE REASON YOU AND YOUR FATHER ARE ALWAYS BICKERING IS THAT YOU'RE SO MUCH ALIKE ME LIKE HIM SURE
translated_text: Besides, says Tom. Half the reason you and your father are always bickering is that you're so much alike. Me, like him? Sure.

text: AS LONG AS THERE'S A BONE ON THE FLOOR THE TWO OF YOU WORRY IT
translated_text: As long as there's a bone on the floor, the two of you worry it.

text: I GET THE PILLOWS COMFORTABLY ARRANGED ON THE FLOOR WITH A BIG BOTTLE OF SODA AND A BAG OF POPCORN WITHIN EASY REACH
translated_text: I get the pillows comfortably arranged on the floor with a big bottle of soda and a bag of popcorn with an easy reach.

text: POP GOES RIGHT ON TUNING HIS CHANNEL
translated_text: Pop goes right on tuning his channel.

text: YOU'RE GETTING ALTOGETHER TOO UPSET ABOUT THESE PROGRAMS STOP IT AND BEHAVE YOURSELF
translated_text: You're getting altogether to upset about these programs. Stop it and behave yourself.

text: IT'S YOUR FAULT MOP IT UP YOURSELF
translated_text: It's your fault, mop it up yourself.

text: I HEAR THE T V GOING FOR A FEW MINUTES THEN POP TURNS IT OFF AND GOES IN THE KITCHEN TO TALK TO MOM
translated_text: I hear the TV going for a few minutes, then pop turns it off and goes in the kitchen to talk to mom.

text: WELL I DON'T THINK YOU SHOULD TURN A GUY'S T V PROGRAM OFF IN THE MIDDLE WITHOUT EVEN FINDING OUT ABOUT IT
translated_text: Well, I don't think you should turn a guy's TV program off in the middle without even finding out about it.

text: I LOOK AT MY WATCH IT'S A QUARTER TO ELEVEN
translated_text: I look at my watch. It's a quarter to eleven.

text: I TURN OFF THE TELEVISION SET I'VE LOST TRACK OF WHAT'S HAPPENING AND IT DOESN'T SEEM TO BE THE GRANDFATHER WHO'S THE SPOOK AFTER ALL
translated_text: I turn off the television set. I've lost track of what's happening and it doesn't seem to be the grandfather who's a spook after all.

text: IT'S THE FIRST TIME HILDA HAS BEEN TO OUR HOUSE AND TOM INTRODUCES HER AROUND
translated_text: It's the first time Hilda has been to our house, and Tom introduces her around.

text: I TOLD TOM WE SHOULDN'T COME SO LATE SAYS HILDA
translated_text: A tall time we shouldn't come so late to Zelda.

text: TOM SAYS THANKS AND LOOKS AT HILDA AND SHE BLUSHES REALLY
translated_text: Tom says thanks and looks at Hilda and she blushes. Really.

text: TOM DRINKS A LITTLE MORE COFFEE AND THEN HE GOES ON THE TROUBLE IS I CAN'T GET MARRIED ON THIS FLOWER SHOP JOB
translated_text: Tom drinks a little more coffee and then he goes on. The trouble is, I can't get married on this flower shop job.

text: YOU KNOW I'D GET DRAFTED IN A YEAR OR TWO ANYWAY
translated_text: You know, I'd get drafted in a year or two anyway.

text: I'VE DECIDED TO ENLIST IN THE ARMY
translated_text: I've decided to enlist in the Army.

text: I'LL HAVE TO CHECK SOME MORE SAYS TOM
translated_text: I'll have to check some more," says Talb.

text: HERE'S TO YOU A LONG HAPPY LIFE
translated_text: Here's to you, a long, happy life.

text: HOW INFINITE THE WEALTH OF LOVE AND HOPE GARNERED IN THESE SAME TINY TREASURE HOUSES AND OH
translated_text: How infinite the wealth of love and hope garnered in these same tiny treasure houses, and oh.

text: WHAT BANKRUPTS IN THE WORLD WE FEEL WHEN DEATH LIKE SOME REMORSELESS CREDITOR SEIZES ON ALL WE FONDLY THOUGHT OUR OWN THE TWINS
translated_text: What bankrupts in the world we feel when death, like some remorseless creditor ceases on all we fondly thought our own? The twins.

text: THE GHOUL LIKE FEVER WAS NOT TO BE BRAVED WITH IMPUNITY AND BAULKED OF ITS PREY
translated_text: The ghoul-like fever was not to be braved with impunity, and balked of its prey.

text: THE BOARD NOT SO FORMIDABLE AS SHE HAD IMAGINED HAD INQUIRED INTO HER CASE AND INSTEAD OF SENDING HER TO STOKE CLAYPOLE HER HUSBAND'S BUCKINGHAMSHIRE PARISH AS SHE HAD DREADED HAD AGREED TO PAY HER RENT
translated_text: The board, not so formidable as she had imagined, had inquired into her case, and, instead of sending her to stoke clay-pull, her husband's buckeom-shire-parish, as she had dreaded, had agreed to pay her rent.

text: MARGARET MET JEM WILSON SEVERAL DAYS AFTER HIS BROTHERS WERE SERIOUSLY ILL AND HEARD FROM HIM THE STATE OF THINGS AT HIS HOME
translated_text: Margaret met Jim Wilson several days after his brothers were seriously ill, and heard from him the state of things at his home.

text: SHE STOPPED WITH HER HAND ON THE LATCH OF THE WILSONS DOOR TO STILL HER BEATING HEART AND LISTENED TO THE HUSHED QUIET WITHIN
translated_text: She stopped with her hand on the latch of the Wilson's door to still her beating heart, and listened to the hushed quiet within.

text: SHE OPENED THE DOOR SOFTLY THERE SAT MISSUS WILSON IN THE OLD ROCKING CHAIR WITH ONE SICK DEATH LIKE BOY LYING ON HER KNEE CRYING WITHOUT LET OR PAUSE BUT SOFTLY GENTLY AS FEARING TO DISTURB THE TROUBLED GASPING CHILD WHILE BEHIND HER OLD ALICE LET HER FAST DROPPING TEARS FALL DOWN ON THE DEAD BODY OF THE OTHER TWIN WHICH SHE WAS LAYING OUT ON A BOARD PLACED ON A SORT OF SOFA SETTEE IN A CORNER OF THE ROOM
translated_text: She opened the door softly. There sat Mrs. Wilson in the old rocking-chair. With one sick, death-like boy lying on her knee, crying without let or pause. But softly, gently, as fearing to disturb the troubled gasping child while behind her, old Alice let her fast-dropping tears fall down on the dead body of the other twin, which she was laying out on a board placed on a sort of sofa sati in the corner of the room.

text: OVER THE CHILD WHICH YET BREATHED THE FATHER BENT WATCHING ANXIOUSLY FOR SOME GROUND OF HOPE WHERE HOPE THERE WAS NONE
translated_text: Over the child which yet breathed the Father bent, watching anxiously for some ground of hope, where hope there was none.

text: IS THERE ANY CHANCE FOR THE OTHER ONE THINK YOU
translated_text: Is there any chance for the other one? Thank you.

text: BUT EARNEST AS THE FATHER WAS IN WATCHING THE YET LIVING HE HAD EYES AND EARS FOR ALL THAT CONCERNED THE DEAD AND SPRANG GENTLY UP AND TOOK HIS DEAD SON ON HIS HARD COUCH IN HIS ARMS WITH TENDER STRENGTH AND CARRIED HIM UPSTAIRS AS IF AFRAID OF WAKENING HIM
translated_text: But earnest as the father was in watching the yet-living, he had eyes and ears for all that concerned the dead, and sprang gently up, and took his dead son on his hard couch in his arms with tender strength, and carried him upstairs as if afraid of wakening him.

text: WISHING HIM SAID MARY IN A TONE OF INQUIRY
translated_text: Wishing him said Mary in a tone of inquiry.

text: THEN THE MOTHER LIFTED UP HER VOICE AND WEPT
translated_text: Then the mother lifted up her voice and wept.

text: HER CRIES BROUGHT HER HUSBAND DOWN TO TRY WITH HIS ACHING HEART TO COMFORT HERS
translated_text: Her cries brought her husband down to try with his aching heart to comfort hers.

text: MARY AND ALICE DREW NEAR THE FIRE AND STOOD IN QUIET SORROW FOR SOME TIME
translated_text: Mary and Alice drew near the fire and stood in quiet sorrow for some time.

text: THEN ALICE BROKE THE SILENCE BY SAYING
translated_text: Then Alice broke the silence by saying

text: AFORE CHRISTMAS TIME I WAS AS FULL AS FULL COULD BE OF GOING HOME FOR GOOD AND ALL YO HAN HEARD HOW I'VE WISHED IT THIS TERRIBLE LONG TIME
translated_text: For Christmas time I was as full as full could be of going home for good and all. You and heard how I've wished it this terrible long time.

text: BUT HE STAYED LONG THERE AND AT LAST HIS STURDY FRAME SHOOK WITH HIS STRONG AGONY
translated_text: But he stayed long there, and at last his sturdy frame shook with his strong agony.

text: OH JEM DON'T GIVE WAY SO I CANNOT BEAR TO SEE YOU
translated_text: Oh, Gem, don't give way, so I cannot bear to see you.

text: HE DID NOT SPEAK AS THOUGH FEARING TO DESTROY BY SOUND OR MOTION THE HAPPINESS OF THAT MOMENT WHEN HER SOFT HAND'S TOUCH THRILLED THROUGH HIS FRAME AND HER SILVERY VOICE WAS WHISPERING TENDERNESS IN HIS EAR
translated_text: He did not speak, as though fearing to destroy by sound or motion the happiness of that moment when her soft hands touched thrilled through his frame, and her silvery voice was whispering tenderness in his ear.

text: DON'T JEM PLEASE DON'T WHISPERED SHE AGAIN BELIEVING THAT HIS SILENCE WAS ONLY ANOTHER FORM OF GRIEF
translated_text: Don't, Jim, please. Don't whispered she again, believing that his silence was only another form of grief.

text: MARY I ALMOST LOATHE MYSELF WHEN I FEEL I WOULD NOT GIVE UP THIS MINUTE WHEN MY BROTHERS LIE DEAD AND FATHER AND MOTHER ARE IN SUCH TROUBLE FOR ALL MY LIFE THAT'S PAST AND GONE AND MARY AS SHE TRIED TO RELEASE HER HAND YOU KNOW WHAT MAKES ME FEEL SO BLESSED
translated_text: Mary, I almost loathed myself when I feel I would not give up this minute when my brothers lie dead and father and mother are in such trouble for all my life that's passed and gone and Mary, as she tried to release her hand. You know what makes me feel so blessed.

text: HE REMAINED UP STAIRS UNTIL AFTER THE EARLY DAWN SHOWED MARY THAT SHE NEED HAVE NO FEAR OF GOING HOME THROUGH THE DESERTED AND QUIET STREETS TO TRY AND GET A LITTLE SLEEP BEFORE WORK HOUR
translated_text: He remained upstairs until after the early dawn showed Mary that she need have no fear of going home through the deserted and quiet streets to try and get a little sleep before work hour.

text: SO LEAVING KIND MESSAGES TO GEORGE AND JANE WILSON AND HESITATING WHETHER SHE MIGHT DARE TO SEND A FEW KIND WORDS TO JEM AND DECIDING THAT SHE HAD BETTER NOT SHE STEPPED OUT INTO THE BRIGHT MORNING LIGHT SO FRESH A CONTRAST TO THE DARKENED ROOM WHERE DEATH HAD BEEN
translated_text: So leaving kind messages to George and Jane Wilson, and hesitating whether she might dare to send a few kind words to Jim, and deciding that she had better not. She stepped out into the bright morning light, so fresh a contrast to the darkened room where death had been.

text: HER THOUGHTS RAN ON JEM'S MANNER AND WORDS NOT BUT WHAT SHE HAD KNOWN THE TALE THEY TOLD FOR MANY A DAY BUT STILL SHE WISHED HE HAD NOT PUT IT SO PLAINLY
translated_text: Her thoughts ran on Jim's manner in words, not but what she had known the tale they told for many a day, but still she wished he had not put it so plainly.

text: I CANNOT THINK WHAT POSSESSES ME THAT I MUST ALWAYS BE WANTING TO COMFORT HIM WHEN HE'S DOWNCAST AND THAT I MUST GO MEDDLING WI HIM TO NIGHT WHEN SURE ENOUGH IT WAS HIS AUNT'S PLACE TO SPEAK TO HIM
translated_text: I cannot think what possesses me, that I must always be wanting to comfort him when he's downcast, and that I must go meddling with him tonight, when sure enough it was his aunt's place to speak to him.

text: I THINK I CANNOT GO RIGHT FOR I EITHER CHECK MYSELF TILL I'M DOWNRIGHT CROSS TO HIM OR ELSE I SPEAK JUST NATURAL AND THAT'S TOO KIND AND TENDER BY HALF
translated_text: I think I cannot go right, for I either checked myself till I'm downright crossed to him, or else I speak just natural, and that's too kind and tender by half.

text: BUT WILL HE THANK ME FOR IT
translated_text: But will he think before it?

text: THERE WAS SOMETHING OF KEEN PRACTICAL SHREWDNESS ABOUT HER WHICH CONTRASTED VERY BEWITCHINGLY WITH THE SIMPLE FOOLISH UNWORLDLY IDEAS SHE HAD PICKED UP FROM THE ROMANCES WHICH MISS SIMMONDS YOUNG LADIES WERE IN THE HABIT OF RECOMMENDING TO EACH OTHER YES
translated_text: There was something of keen, practical shrewdness about her, which contrasted very bewitchingly with the simple, foolish, unwirldly ideas she had picked up from the romances which Miss Simmons, young ladies, were in the habit of recommending to each other. Yes.

text: THE OLD LEAVEN INFUSED YEARS AGO BY HER AUNT ESTHER FERMENTED IN HER LITTLE BOSOM AND PERHAPS ALL THE MORE FOR HER FATHER'S AVERSION TO THE RICH AND THE GENTLE
translated_text: The old leaven infused years ago by her on-tester fermented in her little bosom, and perhaps all the more for her father's aversion to the rich and the gentle.

text: IT WAS A COMFORT TO HER WHEN SCOLDED BY MISS SIMMONDS TO THINK OF THE DAY WHEN SHE WOULD DRIVE UP TO THE DOOR IN HER OWN CARRIAGE TO ORDER HER GOWNS FROM THE HASTY TEMPERED YET KIND DRESSMAKER
translated_text: It was a comfort to her when scolded by Miss Simmons to think of the day when she would drive up to the door in her own carriage to order her gowns from the hasty tempered yet kind dressmaker.

text: BUT THE BEST OF HER PLANS THE HOLIEST THAT WHICH IN SOME MEASURE REDEEMED THE VANITY OF THE REST WERE THOSE RELATING TO HER FATHER HER DEAR FATHER NOW OPPRESSED WITH CARE AND ALWAYS A DISHEARTENED GLOOMY PERSON
translated_text: But the best of her plans, the holiest, that which in some measure redeemed the vanity of the rest, were those relating to her father, her dear father. Now pressed with care and always a disheartened gloomy person,

text: THEY SAT ABOUT THE HOUSE MOST OF THE DAY AS IF IT WERE SUNDAY GREASING THEIR BOOTS MENDING THEIR SUSPENDERS PLAITING WHIPLASHES
translated_text: They sought about the house most of the day, as if it were Sunday, greasing their boots, mending their suspenders, plating whiplashes.

text: ANYWAY HE WOULD NEVER ALLOW ONE OF HIS HORSES TO BE PUT TO SUCH A STRAIN
translated_text: Anyway, he would never allow one of his horses to be put to such a strain.

text: I HAD WANTED TO GET SOME PICTURE BOOKS FOR YULKA AND ANTONIA EVEN YULKA WAS ABLE TO READ A LITTLE NOW
translated_text: I had wanted to get some picture books for Yulka and Antonia. Even Yulka was able to read a little now.

text: SHE CUT SQUARES OF COTTON CLOTH AND WE SEWED THEM TOGETHER INTO A BOOK
translated_text: She cut squares of cotton cloth and we sewed them together into a book.

text: ON THE WHITE PAGES I GROUPED SUNDAY SCHOOL CARDS AND ADVERTISING CARDS WHICH I HAD BROUGHT FROM MY OLD COUNTRY
translated_text: On the white pages I grouped Sunday school cards and advertising cards which I had brought from my old country.

text: WHEN HE MOUNTED HIS HORSE AT THE DOOR I SAW THAT HE HAD A HATCHET SLUNG TO HIS BELT AND HE GAVE GRANDMOTHER A MEANING LOOK WHICH TOLD ME HE WAS PLANNING A SURPRISE FOR ME
translated_text: When he mounted his horse at the door, I saw that he had a hatchet slung to his belt, and he gave grandmother a meaning look, which told me he was planning a surprise for me.

text: I PUT ON MY CAP AND RAN OUT TO MEET JAKE
translated_text: I put on my cap and ran out to meet Jake.

text: HE USED TO HELP MY FATHER CUT CHRISTMAS TREES FOR ME IN VIRGINIA AND HE HAD NOT FORGOTTEN HOW MUCH I LIKED THEM
translated_text: He used to help my father cut Christmas trees for me in Virginia, and he had not forgotten how much I liked them.

text: BY THE TIME WE HAD PLACED THE COLD FRESH SMELLING LITTLE TREE IN A CORNER OF THE SITTING ROOM IT WAS ALREADY CHRISTMAS EVE
translated_text: By the time we had placed the cold, fresh-smelling little tree in a corner of the sitting room, it was already Christmas Eve.

text: FROM UNDER THE LINING HE NOW PRODUCED A COLLECTION OF BRILLIANTLY COLORED PAPER FIGURES SEVERAL INCHES HIGH AND STIFF ENOUGH TO STAND ALONE
translated_text: From under the lining he now produced a collection of brilliantly colored paper figures, several inches high and stiff enough to stand alone.

text: I CAN SEE THEM NOW EXACTLY AS THEY LOOKED WORKING ABOUT THE TABLE IN THE LAMPLIGHT JAKE WITH HIS HEAVY FEATURES SO RUDELY MOULDED THAT HIS FACE SEEMED SOMEHOW UNFINISHED OTTO WITH HIS HALF EAR AND THE SAVAGE SCAR THAT MADE HIS UPPER LIP CURL SO FEROCIOUSLY UNDER HIS TWISTED MUSTACHE
translated_text: I can see them now, exactly as they looked, working about the table in the lamp light. Jake with his heavy features so rudely molded that his face seemed somehow unfinished. Otto with his half ear and the savage scar that made his upper lip curl so ferociously under his twisted moustache.

text: GRANDFATHER CAME DOWN WEARING A WHITE SHIRT AND HIS SUNDAY COAT
translated_text: grandfather came down wearing a white shirt and his Sunday coat.

text: MORNING PRAYERS WERE LONGER THAN USUAL
translated_text: Morning prayers were longer than usual.

text: HE GAVE THANKS FOR OUR FOOD AND COMFORT AND PRAYED FOR THE POOR AND DESTITUTE IN GREAT CITIES WHERE THE STRUGGLE FOR LIFE WAS HARDER THAN IT WAS HERE WITH US
translated_text: He gave thanks for our food and comfort, and prayed for the poor and destitute in great cities, where the struggle for life was harder than it was here with us.

text: BECAUSE HE TALKED SO LITTLE HIS WORDS HAD A PECULIAR FORCE THEY WERE NOT WORN DULL FROM CONSTANT USE
translated_text: Because he talked so little, his words had a peculiar force. They were not worn dull from constant use.

text: ALL AFTERNOON HE SAT IN THE DINING ROOM
translated_text: All afternoon he sat in the dining room.

text: AT ABOUT FOUR O'CLOCK A VISITOR APPEARED MISTER SHIMERDA WEARING HIS RABBIT SKIN CAP AND COLLAR AND NEW MITTENS HIS WIFE HAD KNITTED
translated_text: At about four o'clock, a visitor appeared. Mr. Shamirda, wearing his rabbit skin cap in collar, and new mittens, his wife had knitted.

text: HE SAT STILL AND PASSIVE HIS HEAD RESTING AGAINST THE BACK OF THE WOODEN ROCKING CHAIR HIS HANDS RELAXED UPON THE ARMS
translated_text: He sat still and a passive, his head resting against the back of the wooden rocking chair, his hands relaxed upon the arms.

text: HIS FACE HAD A LOOK OF WEARINESS AND PLEASURE LIKE THAT OF SICK PEOPLE WHEN THEY FEEL RELIEF FROM PAIN
translated_text: His face had a look of weariness and pleasure, like that of sick people when they feel relief from pain.

text: HE MADE THE SIGN OF THE CROSS OVER ME PUT ON HIS CAP AND WENT OFF IN THE DARK
translated_text: He made the sign of the cross over me, put on his cap, and went off in the dark.

text: THE WEEK FOLLOWING CHRISTMAS BROUGHT IN A THAW AND BY NEW YEAR'S DAY ALL THE WORLD ABOUT US WAS A BROTH OF GRAY SLUSH AND THE GUTTERED SLOPE BETWEEN THE WINDMILL AND THE BARN WAS RUNNING BLACK WATER
translated_text: The week following Christmas brought in a thaw, and by New Year's Day all the world about us was a broth of grey slush, and the guttered slope between the windmill and the barn was running black water.

text: IT WAS THE FIRST TIME MISSUS SHIMERDA HAD BEEN TO OUR HOUSE AND SHE RAN ABOUT EXAMINING OUR CARPETS AND CURTAINS AND FURNITURE ALL THE WHILE COMMENTING UPON THEM TO HER DAUGHTER IN AN ENVIOUS COMPLAINING TONE
translated_text: It was the first time Mrs. Shemerda had been to our house, and she ran about examining our carpets and curtains and furniture, all the while commenting upon them to her daughter in an envious complaining tone.

text: YOUR MAMA I SAID ANGRILY WANTS OTHER PEOPLE'S THINGS
translated_text: Your mama, I said angrily wants other people's things.

text: FOR AMBROSCH MY MAMA COME HERE
translated_text: For Ambrose, my mama come here.

text: BUT YOU SEE A BODY NEVER KNOWS WHAT TRAITS POVERTY MIGHT BRING OUT IN EM
translated_text: But you see, a lot he never knows what trait's poverty might bring out in him.

text: THEY BEGAN TO LAUGH BOISTEROUSLY WHEN THEY SAW ME CALLING
translated_text: They began to laugh boisterously when they saw me calling.

text: YOU'VE GOT A BIRTHDAY PRESENT THIS TIME JIM AND NO MISTAKE
translated_text: You've got a birthday present this time, Jim, in no mistake.

text: SHE WAS FOUR YEARS OLDER THAN I TO BE SURE AND HAD SEEN MORE OF THE WORLD BUT I WAS A BOY AND SHE WAS A GIRL AND I RESENTED HER PROTECTING MANNER
translated_text: She was four years older than I, to be sure, and had seen more of the world. But I was a boy and she was a girl, and I resented her protecting manner.

text: THIS CHANGE CAME ABOUT FROM AN ADVENTURE WE HAD TOGETHER
translated_text: This change came about from an adventure we had together.

text: ONE DAY WHEN I RODE OVER TO THE SHIMERDAS I FOUND ANTONIA STARTING OFF ON FOOT FOR RUSSIAN PETER'S HOUSE TO BORROW A SPADE AMBROSCH NEEDED
translated_text: One day when I rode over to the Shmeredas, I found Antonya starting off on foot for Russian Peter's house to borrow a spade and broached needed.

text: THERE HAD BEEN ANOTHER BLACK FROST THE NIGHT BEFORE AND THE AIR WAS CLEAR AND HEADY AS WINE
translated_text: There had been another black frost the night before, and the air was clear and heady is wine.

text: IT WAS ON ONE OF THESE GRAVEL BEDS THAT I MET MY ADVENTURE
translated_text: It was on one of these gravel beds that I met my adventure.

text: I WHIRLED ROUND AND THERE ON ONE OF THOSE DRY GRAVEL BEDS WAS THE BIGGEST SNAKE I HAD EVER SEEN
translated_text: I world-round and there on one of those dry gravel beds was the biggest snake I had ever seen.

text: I KNOW I AM JUST AWFUL JIM I WAS SO SCARED
translated_text: I know I'm just awful, Jim. I was so scared.

text: I NEVER KNOW YOU WAS SO BRAVE JIM SHE WENT ON COMFORTINGLY
translated_text: I never know you were so brave, Jim. She went on comfortingly.

text: A FAINT FETID SMELL CAME FROM HIM AND A THREAD OF GREEN LIQUID OOZED FROM HIS CRUSHED HEAD
translated_text: A faint, fetted smell came from him, and a thread of green liquid oozed from his crushed head.

text: LOOK TONY THAT'S HIS POISON I SAID
translated_text: Look, Tony, that's his poison, I said.

text: I EXPLAINED TO ANTONIA HOW THIS MEANT THAT HE WAS TWENTY FOUR YEARS OLD THAT HE MUST HAVE BEEN THERE WHEN WHITE MEN FIRST CAME LEFT ON FROM BUFFALO AND INDIAN TIMES
translated_text: I explained to Antonya how this meant that he was 24 years old, that he must have been there when white men first came, left on from buffalo and Indian times.

text: WE DECIDED THAT ANTONIA SHOULD RIDE DUDE HOME AND I WOULD WALK
translated_text: We decided that Antnea should ride dude home and I would walk.

text: I FOLLOWED WITH THE SPADE OVER MY SHOULDER DRAGGING MY SNAKE
translated_text: I followed with a spade over my shoulder, dragging my snake.

text: OTTO FUCHS WAS THE FIRST ONE WE MET
translated_text: Otto Fuchs was the first one we met.

text: HE COULD STAND RIGHT UP AND TALK TO YOU HE COULD DID HE FIGHT HARD
translated_text: You could stand right up and talk to you. He could. Did he fight hard?

text: OTTO WINKED AT ME
translated_text: I don't winked at me.

text: A SNAKE OF HIS SIZE IN FIGHTING TRIM WOULD BE MORE THAN ANY BOY COULD HANDLE
translated_text: A snake of his size and fighting trim would be more than a boy could handle.

text: PETER TOLD HIS TROUBLES TO MISTER SHIMERDA HE WAS UNABLE TO MEET A NOTE WHICH FELL DUE ON THE FIRST OF NOVEMBER HAD TO PAY AN EXORBITANT BONUS ON RENEWING IT AND TO GIVE A MORTGAGE ON HIS PIGS AND HORSES AND EVEN HIS MILK COW
translated_text: Peter told his troubles to Mr. Shimera. He was unable to meet a note which fell due on the 1st of November, had to pay an exorbitant bonus on renewing it, and to give a mortgage on his pigs and horses and even his milk cow.

text: PETER COULD GIVE NO VERY CLEAR ACCOUNT OF HIS TRANSACTIONS WITH CUTTER
translated_text: Peter could give no very clear account of his transactions with Qatar.

text: SHE ASKED PETER TO WAIT A MOMENT AND WHEN SHE CAME BACK FROM THE KITCHEN SHE BROUGHT A BAG OF SANDWICHES AND DOUGHNUTS FOR US
translated_text: She asked Peter to wait a moment, and when she came back from the kitchen, she brought a bag of sandwiches and donuts for us.

text: WE LAY STILL AND DID NOT TALK
translated_text: We lay still and did not talk.

text: THE LITTLE HOUSE ON THE HILLSIDE WAS SO MUCH THE COLOR OF THE NIGHT THAT WE COULD NOT SEE IT AS WE CAME UP THE DRAW
translated_text: The little house on the hillside was so much the color of the night that we could not see it as we came up the draw.

text: THEY MADE ME THINK OF DEFEATED ARMIES RETREATING OR OF GHOSTS WHO WERE TRYING DESPERATELY TO GET IN FOR SHELTER AND THEN WENT MOANING ON
translated_text: They made me think of defeated armies retreating or of ghosts who were trying desperately to get in for shelter. And then went moaning on.

text: I COULD NOT TAKE MY EYES OFF THE MAN IN THE BED
translated_text: I could not take my eyes off the man in the bed.

text: THE SHARP SMELL OF SPIRITS WENT THROUGH THE ROOM
translated_text: The sharp smell of spirits went through the room.

text: IT SEEMED TO ME THAT HE DESPISED HIM FOR BEING SO SIMPLE AND DOCILE
translated_text: It seemed to me that he despised him for being so simple and docile.

text: THE SICK MAN RAGED AND SHOOK HIS FIST
translated_text: The sick man raged and shook his fist.

text: HE SEEMED TO BE CURSING PEOPLE WHO HAD WRONGED HIM
translated_text: he seemed to be cursing people who had wronged him.

text: QUICKLY IT WAS COVERED WITH BRIGHT RED SPOTS I THOUGHT I HAD NEVER SEEN ANY BLOOD SO BRIGHT
translated_text: Quickly, it was covered with bright red spots. I thought I had never seen any blood so bright.

text: HE LAY PATIENTLY FIGHTING FOR BREATH LIKE A CHILD WITH CROUP
translated_text: He lay patiently fighting for breath like a child with a group.

text: ANTONIA'S FATHER UNCOVERED ONE OF HIS LONG BONY LEGS AND RUBBED IT RHYTHMICALLY
translated_text: Antony is father uncovered one of his long, bony legs and rubbed it with mically.

text: FROM OUR BENCH WE COULD SEE WHAT A HOLLOW CASE HIS BODY WAS
translated_text: From our bench, we could see what a hollow case his body was.

text: GRADUALLY RELIEF CAME TO ALL OF US
translated_text: Gradually, relief came to all of us.

text: WITHOUT A WORD PETER GOT UP AND LIT HIS LANTERN
translated_text: Without a word, Peter got up and lit his lantern.

text: MISTER SHIMERDA WENT WITH HIM
translated_text: Mr. Shamarita went with him.

text: AFTER THE CEREMONY AT THE CHURCH THE PARTY WENT TO A DINNER GIVEN BY THE PARENTS OF THE BRIDE
translated_text: After the ceremony at the church, the party went to a dinner given by the parents of the bride.

text: THE FIRST HOWLS WERE TAKEN UP AND ECHOED AND WITH QUICKENING REPETITIONS
translated_text: The first hulls were taken up and echoed with quickening repetitions.

text: A BLACK DROVE CAME UP OVER THE HILL BEHIND THE WEDDING PARTY
translated_text: A black drove came up over the hill behind the wedding party.

text: SOMETHING HAPPENED TO THE HINDMOST SLEDGE THE DRIVER LOST CONTROL HE WAS PROBABLY VERY DRUNK THE HORSES LEFT THE ROAD THE SLEDGE WAS CAUGHT IN A CLUMP OF TREES AND OVERTURNED
translated_text: Something happened to the hindmost sledge. The driver lost control. He was probably very drunk. The horses left the road. The sledge was caught up in a clump of trees and overturned.

text: THE SHRIEKS THAT FOLLOWED MADE EVERYBODY SOBER
translated_text: The shrieks that followed meant everybody sober.

text: THE ROAD WAS CLEAR AND WHITE AND THE GROOM'S THREE BLACKS WENT LIKE THE WIND
translated_text: The road was clear and white and the groom's three blacks went like the wind.

text: THERE ARE ONLY THREE SLEDGES LEFT HE WHISPERED
translated_text: There are only three sledge left, you whispered.

text: AND THE WOLVES PAVEL ASKED ENOUGH ENOUGH FOR ALL OF US
translated_text: and the wolves' pavolast, enough for all of us.

text: THEY WERE WITHIN A FEW MILES OF THEIR VILLAGE NOW
translated_text: They were within a few miles of their village now.

text: YES HOW MANY
translated_text: Yes. How many?

text: TWENTY THIRTY ENOUGH
translated_text: 20, 30, enough.

text: NOW HIS MIDDLE HORSE WAS BEING ALMOST DRAGGED BY THE OTHER TWO
translated_text: Now, his middle horse was being almost dragged by the other two.

text: PAVEL KNOCKED HIM OVER THE SIDE OF THE SLEDGE AND THREW THE GIRL AFTER HIM
translated_text: Pavel knocked him over the side of the sledge and threw the girl after him.

text: PETER CROUCHING IN THE FRONT SEAT SAW NOTHING
translated_text: Peter, crouching in the front seat saw nothing.

text: THE FIRST THING EITHER OF THEM NOTICED WAS A NEW SOUND THAT BROKE INTO THE CLEAR AIR LOUDER THAN THEY HAD EVER HEARD IT BEFORE THE BELL OF THE MONASTERY OF THEIR OWN VILLAGE RINGING FOR EARLY PRAYERS
translated_text: The first thing either of them noticed was a new sound that broke into the clean air. Louder than they had ever heard it before. The bell of the monastery of their own village ringing for early prayers.

text: THEY WERE RUN OUT OF THEIR VILLAGE
translated_text: They were run out of their village.

text: WHEREVER THEY WENT THE STORY FOLLOWED THEM
translated_text: Wherever they went, the story followed them.

text: THEY WORKED IN CHICAGO DES MOINES FORT WAYNE BUT THEY WERE ALWAYS UNFORTUNATE
translated_text: They worked in Chicago, Des Moines, Fort Wayne, but they were always unfortunate.

text: DURING THE AUCTION HE WENT ABOUT WITH HIS HEAD DOWN AND NEVER LIFTED HIS EYES
translated_text: During the auction, he went about with his head down and never lifted his eyes.

text: EVERY ONE SAID PETER KISSED THE COW BEFORE SHE WAS LED AWAY BY HER NEW OWNER
translated_text: Everyone said Peter kissed the cow before she was led away by her new owner.

text: THE LOSS OF HIS TWO FRIENDS HAD A DEPRESSING EFFECT UPON OLD MISTER SHIMERDA
translated_text: The loss of his two friends had a depressing effect upon old Mr. Shamarida.

text: WHEN HE WAS OUT HUNTING HE USED TO GO INTO THE EMPTY LOG HOUSE AND SIT THERE BROODING
translated_text: When he was out hunting, he used to go into the empty log house and sit there brooding.

text: THIS CABIN WAS HIS HERMITAGE UNTIL THE WINTER SNOWS PENNED HIM IN HIS CAVE
translated_text: This cabin was his hermitage until the winter snow was penned him in his cave.

text: THROUGHOUT THIS CENTURY THE POWER OF THE CHURCH WAS CONSTANTLY ON THE INCREASE AND IS VISIBLE IN MANY IMPORTANT CHANGES
translated_text: Throughout this century, the power of the Church was constantly on the increase and is visible in many important changes.

text: THE ANCESTORS OF THE PRESENT PRETENDER CONGAL SURNAMED THE SQUINT EYED HAD TWICE RECEIVED AND CHERISHED THE LICENTIOUS BARDS WHEN UNDER THE BAN OF TARA AND HIS POPULARITY WITH THAT STILL POWERFUL ORDER WAS ONE PROP OF HIS AMBITION
translated_text: The ancestors of the present pretender, Kongel, surnamed the squint-eyed, had twice received and cherished the licentious bards when under the ban of Tara, and his popularity with that still powerful order was one prop of his ambition.

text: IT IS PRETTY CLEAR ALSO THAT THE LAST RALLY OF DRUIDISM AGAINST CHRISTIANITY TOOK PLACE BEHIND HIS BANNER ON THE PLAIN OF MOIRA
translated_text: It is pretty clear also that the last rally of druidism against Christianity took place behind his banner on the plane of Moira.

text: THE POETS OF SUCCEEDING AGES HAVE DWELT MUCH IN DETAIL ON THE OCCURRENCES OF THIS MEMORABLE DAY
translated_text: The poets of succeeding ages have dwelt much in detail on the occurrences of this memorable day.

text: LIKE THE TWO KINGS OF SPARTA THEY REIGNED JOINTLY DIVIDING BETWEEN THEM THE LABOURS AND CARES OF STATE
translated_text: Like the two kings of Sparta, they ran jointly, dividing between them the labors and cares of state.

text: IT WAS THE SEASON WHEN THE ANCIENT SUN GOD HAD BEEN ACCUSTOMED TO RECEIVE HIS ANNUAL OBLATIONS AND WE CAN WELL BELIEVE THAT THOSE WHOSE HEARTS STILL TREMBLED AT THE NAME OF BEL MUST HAVE CONNECTED THE ECLIPSE AND THE PLAGUE WITH THE REVOLUTION IN THE NATIONAL WORSHIP AND THE OVERTHROW OF THE ANCIENT GODS ON THAT PLAIN OF PROSTRATION WHERE THEY HAD SO LONG RECEIVED THE HOMAGE OF AN ENTIRE PEOPLE
translated_text: It was the season when the ancient sun god had been accustomed to receive his annual ablations, and we can well believe that those whose hearts still tremble that the name of Bell must have connected the eclipse and the plague with the revolution in the national worship and the overthrow of the ancient gods on that plain of prostration, where they had so long received the homage of an entire people.

text: LASTLY THE ROYAL BROTHERS FELL THEMSELVES VICTIMS TO THE EPIDEMIC WHICH SO SADLY SIGNALIZES THEIR REIGN
translated_text: Lastly, the royal brothers fell themselves victims to the epidemic, which so sadly signalizes their reign.

text: THE ONLY CONFLICTS THAT OCCURRED ON IRISH SOIL WITH A PICTISH OR AN ANGLO SAXON FORCE IF WE EXCEPT THOSE WHO FORMED A CONTINGENT OF CONGAL'S ARMY AT MOIRA OCCURRED IN THE TIME OF THE HOSPITABLE FINNACTA
translated_text: The only conflicts that occurred an Irish soil with a pictiche or an Anglo-Sexon force. If we accept those who formed a contingent of Congolese army at Moira, occurred in the time of the hospitable finnachta.

text: AS LEADING TO THE MENTION OF OTHER INTERESTING EVENTS WE MUST SET THIS INROAD CLEARLY BEFORE THE READER
translated_text: As leading to the mention of other interesting events, we must set this enrolled clearly before the reader.

text: THE SAXONS OF KENT AND THE SOUTHERN KINGDOMS GENERALLY WERE CONVERTED BY MISSIONARIES FROM FRANCE OR ROME OR NATIVE PREACHERS OF THE FIRST OR SECOND CHRISTIAN GENERATION THOSE OF NORTHUMBRIA RECOGNISE AS THEIR APOSTLES SAINT AIDAN AND SAINT CUTHBERT TWO FATHERS FROM IONA
translated_text: The Saxons of Kent and the Southern Kingdoms generally were converted by missionaries from France or Rome, or native preachers of the first or second Christian generation. Those of Northumbria recognizes their apostles St. Aiden and St. Cuthbert, two fathers from Iona.

text: THE KINGDOM OF NORTHUMBRIA AS THE NAME IMPLIES EMBRACED NEARLY ALL THE COUNTRY FROM THE HUMBER TO THE PICTISH BORDER
translated_text: The Kingdom of Northumbria, as the name implies, embraced nearly all the country from the Humber to the Pictish border.

text: THE BARREN ROCK ABOUT THREE MILES IN LENGTH WAS COVERED WITH MONASTIC BUILDINGS AND ITS CEMETERY WAS ALREADY ADORNED WITH THE TOMBS OF SAINTS AND KINGS
translated_text: The barren rock about three miles in length was covered with monastic buildings, and its cemetery was already adorned with the tombs of saints and kings.

text: NOW EVERY MISSIONARY THAT EVER WENT OUT FROM IONA HAD TAUGHT THAT TO REDUCE CHRISTIANS TO SLAVERY WAS WHOLLY INCONSISTENT WITH A BELIEF IN THE DOCTRINES OF THE GOSPEL
translated_text: Now every missionary that ever went out from Ayona had taught that to reduce Christians to slavery was wholly inconsistent with a belief in the doctrines of the gospel.

text: WHILE THE LIBERATED EXILES REJOICED ON THE PLAIN OF MEATH THE TENT OF THE ABBOT OF IONA WAS PITCHED ON THE RATH OF TARA A FACT WHICH WOULD SEEM TO INDICATE THAT ALREADY IN LITTLE MORE THAN A CENTURY SINCE THE INTERDICT HAD FALLEN ON IT THE EDIFICES WHICH MADE SO FINE A SHOW IN THE DAYS OF PATRICK WERE RUINED AND UNINHABITABLE
translated_text: While the liberated exiles rejoiced on the plane of Meef, the tent of the Abbott of Iona was pitched on the wrath of Tara, a fact which would seem to indicate that already, in little more than a century since the interdict had fallen on it, the edifices which made so fine a show in the days of Patrick were ruined and uninhabitable.

text: SO SLOW AND PATIENT IS THE PROCESS BY WHICH CHRISTIANITY INFUSES ITSELF INTO THE SOCIAL LIFE OF A CONVERTED PEOPLE
translated_text: So, slow inpatient is the process by which Christianity infuses itself into the social life of a converted people.

text: HERE THE HOLY PRELATE OF FERNS MET HIM AND RELATED A VISION IN WHICH HE HAD BEEN INSTRUCTED TO DEMAND THE ABOLITION OF THE IMPOST
translated_text: Here, the holy prelate of ferns met him and related a vision in which he had been instructed to demand the abolition of the impost.

text: THE TRIBUTE WAS AT THIS PERIOD ENORMOUS FIFTEEN THOUSAND HEAD OF CATTLE ANNUALLY
translated_text: The tribute was at this period enormous. 15,000 head of cattle annually.

text: SAINT MOLING SURVIVED HIM THREE YEARS AND SAINT ADAMNAN SO INTIMATELY CONNECTED WITH HIS REIGN TEN YEARS
translated_text: St. Moline survived him three years, and St. Adamnan so intimately connected with his reign ten years.

text: NOTHING COULD BE MORE NATURAL THAN SUCH AN ASSEMBLY IN SUCH A PLACE AT SUCH A PERIOD
translated_text: Nothing could be more natural than such an assembly in such a place at such a period.

text: KIRKLEATHAM YEAST
translated_text: Kirkley Thym Yeast.

text: SEVENTEEN SEVENTEEN
TO MAKE GOOD HOME MADE BREAD
translated_text: to make good homemade bread.

text: SEVENTEEN EIGHTEEN

MODE PUT THE FLOUR INTO A LARGE EARTHENWARE BOWL OR DEEP PAN THEN WITH A STRONG METAL OR WOODEN SPOON HOLLOW OUT THE MIDDLE BUT DO NOT CLEAR IT ENTIRELY AWAY FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE PAN AS IN THAT CASE THE SPONGE OR LEAVEN AS IT WAS FORMERLY TERMED WOULD STICK TO IT WHICH IT OUGHT NOT TO DO
translated_text: Mode, put the flower into a large earthenware bowl or deep pan, then with a strong metal or wooden spoon hollow out the middle, but do not clear it entirely away from the bottom of the pan, as in that case the sponge or leaven as it was formerly termed would stick to it, which it ought not to do.

text: NEXT TAKE EITHER A LARGE TABLESPOONFUL OF BREWER'S YEAST WHICH HAS BEEN RENDERED SOLID BY MIXING IT WITH PLENTY OF COLD WATER AND LETTING IT AFTERWARDS STAND TO SETTLE FOR A DAY AND NIGHT OR NEARLY AN OUNCE OF GERMAN YEAST PUT IT INTO A LARGE BASIN AND PROCEED TO MIX IT SO THAT IT SHALL BE AS SMOOTH AS CREAM WITH THREE QUARTERS PINT OF WARM MILK AND WATER OR WITH WATER ONLY THOUGH EVEN A VERY LITTLE MILK WILL MUCH IMPROVE THE BREAD
translated_text: Next, take either a large tablespoon full of brewery's yeast, which has been rendered solid by mixing it with plenty of cold water, and letting it afterwards stand a settle for a day and night, or nearly an ounce of German yeast. Put it into a large basin and proceed to mix it so that it shall be as smooth as cream, with ¾ pint of warm milk and water, or with water only. So even a very little milk will much improve the bread.

text: LOOK AT IT FROM TIME TO TIME WHEN IT HAS BEEN LAID FOR NEARLY AN HOUR AND WHEN THE YEAST HAS RISEN AND BROKEN THROUGH THE FLOUR SO THAT BUBBLES APPEAR IN IT YOU WILL KNOW THAT IT IS READY TO BE MADE UP INTO DOUGH
translated_text: Look at it from time to time. When it has been laid for nearly an hour, and when the yeast has risen and broken through the flower so that bubbles appear in it, you will know that it is ready to be made up into dough.

text: THEN PLACE THE PAN ON A STRONG CHAIR OR DRESSER OR TABLE OF CONVENIENT HEIGHT POUR INTO THE SPONGE THE REMAINDER OF THE WARM MILK AND WATER STIR INTO IT AS MUCH OF THE FLOUR AS YOU CAN WITH THE SPOON THEN WIPE IT OUT CLEAN WITH YOUR FINGERS AND LAY IT ASIDE
translated_text: Then place the pan on a strong chair or dresser or table of convenient height. Pour into the sponge the remainder of the warm milk and water. Stir into it as much of the flowers you can with the spoon. Then wipe it out clean with your fingers and lay it aside.

text: TURN IT THEN ON TO A PASTE BOARD OR VERY CLEAN DRESSER AND WITH A LARGE SHARP KNIFE DIVIDE IT IN TWO MAKE IT UP QUICKLY INTO LOAVES AND DISPATCH IT TO THE OVEN MAKE ONE OR TWO INCISIONS ACROSS THE TOPS OF THE LOAVES AS THEY WILL RISE MORE EASILY IF THIS BE DONE
translated_text: Turn it then onto a paste board or very clean dresser, and with a large sharp knife divided in two. Make it up quickly into loaves and dispatch it to the oven. Make one or two incisions across the top of the loaves as they will rise more easily if this be done.

text: ILLUSTRATION ITALIAN MILLET
translated_text: Illustration Italian Millet.

text: ITALIAN MILLET OR GREAT INDIAN MILLET IS CULTIVATED IN EGYPT AND NUBIA WHERE IT IS CALLED DHOURRA AND IS USED AS HUMAN FOOD AS WELL AS FOR THE FERMENTATION OF BEER
translated_text: Italian millet or great Indian millet is cultivated in Egypt and Nubia, where it is called Dura and is used as human food as well as for the fermentation of beer.

text: IT WILL GROW ON POOR SOILS AND IS EXTREMELY PRODUCTIVE
translated_text: It will grow on poor soils and is extremely productive.

text: IT HAS BEEN INTRODUCED INTO ITALY WHERE THEY MAKE A COARSE BREAD FROM IT AND IT IS ALSO EMPLOYED IN PASTRY AND PUDDINGS THEY ALSO USE IT FOR FEEDING HORSES AND DOMESTIC FOWLS
translated_text: It has been introduced into Italy where they make a coarse bread from it, and it is also employed in pastry and puttings. They also use it for feeding horses and domestic fowls.

text: A YELLOW VARIETY CALLED GOLDEN MILLET IS SOLD IN THE GROCERS SHOPS FOR MAKING PUDDINGS AND IS VERY DELICATE AND WHOLESOME
translated_text: A yellow variety called golden millet is sold in the grocer's shops for making puttings and is very delicate and wholesome.

text: ANOTHER ADVANTAGE THE RED WHEATS POSSESS IS THEIR COMPARATIVE IMMUNITY FROM THE ATTACKS OF MILDEW AND FLY
translated_text: Another advantage the Redweets possess is their comparative immunity from the attacks of mildew and fly.

text: MODE BOIL THE RICE IN WATER UNTIL IT IS QUITE TENDER POUR OFF THE WATER AND PUT THE RICE BEFORE IT IS COLD TO THE FLOUR
translated_text: Mode. Boil the rice in water until it is quite tender. Pour off the water and put the rice before it is cold to the flower.

text: ILLUSTRATION MAIZE PLANT
translated_text: Illustration, maze plant.

text: MAIZE NEXT TO WHEAT AND RICE MAIZE IS THE GRAIN MOST USED IN THE NOURISHMENT OF MAN
translated_text: Maze. Next to wheat and rice, Maze is the grain most used in the nourishment of man.

text: IF CARRIED ANY DISTANCE IT SHOULD BE STORED AWAY IN AIR TIGHT VESSELS
translated_text: If carried any distance, it should be stored away in airtight vessels.

text: SOME OF THE PREPARATIONS OF MAIZE FLOUR ARE VERY GOOD AND WHEN PARTAKEN IN MODERATION SUITABLE FOOD FOR ALMOST EVERYBODY
translated_text: Some of the preparations of maize flour are very good, and when partaken in moderation, suitable food for almost everybody.

text: MODE LET THE TARTARIC ACID AND SALT BE REDUCED TO THE FINEST POSSIBLE POWDER THEN MIX THEM WELL WITH THE FLOUR
translated_text: Mode. Let the tartaric acid and salt be reduced to the finest possible powder. Then mix them well with the flour.

text: SOUR MILK OR BUTTERMILK MAY BE USED BUT THEN A LITTLE LESS ACID WILL BE NEEDED
translated_text: sour milk or buttermilk may be used, but then a little less acid will be needed.

text: EXCELLENT ROLLS
translated_text: Excellent roles.

text: HOT ROLLS
translated_text: Hot Rolls.

text: SEVENTEEN TWENTY FOUR

WHEN THEY ARE QUITE HOT DIVIDE THEM LENGTHWISE INTO THREE PUT SOME THIN FLAKES OF GOOD BUTTER BETWEEN THE SLICES PRESS THE ROLLS TOGETHER AND PUT THEM IN THE OVEN FOR A MINUTE OR TWO BUT NOT LONGER OR THE BUTTER WOULD OIL TAKE THEM OUT OF THE OVEN SPREAD THE BUTTER EQUALLY OVER DIVIDE THE ROLLS IN HALF AND PUT THEM ON TO A VERY HOT CLEAN DISH AND SEND THEM INSTANTLY TO TABLE
translated_text: When they are quite hot, divide them lengthwise into three. Put some thin flakes of good butter between the slices, press the rolls together, and put them in the oven for a minute or two. But not longer, or the butter would oil. Take them out of the oven, spread the butter equally over, divide the rolls in half, and put them on to a very hot, clean dish, and send them instantly to table.

text: TO MAKE DRY TOAST
translated_text: to make dry toast.

text: NEVER USE NEW BREAD FOR MAKING ANY KIND OF TOAST AS IT EATS HEAVY AND BESIDES IS VERY EXTRAVAGANT
translated_text: Never use new bread for making any kind of toast as it eats heavy and besides it is very extravagant.

text: MOVE IT BACKWARDS AND FORWARDS UNTIL THE BREAD IS NICELY COLOURED THEN TURN IT AND TOAST THE OTHER SIDE AND DO NOT PLACE IT SO NEAR THE FIRE THAT IT BLACKENS
translated_text: Move it backwards and forwards until the bread is nicely colored. Then turn it and toast the other side. And do not place it so near the fire that it blackens.

text: TO MAKE HOT BUTTERED TOAST SEVENTEEN TWENTY SIX
translated_text: to make hot buttered toast, 1726.

text: A LOAF OF HOUSEHOLD BREAD ABOUT TWO DAYS OLD ANSWERS FOR MAKING TOAST BETTER THAN COTTAGE BREAD THE LATTER NOT BEING A GOOD SHAPE AND TOO CRUSTY FOR THE PURPOSE
translated_text: A loaf of household bread about two days old answers for making toast better than cottage bread. The latter not being a good shape and too crusty for the purpose.

text: CUT AS MANY NICE EVEN SLICES AS MAY BE REQUIRED RATHER MORE THAN ONE QUARTER INCH IN THICKNESS AND TOAST THEM BEFORE A VERY BRIGHT FIRE WITHOUT ALLOWING THE BREAD TO BLACKEN WHICH SPOILS THE APPEARANCE AND FLAVOUR OF ALL TOAST
translated_text: Cut as many nice even slices as may be required. Rather more than one quarter inch in thickness, and toast them before a very bright fire without allowing the bread to blacken, which spoils the appearance and flavor of all toast.

text: SOYER RECOMMENDS THAT EACH SLICE SHOULD BE CUT INTO PIECES AS SOON AS IT IS BUTTERED AND WHEN ALL ARE READY THAT THEY SHOULD BE PILED LIGHTLY ON THE DISH THEY ARE INTENDED TO BE SERVED ON
translated_text: Sawyer recommends that each slice should be cut into pieces as soon as it is buttered and when all are ready, that they should be piled lightly on the dish they are intended to be served on.

text: HE SAYS THAT BY CUTTING THROUGH FOUR OR FIVE SLICES AT A TIME ALL THE BUTTER IS SQUEEZED OUT OF THE UPPER ONES WHILE THE BOTTOM ONE IS SWIMMING IN FAT LIQUID
translated_text: He says that by cutting through four or five slices at a time, all the butter is squeezed out of the upper ones while the bottom one is swimming in fat liquid.

text: MUFFINS AND CRUMPETS SHOULD ALWAYS BE SERVED ON SEPARATE DISHES AND BOTH TOASTED AND SERVED AS EXPEDITIOUSLY AS POSSIBLE
translated_text: Muffins and crumpets should always be served on separate dishes, and both toasted and served as expeditiously as possible.

text: SUFFICIENT ALLOW TWO CRUMPETS TO EACH PERSON
translated_text: sufficient, allow two crumpets to each person.

text: PLAIN BUNS SEVENTEEN TWENTY NINE
translated_text: Plane Buns, 1729

text: MODE PUT THE FLOUR INTO A BASIN MIX THE SUGAR WELL WITH IT MAKE A HOLE IN THE CENTRE AND STIR IN THE YEAST AND MILK WHICH SHOULD BE LUKEWARM WITH ENOUGH OF THE FLOUR TO MAKE IT THE THICKNESS OF CREAM
translated_text: Mode. Put the flour into a basin, mix the sugar well with it, make a hole in the center, and stir in the yeast and milk, which should be lukewarm, with enough of the flour to make it the thickness of cream.

text: FROM FIFTEEN TO TWENTY MINUTES WILL BE REQUIRED TO BAKE THEM NICELY
translated_text: From 15 to 20 minutes will be required to bake them nicely.

text: THESE BUNS MAY BE VARIED BY ADDING A FEW CURRANTS CANDIED PEEL OR CARAWAY SEEDS TO THE OTHER INGREDIENTS AND THE ABOVE MIXTURE ANSWERS FOR HOT CROSS BUNS BY PUTTING IN A LITTLE GROUND ALLSPICE AND BY PRESSING A TIN MOULD IN THE FORM OF A CROSS IN THE CENTRE OF THE BUN
translated_text: These buns may be varied by adding a few currents, candied peel, or caraway seeds to the other ingredients, and the above mixture answers for hot cross buns by putting in a little ground all spice, and by pressing a tin mold in the form of a cross in the center of the bun.

text: SUFFICIENT TO MAKE TWELVE BUNS SEASONABLE AT ANY TIME LIGHT BUNS
translated_text: sufficient to make 12 buns, seasonable at any time. Light buns.

text: ILLUSTRATION BUNS
translated_text: Illustration Buns

text: VICTORIA BUNS SEVENTEEN THIRTY TWO
translated_text: Victoria Buns, 1732.

text: MODE WHISK THE EGG STIR IN THE SUGAR AND BEAT THESE INGREDIENTS WELL TOGETHER BEAT THE BUTTER TO A CREAM STIR IN THE GROUND RICE CURRANTS AND CANDIED PEEL AND AS MUCH FLOUR AS WILL MAKE IT OF SUCH A CONSISTENCY THAT IT MAY BE ROLLED INTO SEVEN OR EIGHT BALLS
translated_text: Mode. Whisk the egg, stir in the sugar, and beat these ingredients well together. Beat the butter to a cream, stir in the ground rice, currents, and candied peel, and as much flour as will make it of such a consistency that it may be rolled into seven or eight balls.

text: ITALIAN RUSKS
translated_text: Italian Rusks.

text: THEY SHOULD BE KEPT IN A CLOSED TIN CANISTER IN A DRY PLACE TO PRESERVE THEIR CRISPNESS
translated_text: they should be kept in a closed tin canister in a dry place to preserve their crispness.

text: IT IS NOT CULTIVATED IN ENGLAND BEING PRINCIPALLY CONFINED TO THE EAST
translated_text: It is not cultivated in England, being principally confined to the East.

text: WHEN WE TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THAT THE ARABIANS ARE FOND OF LIZARDS AND LOCUSTS AS ARTICLES OF FOOD THEIR CUISINE ALTOGETHER IS SCARCELY A TEMPTING ONE
translated_text: When we take into account that the Arabians are fond of lizards and locusts as articles of food, their cuisine altogether is scarcely attempting one.

text: SEVENTEEN THIRTY FOUR
ILLUSTRATION RUSKS
translated_text: Illustration, Rusks.

text: MODE PUT THE MILK AND BUTTER INTO A SAUCEPAN AND KEEP SHAKING IT ROUND UNTIL THE LATTER IS MELTED
translated_text: Mode. Put the milk and butter into a saucepan and keep shaking it round until the latter is melted.

text: WHEN COLD THEY SHOULD BE PUT INTO TIN CANISTERS TO KEEP THEM DRY AND IF INTENDED FOR THE CHEESE COURSE THE SIFTED SUGAR SHOULD BE OMITTED
translated_text: When cold, they should be put into tin canisters to keep them dry. And if intended for the cheese course, the sifted sugar should be omitted.

text: THE NARRATIVE IT MAY BE IS WOVEN OF SO HUMBLE A TEXTURE AS TO REQUIRE THIS ADVANTAGE AND AT THE SAME TIME TO RENDER IT THE MORE DIFFICULT OF ATTAINMENT
translated_text: The narrative, it may be, is woven of so humble a texture as to require this advantage, and at the same time to render it the more difficult of attainment.

text: IN GOOD FAITH HOWEVER HE IS NOT SUFFICIENTLY IMAGINATIVE TO FLATTER HIMSELF WITH THE SLIGHTEST HOPE OF THIS KIND
translated_text: In good faith, however, he is not sufficiently imaginative to flatter himself with the slightest hope of this kind.

text: THE AUTHOR HAS CONSIDERED IT HARDLY WORTH HIS WHILE THEREFORE RELENTLESSLY TO IMPALE THE STORY WITH ITS MORAL AS WITH AN IRON ROD OR RATHER AS BY STICKING A PIN THROUGH A BUTTERFLY THUS AT ONCE DEPRIVING IT OF LIFE AND CAUSING IT TO STIFFEN IN AN UNGAINLY AND UNNATURAL ATTITUDE
translated_text: The author has considered it hardly worth his while, therefore, relentlessly to impale the story with its moral as with an iron rod, or rather as by sticking a pen through a butterfly. Thus it wants the priving of life and causing it to stiffen in an ungainly and unnatural attitude.

text: IF PERMITTED BY THE HISTORICAL CONNECTION WHICH THOUGH SLIGHT WAS ESSENTIAL TO HIS PLAN THE AUTHOR WOULD VERY WILLINGLY HAVE AVOIDED ANYTHING OF THIS NATURE
translated_text: If permitted by the historical connection, which though slight was essential to his plan, the author would very willingly have avoided anything of this nature.

text: HE TRUSTS NOT TO BE CONSIDERED AS UNPARDONABLY OFFENDING BY LAYING OUT A STREET THAT INFRINGES UPON NOBODY'S PRIVATE RIGHTS AND APPROPRIATING A LOT OF LAND WHICH HAD NO VISIBLE OWNER AND BUILDING A HOUSE OF MATERIALS LONG IN USE FOR CONSTRUCTING CASTLES IN THE AIR
translated_text: He trust not to be considered as unpartonably offending by laying out a street that infringes upon nobody's private rights, and appropriating a lot of land which had no visible owner, and building a house of materials long and used for constructing castles in the air.

text: THE ENCLOSURE HAD FORMERLY BEEN VERY EXTENSIVE BUT WAS NOW CONTRACTED WITHIN SMALL COMPASS AND HEMMED ABOUT PARTLY BY HIGH WOODEN FENCES AND PARTLY BY THE OUTBUILDINGS OF HOUSES THAT STOOD ON ANOTHER STREET
translated_text: The enclosure had formerly been very extensive, but was now contracted within small compass, and hemmed about partly by high wooden fences, and partly by the outbuildings of houses that stood on another street.

text: THE WHITE DOUBLE ROSEBUSH HAD EVIDENTLY BEEN PROPPED UP ANEW AGAINST THE HOUSE SINCE THE COMMENCEMENT OF THE SEASON AND A PEAR TREE AND THREE DAMSON TREES WHICH EXCEPT A ROW OF CURRANT BUSHES CONSTITUTED THE ONLY VARIETIES OF FRUIT BORE MARKS OF THE RECENT AMPUTATION OF SEVERAL SUPERFLUOUS OR DEFECTIVE LIMBS
translated_text: The white double rose bush had evidently been propped up anew against the house since the commencement of the season, and the pear tree and three damson trees, which, except a row of current bushes, constituted the only varieties of fruit, poor marks of the recent amputation of several superfluous or defective limbs.

text: THERE WERE ALSO A FEW SPECIES OF ANTIQUE AND HEREDITARY FLOWERS IN NO VERY FLOURISHING CONDITION BUT SCRUPULOUSLY WEEDED AS IF SOME PERSON EITHER OUT OF LOVE OR CURIOSITY HAD BEEN ANXIOUS TO BRING THEM TO SUCH PERFECTION AS THEY WERE CAPABLE OF ATTAINING
translated_text: There were also a few species of antique and hereditary flowers in no very flourishing condition, but scrupulously weeded, as if some person, either out of love or curiosity, had been anxious to bring them to such perfection as they were capable of attaining.

text: SUMMER SQUASHES ALMOST IN THEIR GOLDEN BLOSSOM CUCUMBERS NOW EVINCING A TENDENCY TO SPREAD AWAY FROM THE MAIN STOCK AND RAMBLE FAR AND WIDE TWO OR THREE ROWS OF STRING BEANS AND AS MANY MORE THAT WERE ABOUT TO FESTOON THEMSELVES ON POLES TOMATOES OCCUPYING A SITE SO SHELTERED AND SUNNY THAT THE PLANTS WERE ALREADY GIGANTIC AND PROMISED AN EARLY AND ABUNDANT HARVEST
translated_text: Summer squashes, almost in their golden blossom, cue combers, now evincing a tendency to spread away from the main stock and ramble far and wide. Two or three rows of string beans, and as many more that were about to festoon themselves on poles, tomatoes occupying a site so sheltered and sunny that the plants were already gigantic, and promised an early and abundant harvest.

text: PHOEBE WONDERED WHOSE CARE AND TOIL IT COULD HAVE BEEN THAT HAD PLANTED THESE VEGETABLES AND KEPT THE SOIL SO CLEAN AND ORDERLY
translated_text: Phoebe wondered whose care and toil it could have been that had planted these vegetables and kept the soil so clean and orderly.

text: BEES TOO STRANGE TO SAY HAD THOUGHT IT WORTH THEIR WHILE TO COME HITHER POSSIBLY FROM THE RANGE OF HIVES BESIDE SOME FARM HOUSE MILES AWAY
translated_text: Bees, too, strange to say, had thought it worth their while to come hither, possibly from the range of hives besides some farmhouse miles away.

text: THIS WAS A FOUNTAIN SET ROUND WITH A RIM OF OLD MOSSY STONES AND PAVED IN ITS BED WITH WHAT APPEARED TO BE A SORT OF MOSAIC WORK OF VARIOUSLY COLORED PEBBLES
translated_text: This was a fountain set round with the rim of old mossy stones and paved in its bed with what appeared to be a sort of mosaic work of variously colored pebbles.

text: IT NOW CONTAINED ONLY CHANTICLEER HIS TWO WIVES AND A SOLITARY CHICKEN
translated_text: It now contained only Shanty Claire, his two wives, and a solitary chicken.

text: IT WAS EVIDENT THAT THE RACE HAD DEGENERATED LIKE MANY A NOBLE RACE BESIDES IN CONSEQUENCE OF TOO STRICT A WATCHFULNESS TO KEEP IT PURE
translated_text: It was evident that the race had degenerated, like many a noble race besides, in consequence of too strict to watchfulness to keep it pure.

text: THESE FEATHERED PEOPLE HAD EXISTED TOO LONG IN THEIR DISTINCT VARIETY A FACT OF WHICH THE PRESENT REPRESENTATIVES JUDGING BY THEIR LUGUBRIOUS DEPORTMENT SEEMED TO BE AWARE
translated_text: These feathered people had existed too long in their distinct variety, a fact of which the present representatives, judging by the Lugubrius deportment, seemed to be aware.

text: THEY KEPT THEMSELVES ALIVE UNQUESTIONABLY AND LAID NOW AND THEN AN EGG AND HATCHED A CHICKEN NOT FOR ANY PLEASURE OF THEIR OWN BUT THAT THE WORLD MIGHT NOT ABSOLUTELY LOSE WHAT HAD ONCE BEEN SO ADMIRABLE A BREED OF FOWLS
translated_text: They kept themselves alive unquestionably, and laid now and then an egg, and hatched at chicken, not for any pleasure of their own, but that the world might not absolutely lose what had once been so admirable a breed of fowls.

text: THE DISTINGUISHING MARK OF THE HENS WAS A CREST OF LAMENTABLY SCANTY GROWTH IN THESE LATTER DAYS BUT SO ODDLY AND WICKEDLY ANALOGOUS TO HEPZIBAH'S TURBAN THAT PHOEBE TO THE POIGNANT DISTRESS OF HER CONSCIENCE BUT INEVITABLY WAS LED TO FANCY A GENERAL RESEMBLANCE BETWIXT THESE FORLORN BIPEDS AND HER RESPECTABLE RELATIVE
translated_text: The distinguishing mark of the hens was the crest of lamentably scanty growth in these latter days, but so oddly and wickedly analogous to Hebsibus' turbine that Phoebe, to the poignant distress of her conscience but inevitably, was led to fancy a general resemblance between these four-law and bipeds and her respectable relative.

text: THE CHICKEN CREPT THROUGH THE PALES OF THE COOP AND RAN WITH SOME SHOW OF LIVELINESS TO HER FEET WHILE CHANTICLEER AND THE LADIES OF HIS HOUSEHOLD REGARDED HER WITH QUEER SIDELONG GLANCES AND THEN CROAKED ONE TO ANOTHER AS IF COMMUNICATING THEIR SAGE OPINIONS OF HER CHARACTER
translated_text: The chicken crept through the pales of the coop and ran, with some show of liveliness to her feet. While Shantikler and the ladies of his household regarded her with queer, side-long glances, and then croaked one to another as if communicating their sage opinions of her character.

text: SO WISE AS WELL AS ANTIQUE WAS THEIR ASPECT AS TO GIVE COLOR TO THE IDEA NOT MERELY THAT THEY WERE THE DESCENDANTS OF A TIME HONORED RACE BUT THAT THEY HAD EXISTED IN THEIR INDIVIDUAL CAPACITY EVER SINCE THE HOUSE OF THE SEVEN GABLES WAS FOUNDED AND WERE SOMEHOW MIXED UP WITH ITS DESTINY
translated_text: So wise, as well as antique, was their aspect, as to give color to the idea, not merely that they were the descendants of a time-honored race, but that they had existed in their individual capacity ever since the house of the Seven Gables was founded, and were somehow mixed up with its destiny.

text: HE HELD A HOE IN HIS HAND AND WHILE PHOEBE WAS GONE IN QUEST OF THE CRUMBS HAD BEGUN TO BUSY HIMSELF WITH DRAWING UP FRESH EARTH ABOUT THE ROOTS OF THE TOMATOES
translated_text: He held a hoe in his hand, and while Phoebe was gone in quest of the crumbs, had begun to busy himself with drawing up fresh earth about the roots of the tomatoes.

text: THEY HAVE KNOWN ME MUCH LONGER BUT NEVER HONOR ME WITH ANY FAMILIARITY THOUGH HARDLY A DAY PASSES WITHOUT MY BRINGING THEM FOOD
translated_text: They have known me much longer, but never honor me with any familiarity, though hardly a day passes without my bringing them food.

text: MISS HEPZIBAH I SUPPOSE WILL INTERWEAVE THE FACT WITH HER OTHER TRADITIONS AND SET IT DOWN THAT THE FOWLS KNOW YOU TO BE A PYNCHEON
translated_text: Ms. Hebsava, I suppose, will interweave the fact with her other traditions and set it down that the fowls know you to be a pension.

text: AH BUT THESE HENS ANSWERED THE YOUNG MAN THESE HENS OF ARISTOCRATIC LINEAGE WOULD SCORN TO UNDERSTAND THE VULGAR LANGUAGE OF A BARN YARD FOWL
translated_text: Ah, but these hens answered the young man, these hens of aristocratic lineage would scorn to understand the vulgar language of a barnyard fowl.

text: I PREFER TO THINK AND SO WOULD MISS HEPZIBAH THAT THEY RECOGNIZE THE FAMILY TONE FOR YOU ARE A PYNCHEON
translated_text: I prefer to think, and so would Miss Hebsiva, that they recognize the family tone, for you are a pension.

text: MY NAME IS PHOEBE PYNCHEON SAID THE GIRL WITH A MANNER OF SOME RESERVE FOR SHE WAS AWARE THAT HER NEW ACQUAINTANCE COULD BE NO OTHER THAN THE DAGUERREOTYPIST OF WHOSE LAWLESS PROPENSITIES THE OLD MAID HAD GIVEN HER A DISAGREEABLE IDEA
translated_text: My name is Phoebe Pension, said the girl, with a manner of some reserve, for she was aware that her new acquaintance could be no other than the daguerreotypeist, of whose lawless propensities the old made had given her a disagreeable idea.

text: I TURN UP THE EARTH BY WAY OF PASTIME
translated_text: I turn up the earth by a way of pastime.

text: IT IS LIKE A BANDAGE OVER ONE'S EYES TO COME INTO IT
translated_text: It is like a bandage over one's eyes to come into it.

text: IF YOU WOULD PERMIT ME SAID THE ARTIST LOOKING AT PHOEBE I SHOULD LIKE TO TRY WHETHER THE DAGUERREOTYPE CAN BRING OUT DISAGREEABLE TRAITS ON A PERFECTLY AMIABLE FACE
translated_text: If you would permit me, said the artist, looking at Phoebe, I should like to try whether the daguerreotype can bring out disagreeable traits on a perfectly amiable face.

text: MOST OF MY LIKENESSES DO LOOK UNAMIABLE BUT THE VERY SUFFICIENT REASON I FANCY IS BECAUSE THE ORIGINALS ARE SO
translated_text: Most of my likenesses do look unamiable, but the very sufficient reason, I fancy, is because the originals are so.

text: THERE IS A WONDERFUL INSIGHT IN HEAVEN'S BROAD AND SIMPLE SUNSHINE
translated_text: There is a wonderful insight in Heaven's broad and simple sunshine.

text: WHILE WE GIVE IT CREDIT ONLY FOR DEPICTING THE MEREST SURFACE IT ACTUALLY BRINGS OUT THE SECRET CHARACTER WITH A TRUTH THAT NO PAINTER WOULD EVER VENTURE UPON EVEN COULD HE DETECT IT
translated_text: While we give it credit only for depicting the mirrorist's surface, it actually brings out the secret character with the truth that no painter would ever venture upon. Even could he detect it?

text: YET THE ORIGINAL WEARS TO COMMON EYES A VERY DIFFERENT EXPRESSION
translated_text: Yet the original wares to common eyes are very different expression.

text: HE EXHIBITED A DAGUERREOTYPE MINIATURE IN A MOROCCO CASE
translated_text: He exhibited at the Garotite miniature in a Morocco case.

text: PHOEBE MERELY GLANCED AT IT AND GAVE IT BACK
translated_text: Phoebe merrily glanced at it and gave it back.

text: I CAN ASSURE YOU THAT THIS IS A MODERN FACE AND ONE WHICH YOU WILL VERY PROBABLY MEET
translated_text: I can assure you that this is a modern face and one which you will very probably meet.

text: THE SUN AS YOU SEE TELLS QUITE ANOTHER STORY AND WILL NOT BE COAXED OUT OF IT AFTER HALF A DOZEN PATIENT ATTEMPTS ON MY PART
translated_text: The sun, as you see, tells quite another story, and will not be coped out of it, after half a dozen patience attempts on my part.

text: HERE WE HAVE THE MAN SLY SUBTLE HARD IMPERIOUS AND WITHAL COLD AS ICE LOOK AT THAT EYE
translated_text: Here we have the man, Sly, Settle, Hard, Imperious, and with all cold as ice. Look at that eye.

text: AND YET IF YOU COULD ONLY SEE THE BENIGN SMILE OF THE ORIGINAL
translated_text: And yet, if you could only see the benign smile of the original.

text: WELL I DON'T WISH TO SEE IT ANY MORE OBSERVED PHOEBE TURNING AWAY HER EYES IT IS CERTAINLY VERY LIKE THE OLD PORTRAIT
translated_text: Well, I don't wish to see it anymore, observe Phoebe, turning away her eyes. It is certainly very like the old portrait.

text: IF THE ORIGINAL IS STILL IN THE WORLD I THINK HE MIGHT DEFY THE SUN TO MAKE HIM LOOK STERN AND HARD
translated_text: If the original is still in the world, I think he might defy the sun to make him look stern and hard.

text: IS THERE NOTHING WILD IN THE EYE CONTINUED HOLGRAVE SO EARNESTLY THAT IT EMBARRASSED PHOEBE AS DID ALSO THE QUIET FREEDOM WITH WHICH HE PRESUMED ON THEIR SO RECENT ACQUAINTANCE
translated_text: Is there nothing wild in the eye, continued wholegrave? So earnestly that it embarrassed Phoebe, as did also the quiet freedom with which she presumed on their so recent acquaintance.

text: IT IS NONSENSE SAID PHOEBE A LITTLE IMPATIENTLY FOR US TO TALK ABOUT A PICTURE WHICH YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN
translated_text: It is nonsense, said Phoebe, a little impatiently, for us to talk about a picture which you have never seen.

text: SINCE YOU ARE A FRIEND OF MY COUSIN HEPZIBAH'S YOU SHOULD ASK HER TO SHOW YOU THE PICTURE
translated_text: Since you are a friend of my cousin Hebsibos, you should ask her to show you the picture.

text: SO WE WILL BE FELLOW LABORERS SOMEWHAT ON THE COMMUNITY SYSTEM
translated_text: So we will be fellow laborers, somewhat on the community system.

text: SHE DID NOT ALTOGETHER LIKE HIM
translated_text: She did not altogether like him.

text: OH REJOINED THE DAGUERREOTYPIST BECAUSE LIKE AN OLD LADY'S CUP OF TEA IT IS WATER BEWITCHED
translated_text: Oh, rejoin the degarotipus, because like an old lady's cup of tea, it is water be witch'd.

text: SHE WAS INDISTINCTLY AWARE HOWEVER THAT THE GAUNT FIGURE OF THE OLD GENTLEWOMAN WAS SITTING IN ONE OF THE STRAIGHT BACKED CHAIRS A LITTLE WITHDRAWN FROM THE WINDOW THE FAINT GLEAM OF WHICH SHOWED THE BLANCHED PALENESS OF HER CHEEK TURNED SIDEWAYS TOWARDS A CORNER
translated_text: She was indistinctly aware, however, that the gaunt figure of the old gentlewoman was sitting in one of the straight-back chairs, a little withdrawn from the window, the faint gleam of which showed the blanched paleness of her cheek, turned sideways towards the corner.

text: BUT PUT IT ON THE TABLE IN THE CORNER OF THE PASSAGE
translated_text: but put it on the table in the corner of the passage.

text: WHAT AN INSTRUMENT IS THE HUMAN VOICE
translated_text: What an instrument is the human voice.

text: HOW WONDERFULLY RESPONSIVE TO EVERY EMOTION OF THE HUMAN SOUL
translated_text: how wonderfully responsive to every emotion of the human soul.

text: FEWER WORDS THAN BEFORE BUT WITH THE SAME MYSTERIOUS MUSIC IN THEM
translated_text: Fewer words than before, but with the same mysterious music in them.

text: PRAY GO TO BED FOR I AM SURE YOU MUST NEED REST
translated_text: Pray go to bed for I'm sure you must need rest.

text: I WILL SIT IN THE PARLOR AWHILE AND COLLECT MY THOUGHTS
translated_text: I will sit in the parlour a while and collect my thoughts.

text: WHILE THUS DISMISSING HER THE MAIDEN LADY STEPT FORWARD KISSED PHOEBE AND PRESSED HER TO HER HEART WHICH BEAT AGAINST THE GIRL'S BOSOM WITH A STRONG HIGH AND TUMULTUOUS SWELL
translated_text: While thus dismissing her, the maiden lady stepped forward, kissed Phoebe and pressed her to her heart, which beat against the girl's bosom with a strong, high and tumultuous swell.

text: AT SOME UNCERTAIN PERIOD IN THE DEPTHS OF NIGHT AND AS IT WERE THROUGH THE THIN VEIL OF A DREAM SHE WAS CONSCIOUS OF A FOOTSTEP MOUNTING THE STAIRS HEAVILY BUT NOT WITH FORCE AND DECISION
translated_text: At some uncertain period in the depths of night, and as it were through the thin veil of a dream, she was conscious of a footstep mounting the stairs heavily, but not with force and decision.

text: MINNIE'S FLAT AS THE ONE FLOOR RESIDENT APARTMENTS WERE THEN BEING CALLED WAS IN A PART OF WEST VAN BUREN STREET INHABITED BY FAMILIES OF LABOURERS AND CLERKS MEN WHO HAD COME AND WERE STILL COMING WITH THE RUSH OF POPULATION POURING IN AT THE RATE OF FIFTY THOUSAND A YEAR
translated_text: Minis Flat, as the one-floor resident apartments were then being called, was in a part of West Van Buren Street inhabited by families of laborers and clerks, men who had come and were still coming, with the rush of population pouring in at the rate of 50,000 a year.

text: TO CARRIE THE SOUND OF THE LITTLE BELLS UPON THE HORSE CARS AS THEY TINKLED IN AND OUT OF HEARING WAS AS PLEASING AS IT WAS NOVEL
translated_text: To carry the sound of the little bells upon the horse cars as they tingled in and out of hearing was as pleasing as it was novel.

text: TO HIM THE PRESENCE OR ABSENCE OF HIS WIFE'S SISTER WAS A MATTER OF INDIFFERENCE
translated_text: To him, the presence or absence of his wife's sister was a matter of indifference.

text: HE WAS OF A CLEAN SAVING DISPOSITION AND HAD ALREADY PAID A NUMBER OF MONTHLY INSTALMENTS ON TWO LOTS FAR OUT ON THE WEST SIDE
translated_text: He was of a clean, saving disposition and had already paid a number of monthly installments on two lots far out on the west side.

text: HIS AMBITION WAS SOME DAY TO BUILD A HOUSE ON THEM
translated_text: His ambition was someday to build a house on them.

text: SHE HAD SOME SLIGHT GIFT OF OBSERVATION AND THAT SENSE SO RICH IN EVERY WOMAN INTUITION
translated_text: She had some slight gift of observation and that sense so rich in every woman intuition

text: THE WALLS OF THE ROOMS WERE DISCORDANTLY PAPERED
translated_text: The walls of the rooms were discordantly papered.

text: THE FLOORS WERE COVERED WITH MATTING AND THE HALL LAID WITH A THIN RAG CARPET
translated_text: The floors were covered with matting and the hall laid with a thin rag carpet.

text: THEN SHE WALKED AND SANG TO IT UNTIL HANSON DISTURBED IN HIS READING CAME AND TOOK IT
translated_text: Then she walked and sang to it until Hanson, disturbed in his reading, came and took it.

text: ONE COULD SEE THAT HE WAS VERY MUCH WRAPPED UP IN HIS OFFSPRING
translated_text: One could see that he was very much wrapped up in his offspring.

text: NOW NOW HE SAID WALKING THERE THERE AND THERE WAS A CERTAIN SWEDISH ACCENT NOTICEABLE IN HIS VOICE
translated_text: Now, now, he said walking there there, and there was a certain Swedish accent noticeable in his voice.

text: HE SEEMED TO BE THINKING OF SOMETHING ELSE
translated_text: he seemed to be thinking of something else.

text: MINNIE BEGAN TO EXPLAIN BUT HER HUSBAND TOOK THIS PART OF THE CONVERSATION TO HIMSELF
translated_text: Many began to explain, but her husband took this part of the conversation to himself.

text: YOU COULD GET HOME EASY TOO IT ISN'T VERY FAR
translated_text: You could get home easy too. It isn't very far.

text: SHE ASKED MINNIE FOR INK AND PAPER WHICH WERE UPON THE MANTEL IN THE DINING ROOM AND WHEN THE LATTER HAD GONE TO BED AT TEN GOT OUT DROUET'S CARD AND WROTE HIM
translated_text: She asked many for ink and paper, which were upon the mantle in the dining room. And when the latter had gone to bed at 10, got out Drew's card and wrote him.

text: SHE WANTED TO MAKE SOME REFERENCE TO THEIR RELATIONS UPON THE TRAIN BUT WAS TOO TIMID
translated_text: She wanted to make some reference to their relations upon the train, but was too timid.

text: ANYTHING WAS GOOD ENOUGH SO LONG AS IT PAID SAY FIVE DOLLARS A WEEK TO BEGIN WITH
translated_text: Anything was good enough so long as it paid, say, $5 a week to begin with.

text: A SHOP GIRL WAS THE DESTINY PREFIGURED FOR THE NEWCOMER
translated_text: A shopgirl was the destiny prefigured for the newcomer.

text: IT WAS UNDER SUCH AUSPICIOUS CIRCUMSTANCES THAT SHE STARTED OUT THIS MORNING TO LOOK FOR WORK
translated_text: It was under such auspicious circumstances that she started out this morning to look for work.

text: NARROW BOARD WALKS EXTENDED OUT PASSING HERE A HOUSE AND THERE A STORE AT FAR INTERVALS EVENTUALLY ENDING ON THE OPEN PRAIRIE
translated_text: Narrow boardwalks extended out, passing here a house and their a store at far intervals, eventually ending on the open prairie.

text: IT GAVE AN IMPOSING APPEARANCE TO MOST OF THE WHOLESALE HOUSES WHOSE OFFICES WERE UPON THE GROUND FLOOR AND IN PLAIN VIEW OF THE STREET
translated_text: It gave an imposing appearance to most of the wholesale houses, whose offices were up on the ground floor and in plain view of the street.

text: THESE VAST BUILDINGS WHAT WERE THEY
translated_text: These vast buildings, what were they?

text: HE WAS IN A FEVERED STATE OF MIND OWING TO THE BLIGHT HIS WIFE'S ACTION THREATENED TO CAST UPON HIS ENTIRE FUTURE
translated_text: He was in a fevered state of mind, owing to the blight his wife's action threatened to cast up on his entire future.

text: HE WOULD HAVE TO PAY HER THE MONEY WHICH SHE WOULD NOW REGULARLY DEMAND OR THERE WOULD BE TROUBLE IT DID NOT MATTER WHAT HE DID
translated_text: He would have to pay her the money which she would now regularly demand, or there would be trouble. It did not matter what he did.

text: HURSTWOOD WALKED THE FLOOR MENTALLY ARRANGING THE CHIEF POINTS OF HIS SITUATION
translated_text: Hurstwood walked the floor, mentally arranging the chief points of his situation.

text: HE ALSO THOUGHT OF HIS MANAGERIAL POSITION
translated_text: He also thought of his managerial position.

text: HOW WOULD THE PAPERS TALK ABOUT IT
translated_text: How would the papers talk about it?

text: MANY LITTLE WRINKLES GATHERED BETWEEN HIS EYES AS HE CONTEMPLATED THIS AND HIS BROW MOISTENED
translated_text: Many little wrinkles gathered between his eyes as he contemplated this and his brown moistened.

text: HE COULD ARRANGE THAT SATISFACTORILY FOR CARRIE WOULD BE GLAD TO WAIT IF NECESSARY
translated_text: He could arrange that satisfactory for Carrie would be glad to wait if necessary.

text: HE WOULD SEE HOW THINGS TURNED OUT TO MORROW AND THEN HE WOULD TALK TO HER THEY WERE GOING TO MEET AS USUAL
translated_text: He would see how things turned out tomorrow and then he would talk to her. They were going to meet as usual.

text: FOR SOME REASON HE FELT AS IF SOMETHING MIGHT COME THAT WAY AND WAS RELIEVED WHEN ALL THE ENVELOPES HAD BEEN SCANNED AND NOTHING SUSPICIOUS NOTICED
translated_text: For some reason, he felt as if something might come that way and was relieved when all the envelopes had been scanned and nothing suspicious noticed.

text: WHILE THE DANGER HAD NOT LESSENED IT HAD NOT AS YET MATERIALISED AND WITH HIM NO NEWS WAS GOOD NEWS
translated_text: While the danger had not lessened, it had not as yet materialized, and with him no news was good news.

text: SO LITTLE DID HE CONSIDER DROUET THAT IT NEVER ONCE OCCURRED TO HIM TO WORRY ABOUT HIS FINDING OUT
translated_text: So little did he consider Drua that it never once occurred to him to worry about his finding out.

text: HE GREW RESTLESS AS HE RUMINATED AND THEN DECIDED THAT PERHAPS IT WAS NOTHING
translated_text: He grew restless as he remininated and then decided that perhaps it was nothing.

text: SHE HAD NOT BEEN ABLE TO GET AWAY THIS MORNING
translated_text: She had not been able to get away this morning.

text: HE WOULD GET ONE TO DAY IT WOULD PROBABLY BE ON HIS DESK WHEN HE GOT BACK HE WOULD LOOK FOR IT AT ONCE
translated_text: He would get one today. It would probably be on his desk when he got back. He would look for it at once.

text: AFTER A TIME HE GAVE UP WAITING AND DREARILY HEADED FOR THE MADISON CAR
translated_text: After a time, he gave up waiting and generally headed for the Madison car.

text: HE WENT IN AND EXAMINED HIS LETTERS BUT THERE WAS NOTHING FROM CARRIE
translated_text: He went in and examined his letters, but there was nothing from Kerry.

text: FORTUNATELY THERE WAS NOTHING FROM HIS WIFE EITHER
translated_text: Fortunately, there was nothing from his wife either.

text: AT ONE THIRTY HE WENT TO RECTOR'S FOR LUNCH AND WHEN HE RETURNED A MESSENGER WAS WAITING FOR HIM
translated_text: At 130, he went to Refters for lunch, and when he returned, a messenger was waiting for him.

text: HIS FIRST IMPULSE WAS TO WRITE BUT FOUR WORDS IN REPLY GO TO THE DEVIL
translated_text: His first impulse was to write but four words in reply. Go to the devil.

text: BUT HE COMPROMISED BY TELLING THE BOY THAT THERE WOULD BE NO REPLY
translated_text: but he compromised by telling the boy that there would be no reply.

text: THEN HE SAT DOWN IN HIS CHAIR AND GAZED WITHOUT SEEING CONTEMPLATING THE RESULT OF HIS WORK
translated_text: Then he sat down in his chair and gazed without seeing, contemplating the result of his work.

text: WHAT WOULD SHE DO ABOUT THAT THE CONFOUNDED WRETCH
translated_text: What would she do about that? The confounded wretch.

text: LATER HOWEVER HIS OLD DISCRETION ASSERTED ITSELF
translated_text: Later, however, his old discretion asserted itself.

text: SOMETHING HAD TO BE DONE A CLIMAX WAS NEAR AND SHE WOULD NOT SIT IDLE
translated_text: Something had to be done. A climax was near and she would not sit idle.

text: HE KNEW HER WELL ENOUGH TO KNOW THAT WHEN SHE HAD DECIDED UPON A PLAN SHE WOULD FOLLOW IT UP
translated_text: He knew her well enough to know that when she had decided upon a plan, she would follow it up.

text: HE AROSE FROM HIS CHAIR AND WENT AND LOOKED OUT INTO THE STREET
translated_text: He arose from his chair and went and looked out into the street.

text: THE LONG DRIZZLE HAD BEGUN PEDESTRIANS HAD TURNED UP COLLARS AND TROUSERS AT THE BOTTOM
translated_text: The long drizzle had begun. Pedestrians had turned up collars and trousers at the bottom.

text: HURSTWOOD ALMOST EXCLAIMED OUT LOUD AT THE INSISTENCY OF THIS THING
translated_text: Herst would almost explain out loud at the insistency of this thing.

text: HE PUT ON HIS HAT AND LOOKED AROUND FOR HIS UMBRELLA
translated_text: He put on his hat and looked around for his umbrella.

text: HE WOULD HAVE SOME ARRANGEMENT OF THIS THING
translated_text: he would have some arrangement of this thing.

text: HE BEGAN TO WISH THAT HE HAD COMPROMISED IN SOME WAY OR OTHER THAT HE HAD SENT THE MONEY PERHAPS HE COULD DO IT UP HERE
translated_text: He began to wish that he had compromised in some way or other that he had sent the money. Perhaps he could do it up here.

text: HE WOULD GO IN AND SEE ANYHOW HE WOULD HAVE NO ROW
translated_text: He would go in and see anyhow. He would have no row.

text: BY THE TIME HE REACHED HIS OWN STREET HE WAS KEENLY ALIVE TO THE DIFFICULTIES OF HIS SITUATION AND WISHED OVER AND OVER THAT SOME SOLUTION WOULD OFFER ITSELF THAT HE COULD SEE HIS WAY OUT
translated_text: By the time he reached his own street, he was keenly alive to the difficulties of his situation, and wished over and over that some solution would offer itself, that he could see his way out.

text: THEN HE RANG THE BELL NO ANSWER
translated_text: Then he rang the bell. No answer.

text: HE RANG AGAIN THIS TIME HARDER STILL NO ANSWER
translated_text: He rang again this time harder. Still no answer.

text: WHEN HURSTWOOD GOT BACK TO HIS OFFICE AGAIN HE WAS IN A GREATER QUANDARY THAN EVER
translated_text: When Hirstwood got back to his office again, he was in a greater quandary than ever.

text: HE COULD HARDLY REALISE HOW IT HAD ALL COME ABOUT
translated_text: He could hardly realize how it'd all come about.

text: NO LETTER HAD COME NO WORD OF ANY KIND AND YET HERE IT WAS LATE IN THE EVENING AND SHE HAD AGREED TO MEET HIM THAT MORNING
translated_text: No letter had come, no word of any kind, and yet here it was late in the evening, and she had agreed to meet him that morning.

text: HE SAW THAT IN THE EXCITEMENT OF RECENT EVENTS HE HAD NOT FORMULATED A PLAN UPON THAT SCORE
translated_text: He saw that in the excitement of recent events, he had not formulated a plan upon that score.

text: HE WAS GETTING SOME VAGUE COMFORT OUT OF A GOOD CIGAR BUT IT WAS NO PANACEA FOR THE ILL WHICH AFFECTED HIM
translated_text: He was getting some big comfort out of a good cigar, but it was no penetra for the ill which affected him.

text: IT WAS WITH GREAT OPPOSITION AFTER TWO OR THREE HOURS OF THE MOST URGENT MENTAL AFFIRMATION AND DENIAL THAT AT LAST HE GOT AN ENVELOPE PLACED IN IT THE REQUESTED AMOUNT AND SLOWLY SEALED IT UP
translated_text: It was with great opposition after two or three hours of the most urgent mental affirmation in denial that at last he got a envelope placed in it the requested amount and slowly sealed it up.

text: THEN HE CALLED HARRY THE BOY OF ALL WORK AROUND THE PLACE
translated_text: Then he called Harry, the boy of all work around the place.

text: YOU TAKE THIS TO THIS ADDRESS HE SAID HANDING HIM THE ENVELOPE AND GIVE IT TO MISSUS HURSTWOOD YES SIR SAID THE BOY
