translated_text: You take this to this address," he said, handing him the envelope, and give it to Mrs. Hurstwood. Yes, sir," said the boy.

text: ANY ANSWER I GUESS NOT
translated_text: Any answer? I guess not.

text: THE BOY HASTENED AWAY AND THE MANAGER FELL TO HIS MUSINGS
translated_text: The boy hastened away and the manager fell to his musings.

text: HE WAS BEATEN FOR TO NIGHT AND HE MIGHT JUST AS WELL MAKE THE BEST OF IT
translated_text: He was beaten for tonight and he might just as well make the best of it.

text: SHE WOULD TAKE THE ENVELOPE AND KNOW THAT SHE HAD TRIUMPHED
translated_text: She would take the envelope and know that she had triumphed.

text: IF HE ONLY HAD THAT LETTER BACK HE WOULDN'T SEND IT
translated_text: If he only had that letter back, he wouldn't send it.

text: FOR RELIEF HE AROSE AND JOINED IN CONVERSATION WITH A FEW FRIENDS WHO WERE DRINKING
translated_text: For relief, he arose and joined in the conversation with a few friends who were drinking.

text: ALL THE TIME HIS THOUGHTS WOULD RUN OUT TO HIS HOME AND SEE THE SCENE BEING THEREIN ENACTED
translated_text: All the time, his thoughts would run out to his home and see the scene being there in enacted.

text: IN ABOUT AN HOUR AND THREE QUARTERS THE BOY RETURNED
translated_text: In about an hour and three quarters, the boy returned.

text: HE FANCIED AS HE SAT AT HIS DESK THAT NOTHING WOULD BE DONE FOR A WEEK OR TWO MEANWHILE HE WOULD HAVE TIME TO THINK
translated_text: He'd fancy, as he sat at his desk, that nothing would be done for a week or two. Meanwhile, he would have time to think.

text: HOW ABOUT THAT NOW HIS PAIN AT HER FAILURE TO MEET OR WRITE HIM RAPIDLY INCREASED AS HE DEVOTED HIMSELF TO THIS SUBJECT
translated_text: How about that now? His pain at her failure to meet or write him rapidly increased as he devoted himself to the subject.

text: HE DECIDED TO WRITE HER CARE OF THE WEST SIDE POST OFFICE AND ASK FOR AN EXPLANATION AS WELL AS TO HAVE HER MEET HIM
translated_text: He decided to write her care of the West Side Post Office and ask for an explanation, as well as to have her meet him.

text: THREE O'CLOCK CAME FOUR FIVE SIX AND NO LETTER
translated_text: 3 o'clock came, 4, 5, 6 and no letter.

text: THE HELPLESS MANAGER PACED THE FLOOR AND GRIMLY ENDURED THE GLOOM OF DEFEAT
translated_text: The helpless manager paced the floor and grimly endured the gloom of defeat.

text: HE SAW A BUSY SATURDAY USHERED OUT THE SABBATH IN AND NOTHING DONE
translated_text: He saw a busy Saturday ushered out, the Sabbath in, and nothing done.

text: ALL DAY THE BAR BEING CLOSED HE BROODED ALONE SHUT OUT FROM HOME FROM THE EXCITEMENT OF HIS RESORT FROM CARRIE AND WITHOUT THE ABILITY TO ALTER HIS CONDITION ONE IOTA
translated_text: All day, the bar being closed, Hebrew did alone. Shut out from home, from the excitement of his resort, from Carrie, and without the ability to alter his condition, one Iota.

text: IT WAS THE WORST SUNDAY HE HAD SPENT IN HIS LIFE
translated_text: It was the worst Sunday he had spent in his life.

text: IT SEEMED AS IF HIS FAMILY TROUBLES WERE JUST BEGINNING
translated_text: It seemed as if his family troubles were just beginning.

text: HE WAS QUITE CERTAIN NOW THAT SHE KNEW HE WAS MARRIED AND WAS ANGERED AT HIS PERFIDY
translated_text: He was quite certain now that she knew he was married and was angered at his perfidy.

text: HE HAD LOVED HER EARNESTLY ENOUGH BUT NOW THAT THE POSSIBILITY OF LOSING HER STARED HIM IN THE FACE SHE SEEMED MUCH MORE ATTRACTIVE
translated_text: He had loved her earnestly enough, but now that the possibility of losing her has stared him in the face, she seemed much more attractive.

text: HE WOULD GO TO HER AND TELL HER ALL HIS FAMILY COMPLICATIONS
translated_text: He would go to her and tell her all his family complications.

text: HE WOULD EXPLAIN TO HER JUST WHERE HE STOOD AND HOW MUCH HE NEEDED HER
translated_text: He would explain to her just where he stood and how much he needed her.

text: HE DID MANAGE TO BRING HIMSELF INTO THE MOOD TO GO OUT TO CARRIE BUT WHEN HE GOT IN OGDEN PLACE HE THOUGHT HE SAW A MAN WATCHING HIM AND WENT AWAY
translated_text: He did manage to bring himself into the mood to go out to carry. But when he got in Ogden Place, he thought he saw a man watching him and went away.

text: HE DID NOT GO WITHIN A BLOCK OF THE HOUSE
translated_text: He did not go within a block of the house.

text: HE TROUBLED OVER MANY LITTLE DETAILS AND TALKED PERFUNCTORILY TO EVERYBODY
translated_text: He traveled over many little details and talked profanctorally to everybody.

text: HE STAYED AT HIS DESK LONG AFTER ALL OTHERS HAD GONE AND ONLY QUITTED IT WHEN THE NIGHT WATCHMAN ON HIS ROUND PULLED AT THE FRONT DOOR TO SEE IF IT WAS SAFELY LOCKED
translated_text: He stayed at his desk long after all others had gone, and only quitted it when the night watchman on his round pulled at the front door to see if it was safely locked.

text: ON WEDNESDAY HE RECEIVED ANOTHER POLITE NOTE FROM MC GREGOR JAMES AND HAY IT READ
translated_text: On Wednesday, he received another polite note from McGregor James and Hay. It read.

text: DEAR SIR WE BEG TO INFORM YOU THAT WE ARE INSTRUCTED TO WAIT UNTIL TO MORROW THURSDAY AT ONE O'CLOCK BEFORE FILING SUIT AGAINST YOU ON BEHALF OF MISSUS JULIA HURSTWOOD FOR DIVORCE AND ALIMONY
translated_text: Dear Sir, we beg to inform you that we are instructed to wait until tomorrow, Thursday, at 1 o'clock, before filing suit against you, on behalf of Mrs. Julia Hearstwood, for divorce and alimony.

text: VERY TRULY YOURS ET CETERA COMPROMISE
translated_text: very truly yours, etc. Compromise

text: SO HERE IT WAS SPREAD OUT CLEAR BEFORE HIM AND NOW HE KNEW WHAT TO EXPECT
translated_text: So here it was, spread out clear before him, and now he knew what to expect.

text: IF HE DIDN'T GO AND SEE THEM THEY WOULD SUE HIM PROMPTLY
translated_text: If he didn't go and see them, they would sue him promptly.

text: PREFACE TO SECOND EDITION
translated_text: Preface to the second edition.

text: THIS IS A MISTAKE THOUGH A PERFECTLY NATURAL ONE
translated_text: This is a mistake, though, a perfectly natural one.

text: ON MY RETURN I PURPOSELY AVOIDED LOOKING INTO IT UNTIL I HAD SENT BACK MY LAST REVISES TO THE PRINTER
translated_text: On my return, I purposely avoided looking into it until I had sent back my last revises to the printer.

text: THEN I HAD MUCH PLEASURE IN READING IT BUT WAS INDEED SURPRISED AT THE MANY LITTLE POINTS OF SIMILARITY BETWEEN THE TWO BOOKS IN SPITE OF THEIR ENTIRE INDEPENDENCE TO ONE ANOTHER
translated_text: Then I had much pleasure in reading it, but was indeed surprised that the many little points of similarity between the two books, in spite of their entire independence to one another.

text: I REGRET THAT REVIEWERS HAVE IN SOME CASES BEEN INCLINED TO TREAT THE CHAPTERS ON MACHINES AS AN ATTEMPT TO REDUCE MISTER DARWIN'S THEORY TO AN ABSURDITY
translated_text: I regret that reviewers have, in some cases, been inclined to treat the chapters on machines as an attempt to reduce Mr. Darwin's theory to an absurdity.

text: I AM SURPRISED HOWEVER THAT THE BOOK AT WHICH SUCH AN EXAMPLE OF THE SPECIOUS MISUSE OF ANALOGY WOULD SEEM MOST NATURALLY LEVELLED SHOULD HAVE OCCURRED TO NO REVIEWER NEITHER SHALL I MENTION THE NAME OF THE BOOK HERE THOUGH I SHOULD FANCY THAT THE HINT GIVEN WILL SUFFICE
translated_text: I am surprised, however, that the book at which such an example of the species misuse of analogy would seem most naturally leveled should have occurred to no reviewer, neither shall I mention the name of the book here, though I should fancy that the hint given will suffice.

text: BUT THIS HAD AN EFFECT OF WHICH I HAVE LITTLE REASON TO COMPLAIN FOR I WAS ALLOWED ALMOST TO CALL THEM LIFE LONG SELF DECEIVERS TO THEIR FACES AND THEY SAID IT WAS QUITE TRUE BUT THAT IT DID NOT MATTER
translated_text: But this had an effect of which I have little reason to complain for I was allowed almost to call them lifelong self-dosevers to their faces. And they said it was quite true, but that it did not matter.

text: I MUST NOT CONCLUDE WITHOUT EXPRESSING MY MOST SINCERE THANKS TO MY CRITICS AND TO THE PUBLIC FOR THE LENIENCY AND CONSIDERATION WITH WHICH THEY HAVE TREATED MY ADVENTURES
translated_text: I must not conclude without expressing my most sincere thanks to my critics and to the public for the leniency and consideration with which they have treated my adventures.

text: IT WAS WRITTEN IN THE UPPER RANGITATA DISTRICT OF THE CANTERBURY PROVINCE AS IT THEN WAS OF NEW ZEALAND AND APPEARED AT CHRISTCHURCH IN THE PRESS NEWSPAPER JUNE THIRTEENTH EIGHTEEN SIXTY THREE
translated_text: It was written in the Upper Rangatata District of the Canabary Province as it then was of New Zealand, an appeared at Christchurch in the Press newspaper, June 13, 1863.

text: I ALSO WROTE ABOUT THIS TIME THE SUBSTANCE OF WHAT ULTIMATELY BECAME THE MUSICAL BANKS AND THE TRIAL OF A MAN FOR BEING IN A CONSUMPTION
translated_text: I also wrote about this time the substance of what ultimately became the musical banks, and the trial of a man for being in a consumption.

text: I SEE FROM MY SECOND PREFACE THAT I TOOK THE BOOK TO MESSRS CHAPMAN AND HALL MAY FIRST EIGHTEEN SEVENTY ONE AND ON THEIR REJECTION OF IT UNDER THE ADVICE OF ONE WHO HAS ATTAINED THE HIGHEST RANK AMONG LIVING WRITERS I LET IT SLEEP TILL I TOOK IT TO MISTER TRUBNER EARLY IN EIGHTEEN SEVENTY TWO
translated_text: I see for my second preface that I took the book to Miss Eur's Chapman and Hall, May 1, 1871, and on their rejection of it under the advice of one who has attained the highest rank among living writers, I let it sleep till I took it to Mr. Trubner early in 1872.

text: I ATTRIBUTE ITS UNLOOKED FOR SUCCESS MAINLY TO TWO EARLY FAVOURABLE REVIEWS THE FIRST IN THE PALL MALL GAZETTE OF APRIL TWELFTH AND THE SECOND IN THE SPECTATOR OF APRIL TWENTIETH
translated_text: I attribute its unlooked for success mainly to two early favorable reviews. The first in the Palmol Gazette of April 12th, and the second in the spectator of April 20th.

text: THERE WAS ALSO ANOTHER CAUSE
translated_text: There was also another cause.

text: THE FIRST EDITION OF EREWHON SOLD IN ABOUT THREE WEEKS I HAD NOT TAKEN MOULDS AND AS THE DEMAND WAS STRONG IT WAS SET UP AGAIN IMMEDIATELY
translated_text: The first edition of Iruon sold in about three weeks. I had not taken molds and as the demand was strong it was set up again immediately.

text: I MADE A FEW FURTHER VERY TRIFLING ALTERATIONS BEFORE MOULDS WERE TAKEN BUT SINCE THE SUMMER OF EIGHTEEN SEVENTY TWO AS NEW EDITIONS WERE FROM TIME TO TIME WANTED THEY HAVE BEEN PRINTED FROM STEREOS THEN MADE
translated_text: I made a few further very trifling alterations before molds were taken, but since the summer of 1872. As new additions were from time to time wanted, they had been printed from stereos then made.

text: I AM STILL FAIRLY WELL SATISFIED WITH THOSE PARTS OF EREWHON THAT WERE REPEATEDLY REWRITTEN BUT FROM THOSE THAT HAD ONLY A SINGLE WRITING I WOULD GLADLY CUT OUT SOME FORTY OR FIFTY PAGES IF I COULD
translated_text: I am still fairly well satisfied with those parts of Eroan that were repeatedly rewritten, but from those that had only a single writing, I would gladly cut out some 40 or 50 pages if I could.

text: THIS HOWEVER MAY NOT BE FOR THE COPYRIGHT WILL PROBABLY EXPIRE IN A LITTLE OVER TWELVE YEARS
translated_text: This, however, may not be, for the copyright will probably expire in a little over 12 years.

text: IF THE READER WILL EXCUSE ME I WILL SAY NOTHING OF MY ANTECEDENTS NOR OF THE CIRCUMSTANCES WHICH LED ME TO LEAVE MY NATIVE COUNTRY THE NARRATIVE WOULD BE TEDIOUS TO HIM AND PAINFUL TO MYSELF
translated_text: If the reader will excuse me, I will say nothing of my antecedents, nor of the circumstances which led me to leave my native country. The narrative would be tedious to him and painful to myself.

text: IT WILL BE SEEN THAT I DID NOT SUCCEED IN MY DESIGN AND THAT HOWEVER MUCH I MAY HAVE MET WITH THAT WAS NEW AND STRANGE I HAVE BEEN UNABLE TO REAP ANY PECUNIARY ADVANTAGE
translated_text: It will be seen that I did not succeed in my design, and that however much I may have met with that was new and strange. I have been unable to reap any pecuniary advantage.

text: NO ONE WHO IS HIMSELF HONEST WILL DOUBT MY BEING SO
translated_text: No one who is himself honest will doubt my being so.

text: I REACHED MY DESTINATION IN ONE OF THE LAST MONTHS OF EIGHTEEN SIXTY EIGHT BUT I DARE NOT MENTION THE SEASON LEST THE READER SHOULD GATHER IN WHICH HEMISPHERE I WAS
translated_text: I reached my destination in one of the last months of 1868, but I dare not mention the season, lest the reader should gather in which hemisphere I was.

text: SHEEP AND CATTLE WERE INTRODUCED AND BRED WITH EXTREME RAPIDITY MEN TOOK UP THEIR FIFTY THOUSAND OR ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND ACRES OF COUNTRY GOING INLAND ONE BEHIND THE OTHER TILL IN A FEW YEARS THERE WAS NOT AN ACRE BETWEEN THE SEA AND THE FRONT RANGES WHICH WAS NOT TAKEN UP AND STATIONS EITHER FOR SHEEP OR CATTLE WERE SPOTTED ABOUT AT INTERVALS OF SOME TWENTY OR THIRTY MILES OVER THE WHOLE COUNTRY
translated_text: Sheep and cattle were introduced and bred with extreme rapidity. Men took up their 50,000 or 100,000 acres of country, going inland one behind the other. Till in a few years there was not an acre between the sea and the front ranges which was not taken up. And stations either for sheep or cattle were spotted, about an intervals of some 20 or 30 miles over the whole country.

text: I WAS DELIGHTED WITH THE COUNTRY AND THE MANNER OF LIFE
translated_text: I was delighted with the country and the manner of life.

text: I WAS TO SEE THE SHEEP NOT NECESSARILY CLOSE AT HAND NOR TO GET THEM IN A SINGLE MOB BUT TO SEE ENOUGH OF THEM HERE AND THERE TO FEEL EASY THAT NOTHING HAD GONE WRONG THIS WAS NO DIFFICULT MATTER FOR THERE WERE NOT ABOVE EIGHT HUNDRED OF THEM AND BEING ALL BREEDING EWES THEY WERE PRETTY QUIET
translated_text: I was to see the sheep not necessarily close at hand, or to get them in a single mob, but to see enough of them here and there to feel easy that nothing had gone wrong. This was no difficult matter, for there were not above 800 of them, and being all breeding use, they were pretty quiet.

text: THERE WERE A GOOD MANY SHEEP WHICH I KNEW AS TWO OR THREE BLACK EWES AND A BLACK LAMB OR TWO AND SEVERAL OTHERS WHICH HAD SOME DISTINGUISHING MARK WHEREBY I COULD TELL THEM
translated_text: There were good many sheep which I knew as two or three black use and a black lamb or two, and several others which had some distinguishing mark whereby I could tell them.

text: IT IS SURPRISING HOW SOON THE EYE BECOMES ACCUSTOMED TO MISSING TWENTY SHEEP OUT OF TWO OR THREE HUNDRED
translated_text: It is surprising how soon the eye becomes accustomed to missing 20 sheep out of two or three hundred.

text: IT WAS A MONOTONOUS LIFE BUT IT WAS VERY HEALTHY AND ONE DOES NOT MUCH MIND ANYTHING WHEN ONE IS WELL
translated_text: It was a monotonous life, but it was very healthy, and one does not much mind anything one won as well.

text: THE COUNTRY WAS THE GRANDEST THAT CAN BE IMAGINED
translated_text: The country was the grandest that can be imagined.

text: SO LONELY AND SO SOLEMN WITH THE SAD GREY CLOUDS ABOVE AND NO SOUND SAVE A LOST LAMB BLEATING UPON THE MOUNTAIN SIDE AS THOUGH ITS LITTLE HEART WERE BREAKING
translated_text: So lonely and so solemn, with the sad grey clouds above, and no sound save a lost lamb bleeding upon them outside, as though it's a little heart we're breaking.

text: EACH MUST CRY LOUDER AND WANDER FARTHER YET MAY LUCK BE WITH THEM BOTH THAT THEY MAY FIND THEIR OWN AT NIGHTFALL
translated_text: Each must cry louder and wander farther yet. May luck be with them both that they may find their own at nightfall.

text: I HAD NO MONEY BUT IF I COULD ONLY FIND WORKABLE COUNTRY I MIGHT STOCK IT WITH BORROWED CAPITAL AND CONSIDER MYSELF A MADE MAN
translated_text: I had no money, but if I could only find workable country, I might stock it with borrowed capital, and consider myself a made man.

text: THERE WAS NO ONE IN THE WHOLE WORLD WHO HAD THE SMALLEST IDEA SAVE THOSE WHO WERE THEMSELVES ON THE OTHER SIDE OF IT IF INDEED THERE WAS ANY ONE AT ALL COULD I HOPE TO CROSS IT
translated_text: There was no one in the whole world who had the smallest idea. Save those who were themselves on the other side of it. If indeed there was anyone at all, could I hope to cross it?

text: I WOULD TRY THE NEARER RANGE AND SEE HOW FAR I COULD GO
translated_text: I would try the nearer range and see how far I could go.

text: SHORTLY AFTER PASSING ONE OF THESE CHAPELS WE CAME SUDDENLY UPON A VILLAGE WHICH STARTED UP OUT OF THE MIST AND I WAS ALARMED LEST I SHOULD BE MADE AN OBJECT OF CURIOSITY OR DISLIKE
translated_text: Shortly after passing one of these chapels we came suddenly upon a village which started up out of the mist, and I was alarmed lest I should be made an object of curiosity or dislike.

text: MY GUIDES HOWEVER WERE WELL KNOWN AND THE NATURAL POLITENESS OF THE PEOPLE PREVENTED THEM FROM PUTTING ME TO ANY INCONVENIENCE BUT THEY COULD NOT HELP EYEING ME NOR I THEM
translated_text: My guides, however, were well known, and the natural politeness of the people prevented them from putting me to any inconvenience. But they could not help eyeing me nor eye them.

text: THE STREETS WERE NARROW AND UNPAVED BUT VERY FAIRLY CLEAN
translated_text: The streets were narrow and unpaid but very fairly clean.

text: THE VINE GREW OUTSIDE MANY OF THE HOUSES AND THERE WERE SOME WITH SIGN BOARDS ON WHICH WAS PAINTED A BOTTLE AND A GLASS THAT MADE ME FEEL MUCH AT HOME
translated_text: The vine grew outside many of the houses and there were some with signboards on which was painted a bottle and a glass that made me feel much at home.

text: EVEN ON THIS LEDGE OF HUMAN SOCIETY THERE WAS A STUNTED GROWTH OF SHOPLETS WHICH HAD TAKEN ROOT AND VEGETATED SOMEHOW THOUGH AS IN AN AIR MERCANTILE OF THE BLEAKEST
translated_text: Even on this ledge of human society there was a stunted growth of shoplets, which had taken and vegetated somehow, though as in an air-American tile of the bleakest.

text: EACH FEATURE WAS FINISHED EYELIDS EYELASHES AND EARS BEING ALMOST INVARIABLY PERFECT
translated_text: Each feature was finished, eyelids, eyelashes and ears being almost invariably perfect.

text: THEIR EXPRESSION WAS DIVINE AND AS THEY GLANCED AT ME TIMIDLY BUT WITH PARTED LIPS IN GREAT BEWILDERMENT I FORGOT ALL THOUGHTS OF THEIR CONVERSION IN FEELINGS THAT WERE FAR MORE EARTHLY
translated_text: Their expression was divine, and as they glanced at me timidly but with parted lips and great bewilderment, I forgot all thoughts of their conversion and feelings that were far more earthly.

text: EVEN IN MIDDLE AGE THEY WERE STILL COMELY AND THE OLD GREY HAIRED WOMEN AT THEIR COTTAGE DOORS HAD A DIGNITY NOT TO SAY MAJESTY OF THEIR OWN
translated_text: Even in middle age they were still cumly, and the old great-haired women at their cottage doors had a dignity, not to say majesty of their own.

text: THE MEN WERE AS HANDSOME AS THE WOMEN BEAUTIFUL
translated_text: The Menwear is handsome as the women beautiful.

text: I HAVE ALWAYS DELIGHTED IN AND REVERENCED BEAUTY BUT I FELT SIMPLY ABASHED IN THE PRESENCE OF SUCH A SPLENDID TYPE A COMPOUND OF ALL THAT IS BEST IN EGYPTIAN GREEK AND ITALIAN
translated_text: I have always delighted in and reverenced beauty, but I felt simply abashed in the presence of such a splendid type, a compound of all that is best in Egyptian Greek and Italian.

text: THE CHILDREN WERE INFINITE IN NUMBER AND EXCEEDINGLY MERRY I NEED HARDLY SAY THAT THEY CAME IN FOR THEIR FULL SHARE OF THE PREVAILING BEAUTY
translated_text: The children were infinite in number and exceedingly merry. I need hardly say that they came in for their full share of the prevailing beauty.

text: I EXPRESSED BY SIGNS MY ADMIRATION AND PLEASURE TO MY GUIDES AND THEY WERE GREATLY PLEASED
translated_text: I expressed by signs my admiration and pleasure to my guides, and they were greatly pleased.

text: THE COUNTRY WAS HIGHLY CULTIVATED EVERY LEDGE BEING PLANTED WITH CHESTNUTS WALNUTS AND APPLE TREES FROM WHICH THE APPLES WERE NOW GATHERING
translated_text: The country was highly cultivated every ledge being planted with chestnuts, walnuts, and apple trees, from which the apples were now gathering.

text: I SAW A FEW SHEEP WITH ROUNDED NOSES AND ENORMOUS TAILS
translated_text: I saw a few sheep with rounded noses and enormous tails.

text: IN ABOUT FOUR HOURS OF WALKING FROM THE TIME WE STARTED AND AFTER PASSING TWO OR THREE MORE VILLAGES WE CAME UPON A CONSIDERABLE TOWN AND MY GUIDES MADE MANY ATTEMPTS TO MAKE ME UNDERSTAND SOMETHING BUT I GATHERED NO INKLING OF THEIR MEANING EXCEPT THAT I NEED BE UNDER NO APPREHENSION OF DANGER
translated_text: In about four hours of walking from the time we started and after passing two or three more villages, we came upon a considerable town and my guides made many attempts to make me understand something. But I gathered no inkling of their meaning, except that I need be under no apprehension of danger.

text: SUFFICE IT THAT I FOUND MYSELF TAKEN BEFORE THE CHIEF MAGISTRATE AND BY HIS ORDERS WAS PLACED IN AN APARTMENT WITH TWO OTHER PEOPLE WHO WERE THE FIRST I HAD SEEN LOOKING ANYTHING BUT WELL AND HANDSOME
translated_text: Suffice it that I found myself taken before the chief magistrate, and by his orders was placed in an apartment with two other people. Who were the first I had seen looking anything but well in handsome.

text: IN FACT ONE OF THEM WAS PLAINLY VERY MUCH OUT OF HEALTH AND COUGHED VIOLENTLY FROM TIME TO TIME IN SPITE OF MANIFEST EFFORTS TO SUPPRESS IT
translated_text: In fact, one of them was plainly very much out of health, and coughed violently from time to time in spite of manifest efforts to suppress it.

text: THE OTHER LOOKED PALE AND ILL BUT HE WAS MARVELLOUSLY SELF CONTAINED AND IT WAS IMPOSSIBLE TO SAY WHAT WAS THE MATTER WITH HIM
translated_text: The other looked pale and ill, but he was marvelously self-contained, and it was impossible to say what was the matter with him.

text: THEY FELT MY PULSE THEY LOOKED AT MY TONGUE THEY LISTENED AT MY CHEST THEY FELT ALL MY MUSCLES AND AT THE END OF EACH OPERATION THEY LOOKED AT THE CHIEF AND NODDED AND SAID SOMETHING IN A TONE QUITE PLEASANT AS THOUGH I WERE ALL RIGHT
translated_text: They felt my pulse, they looked at my tongue, they listened at my chest, they felt all my muscles, and at the end of each operation they looked at the chief and nodded. And said something in a tone quite pleasant as though I were alright.

text: BUT BY AND BY THEY CAME TO MY WATCH WHICH I HAD HIDDEN AWAY IN THE INMOST POCKET THAT I HAD AND HAD FORGOTTEN WHEN THEY BEGAN THEIR SEARCH
translated_text: But by and by they came to my watch, which I had hidden away in the inn most pocket that I had, and had forgotten when they began their search.

text: AGAIN THERE WAS A VERY OLD CARRIAGE WHOSE WHEELS IN SPITE OF RUST AND DECAY I COULD SEE HAD BEEN DESIGNED ORIGINALLY FOR IRON RAILS
translated_text: Again, there was a very old carriage whose wheels, in spite of rest and decay, I could see, had been designed originally for iron rails.

text: WE PASSED MANY CASES AND AT LAST CAME TO ONE IN WHICH THERE WERE SEVERAL CLOCKS AND TWO OR THREE OLD WATCHES
translated_text: We passed many cases and it last came to one in which there were several clocks and two or three old watches.

text: THE DESIGN WAS DIFFERENT BUT THE THING WAS CLEARLY THE SAME
translated_text: The design was different, but the thing was clearly the same.

text: THIS HAD SOME EFFECT IN CALMING HIM
translated_text: This had some effect in calming him.

text: HE BEGAN PRESENTLY TO RELENT AND SPOKE TO ME IN A KINDER MANNER
translated_text: He began presently to relent and spoke to me in a kinder manner.

text: I IMAGINE THERE WERE SEVERAL KINDS OF OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMASES BUT IT COULD HARDLY BE WORSE THAN A CHOP IN MY CHAMBERS OR HORROR OF HORRORS AT THE CLUB OR MY COUSIN LUCY'S NOTION OF WHAT SHE CALLS THE FESTIVE SEASON
translated_text: I imagine there were several kinds of old-fashioned Christmases, but it could hardly be worse than a chop at my chambers, or horror of horrors at the club, where my cousin Lucy's notion of what she calls the festive season.

text: FESTIVE YES
translated_text: Festive? Yes.

text: THE REPLY WAS WRITTEN IN A SPRAWLING FEMININE HAND IT WAS A LITTLE VAGUE
translated_text: The reply was written in a sprawling feminine hand. It was a little vague.

text: IT APPEARED THAT THE TERMS WOULD BE FIVE GUINEAS BUT THERE WAS NO MENTION OF THE LENGTH OF TIME WHICH THAT FEE WOULD COVER
translated_text: It appeared that the terms would be 5 guineas, but there was no mention of the length of time which that fee would cover.

text: THE WHOLE THING WAS A TRIFLE ODD
translated_text: The whole thing was a trifle odd.

text: THERE WAS NOTHING SAID ABOUT THE SORT OF ACCOMMODATION WHICH WOULD BE PROVIDED NOTHING ABOUT THE KIND OF ESTABLISHMENT WHICH WAS MAINTAINED OR THE TABLE WHICH WAS KEPT
translated_text: There was nothing set about the sort of accommodation which would be provided, nothing about the kind of establishment which was maintained, or the table which was kept.

text: NOW IT IS A REMARKABLE THING THAT I HAVE ALWAYS HAD AN EXTRAORDINARY PREDILECTION FOR THE NAME MADGE I DO NOT KNOW WHY
translated_text: Now it is a remarkable thing that I have always had an extraordinary predilection for the name Mag. I do not know why.

text: I HAVE NEVER KNOWN A MADGE AND YET FROM MY BOYHOOD UPWARD I HAVE DESIRED TO MEET ONE
translated_text: I have never known a match, and yet, from my boyhood upward, I have desired to meet one.

text: UNDER SUCH CIRCUMSTANCES SHE WAS HARDLY LIKELY TO BE LIVELY HERSELF BUT HER NAME WAS MADGE AND IT WAS THE ACCIDENT OF HER CHRISTIAN NAME WHICH DECIDED ME TO GO
translated_text: Under such circumstances, she was hardly likely to be lively herself, but her name was match, and it was the accident of her Christian name which decided me to go.

text: I HAD NO ILLUSIONS
translated_text: I had no illusions.

text: I DID NOT EXPECT A PRINCELY ENTERTAINMENT
translated_text: I did not expect a princely entertainment.

text: ALL NIGHT IT HAD BEEN BLOWING AND RAINING
translated_text: All night it had been blowing and raining.

text: I FELT QUITE LIVELY MYSELF AS I MINGLED WITH THE CHRISTMAS CROWD LOOKING FOR THINGS WHICH MIGHT NOT TURN OUT TO BE ABSOLUTELY PREPOSTEROUS
translated_text: I felt quite lively myself as I mingled with the Christmas crowd, looking for things which might not turn out to be absolutely preposterous.

text: I EVEN BOUGHT SOMETHING FOR MADGE I MEAN MISSUS WILSON
translated_text: I even bought something from Edge. I mean Mrs. Wilson.

text: IT WAS A HORRIBLE JOURNEY
translated_text: It was a horrible journey.

text: HE WAS IMPERVIOUS TO REASON
translated_text: He was impervious to reason.

text: IT IS SOME SATISFACTION FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO REFLECT THAT I MADE IT WARM FOR THE OFFICIALS HOWEVER COLD I MIGHT HAVE BEEN MYSELF
translated_text: It is some satisfaction for me to be able to reflect that I made it warm for the officials, however cold I might have been myself.

text: WHEN AT LAST I REACHED CROFTON MY JOURNEY'S END IT TURNED OUT THAT THE STATION STAFF CONSISTED OF A HALF WITTED INDIVIDUAL WHO WAS STATIONMASTER PORTER AND CLERK COMBINED AND A HULKING LAD WHO DID WHATEVER ELSE THERE WAS TO DO
translated_text: When at last I reached Crofton, my journey's end, it turned out that the station staff consisted of a half-witted individual who was station master, porter, and clerk combined, and a hooking lad who did whatever else there was to do.

text: NO ONE HAD COME TO MEET ME THE VILLAGE WAS ABOUT HALF A MILE AND HANGAR DENE THE HOUSE FOR WHICH MY STEPS WERE BENT ABOUT FOUR MILES BY THE ROAD HOW FAR IT WAS ACROSS PLOUGHED FIELDS MY INFORMANT DID NOT MENTION
translated_text: No one had come to meet me. The village was about a half a mile. And hang our dean, the house for which my steps were bent, about four miles by the road, how far it was across Ploughed Fields my informant did not mention.

text: THERE WAS A TRAP AT THE BOY AND BLUNDERBUSS BUT THAT REQUIRED FETCHING
translated_text: There was a trap at the boy in Blunderbuss, but that required fetching.

text: WHEN THE TRAP DID APPEAR IT LOOKED TO ME UNCOMMONLY LIKE AN OPEN SPRING CART
translated_text: When the trap did appear, it looked to me uncommonly like an open spring cart.

text: IN IT I WAS DEPOSITED WITH MY LUGGAGE
translated_text: In it, I was deposited with my luggage.

text: I DID NOT KNOW WHAT HE MEANT
translated_text: I did not know what he meant.

text: I DID NOT ASK I WAS BEYOND IT
translated_text: I did not ask. I was beyond it.

text: I WAS CHILLED TO THE BONE WET TIRED HUNGRY
translated_text: I was chilled to the bone, wet, tired, hungry.

text: I HAD LONG BEEN WISHING THAT AN OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMAS HAD BEEN COMPLETELY EXTINCT BEFORE I HAD THOUGHT OF ADVENTURING IN QUEST OF ONE
translated_text: I had long been wishing that an old-fashioned Christmas had been completely extinct before I had thought of adventuring in quest of one.

text: HERE WE BE THAT MIGHT BE SO
translated_text: Here we be. That might be so.

text: THERE BE THE DOOR IN FRONT OF YOU YOU GO UP THREE STEPS IF YOU CAN FIND EM
translated_text: There'd be the door in front of you, you'd go up three steps if you can find them.

text: THERE'S A KNOCKER IF NONE OF EM HAVEN'T TWISTED IT OFF
translated_text: There's a knocker if none of them haven't twisted it off.

text: THERE APPEARED TO BE NO KNOCKER THOUGH WHETHER IT HAD BEEN TWISTED OFF WAS MORE THAN I COULD SAY
translated_text: There appeared to be no knocker, though whether it had been twisted off was more than I could say.

text: NO ANSWER THOUGH I ALLOWED A MORE THAN DECENT INTERVAL
translated_text: No answer, though. I allowed a more than decent interval.

text: BETTER RING AGAIN SUGGESTED THE DRIVER HARD
translated_text: Better ring again suggested the driver. Hard.

text: MAYBE THEY'RE UP TO SOME OF THEIR GAMES AND WANTS ROUSING
translated_text: Maybe they're up to some of their games and wants rousing.

text: THE BELL REVERBERATED THROUGH WHAT SEEMED LIKE AN EMPTY HOUSE
translated_text: The bell reverberated through what seemed like an empty house.

text: PRESENTLY FEET WERE HEARD ADVANCING ALONG THE PASSAGE SEVERAL PAIRS IT SEEMED AND A LIGHT GLEAMED THROUGH THE WINDOW OVER THE DOOR
translated_text: Presently feet were heard advancing along the passage. Several pairs it seemed, and a light gleam through the window over the door.

text: A VOICE INQUIRED WHO'S THERE
translated_text: A voice inquired. Who's there?

text: THE INFORMATION WAS GREETED WITH WHAT SOUNDED UNCOMMONLY LIKE A CHORUS OF LAUGHTER
translated_text: The information was greeted with what sounded uncommonly like a chorus of laughter.

text: THERE WAS A RUSH OF RETREATING FEET AN EXPOSTULATING VOICE THEN DARKNESS AGAIN AND SILENCE
translated_text: There was a rush of retreating feet, an expostulating voice, then darkness again, and silence.

text: WHO LIVES HERE ARE THE PEOPLE MAD
translated_text: Who lives here? Are the people mad?

text: I TOLLED THE BELL AGAIN
translated_text: I told the bell again.

text: AFTER A VAST AMOUNT OF UNFASTENING THE DOOR WAS OPENED AND ON THE THRESHOLD THERE STOOD A GIRL WITH A LIGHTED CANDLE IN HER HAND
translated_text: After a vast amount of unfasseting, the door was opened, and on the threshold there stood a girl, with a lighted candle in her hand.

text: I'M MISTER CHRISTOPHER FROM LONDON
translated_text: I'm Mr. Christopher from London.

text: WE'VE LOST THE KEY OF THE CELLAR AND THERE'S NOTHING OUT EXCEPT WATER AND I DON'T THINK YOU'D CARE FOR THAT
translated_text: We've lost the key of the cellar, and there's nothing out except water. And I don't think you'd care for that.

text: HER FATHER IS A MOST REMARKABLE PERSON TO SAY THE LEAST
translated_text: Her father is a most remarkable person to say the least.

text: BUT IT IS QUITE PLAIN TO ME THAT ALL THE ARRANGEMENTS FOR MY WEDDING ARE GOING TO BE MADE BY THE SNELLINGS
translated_text: But it is quite plain to me that all the arrangements for my wedding are going to be made by the snowlings.

text: I DO NOT KNOW WHEN IT IS GOING TO BE BUT IT WILL BE EITHER NEXT WEEK OR THE WEEK AFTER CERTAINLY AT THE EARLIEST POSSIBLE MOMENT AND I SHOULDN'T BE AT ALL SURPRISED TO LEARN THAT ALL MARY ANN'S THINGS HAD BEEN ALREADY BOUGHT AND PERHAPS SOME OF THEM MARKED
translated_text: I do not know when it is going to be, but it will be either next week or the week after, certainly at the earliest possible moment. And I shouldn't be at all surprised to learn that all Mary Ann's things have been already bought and perhaps some of them marked.

text: IT IS MOST DELIGHTFUL
translated_text: It is most delightful.

text: IT MIGHT JUST AS WELL BE SOME ONE ELSE'S WEDDING SO UNIMPORTANT IS THE PART WHICH I AM SET TO PLAY IN IT
translated_text: It might just as well be someone else's wedding. So unimportant is the part which I am set to play in it.

text: FOR INSTANCE LOOK AT THEIR BEHAVIOUR IN THE MATTER OF THE RING
translated_text: For instance, look at their behavior in the matter of the ring.

text: THE ACCIDENT IN QUESTION OCCURRED UPON THE SUNDAY EVENING
translated_text: The accident and question occurred upon the Sunday evening.

text: THE GIRL IS FRETTING BUT YOU DON'T SEEM TO NOTICE IT
translated_text: The girl is fretting, but you don't seem to notice it.

text: I GASPED POSITIVELY GASPED
translated_text: I guessed. Positively guessed.

text: THAT'S IT ON YOUR ACCOUNT
translated_text: That's it on your account.

text: FROM A COUSIN OF OURS WHO'S IN THAT LINE
translated_text: from a cousin of ours who's in that line.

text: I NEVER SAW PEOPLE LIKE THE SNELLINGS FOR POSSESSING RELATIVES IN ALL SORTS OF LINES
translated_text: I never saw people like the snowlings for possessing relatives and all sorts of lines.

text: I WAS PERSUADED THAT SOMEBODY BESIDES THAT COUSIN GOT A PROFIT OUT OF MARY ANN'S ENGAGEMENT RING BUT I HANDED OVER THE AMOUNT
translated_text: I was persuaded that somebody, besides that cousin, got a profit out of Mary Ann's engagement ring, but I handed over the amount.

text: IT IS FROM HER ACTION IN THAT MATTER THAT MY SUSPICION SPRINGS
translated_text: It is from her action in that matter that my suspicion springs.

text: THERE SHE OWNS A COTTAGE OR IT MAY BE A PIGSTYE FOR ALL I KNOW
translated_text: There she owns a cottage, or it may be a pigstie for all I know.

text: WHEN SHE HEARD OF MY ENGAGEMENT WITH MARY ANN SHE WROTE AND SUGGESTED THAT WE SHOULD SPEND OUR HONEYMOON IN HER COTTAGE OR PIGSTYE AND THAT I SHOULD PAY HER RENT FOR IT
translated_text: When she heard of my engagement with Mary Ann, she wrote and suggested that we should spend our honeymoon in her cottage, or pigstie, and that I should pay her rent for it.

text: THERE WERE NO SIGNS OF FALTERING ABOUT HER FLOW OF LANGUAGE
translated_text: There were no signs of faltering about her flow of language.

text: I FOUND THAT AS A WOMAN OF BUSINESS SHE WAS BEYOND ALL MY EXPECTATIONS
translated_text: I found that as a woman of business, she was beyond all my expectations.

text: IT TURNED OUT THAT SHE HAD A LITTLE MONEY OF HER OWN ABOUT A HUNDRED AND THIRTY POUNDS A YEAR
translated_text: It turned out that she had a little money of her own, about 130 pounds a year.

text: AND OF COURSE I HAD MY EXPECTATIONS AND SHE HAD HERS
translated_text: And, of course, I had my expectations, and she had hers.

text: IT WAS PLAIN THAT TOGETHER WE SHOULD MANAGE MOST COMFORTABLY DELIGHTFULLY IN FACT
translated_text: It was plain that together we should manage most comfortably, delightfully in fact.

text: I SHALL MAKE PAPA GIVE ME FIVE HUNDRED POUNDS AT LEAST
translated_text: I shall make Papa give me 500 pounds at least.

text: A BIRD IN THE HAND IS WORTH TWO IN A BUSH' AND IT WILL BE SOMETHING TO HAVE BY US
translated_text: A bird in the hand is worth two in a bush, and it will be something to have by us.

text: I KNOW WHAT MAMMA CAN AFFORD TO GIVE AND I WILL SEE SHE GIVES IT
translated_text: I know what Mama can afford to give and I will see if she gives it.

text: AND I WILL SEE THAT THERE IS NO SHIRKING ABOUT THE BOYS OR ABOUT THE GIRLS EITHER
translated_text: And I will see that there is no shirking about the boys or about the girls either.

text: I HAVE DRAWN UP A LIST OF ALL THE PEOPLE WHO OUGHT TO GIVE US A PRESENT AND I SHALL TELL THEM WHAT THEY OUGHT TO GIVE IT WON'T BE MY FAULT IF I DON'T GET IT
translated_text: I have drawn up a list of all the people who ought to give us a present, and I shall tell them what they ought to give. It won't be my fault if I don't get it.

text: OF COURSE THERE ARE SOME PEOPLE WITH WHOM YOU CAN'T BE PERFECTLY PLAIN BUT I SHALL BE AS PLAIN AS I CAN THERE'S A WAY AND A MANNER OF DOING THAT KIND OF THING
translated_text: Of course, there are some people with whom you can't be perfectly plain, but I shall be as plain as I can. There's a way and a manner of doing that kind of thing.

text: HERS HAS BEEN PRODIGIOUS
translated_text: Hers has been prodigious.

text: SHE HAS A KNACK OF GETTING PEOPLE TO DO WHAT SHE WISHES AND TO GIVE HER WHAT SHE WANTS WHICH IS A LITTLE SHORT OF MIRACULOUS
translated_text: She has a knack of getting people to do what she wishes and to give her what she wants, which is a little short of miraculous.

text: I NOTICE THAT THEY ARE GENERALLY PERSONS WHO HAVE ALREADY TENDERED THEIR OFFERINGS
translated_text: I noticed that they are generally persons who have already tendered their offerings.

text: THE FACT OF HAVING GIVEN MARY ANN A WEDDING PRESENT SEEMS TO FILL THEM WITH A FEELING OF RANCOROUS ACIDITY WHICH TO ME IS INEXPLICABLE
translated_text: The fact of having given Marianna wedding present seems to fill them with a feeling of renchorus acidity which, to me, is inexplicable.

text: SUCH IS THE SELFISHNESS OF HUMAN NATURE
translated_text: such as the selfishness of human nature.

text: BUT WHY ON THAT ACCOUNT THEY SHOULD PITY ME I ALTOGETHER FAIL TO UNDERSTAND
translated_text: But why on that account they should pity me I altogether failed to understand.

text: WE HAVE ALL BEEN GIVING MARY ANN PRESENTS AND I SUPPOSE YOU MISTER WHITING HAVE BEEN GIVING HER SOMETHING TOO
translated_text: We have all been giving Mary and Presence, and I suppose you, Mr. Widing, have been giving her something too.

text: THAT WAS WHAT MISSUS MACPHERSON SAID TO ME ONLY THE OTHER DAY
translated_text: That was what Mrs. McPherson said to me only the other day.

text: AND WHAT INQUIRED MISSUS MACPHERSON HAS MARY ANN GIVEN YOU HER LOVE
translated_text: And what inquired Mrs. McPherson has Maryanne given you? Her love.

text: SOMEONE SNIGGERED
translated_text: Someone sniggered.

text: I CANNOT PRETEND TO EXPLAIN WHY EXCEPT ON THE SUPPOSITION THAT ROMANCE IS DEAD AT LEAST IN THAT CIRCLE OF SOCIETY IN WHICH THE SNELLINGS MOVE
translated_text: I cannot pretend to explain why, except on the supposition that romance is dead, at least in that circle of society in which the snowlings move.

text: AS IT IS UNLESS I AM MISTAKEN SOME OF THE RENDING WILL BE ON OUR SIDE AND THEY KNOW IT
translated_text: As it is, unless I am mistaken, some of the Rending will be on our side, and they know it.

text: P S THE CARDS ARE OUT FOR THE WEDDING
translated_text: PS, the cards are out for the wedding.

text: WE ARE GOING FOR OUR HONEYMOON TO ITALY AND THE SOUTH OF FRANCE
translated_text: We are going for our honeymoon to Italy and the south of France.

text: A SECOND COUSIN OF MARY ANN'S IS IN THE COOK'S TOURS LINE
translated_text: A second cousin of Mary Ann's is in the Cook's Tour's line.

text: HE HAS GIVEN US FREE PASSES ALL THE WAY TO THE END OF OUR JOURNEY AND ALL THE WAY BACK AGAIN AND COUPONS FOR FREE BOARD AND LODGING AT THE HOTEL IT'S A WEDDING PRESENT
translated_text: He has given us free passes all the way to the end of our journey, and all the way back again, and coupons for free-board and lodging at the hotel. It's a wedding present.

text: BESIDES WHICH WE CAN ALWAYS SELL THE COUPONS AND RAILWAY PASSES WHICH WE DON'T USE
translated_text: Besides which, we can always sell the coupons and railway passes, which we don't use.

text: HE WAS YOUNG NO SPEAR HAD TOUCHED HIM NO POISON LURKED IN HIS WINE
translated_text: He was young. No spear had touched him. No poison lurked in his wine.

text: I TELL YOU IT IS NOT POISON SHE CRIED
translated_text: I tell you it is not poison," she cried.

text: SINCE HIS BIRTH HE HAS BEEN GUARDED SO CLOSELY THAT THE CLEVEREST POISONERS OF THE EAST COULD NOT REACH HIM
translated_text: Since his birth, he has been guarded so closely that the cleverest poisonous of the East could not reach him.

text: AS YOU WELL KNOW THERE ARE TEN MEN AND TEN WOMEN WHOSE SOLE DUTY IS TO TASTE HIS FOOD AND WINE AND FIFTY ARMED WARRIORS GUARD HIS CHAMBER AS THEY GUARD IT NOW
translated_text: As you well know, there are ten men and ten women whose sole duty is to taste his food and wine, and fifty armed warriors guard his chamber as they guard it now.

text: A LOW CONFUSED MOAN WANED FROM HIS MOUTH
translated_text: A low, confused moan wane from his mouth.

text: THE MAN SHRUGGED HIS BROAD SHOULDERS AND TURNED BACK INTO THE ARABESQUE CHAMBER
translated_text: The man shrugged his broad shoulders and turned back into the Arabesque chamber.

text: THIS MAN WAS CLAD IN A BROWN CAMEL HAIR ROBE AND SANDALS AND A GREEN TURBAN WAS ON HIS HEAD
translated_text: This man was clad in a brown camel hair robe and sandals, and a green turban was on his head.

text: NOT UNTIL THE HEAVENS WERE IN THE PROPER ORDER COULD THEY PERFORM THIS NECROMANCY
translated_text: Not until the heavens were in the proper order, could they perform this necromancy?

text: WITH A LONG STAINED FINGERNAIL HE MAPPED THE CONSTELLATIONS ON THE MARBLE TILED FLOOR
translated_text: With a long stained fingernail, he mapped the constellations on the marble-tiled floor.

text: THE SLANT OF THE MOON PRESAGED EVIL FOR THE KING OF VENDHYA THE STARS ARE IN TURMOIL THE SERPENT IN THE HOUSE OF THE ELEPHANT
translated_text: The slant of the moon pressaged evil for the king of Vendya. The stars are in turmoil, the serpent in the house of the elephant.

text: POINT OF CONTACT INQUIRED THE OTHER
translated_text: Point of contact, inquired the other.

text: ALL DISCARDED PORTIONS OF THE HUMAN BODY STILL REMAIN PART OF IT ATTACHED TO IT BY INTANGIBLE CONNECTIONS
translated_text: All discarded portions of the human body still remain part of it, attached to it by intangible connections.

text: BUT AT THE URGENT ENTREATY OF THE PRINCESS OF KHOSALA WHO LOVED BHUNDA CHAND VAINLY HE GAVE HER A LOCK OF HIS LONG BLACK HAIR AS A TOKEN OF REMEMBRANCE
translated_text: But, at the urgent and treaty of the princes of Kossala, who loved Bunda Chandvene, he gave her a lock of his long black hair as a token of remembrance.

text: BY WHICH A SOUL IS DRAWN FROM ITS BODY AND ACROSS GULFS OF ECHOING SPACE RETURNED THE MAN ON THE MAT
translated_text: By which a soul is drawn from its body and across gulfs of echoing space, return the man on the mat.

text: ON THE DAIS UNDER THE GOLDEN DOME THE KING CRIED OUT AGAIN RACKED BY AWFUL PAROXYSMS
translated_text: On the dais, under the golden dome, the king cried out again, racked by awful paroxisms.

text: THEY SEEK TO SNAP THE SILVER CORD THAT BINDS ME TO MY DYING BODY
translated_text: They seek to snap the silver cord that binds me to my dying body.

text: THEY CLUSTER AROUND ME THEIR HANDS ARE TALONED THEIR EYES ARE RED LIKE FLAME BURNING IN DARKNESS
translated_text: They cluster around me. Their hands are taloned. Their eyes are red like flame burning in darkness.

text: THEIR FINGERS SEAR ME LIKE FIRE
translated_text: Their fingers seer me like fire.

text: I KNOW NOW WHAT BRINGS ME TO THE PYRE
translated_text: I know now what brings me to the pyre.

text: THERE THEY STROVE TO BREAK THE SILVER CORD OF LIFE AND THRUST MY SOUL INTO THE BODY OF A FOUL NIGHT WEIRD THEIR SORCERY SUMMONED UP FROM HELL AH
translated_text: There, they strove to break the silver cord of life, and thrust my soul into the body of a foul night-weird their sorcery summoned up from hell.

text: YOUR CRY AND THE GRIP OF YOUR FINGERS BROUGHT ME BACK BUT I AM GOING FAST
translated_text: Your cry and the grip of your fingers brought me back, but I am going fast.

text: THERE WAS THE OLD IMPERIOUS NOTE IN HIS FAILING WHISPER
translated_text: There was the old, imperious note in his failing whisper.

text: YOU HAVE NEVER DISOBEYED ME OBEY MY LAST COMMAND
translated_text: You have never disobeyed me. Obey my last command.

text: SEND MY SOUL CLEAN TO ASURA
translated_text: Send my soul clean to a sureer.

text: THEY ALSO FOUND A MARTIAN CALENDAR THE YEAR HAD BEEN DIVIDED INTO TEN MORE OR LESS EQUAL MONTHS AND ONE OF THEM HAD BEEN DOMA
translated_text: They also found a Martian calendar. The year had been divided into ten more or less equal months, and one of them had been Doma.

text: BILL CHANDLER THE ZOOLOGIST HAD BEEN GOING DEEPER AND DEEPER INTO THE OLD SEA BOTTOM OF SYRTIS
translated_text: Bill Chandler, the zoologist, have been going deeper and deeper into the old sea bottom of Sirtais.

text: THAT TOOK THE CENTER OF INTEREST AWAY FROM ARCHAEOLOGY AND STARTED A NEW BURST OF ACTIVITY
translated_text: That took the center of interest away from archaeology and started a new burst of activity.

text: THE CIVILIAN SPECIALISTS IN OTHER FIELDS AND THE SPACE FORCE PEOPLE WHO HAD BEEN HOLDING TAPE LINES AND MAKING SKETCHES AND SNAPPING CAMERAS WERE ALL FLYING TO LOWER SYRTIS TO FIND OUT HOW MUCH OXYGEN THERE WAS AND WHAT KIND OF LIFE IT SUPPORTED
translated_text: The civilian specialists in other fields and the space force people who have been holding tape lines and making sketches and snapping cameras were all flying to lower seartists to find out how much oxygen there was and what kind of life it supported.

text: THEY HAD FOUR OR FIVE SPECIES OF WHAT MIGHT LOOSELY BE CALLED BIRDS AND SOMETHING THAT COULD EASILY BE CLASSED AS A REPTILE AND A CARNIVOROUS MAMMAL THE SIZE OF A CAT WITH BIRDLIKE CLAWS AND A HERBIVORE ALMOST IDENTICAL WITH THE PIGLIKE THING IN THE BIG DARFHULVA MURAL AND ANOTHER LIKE A GAZELLE WITH A SINGLE HORN IN THE MIDDLE OF ITS FOREHEAD
translated_text: They had four or five species of what might loosely be called birds, and something that could easily be classed as a reptile, and a carnivorous mammal the size of a cat, with bird-like claws, and a herbivore almost identical with the pig-like thing in the big Darf Hullva mural, and another, like a gazelle, with a single horn in the middle of its forehead.

text: THE DAILY NEWSCASTS FROM TERRA SHOWED A CORRESPONDING SHIFT IN INTEREST AT HOME
translated_text: The Daily Newscast from Tara showed a corresponding shift in interest at home.

text: TONY'S FOUND THE MARTIANS
translated_text: TOTES FOUND THE MARTIONS!

text: IT WAS LOCKED FROM THE INSIDE AND WE HAD TO BURN IT DOWN WITH A TORCH THAT'S WHERE THEY ARE
translated_text: It was locked from the inside and we had to burn it down with the torch. That's where they are.

text: GLORIA STANDISH WHO HAD DROPPED IN FOR LUNCH WAS ON THE MEZZANINE FAIRLY SCREAMING INTO A RADIOPHONE EXTENSION DOZEN AND A HALF OF THEM
translated_text: Gloria Standish, who had dropped in for lunch, was on the mezzanine, fairly screaming into a radio phone extension. Doesn't in a half of them!

text: WELL OF COURSE THEY'RE DEAD WHAT A QUESTION
translated_text: Well, of course they're dead. What a question.

text: MARTHA REMEMBERED THE CLOSED DOOR ON THE FIRST SURVEY THEY HADN'T ATTEMPTED OPENING IT
translated_text: Martha remembered the closed door. On the first survey, they hadn't attempted opening it.

text: NOW IT WAS BURNED AWAY AT BOTH SIDES AND LAY STILL HOT ALONG THE EDGES ON THE FLOOR OF THE BIG OFFICE ROOM IN FRONT
translated_text: Now it was burned away at both sides, and lay still hot along the edges on the floor of the big office room in front.

text: A FLOODLIGHT WAS ON IN THE ROOM INSIDE AND LATTIMER WAS GOING AROUND LOOKING AT THINGS WHILE A SPACE FORCE OFFICER STOOD BY THE DOOR
translated_text: A flood light was on in the room inside, and Vladimir was going around looking at things while a Space Force officer stood by the door.

text: MASS SUICIDE THAT'S WHAT IT WAS NOTICE WHAT'S IN THE CORNERS
translated_text: Mass suicide. That's what it was. Notice what's in the corners.

text: YES CHARCOAL
translated_text: Yes, charcoal.

text: SO THEY JUST CAME IN HERE AND LIT THE CHARCOAL AND SAT DRINKING TOGETHER TILL THEY ALL FELL ASLEEP
translated_text: So, they just came in here and lit the charcoal and sat drinking together till they all fell asleep.

text: THE TERRAN PUBLIC WANTED TO HEAR ABOUT MARTIANS AND IF LIVE MARTIANS COULDN'T BE FOUND A ROOM FULL OF DEAD ONES WAS THE NEXT BEST THING
translated_text: The Terran public wanted to hear about Martians, and if live Martians couldn't be found, a room full of dead ones was the next best thing.

text: TONY LATTIMER THE DISCOVERER WAS BEGINNING TO CASH IN ON HIS ATTENTIONS TO GLORIA AND HIS INGRATIATION WITH SID HE WAS ALWAYS EITHER MAKING VOICE AND IMAGE TALKS FOR TELECAST OR LISTENING TO THE NEWS FROM THE HOME PLANET
translated_text: Tony Latimer, the discoverer, was beginning to cash in on his attentions to Gloria and his engratiation with Sid. He was always either making voice and image talks for telecast or listening to the news from the home planet.

text: WITHOUT QUESTION HE HAD BECOME OVERNIGHT THE MOST WIDELY KNOWN ARCHAEOLOGIST IN HISTORY
translated_text: Without question, he had become overnight the most widely known archaeologist in history.

text: NOT THAT I'M INTERESTED IN ALL THIS FOR MYSELF HE DISCLAIMED AFTER LISTENING TO THE TELECAST FROM TERRA TWO DAYS AFTER HIS DISCOVERY
translated_text: Not that I'm interested in all this for myself. He disclaimed after listening to the telecast from Tara two days after his discovery.

text: BRING IT TO THE PUBLIC ATTENTION DRAMATIZE IT
translated_text: Bring it to the public attention. Dramatize it.

text: SO I BELIEVE I SHALL GO BACK AT LEAST FOR A WHILE AND SEE WHAT I CAN DO
translated_text: So, I believe I shall go back at least for a while and see what I can do.

text: LECTURES
translated_text: lectures.

text: THE ORGANIZATION OF A SOCIETY OF MARTIAN ARCHAEOLOGY WITH ANTHONY LATTIMER PH D THE LOGICAL CANDIDATE FOR THE CHAIR
translated_text: The organization of a society of Martian archaeology with Anthony Latimer, PhD, the logical candidate for the chair.

text: I'LL BE GLAD TO TRY SIR HE REPLIED
translated_text: I'll be glad to try, sir," he replied.

text: INSIDE A SECRET ROCKET TELEMETERING DEVICE WAS MOUNTED ON ITS TEST STAND
translated_text: Inside, a secret rocket telemetering device was mounted on its test stand.

text: THIS ISN'T PART OF YOUR TESTING ROUTINE IS IT
translated_text: This isn't part of your testing routine, is it?

text: ANOTHER ENGINEER RUSHED TOWARD THE DOOR TO SEE WHAT WAS HAPPENING OUTSIDE
translated_text: Another engineer rushed toward the door to see what was happening outside.

text: ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT CASCADED FROM THE WALL SHELVES AND A HEAVY DUTY CHAIN HOIST CAME LOOSE FROM ITS OVERHEAD TRACK PLUNGING TO THE FLOOR WITH A TERRIFYING CRASH
translated_text: Electronic equipment cascaded from the wall shelves, and a heavy duty chain hoist came loose from its overhead track, plunging to the floor with a terrifying crash.

text: AN INSTANT LATER IT CRASHED OVER PINNING MARK FABER BENEATH IT
translated_text: An instant later it crashed over, pinning Mark Faber beneath it.

text: BUD THREW UP HIS ARMS TO PROTECT HIMSELF BUT TOO LATE
translated_text: Bud threw up his arms to protect himself, but too late.

text: FOR MINUTES NO ONE STIRRED AMONG THE WRECKAGE
translated_text: For minutes no one stirred among the wreckage.

text: THEN TOM WHO HAD BEEN STUNNED BY SOME FALLING DEBRIS RAISED HIMSELF TO A SITTING POSITION
translated_text: Then Tom, who had been stunned by some falling debris, raised himself to a sitting position.

text: TOM'S EYES FOCUSED IN HORROR ON THE WRECKAGE ENVELOPED BY STILL BILLOWING DUST
translated_text: Tom's eyes focused in horror on the wreckage enveloped by still-billowing dust.

text: THE SKY WAS VISIBLE THROUGH SEVERAL GAPING HOLES IN THE ROOF WHICH WAS SAGGING DANGEROUSLY ON ITS SUPPORTING TRUSSES
translated_text: The sky was visible through several gaping holes in the roof, which was sagging dangerously on its supporting trusses.

text: THE YOUNG INVENTOR HAD JUST NOTICED HIS FRIEND LYING PINNED BENEATH A HEAVY BEAM NEARBY
translated_text: The young inventor had just noticed his friend lying pin beneath a heavy beam nearby.

text: HIS FRIEND'S EYELIDS FLICKERED
translated_text: his friends eyelids flickered.

text: WE'D BETTER NOT TRY TO MOVE HIM TOM DECIDED WE'LL GET AN AMBULANCE
translated_text: We'd better not try to move him," Tom decided. We'll get an ambulance.

text: THEY PICKED THEIR WAY THROUGH THE WRECKAGE AND EMERGED ON A SCENE OF FRIGHTFUL DESTRUCTION
translated_text: They pick their way through the wreckage and emerged on a scene of frightful destruction.

text: LET'S SEE ABOUT GETTING HELP FOR MISTER FABER
translated_text: Let's see about getting help for Mr. Faber.

text: AND THE ONLY TRUCK WE HAD AVAILABLE WAS IN THAT BURNING SHED THE SUPERINTENDENT ADDED BITTERLY
translated_text: And the only truck we had available was in that burning shed. The superintendent added bitterly.

text: ANYHOW WE WANT TO HELP GOT A JOB FOR US
translated_text: Anyhow, we want to help. Got a job for us?

text: WITHIN MINUTES TOM WAS IN CHARGE OF CLEARING AWAY RUBBLE AND EXTRICATING ANYONE WHO MIGHT BE TRAPPED INSIDE THE BUILDINGS
translated_text: Within minutes, Tom was in charge of clearing away rubble and extricating anyone who might be trapped inside the buildings.

text: THE TELEPHONE LINE WAS SOON REPAIRED AND A STEADY STREAM OF RESCUE VEHICLES BEGAN ARRIVING FROM HARKNESS FIRE TRUCKS THREE AMBULANCES AND PRIVATE CARS DRIVEN BY VOLUNTEERS
translated_text: The telephone line was soon repaired and a steady stream of rescue vehicles began arriving from Harkness, Firetrucks, three ambulances and private cars driven by volunteers.

text: THE TWO GIRLS WERE AS MUCH UPSET AS TOM'S MOTHER TOM LAUGHED
translated_text: The two girls were as much upset as Tom's mother. Tom laughed.

text: MISTER SWIFT CAME INTO THE LIVING ROOM JUST THEN AND TOLD TOM HOW WORRIED MISSUS SWIFT AND SANDY HAD BEEN
translated_text: Mr. Swift came into the living room just then and told Tom how worried Mrs. Swift and Sandy had been.

text: HE SMILED GUILTILY AS HE ADDED BUT I MUST ADMIT I WAS MORE THAN A LITTLE CONCERNED MYSELF
translated_text: He smiled guiltily as he added, but I must admit I was more than a little concerned myself.

text: HE'S A GREAT SCIENTIST
translated_text: He's a great scientist.

text: TOM NODDED UNHAPPILY
translated_text: Tom nodded unhappily.

text: MALE OR FEMALE HUMAN OR ANIMAL
translated_text: Male or female, human or animal.

text: MISTER SWIFT'S EYES TWINKLED
translated_text: Mr. Swift's eyes twinkled.

text: FORTUNATELY WILL HALLEY WAS NOT A MAN IN A HURRY AND DID NOT USE A PRESS OF CANVAS OR HIS MASTS WOULD INEVITABLY HAVE COME DOWN
translated_text: Fortunately, Will Hally was not a man in a hurry and did not use oppressive canvass or his mass would inevitably have come down.

text: JOHN MANGLES THEREFORE HOPED THAT THE WRETCHED HULL WOULD REACH PORT WITHOUT ACCIDENT BUT IT GRIEVED HIM THAT HIS COMPANIONS SHOULD HAVE TO SUFFER SO MUCH DISCOMFORT FROM THE DEFECTIVE ARRANGEMENTS OF THE BRIG
translated_text: John Mangles, therefore, hoped that the wretched hole would reach port without accident, but it grieved him that his companions should have to suffer so much discomfort from the defective arrangements of the brig.

text: THEIR FRIENDS DID THEIR BEST TO AMUSE THEM
translated_text: Their friends did their best to amuse them.

text: THEIR MINDS WERE SO DISTRACTED AT THIS CHANGE OF ROUTE AS TO BE QUITE UNHINGED
translated_text: Their minds were so distracted at this change of route as to be quite unhinged.

text: MUCH AS THEY HAD BEEN INTERESTED IN HIS DISSERTATION ON THE PAMPAS OR AUSTRALIA HIS LECTURES ON NEW ZEALAND FELL ON COLD AND INDIFFERENT EARS
translated_text: much as they had been interested in his dissertation on the pompous or Australia, his lectures on New Zealand fell on cold and indifferent ears.

text: HIS EYES WANDERED CEASELESSLY OVER THE BLANK HORIZON
translated_text: His eyes wandered ceaselessly over the blank horizon.

text: WHAT THEN MY LORD
translated_text: What then, my Lord?

text: GOD KEEP US FROM SUCH A MEETING WHY JOHN
translated_text: God, keep us from such a meeting. Why John?

text: WE COULD NOT EVEN FLY FLY JOHN
translated_text: We could not even fly. Fly, John.

text: YES MY LORD WE SHOULD TRY IN VAIN
translated_text: Yes, my Lord, we should try and vain.

text: WE WOULD FIGHT TO THE DEATH OF COURSE BUT AFTER THAT
translated_text: We would fight to the death of course, but after that

text: THINK OF LADY GLENARVAN THINK OF MARY GRANT
translated_text: Think of Lady Glenarvin. Think of Mary Grant.

text: WILL HALLEY IS A BRUTE BUT I AM KEEPING MY EYES OPEN AND IF THE COAST LOOKS DANGEROUS I WILL PUT THE SHIP'S HEAD TO SEA AGAIN
translated_text: Will Hally is a brute, but I am keeping my eyes open. And if the coast looks dangerous, I will put the ships head to sea again.

text: SO THAT ON THAT SCORE THERE IS LITTLE OR NO DANGER
translated_text: So that and that score there is little or no danger.

text: BUT AS TO GETTING ALONGSIDE THE DUNCAN GOD FORBID
translated_text: about as to getting alongside the Duncan? God forbid!

text: THEY WERE NOT TO LEAVE IT AGAIN TILL THE TOPS OF THE WAHITI RANGES WERE LIT WITH THE FIRST FIRES OF DAY
translated_text: They were not to leave it again till the tops of the Wahidi ranges were lit for the first fires of day.

text: THEY HAD ONE NIGHT IN WHICH TO PREPARE FOR DEATH
translated_text: They had one night in which to prepare for death.

text: THE MEAL ENDED
translated_text: The meal ended.

text: SLEEP WHICH KEEPS ALL SORROW IN ABEYANCE SOON WEIGHED DOWN THEIR EYELIDS THEY SLEPT IN EACH OTHER'S ARMS OVERCOME BY EXHAUSTION AND PROLONGED WATCHING
translated_text: Sleep, which keeps all sorrow in advance, soon weighed down their eyelids. They slept in each other's arms, overcome by exhaustion and prolonged watching.

text: IF IT IS DECREED THAT WE DIE TO MORROW LET US DIE BRAVELY LIKE CHRISTIAN MEN READY TO APPEAR WITHOUT TERROR BEFORE THE SUPREME JUDGE
translated_text: If it is decreed that we die tomorrow, let us die bravely, like Christian men, ready to appear without terror before the supreme judge.

text: GOD WHO READS OUR HEARTS KNOWS THAT WE HAD A NOBLE END IN VIEW
translated_text: God, who reads our hearts, knows that we had a noble end in view.

text: GLENARVAN'S VOICE FIRM TILL NOW FALTERED
translated_text: Glenarbon's voice firm till now faltered.

text: JOHN YOU HAVE PROMISED MARY WHAT I PROMISED LADY HELENA WHAT IS YOUR PLAN
translated_text: John, you have promised Mary what I promised Lady Helena, what is your plan?

text: I BELIEVE SAID JOHN THAT IN THE SIGHT OF GOD I HAVE A RIGHT TO FULFILL THAT PROMISE
translated_text: I believe, said John, that in the sight of God I have a right to fulfill that promise.

text: MY LORD WHICHEVER OF US SURVIVES THE OTHER WILL FULFILL THE WISH OF LADY HELENA AND MARY GRANT
translated_text: My Lord, whichever of us survives, the other will fulfill the wish of Lady Helena and Mary Grant.

text: AT LAST THE MAJOR SAID MY FRIENDS KEEP THAT TO THE LAST MOMENT
translated_text: At last, the Major said, my friends, keep that to the last moment.

text: THE JAILER MAY FORGET THAT HE IS ON GUARD THE PRISONER NEVER FORGETS THAT HE IS GUARDED
translated_text: The jailer may forget that he is on guard. The prisoner never forgets that he is guarded.

text: ON THAT SIDE DESCENT WAS IMPOSSIBLE AND HAD IT BEEN POSSIBLE THE BOTTOM WAS SHUT IN BY THE ENORMOUS ROCK
translated_text: on that side descent was impossible and had it been possible, bottom was shut in by the enormous rock.

text: LISTEN SAID HE MOTIONING THEM TO STOOP
translated_text: Listen said he motioned them to stoop

text: ANIMAL OR MAN ANSWERED THE MAJOR I WILL SOON FIND OUT
translated_text: Animal or man answered the major, I will soon find out.

text: WILSON AND OLBINETT JOINED THEIR COMPANIONS AND ALL UNITED TO DIG THROUGH THE WALL JOHN WITH HIS DAGGER THE OTHERS WITH STONES TAKEN FROM THE GROUND OR WITH THEIR NAILS WHILE MULRADY STRETCHED ALONG THE GROUND WATCHED THE NATIVE GUARD THROUGH A CREVICE OF THE MATTING
translated_text: Wilson and Obernette joined their companions and all united to dig through the wall. John with his dagger, the others with stones taken from the ground, or with their nails, while Mouraddy stretched along the ground, watched the native guard through a crevice of the matty.

text: WHAT COULD BE THE OBJECT
translated_text: What could be the object?

text: DID THEY KNOW OF THE EXISTENCE OF THE PRISONERS OR WAS IT SOME PRIVATE ENTERPRISE THAT LED TO THE UNDERTAKING
translated_text: Did they know the existence of the prisoners or was it some private enterprise that led to the undertaking?

text: THEIR FINGERS BLED BUT STILL THEY WORKED ON AFTER HALF AN HOUR THEY HAD GONE THREE FEET DEEP THEY PERCEIVED BY THE INCREASED SHARPNESS OF THE SOUNDS THAT ONLY A THIN LAYER OF EARTH PREVENTED IMMEDIATE COMMUNICATION
translated_text: Their fingers bled, but still they worked on. After a half an hour they had gone three feet deep. They perceived by the increased sharpness of the sounds that only a thin layer of earth prevented immediate communication.

text: JOHN MANGLES INSERTING THE BLADE OF HIS PONIARD AVOIDED THE KNIFE WHICH NOW PROTRUDED ABOVE THE SOIL BUT SEIZED THE HAND THAT WIELDED IT
translated_text: John Mangles inserting the blade of his pognared, avoided the knife which now protruded above the soil, but seized the hand that wielded it.

text: BUT SOFTLY AS THE NAME WAS BREATHED MARY GRANT ALREADY AWAKENED BY THE SOUNDS IN THE HUT SLIPPED OVER TOWARD GLENARVAN AND SEIZING THE HAND ALL STAINED WITH EARTH SHE COVERED IT WITH KISSES
translated_text: But softly as the name was breathed, Mary Grant already awakened by the sounds of the hut, slipped over toward Glenarbon and seizing the hand, all stained with earth, she covered it with kisses.

text: WATCH THE SAVAGES OUTSIDE SAID ROBERT
translated_text: Watch the savages outside," said Robert.

text: ROUND HIS BODY WAS ROLLED A LONG COIL OF FLAX ROPE
translated_text: Round his body was rolled along coil of Flax rope.

text: MY CHILD MY CHILD MURMURED LADY HELENA THE SAVAGES DID NOT KILL YOU
translated_text: My child, my child, murmured Lady Helena, the savages did not kill you.

text: ONCE THERE WAS A FATHER WHO THOUGHT HE WOULD BUILD FOR HIS CHILDREN A BEAUTIFUL HOME PUTTING INTO IT EVERY THING THEY COULD NEED OR DESIRE THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES
translated_text: Once there was a father who thought he would build for his children a beautiful home, putting into it everything they could need or desire throughout their lives.

text: THE SWEETEST PERFUMES FLOATED THROUGH THE AIR WHILE THOUSANDS OF BIRDS ANSWERED THE MUSIC OF FOUNTAINS WITH THEIR SONGS
translated_text: The sweetest perfumes floated through the air, while thousands of birds answered the music of fountains with their songs.

text: WHY DID HE GIVE THAT SO ODD A SHAPE OR SO STRANGE A COVERING
translated_text: Why did he give that so odd a shape or so strange a covering?

text: AND SO THROUGH MANY QUESTIONS AND MANY EXPERIMENTS THEY LEARN AT LAST HOW TO USE THE CONTENTS OF THIS ONE STOREHOUSE
translated_text: And so, through many questions and experiments, they learn at last how to use the contents of this one storehouse.

text: THE ENTRANCE IS LIGHT BECAUSE IT OPENS SO WIDE BUT WE CAN SEE THAT THE FLOOR SLOPES DOWNWARD AND THE WAY LOOKS DARK AND NARROW BEFORE US
translated_text: The entrance is light because it opens so wide, but we can see that the floor slopes downward and the way looks dark and narrow before us.

text: WALK DOWN THE SLOPING FOOT PATH NOW AND BE CAREFUL TO KEEP OUT OF THE WAY OF THE LITTLE CARS THAT ARE COMING AND GOING ON EACH SIDE OF YOU LOADED ON ONE SIDE AND EMPTY ON THE OTHER AND SEEMING TO RUN UP AND DOWN BY THEMSELVES
translated_text: Walk down the sloping footpath now and be careful to keep out of the way of the little cars that are coming and going on each side of you. Load it on one side and empty on the other and seeming to run up and down by themselves.

text: LOOK A LITTLE CLOSER WHILE OUR GUIDE LETS THE LIGHT OF HIS LAMP FALL UPON THE BLACK WALL AT YOUR SIDE
translated_text: Look a little closer while our guide lets the light of his lamp fall upon the black wall at your side.

text: SEE BENEATH YOUR FEET IS THE MARKING OF GREAT TREE TRUNKS LYING ASLANT ACROSS THE FLOOR AND THE FORMS OF GIGANTIC PALM LEAVES STREWED AMONG THEM
translated_text: See beneath your feet is the marking of great tree trunks lying a slant across the floor, and the forms of gigantic palm leaves strode among them.

text: HERE IS SOMETHING DIFFERENT ROUNDED LIKE A NUT SHELL YOU CAN SPLIT OFF ONE SIDE AND BEHOLD THERE IS THE NUT LYING SNUGLY AS DOES ANY CHESTNUT IN ITS BUR
translated_text: Here is something different. Rounded like a nut shell, you can split off one side and behold there is the nut lined snugly as does any chestnut in its burr.

text: FERNS AND PALMS MOSSES AND TREES AND ANIMALS ALL PERFECT ALL BEAUTIFUL AND YET ALL HIDDEN AWAY UNDER THIS HILL AND TURNED INTO SHINING BLACK COAL NOW I CAN VERY WELL REMEMBER WHEN I FIRST SAW A COAL FIRE AND HOW ODD IT LOOKED TO SEE WHAT SEEMED TO BE BURNING STONES
translated_text: Furns and palms, mosses and trees and animals, all perfect, all beautiful, and yet all hidden away under this hill and turned into shining black coal. Now, I can very well remember when I first saw a coal fire and how odd it looked to see what seemed to be burning stones.

text: FOR WHEN I WAS A LITTLE GIRL WE ALWAYS HAD LOGS OF WOOD BLAZING IN AN OPEN FIREPLACE AND SO DID MANY OTHER PEOPLE AND COAL WAS JUST COMING INTO USE FOR FUEL
translated_text: For when I was a little girl, we always had logs of wood blazing in an open fireplace. And so did many other people, and Cole was just coming into use for fuel.

text: WHAT SHOULD WE HAVE DONE IF EVERYBODY HAD KEPT ON BURNING WOOD TO THIS DAY
translated_text: What should we have done if everybody had capped on burning wood to this day?

text: THESE FORESTS WERE OF TREES DIFFERENT IN SOME WAYS FROM THOSE WE HAVE NOW GREAT FERNS AS TALL AS THIS HOUSE AND MOSSES AS HIGH AS LITTLE TREES AND PALM LEAVES OF ENORMOUS SIZE
translated_text: These forests were of trees different in some ways from those we have now. Great ferns as tall as this house, and mosses as high as little trees, and palm leaves of enormous size.

text: THEN THE HILLS WERE PILED UP ON TOP OF IT ALL BUT HERE AND THERE SOME EDGE OF A COAL BED WAS TILTED UP AND APPEARED ABOVE THE GROUND
translated_text: then the hills were piled up on top of it all. But here and there, some edge of a coal bed was tilted up and appeared above the ground.

text: BUT BY AND BY THE WISE MEN THOUGHT ABOUT IT AND SAID TO THEMSELVES WE MUST FIND OUT WHAT USEFUL PURPOSE GOD MADE THE GAS FOR WE KNOW THAT HE DOES NOT MAKE ANY THING FOR HARM ONLY
translated_text: But by and by the wise men thought about it and said to themselves, we must find out what useful purpose God made the gas for. We know that He does not make anything for harm only.

text: IT WAS ONLY A TROUBLE TO THE GAS MAKERS WHO HAD NO USE FOR IT AND EVEN THREW IT AWAY UNTIL SOME ONE MORE THOUGHTFUL THAN THE OTHERS FOUND OUT THAT WATER WOULD NOT PASS THROUGH IT
translated_text: It was only a trouble to the gas makers who had no use for it and even threw it away until someone more thoughtful than the others found out that water would not pass through it.

text: DON'T YOU SEE HOW MANY USES WE HAVE FOUND FOR THIS REFUSE COAL TAR
translated_text: Don't you see how many uses we have found for this refuse cold car?

text: WHEN YOUR HANDS OR LIPS ARE CRACKED AND ROUGH FROM THE COLD DOES YOUR MOTHER EVER PUT ON GLYCERIN TO HEAL THEM
translated_text: When your hands or lips are cracked and rough from the cold, does your mother ever put on glycerin to heal them?

text: ONE WHO WRITES OF SUCH AN ERA LABOURS UNDER A TROUBLESOME DISADVANTAGE
translated_text: One who writes of such an era, labors under a troublesome disadvantage.

text: IN THE PRESENT CASE THAT DISADVANTAGE IS DOUBLED FOR WHILE THE SINS OF THE CHURCH HOWEVER HEINOUS WERE STILL SUCH AS ADMIT OF BEING EXPRESSED IN WORDS THE SINS OF THE HEATHEN WORLD AGAINST WHICH SHE FOUGHT WERE UTTERLY INDESCRIBABLE AND THE CHRISTIAN APOLOGIST IS THUS COMPELLED FOR THE SAKE OF DECENCY TO STATE THE CHURCH'S CASE FAR MORE WEAKLY THAN THE FACTS DESERVE
translated_text: In the present case, that disadvantage is doubled. For while the sins of the Church, however heinous, were still such as admit of being expressed in words, the sins of the heathen world against which she fought were utterly indescribable, and the Christian apologist is thus compelled for the sake of decency to state the church's case far more weekly than the facts deserve.

text: NOT BE IT EVER REMEMBERED THAT THE SLIGHTEST SUSPICION OF IMMORALITY ATTACHES EITHER TO THE HEROINE OF THIS BOOK OR TO THE LEADING PHILOSOPHERS OF HER SCHOOL FOR SEVERAL CENTURIES
translated_text: Not be it ever remembered that the slightest suspicion of immorality attaches either to the heroine of this book or to the leading philosophers of her school for several centuries.

text: THAT DIVINE WORD WHO IS THE LIGHT WHO LIGHTETH EVERY MAN WHICH COMETH INTO THE WORLD HAD AWAKENED IN THE HEART OF MANKIND A MORAL CRAVING NEVER BEFORE FELT IN ANY STRENGTH EXCEPT BY A FEW ISOLATED PHILOSOPHERS OR PROPHETS
translated_text: That divine word, who is the light, who lighteth every man which comeeth into the world, how to wake in the heart of mankind a moral craving never before felt in any strength, except by a few isolated philosophers or prophets.

text: THE VERY EMPERORS HAD ARRAYED THEMSELVES ON HER SIDE
translated_text: The very Emperor's had to raid themselves on her side.

text: JULIAN'S LAST ATTEMPT TO RESTORE PAGANISM BY IMPERIAL INFLUENCE HAD ONLY PROVED THAT THE OLD FAITH HAD LOST ALL HOLD UPON THE HEARTS OF THE MASSES AT HIS DEATH THE GREAT TIDE WAVE OF NEW OPINION ROLLED ON UNCHECKED AND THE RULERS OF EARTH WERE FAIN TO SWIM WITH THE STREAM TO ACCEPT IN WORDS AT LEAST THE CHURCH'S LAWS AS THEIRS TO ACKNOWLEDGE A KING OF KINGS TO WHOM EVEN THEY OWED HOMAGE AND OBEDIENCE AND TO CALL THEIR OWN SLAVES THEIR POORER BRETHREN AND OFTEN TOO THEIR SPIRITUAL SUPERIORS
translated_text: Julian's last attempt to restore paganism by imperial influence had only proved that the old faith had lost all hold upon the hearts of the masses. Had his death the great tide wave of new opinion rolled on unchecked, and the rulers of earth were feigned to swim with the stream. To accept, in words at least, the church's laws as theirs. To acknowledge a king of kings to whom even they owed homage and obedience, and to call their own slaves their poor brethren. And often too, their spiritual superiors.

text: BUT IF THE EMPERORS HAD BECOME CHRISTIAN THE EMPIRE HAD NOT
translated_text: But if the Emperor had become Christian, the Empire had not.

text: IN THE MEANWHILE THE MINDS OF MEN CUT ADRIFT FROM THEIR ANCIENT MOORINGS WANDERED WILDLY OVER PATHLESS SEAS OF SPECULATIVE DOUBT AND ESPECIALLY IN THE MORE METAPHYSICAL AND CONTEMPLATIVE EAST ATTEMPTED TO SOLVE FOR THEMSELVES THE QUESTIONS OF MAN'S RELATION TO THE UNSEEN BY THOSE THOUSAND SCHISMS HERESIES AND THEOSOPHIES IT IS A DISGRACE TO THE WORD PHILOSOPHY TO CALL THEM BY IT ON THE RECORDS OF WHICH THE STUDENT NOW GAZES BEWILDERED UNABLE ALIKE TO COUNT OR TO EXPLAIN THEIR FANTASIES
translated_text: In the meanwhile, the minds of men, cut adrift from their ancient moorings, wandered wildly over pathless seas of speculative doubt, and especially in the more metaphysical and contemplative east, attempted to solve for themselves the questions of man's relation to the unseen by those thousand schisms, heresies, and theosophies. It is a disgrace to the word philosophy to call them by it. On the records of which the student now gazes bewildered, unable alike to count, or to explain their fantasies.

text: THEY BROUGHT BEFORE THE MINDS OF CHURCHMEN A THOUSAND NEW QUESTIONS WHICH MUST BE SOLVED UNLESS THE CHURCH WAS TO RELINQUISH FOR EVER HER CLAIMS AS THE GREAT TEACHER AND SATISFIER OF THE HUMAN SOUL
translated_text: They brought before the minds of church men a thousand new questions which must be solved, unless the church was to relinquish forever her claims as the great teacher and satisfy her of the human soul.

text: BUT THE HEALTH OF A CHURCH DEPENDS NOT MERELY ON THE CREED WHICH IT PROFESSES NOT EVEN ON THE WISDOM AND HOLINESS OF A FEW GREAT ECCLESIASTICS BUT ON THE FAITH AND VIRTUE OF ITS INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS
translated_text: But the health of a church depends not merely on the creed which it professes, not even on the wisdom and holiness of a few great ecclesiastics, but on the faith and virtue of its individual members.

text: THE MENS SANA MUST HAVE A CORPUS SANUM TO INHABIT
translated_text: The men's santa must have a corpus santa to inhabit.

text: AND THE NEW BLOOD AT THE ERA OF THIS STORY WAS AT HAND
translated_text: And the new blood at the era of this story was at hand.

text: TRIBE AFTER TRIBE WAS CROWDING DOWN TO THE ALPS AND TRAMPLING UPON EACH OTHER ON THE FRONTIERS OF THE EMPIRE
translated_text: tribe after tribe was crowding down to the Alps and trampling upon each other on the frontiers of the Empire.

text: THE HUNS SINGLY THEIR INFERIORS PRESSED THEM FROM BEHIND WITH THE IRRESISTIBLE WEIGHT OF NUMBERS ITALY WITH HER RICH CITIES AND FERTILE LOWLANDS BECKONED THEM ON TO PLUNDER AS AUXILIARIES THEY HAD LEARNED THEIR OWN STRENGTH AND ROMAN WEAKNESS A CASUS BELLI WAS SOON FOUND
translated_text: The Huns, singly their inferior, pressed them from behind with the irresistible weight of numbers. Italy, with her rich cities and fertile lowlands, beckoned them on to plunder. As auxiliary they had learned their own strength and a Roman weakness. Acausus Belli was soon found.

text: HOW INIQUITOUS WAS THE CONDUCT OF THE SONS OF THEODOSIUS IN REFUSING THE USUAL BOUNTY BY WHICH THE GOTHS WERE BRIBED NOT TO ATTACK THE EMPIRE THE WHOLE PENT UP DELUGE BURST OVER THE PLAINS OF ITALY AND THE WESTERN EMPIRE BECAME FROM THAT DAY FORTH A DYING IDIOT WHILE THE NEW INVADERS DIVIDED EUROPE AMONG THEMSELVES
translated_text: How aniquitous was the conduct of the sons of Theodosius in refusing the usual bounty by which the Goths were bribed not to attack the Empire. The whole pent-up day-luch burst over the plains of Italy, and the Western Empire became from that day 4th a dying idiot, while the new invaders divided Europe among themselves.

text: THE COUNTLESS TREASURES WHICH FIVE CENTURIES OF RAPINE HAD ACCUMULATED ROUND THE CAPITOL HAD BECOME THE PREY OF MEN CLOTHED IN SHEEPSKINS AND HORSE HIDE AND THE SISTER OF AN EMPEROR HAD FOUND HER BEAUTY VIRTUE AND PRIDE OF RACE WORTHILY MATCHED BY THOSE OF THE HARD HANDED NORTHERN HERO WHO LED HER AWAY FROM ITALY AS HIS CAPTIVE AND HIS BRIDE TO FOUND NEW KINGDOMS IN SOUTH FRANCE AND SPAIN AND TO DRIVE THE NEWLY ARRIVED VANDALS ACROSS THE STRAITS OF GIBRALTAR INTO THE THEN BLOOMING COAST LAND OF NORTHERN AFRICA
translated_text: The countless treasures which five centuries of rapine had accumulated around the capital had become the prey of men clothed in sheep skins and horse hide. And the sister of an emperor had found her beauty, virtue and pride of race worthily matched by those of the hard-handed northern hero who led her away from Italy as his captive and his bride, to found new kingdoms in South France and Spain. To drive the newly-arrived vandals across the straits of Gibraltar into the then blooming coastland of Northern Africa.

text: THAT EXTRAORDINARY REFORM IN MORALS WHICH ACCORDING TO SALVIAN AND HIS CONTEMPORARIES THE VANDAL CONQUERORS WORKED IN NORTH AFRICA AVAILED THEM NOTHING THEY LOST MORE THAN THEY GAVE
translated_text: That extraordinary reform in morals, which, according to Salvian and his contemporaries, the Vandal conquerors worked in North Africa, availed them nothing. They lost more than they gave.

text: CLIMATE BAD EXAMPLE AND THE LUXURY OF POWER DEGRADED THEM IN ONE CENTURY INTO A RACE OF HELPLESS AND DEBAUCHED SLAVE HOLDERS DOOMED TO UTTER EXTERMINATION BEFORE THE SEMI GOTHIC ARMIES OF BELISARIUS AND WITH THEM VANISHED THE LAST CHANCE THAT THE GOTHIC RACES WOULD EXERCISE ON THE EASTERN WORLD THE SAME STERN YET WHOLESOME DISCIPLINE UNDER WHICH THE WESTERN HAD BEEN RESTORED TO LIFE
translated_text: Climate, bad example, and the luxury of power degraded them in one century into a race of helpless and debauched slaveholders, doomed to utter extermination before the semi-gothic armies of Belicarius. And with them vanished the last chance that the Gothic races would exercise on the eastern world the same stern yet wholesome discipline under which the western had been restored to life.

text: THAT WONDERFUL METAPHYSIC SUBTLETY WHICH IN PHRASES AND DEFINITIONS TOO OFTEN UNMEANING TO OUR GROSSER INTELLECT SAW THE SYMBOLS OF THE MOST IMPORTANT SPIRITUAL REALITIES AND FELT THAT ON THE DISTINCTION BETWEEN HOMOOUSIOS AND HOMOIOUSIOS MIGHT HANG THE SOLUTION OF THE WHOLE PROBLEM OF HUMANITY WAS SET TO BATTLE IN ALEXANDRIA THE ANCIENT STRONGHOLD OF GREEK PHILOSOPHY WITH THE EFFETE REMAINS OF THE VERY SCIENTIFIC THOUGHT TO WHICH IT OWED ITS EXTRAORDINARY CULTURE
translated_text: That wonderful metaphysics subtlety, which, in phrases and definitions, too often unmeaning to our grosser intellect, saw the symbols of the most important spiritual realities, and felt that on the distinction between homo-oceus and homo-ioceus might hang the solution of the whole problem of humanity, was set to battle in Alexandria, the ancient stronghold of Greek philosophy, with the effete remains of the very scientific thought to which it owed its extraordinary culture.

text: TO SYNESIUS'S MOST CHARMING LETTERS AS WELL AS TO THOSE OF ISIDORE THE GOOD ABBOT OF PELUSIUM I BEG LEAVE TO REFER THOSE READERS WHO WISH FOR FURTHER INFORMATION ABOUT THE PRIVATE LIFE OF THE FIFTH CENTURY
translated_text: Tussanesius' most charming letters, as well as to those of Isidore, the good abbot of Pallusium, I beg leave to refer those readers who wish for further information about the private life of the 5th century.

text: I CANNOT HOPE THAT THESE PAGES WILL BE ALTOGETHER FREE FROM ANACHRONISMS AND ERRORS
translated_text: I cannot hope that these pages will be altogether free from anachronisms and errors.

text: THE PLACE SEEMED FRAGRANT WITH ALL THE RICHES OF GREEK THOUGHT AND SONG SINCE THE DAYS WHEN PTOLEMY PHILADELPHUS WALKED THERE WITH EUCLID AND THEOCRITUS CALLIMACHUS AND LYCOPHRON
translated_text: The place seemed fragrant with all the riches of Greek thought and song, since the days when Tolomea Philadelphia walked there with Euclid and Theocritus, Kalamakis and Lycafran.
