text: THE ROOM HAD NEITHER CARPET NOR FIREPLACE AND THE ONLY MOVABLES IN IT WERE A SOFA BED A TABLE AND AN ARM CHAIR ALL OF SUCH DELICATE AND GRACEFUL FORMS AS MAY BE SEEN ON ANCIENT VASES OF A FAR EARLIER PERIOD THAN THAT WHEREOF WE WRITE
translated_text: The room had neither carpet nor fireplace, and the only movables in it were a sofa bed, a table, and an armchair. All of such delicate and graceful forms as may be seen on ancient vases of a far earlier period than that were of we right.

text: BUT MOST PROBABLY HAD ANY OF US ENTERED THAT ROOM THAT MORNING WE SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN ABLE TO SPARE A LOOK EITHER FOR THE FURNITURE OR THE GENERAL EFFECT OR THE MUSEUM GARDENS OR THE SPARKLING MEDITERRANEAN BEYOND BUT WE SHOULD HAVE AGREED THAT THE ROOM WAS QUITE RICH ENOUGH FOR HUMAN EYES FOR THE SAKE OF ONE TREASURE WHICH IT POSSESSED AND BESIDE WHICH NOTHING WAS WORTH A MOMENT'S GLANCE
translated_text: But most probably had any of us entered that room that morning, we should not have been able to spare a look either for the furniture, or the generally fact, or the museum gardens, or the sparkling Mediterranean beyond. But we should have agreed that the room was quite rich enough for human eyes, for the sake of one treasure which it possessed, and beside which, nothing was worth a moment to glance.

text: SHE HAS LIFTED HER EYES OFF HER MANUSCRIPT SHE IS LOOKING OUT WITH KINDLING COUNTENANCE OVER THE GARDENS OF THE MUSEUM HER RIPE CURLING GREEK LIPS SUCH AS WE NEVER SEE NOW EVEN AMONG HER OWN WIVES AND SISTERS OPEN
translated_text: She has lifted her eyes off her manuscript. She is looking out with kindling countenance over the gardens of the museum. Her ripe curling Greek lips, such as we never see now, even among her own wives and sisters, open.

text: IF THEY HAVE CEASED TO GUIDE NATIONS THEY HAVE NOT CEASED TO SPEAK TO THEIR OWN ELECT
translated_text: If they have ceased to guide nations, they have not ceased to speak to their own elect.

text: IF THEY HAVE CAST OFF THE VULGAR HERD THEY HAVE NOT CAST OFF HYPATIA
translated_text: If they have cast off the vulgar herd, they have not cast off a patia.

text: TO BE WELCOMED INTO THE CELESTIAL RANKS OF THE HEROIC TO RISE TO THE IMMORTAL GODS TO THE INEFFABLE POWERS ONWARD UPWARD EVER THROUGH AGES AND THROUGH ETERNITIES TILL I FIND MY HOME AT LAST AND VANISH IN THE GLORY OF THE NAMELESS AND THE ABSOLUTE ONE
translated_text: to be welcomed into the celestial ranks of the heroic, to rise to the immortal gods, to the ineffable powers, onward, upward ever, through ages and through eternities, to lie find my home at last and vanish in the glory of the nameless and the absolute one.

text: I TO BELIEVE AGAINST THE AUTHORITY OF PORPHYRY HIMSELF TOO IN EVIL EYES AND MAGIC
translated_text: I, to believe against the authority of Porphyry himself to in evil eyes in the magic.

text: WHAT DO I CARE FOR FOOD
translated_text: What do I care for food?

text: HOW CAN HE WHOSE SPHERE LIES ABOVE THE STARS STOOP EVERY MOMENT TO EARTH
translated_text: How can he, whose sphere lies above the stars, stoop every moment to earth?

text: AY SHE ANSWERED HALF BITTERLY AND WOULD THAT WE COULD LIVE WITHOUT FOOD AND IMITATE PERFECTLY THE IMMORTAL GODS
translated_text: I, she answered, half-bitterly, and would that we could live without food and imitate perfectly the immortal gods.

text: THERE IS FRUIT WITH LENTILS AND RICE WAITING FOR YOU IN THE NEXT ROOM AND BREAD UNLESS YOU DESPISE IT TOO MUCH
translated_text: There is fruit with lentils and rice waiting for you in the next room, and bread unless you despise it too much.

text: STRANGE THAT MEN SHOULD BE CONTENT TO GROVEL AND BE MEN WHEN THEY MIGHT RISE TO THE RANK OF GODS
translated_text: Strange that men should be content to gravel and to be men when they might rise to the rank of gods.

text: NOT THAT SUCH A CREATURE AS THAT DISTURBS ME NO CREATED THING I HOPE CAN MOVE MY EQUANIMITY BUT IF I COULD STOOP TO HATE I SHOULD HATE HER HATE HER
translated_text: Not that such a creature as that disturbs me. No, created thing I hope can move my equanimity. But if I could stoop to hate, I should hate her. Hate her.

text: AND HER VOICE TOOK A TONE WHICH MADE IT SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN WHETHER IN SPITE OF ALL THE LOFTY IMPASSIBILITY WHICH SHE FELT BOUND TO POSSESS SHE DID NOT HATE PELAGIA WITH A MOST HUMAN AND MUNDANE HATRED
translated_text: And her voice took a tone which made it somewhat uncertain weather, in spite of all the lofty impassibility which she felt bound to possess, she did not hate Pelagia with a most human and mundane hatred.

text: HIS EXCELLENCY MADAM THE PREFECT
translated_text: His excellency, Madam, the Prefect!

text: AND WHY SHOULD THAT DISTURB ME LET HIM ENTER
translated_text: And why should that disturb me? Let him enter.

text: SHASTA RAMBLES AND MODOC MEMORIES
translated_text: Shaster Rambles and Modoc Memories.

text: ARCTIC BEAUTY AND DESOLATION WITH THEIR BLESSINGS AND DANGERS ALL MAY BE FOUND HERE TO TEST THE ENDURANCE AND SKILL OF ADVENTUROUS CLIMBERS BUT FAR BETTER THAN CLIMBING THE MOUNTAIN IS GOING AROUND ITS WARM FERTILE BASE ENJOYING ITS BOUNTIES LIKE A BEE CIRCLING AROUND A BANK OF FLOWERS
translated_text: Arctic beauty and desolation, with their blessings and dangers, all may be found here to test the endurance and skill of adventurous climbers. But far better than climbing the mountain is going around its warm, fertile base, enjoying its bounties like a bee circling around a bank of flowers.

text: PERHAPS THE PROFESSION OF DOING GOOD MAY BE FULL BUT EVERY BODY SHOULD BE KIND AT LEAST TO HIMSELF
translated_text: Perhaps the profession of doing good may be full, but everybody should be kind at least to himself.

text: GO QUIETLY ALONE NO HARM WILL BEFALL YOU
translated_text: Go quietly, alone. No harm will befall you.

text: BUT IT IS FAR BETTER TO GO AFOOT
translated_text: But it is far better to go a foot.

text: ONE BLANKET WILL BE ENOUGH TO CARRY OR YOU MAY FOREGO THE PLEASURE AND BURDEN ALTOGETHER AS WOOD FOR FIRES IS EVERYWHERE ABUNDANT
translated_text: One blanket will be enough to carry, or you may forego the pleasure and burden altogether, as wood for fires is everywhere abundant.

text: ONLY A LITTLE FOOD WILL BE REQUIRED
translated_text: Only a little food will be required.

text: THUS ONE SAUNTERS ON AND ON IN THE GLORIOUS RADIANCE IN UTTER PEACE AND FORGETFULNESS OF TIME
translated_text: Thus one's sulters on and on in the glorious radiance, in utter peace and forgetfulness of time.

text: YET STRANGE TO SAY THERE ARE DAYS EVEN HERE SOMEWHAT DULL LOOKING WHEN THE MOUNTAIN SEEMS UNCOMMUNICATIVE SENDING OUT NO APPRECIABLE INVITATION AS IF NOT AT HOME
translated_text: Yet strange to say, there are days, even here, somewhat dull looking, when the mountain seems uncommunicative, sending out no appreciable invitation, as if not at home.

text: AT SUCH TIME ITS HEIGHT SEEMS MUCH LESS AS IF CROUCHING AND WEARY IT WERE TAKING REST
translated_text: At such time, its height seems much less, as if crouching and weary, it were taking rest.

text: EVERY CRYSTAL DANCES RESPONSIVE TO THE TOUCHES OF THE SUN AND CURRENTS OF SAP IN THE GROWING CELLS OF ALL THE VEGETATION ARE EVER IN A VITAL WHIRL AND RUSH AND THOUGH MANY FEET AND WINGS ARE FOLDED HOW MANY ARE ASTIR
translated_text: Every crystal dances responsive to the touches of the sun, and the currents of sap in the growing cells of all the vegetation are ever in a vital whirl and rush, and though many feet and wings are folded, how many are a stir?

text: SLIGHT RAINSTORMS ARE LIKELY TO BE ENCOUNTERED IN A TRIP ROUND THE MOUNTAIN BUT ONE MAY EASILY FIND SHELTER BENEATH WELL THATCHED TREES THAT SHED THE RAIN LIKE A ROOF
translated_text: Slight rainstorms are likely to be encountered in a trip around the mountain, but one may easily find shelter beneath well-fetched trees that shed the rain like a roof.

text: THEN THE SHINING OF THE WET LEAVES IS DELIGHTFUL AND THE STEAMY FRAGRANCE AND THE BURST OF BIRD SONG FROM A MULTITUDE OF THRUSHES AND FINCHES AND WARBLERS THAT HAVE NESTS IN THE CHAPARRAL
translated_text: Then the shining of the wet leaves is delightful, and the steamy fragrance and the burst of bird song from a multitude of thrushes and finches and warblers that have nests in the chaparral.

text: A THOUSAND THOUSAND VOICES ARE HEARD BUT SO FINELY BLENDED THEY SEEM A PART OF THE NIGHT ITSELF AND MAKE A DEEPER SILENCE
translated_text: A thousand, thousand voices are heard. But so finally blended, they seem a part of the night itself, and make a deeper silence.

text: IN SETTING OUT FROM STRAWBERRY VALLEY BY BEARING OFF TO THE NORTHWESTWARD A FEW MILES YOU MAY SEE
translated_text: and setting out from Stratbury Valley by bearing off to the northwestward a few miles you may see.

text: IN APPROACHING IT ITS SUSPICIOUS LOOKING YELLOW SPOTTED HOOD AND WATCHFUL ATTITUDE WILL BE LIKELY TO MAKE YOU GO CAUTIOUSLY THROUGH THE BOG WHERE IT STANDS AS IF YOU WERE APPROACHING A DANGEROUS SNAKE
translated_text: In approaching it, its suspicious-looking yellow-spotted hood and watchful attitude will be likely to make you go cautiously through the bog where it stands, as if you were approaching a dangerous snake.

text: IT IS LINED WITH EMERALD ALGAE AND MOSSES AND SHADED WITH ALDER WILLOW AND THORN BUSHES WHICH GIVE IT A FINE SETTING
translated_text: It is lined with emerald algae and mosses, and shaded with alder, willow, and thorn bushes, which give it a fine setting.

text: IT IS THREE OR FOUR MILES LONG AND TERMINATES AT AN ELEVATION OF ABOUT NINE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL IN MORAINE SPRINKLED ICE CLIFFS SIXTY FEET HIGH
translated_text: It is three or four miles long and terminates at an elevation of about 9,500 feet above sea level. In moreane sprinkled ice cliffs, 60 feet high.

text: THE LONG GRAY SLOPES LEADING UP TO THE GLACIER SEEM REMARKABLY SMOOTH AND UNBROKEN
translated_text: The long-grave slopes leading up to the glacier seem remarkably smooth and unbroken.

text: MOST OF THE DRAINAGE OF THE GLACIER VANISHES AT ONCE IN THE POROUS ROCKS TO REAPPEAR IN SPRINGS IN THE DISTANT VALLEY AND IT IS ONLY IN TIME OF FLOOD THAT THE CHANNEL CARRIES MUCH WATER THEN THERE ARE SEVERAL FINE FALLS IN THE GORGE SIX HUNDRED FEET OR MORE IN HEIGHT
translated_text: Most of the drainage of the glacier vanishes at once, in the porous rocks to appear in springs in the distant valley, and it is only in time of flood that the channel carries much water. Then there are several fine falls in the gorge, 600 feet or more in height.

text: TRACING THIS WILD CHANGING CHANNEL GORGE GULLY OR CANYON THE SECTIONS WILL SHOW MOUNT SHASTA AS A HUGE PALIMPSEST CONTAINING THE RECORDS LAYER UPON LAYER OF STRANGELY CONTRASTED EVENTS IN ITS FIERY ICY HISTORY
translated_text: Tracing this wild-changing channel gorge, Gully or Canyon, the sections will show Mount Shasta as a huge palimp zest, containing the records layer upon layer of strangely contrasted events in its fiery icy history.

text: REGAINING THE LOW GROUND AT THE BASE OF THE MOUNTAIN AND HOLDING ON IN YOUR GRAND ORBIT YOU PASS THROUGH A BELT OF JUNIPER WOODS CALLED THE CEDARS TO SHEEP ROCK AT THE FOOT OF THE SHASTA PASS
translated_text: Regaining the low ground at the base of the mountain and holding on in your grand orbit, you pass through a belt of Juniper Woods called the Seaters, to Sheeprock at the foot of the Shasta Pass.

text: HERE YOU STRIKE THE OLD EMIGRANT ROAD WHICH LEADS OVER THE LOW DIVIDE TO THE EASTERN SLOPES OF THE MOUNTAIN
translated_text: Here you strike the old immigrant road, which leads over the low divide to the eastern slopes of the mountain.

text: MOUNT BREMER IS THE MOST NOTED STRONGHOLD OF THE SHEEP IN THE WHOLE SHASTA REGION
translated_text: Mount Bremer is the most noted stronghold of the sheep in the whole Shasta region.

text: LARGE FLOCKS DWELL HERE FROM YEAR TO YEAR WINTER AND SUMMER DESCENDING OCCASIONALLY INTO THE ADJACENT SAGE PLAINS AND LAVA BEDS TO FEED BUT EVER READY TO TAKE REFUGE IN THE JAGGED CRAGS OF THEIR MOUNTAIN AT EVERY ALARM
translated_text: Large flocks dwell here from year to year, winter and summer, descending occasionally into the adjacent sage plains and lava beds to feed, but ever ready to take refuge in the jagged crags of their mountain and every alarm.

text: WHILE TRAVELING WITH A COMPANY OF HUNTERS I SAW ABOUT FIFTY IN ONE FLOCK
translated_text: While traveling with a company of hunters, I saw about 50 in one flock.

text: THE MULE DEER ARE NEARLY AS HEAVY
translated_text: The mule deer are nearly as heavy.

text: THEIR LONG MASSIVE EARS GIVE THEM A VERY STRIKING APPEARANCE
translated_text: their long, massive ears give them a very striking appearance.

text: BUT NEITHER THE GLORIFIED WOODS ON THE ONE HAND NOR THE LAKE ON THE OTHER COULD AT FIRST HOLD THE EYE
translated_text: But neither the glorified woods on the one hand, nor the lake on the other, could it first hold the eye.

text: THEN FELL THE GLOAMING MAKING EVERYTHING STILL MORE FORBIDDING AND MYSTERIOUS
translated_text: Then fell the gloaming, making everything still more forbidding and mysterious.

text: THEN DARKNESS LIKE DEATH
translated_text: then darkness like death.

text: TWO OR THREE MILES FARTHER ON IS THE MAIN STRONGHOLD OF THE MODOCS HELD BY THEM SO LONG AND DEFIANTLY AGAINST ALL THE SOLDIERS THAT COULD BE BROUGHT TO THE ATTACK
translated_text: Two or three miles farther on is the main stronghold of the motox, held by them so long and defiantly against all the soldiers that could be brought to the attack.

text: THE DUCKS LESS WARY KEPT THEIR PLACES MERELY SWIMMING IN AND OUT THROUGH OPENINGS IN THE RUSHES RIPPLING THE GLASSY WATER AND RAISING SPANGLES IN THEIR WAKE
translated_text: The ducks, less wary, kept their places merely swimming in and out through openings in the rushes, rippling the glassy water and raising spangles in their wake.

text: THEY ARE BROAD RUGGED CREVASSED CLOUDLIKE MASSES OF DOWN GRINDING ICE POURING FORTH STREAMS OF MUDDY WATER AS MEASURES OF THE WORK THEY ARE DOING IN SCULPTURING THE ROCKS BENEATH THEM VERY UNLIKE THE LONG MAJESTIC GLACIERS OF ALASKA THAT RIVERLIKE GO WINDING DOWN THE VALLEYS THROUGH THE FORESTS TO THE SEA
translated_text: They were broad, rugged, crevast, cloud-like masses of downgrinding ice, pouring forth streams of muddy water as measures of the work they are doing and sculpturing the rocks beneath them. Very unlike the long majestic glaciers of Alaska, that river-like go winding down the valleys through the forests to the sea.

text: THUS THE SHASTA RIVER ISSUES FROM A LARGE LAKE LIKE SPRING IN SHASTA VALLEY AND ABOUT TWO THIRDS OF THE VOLUME OF THE MC CLOUD GUSHES FORTH IN A GRAND SPRING ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN A FEW MILES BACK FROM ITS IMMEDIATE BASE
translated_text: Thus the Shasta River issues from a large lake-like spring in Shasta Valley, and about two-thirds of the volume of the MacLeod gushes forth in a grand spring on the east side of the mountain, a few miles back from its immediate base.

text: SHOULD THE VOLUME OF THE STREAM WHERE YOU STRIKE IT SEEM SMALL THEN YOU WILL KNOW THAT YOU ARE ABOVE THE SPRING IF LARGE NEARLY EQUAL TO ITS VOLUME AT ITS CONFLUENCE WITH THE PITT RIVER THEN YOU ARE BELOW IT AND IN EITHER CASE HAVE ONLY TO FOLLOW THE RIVER UP OR DOWN UNTIL YOU COME TO IT
translated_text: Should the volume of the stream where you strike it seems small, then you will know that you are above the spring. If large, nearly equal to its volume at its confluence with the pit river, then you are below it. And in either case, have only to follow the river up or down until you come to it.

text: UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS YOU MAY HEAR THE ROAR OF THE WATER RUSHING FROM THE ROCK AT A DISTANCE OF HALF A MILE OR EVEN MORE OR YOU MAY NOT HEAR IT UNTIL WITHIN A FEW RODS
translated_text: Under certain conditions, you may hear the roar of the water rushing from the rock at a distance of half a mile or even more, or you may not hear it until within a few rods.

text: THE VIVID GREEN OF THE BOULDERS BENEATH THE WATER IS VERY STRIKING AND COLORS THE ENTIRE STREAM WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE PORTIONS BROKEN INTO FOAM
translated_text: The vivid green of the boulders beneath the water is very striking and colors the entire stream with the exception of the portions broken into foam.

text: ASPLENIUM EPILOBIUM HEUCHERA HAZEL DOGWOOD AND ALDER MAKE A LUXURIOUS FRINGE AND SETTING AND THE FORESTS OF DOUGLAS SPRUCE ALONG THE BANKS ARE THE FINEST I HAVE EVER SEEN IN THE SIERRA
translated_text: A splenium, epilobium, huchera, hazel, dogwood, and alder make a luxurious fringe and setting, and the forests of Douglas Bruce along the banks are the finest I have ever seen in this era.

text: TRACING RIVERS TO THEIR FOUNTAINS MAKES THE MOST CHARMING OF TRAVELS
translated_text: Tracing rivers to their fountains makes the most charming of travels.

text: AS THE LIFE BLOOD OF THE LANDSCAPES THE BEST OF THE WILDERNESS COMES TO THEIR BANKS AND NOT ONE DULL PASSAGE IS FOUND IN ALL THEIR EVENTFUL HISTORIES
translated_text: As the lifeblood of the landscapes, the best of the wilderness comes to their banks, and not one dull passage is found in all their eventful histories.

text: TRACING THE MC CLOUD TO ITS HIGHEST SPRINGS AND OVER THE DIVIDE TO THE FOUNTAINS OF FALL RIVER NEAR FORT CROOK THENCE DOWN THAT RIVER TO ITS CONFLUENCE WITH THE PITT ON FROM THERE TO THE VOLCANIC REGION ABOUT LASSEN'S BUTTE THROUGH THE BIG MEADOWS AMONG THE SOURCES OF THE FEATHER RIVER AND DOWN THROUGH FORESTS OF SUGAR PINE TO THE FERTILE PLAINS OF CHICO THIS IS A GLORIOUS SAUNTER AND IMPOSES NO HARDSHIP
translated_text: Tracing the Maccloud to its highest springs, and over the divide to the fountains of Fall River near Fort Crook, vents down that river to its confluence with the pit, on from there to the volcanic region about Lassen's Bute. Through the big meadows among the sources of the Feather River, and down through forests of sugar pine to the fertile plains of Chico, this is a glorious saunter and imposes no hardship.

text: THE ASCENT OF LASSEN'S BUTTE IS AN EASY WALK AND THE VIEWS FROM THE SUMMIT ARE EXTREMELY TELLING
translated_text: The Ascent of Lassen's Bute is an easy walk, and the views from the summit are extremely telling.

text: THE LOFTY ICY SHASTA TOWERING HIGH ABOVE ALL SEEMS BUT AN HOUR'S WALK FROM YOU THOUGH THE DISTANCE IN AN AIR LINE IS ABOUT SIXTY MILES
translated_text: The lofty icy shasta, towering high above all, seems but an hour's walk from you, though the distance in an airline is about 60 miles.

text: THE BIG MEADOWS LIE NEAR THE FOOT OF LASSEN'S BUTTE A BEAUTIFUL SPACIOUS BASIN SET IN THE HEART OF THE RICHLY FORESTED MOUNTAINS SCARCELY SURPASSED IN THE GRANDEUR OF ITS SURROUNDINGS BY TAHOE
translated_text: The big meadows line near the foot of Lassen's butte, a beautiful spacious basin set in the heart of the richly forested mountains, scarcely surpassed in the grandeur of its surroundings by Tahoe.

text: THE GREAT WILDS OF OUR COUNTRY ONCE HELD TO BE BOUNDLESS AND INEXHAUSTIBLE ARE BEING RAPIDLY INVADED AND OVERRUN IN EVERY DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING DESTRUCTIBLE IN THEM IS BEING DESTROYED
translated_text: The great wilds of our country, once held to be boundless and inexhaustible, are being rapidly invaded and overrun in every direction, and everything destructible in them is being destroyed.

text: EVERY LANDSCAPE LOW AND HIGH SEEMS DOOMED TO BE TRAMPLED AND HARRIED
translated_text: Every landscape low and high seems doomed to be trampled and harried.

text: WHEN WE TOOK OUR SEATS AT THE BREAKFAST TABLE IT WAS WITH THE FEELING OF BEING NO LONGER LOOKED UPON AS CONNECTED IN ANY WAY WITH THIS CASE
translated_text: When we took our seats at the breakfast table, it was with the feeling of being no longer looked upon as connected in any way with this case.

text: INSTANTLY THEY ABSORBED ALL MY ATTENTION THOUGH I DARED NOT GIVE THEM A DIRECT LOOK AND CONTINUED TO OBSERVE THEM ONLY IN THE GLASS
translated_text: Instantly, they absorbed all my attention, though I did not give them a direct look, and continued to observe them only in the glass.

text: YES AND A VERY RESPECTABLE ONE
translated_text: Yes, and a very respectable one.

text: THE LADY IS NOT THE MOTHER OF THE BOYS BUT THEIR AUNT
translated_text: The lady is not the mother of the boys, but their aunt.

text: THE BOYS BELONG TO THE GENTLEMAN WHO IS A WIDOWER
translated_text: the boys belong to the gentleman who is a widower.

text: GEORGE NODDED
translated_text: George Notted.

text: THE BOYS LOOK WIDE AWAKE ENOUGH IF THE FATHER DOES NOT
translated_text: The boys look quite awake enough if the father does not.

text: DO THEY STILL INSIST THAT MISS CHALLONER WAS THE ONLY PERSON IN THE ROOM WITH THEM AT THIS TIME
translated_text: Do they still insist that Miss Chelena was the only person in the room with them at this time?

text: GEORGE
translated_text: George?

text: HAVE YOU EVER THOUGHT THAT SHE MIGHT HAVE BEEN A SUICIDE
translated_text: Have you ever thought that she might have been a suicide?

text: I KNOW IT SOUNDS FOOLISH BUT THE ALTERNATIVE IS SO IMPROBABLE
translated_text: I know it sounds foolish, but the alternative is so improbable.

text: THE BOYS LOOK WIDE AWAKE ENOUGH BUT WHO CAN TELL I WOULD SOONER BELIEVE THAT
translated_text: The boys look quite awake enough, but who can tell? I would sooner believe that...

text: A MAN WAS LOOKING IN FROM THE CORRIDOR BEHIND AT THE FOUR PERSONS WE WERE JUST DISCUSSING
translated_text: A man was looking in from the corridor behind. At the four persons we were just discussing.

text: I INQUIRED OF GEORGE WITH MY EYES STILL ON THIS FURTIVE WATCHER
translated_text: I inquired of George, with my eyes still on this fervent watcher.

text: I TOOK QUITE A FANCY TO HIM WHY
translated_text: I took quite a fancy to him. Why?

text: I AM LOOKING AT HIM NOW
translated_text: I am looking at him now.

text: JUST AN EVERYDAY DETECTIVE BUT AMBITIOUS I SUPPOSE AND QUITE ALIVE TO THE IMPORTANCE OF BEING THOROUGH
translated_text: just an everyday deductive, but ambitious, I suppose, and quite alive to the importance of being thorough.

text: YES HE'S MERCURIAL IN ALL HIS MOVEMENTS
translated_text: Yes, he's more career in all his movements.

text: WHAT DOES HE WANT
translated_text: What does he want?

text: I ASKED AS SOON AS GEORGE HAD RETURNED TO MY SIDE
translated_text: I asked as soon as George had returned to my side.

text: HE WANTS ME TO STAND READY TO OBEY ANY SUMMONS THE POLICE MAY SEND ME
translated_text: He wants me to stand ready to obey any summons the police may send me.

text: I EMPHASISED COMPLACENTLY
translated_text: I am facized complacently.

text: HE APPEARED TO KNOW FOR HE TOLD ME AT ONCE THAT HE WAS DETECTIVE GRYCE A MAN WHO HAD GROWN OLD IN SOLVING JUST SUCH BAFFLING PROBLEMS AS THESE
translated_text: He appeared to know, for he told me at once that he was detective Greiss, a man who had grown old in solving just such baffling problems as these.

text: HE GAVE UP WORK SOME TIME AGO I HAVE BEEN TOLD MY HUSBAND WENT ON BUT EVIDENTLY A GREAT CASE STILL HAS ITS ALLUREMENT FOR HIM
translated_text: He gave up work some time ago I have been told. My husband went on. But evidently a great case still has its alertment for him.

text: THE TRAIL HERE MUST BE A VERY BLIND ONE FOR THEM TO CALL HIM IN
translated_text: The trail here must be a very blind one for them to call him in.

text: I WISH WE HAD NOT LEFT SO SOON
translated_text: I wish we had not left so soon.

text: HE WAS LATE OF COURSE BUT WHEN HE DID APPEAR I ALMOST FORGOT OUR USUAL GREETING IN MY HURRY TO ASK HIM IF HE HAD SEEN THE EVENING PAPERS
translated_text: He was late, of course. But when he did appear, I almost forgot our usual greeting in my hurry to ask him if he had seen the evening papers.

text: HOWEVER A LITTLE LATER WE HAD A COMFORTABLE CHAT
translated_text: However, a little later we had a comfortable chat.

text: IT WAS ONE WHICH GAVE ME A SMALL TRIUMPH OVER GEORGE
translated_text: It was one which gave me a small triumph over George.

text: THE SUGGESTION HE HAD LAUGHED AT WAS NOT SO ENTIRELY FOOLISH AS HE HAD BEEN PLEASED TO CONSIDER IT
translated_text: The suggestion he had laughed at was not so entirely foolish as he had been pleased to consider it.

text: THEIR GREETING WAS CORDIAL AND THE LINES ON THE LATTER'S FACE RELAXED A LITTLE AS HE MET THE STILL BRIGHT EYE OF THE MAN UPON WHOSE INSTINCT AND JUDGMENT SO MUCH RELIANCE HAD ALWAYS BEEN PLACED
translated_text: Their greeting was cordial and the lines on the latter's face relaxed a little as he met the still bright eye of the man upon whose instinct and judgment so much reliance had always been placed.

text: THIS IS VERY GOOD OF YOU HE BEGAN GLANCING DOWN AT THE AGED DETECTIVE'S BUNDLED UP LEGS AND GENTLY PUSHING A CHAIR TOWARDS HIM
translated_text: This is very good of you, he began glancing down at the aged detectives bundled up legs and gently pushing a chair towards him.

text: IT'S THE MOST INEXPLICABLE THERE
translated_text: It's the most inexplicable there.

text: BUT CLEWS THERE ARE ABSOLUTELY NONE
translated_text: but clues there are absolutely none.

text: THAT IS WE HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO FIND ANY PERHAPS YOU CAN
translated_text: That is, we have not been able to find any. Perhaps you can.

text: AT LEAST THAT IS WHAT WE HOPE
translated_text: At least that is what we hope.

text: IT'S A CASE IN A THOUSAND GRYCE
translated_text: It's a case in a thousand, Grace.

text: THE OLD MAN'S EYES SHOT FIRE AND UNCONSCIOUSLY ONE FOOT SLIPPED TO THE FLOOR
translated_text: The old man's eyes shot fire and unconsciously one foot slipped to the floor.

text: SHE HAD NO COMPANION NEAR HER
translated_text: She had no companion near her.

text: NO WORD NO CRY JUST A COLLAPSE AND SUDDEN FALL
translated_text: No word, no cry, just to collapse and sudden fall.

text: IN OLDEN DAYS THEY WOULD HAVE SAID STRUCK BY A BOLT FROM HEAVEN
translated_text: In olden days they would have said struck by a bolt from heaven.

text: WHAT DO YOU MAKE OF IT GRYCE
translated_text: What do you make of it, Grace?

text: I SHOULD LIKE TO SEE THE DESK YOU SPEAK OF AND THE SPOT WHERE SHE FELL
translated_text: I should like to see the desk you speak of and the spot where she fell.

text: A YOUNG FELLOW WHO HAD BEEN HOVERING IN THE BACKGROUND AT ONCE STEPPED FORWARD
translated_text: A young fellow who had been hovering in the background at one step forward.

text: HE WAS THE PLAIN FACED DETECTIVE WHO HAD SPOKEN TO GEORGE
translated_text: He was the plain-faced detective who had spoken to George.

text: THIS SWEETWATER AS THEY CALLED HIM WAS I HAVE SINCE UNDERSTOOD ONE OF HIS PROTEGES AND MORE OR LESS OF A FAVOURITE
translated_text: This sweet water, as they called him, was, I have since understood, one of his prodigies, and more or less of a favorite.

text: BEEN OVER THE GROUND STUDIED THE AFFAIR CAREFULLY
translated_text: been over the ground, studied at the affair carefully.

text: VERY WELL THEN YOU'RE IN A POSITION TO PIONEER ME
translated_text: Jerry, well then, you're in a position to pioneer me.

text: WELL WELL THAT'S HONEST AT ALL EVENTS
translated_text: Well, well, that's honest at all events.

text: BUT I'M IN NO POSITION TO MAKE PROMISES
translated_text: but I am in no position to make promises.

text: OLD DAYS DON'T RETURN FOR THE ASKING
translated_text: old days don't return for the asking.

text: WHETHER HE GOT ANYTHING ELSE IT WOULD BE IMPOSSIBLE TO SAY FROM HIS MANNER AS HE FINALLY SANK INTO A CHAIR BY ONE OF THE OPENINGS AND LOOKED DOWN ON THE LOBBY BELOW
translated_text: Whether he got anything else, it would be impossible to say from his manner as he finally sank into a chair by one of the openings and looked down on the lobby below.

text: ONE OR TWO OF THE MUSICIANS FROM THE END OF THE HALL
translated_text: What are two of the musicians from the end of the hall?

text: NATURALLY THEY REACHED HER FIRST
translated_text: Naturally, they reached her first.

text: MARK SOWERBY AND CLAUS HENNERBERG
translated_text: Mark Sauerby and Klaus Hinnerberg.

text: HONEST GERMANS MEN WHO HAVE PLAYED HERE FOR YEARS
translated_text: Honest Germans, men who have played here for years.

text: WHO CAME NEXT ON THE SCENE SOME PEOPLE FROM THE LOBBY
translated_text: Who came next on the scene? Some people from the lobby.

text: ANYBODY BEFORE THE FATHER CAME IN
translated_text: Anybody before the father came in?

text: YES MISS CLARKE THE MIDDLE AGED LADY WITH THE PARRISHES
translated_text: Yes, Ms. Clark, the middle-aged lady with the parishes.

text: I SUPPOSE SHE HAS BEEN CAREFULLY QUESTIONED VERY I SHOULD SAY
translated_text: I suppose she has been carefully questioned. Very, I should say.

text: AND SHE SPEAKS OF NO WEAPON
translated_text: and she speaks of no weapon.

text: NOT TILL THE DOCTOR CAME HER DOCTOR WHO WAS HAPPILY IN HIS OFFICE IN THIS VERY BUILDING
translated_text: Not till the doctor came, her doctor who was happily in his office in this very building.

text: YES MISTER SLATER THE ASSISTANT MANAGER WHO WAS IN THE LOBBY AT THE TIME SAYS THAT TEN MINUTES AT LEAST MUST HAVE ELAPSED
translated_text: Yes, Mr. Slater, the assistant manager who was in the lobby at the time, says that 10 minutes at least must have elapsed.

text: NO DOUBT
translated_text: No doubt.

text: SWEETWATER SOMEONE DREW THAT WEAPON OUT
translated_text: Sweetwater, someone drew that weapon out.

text: NOT ALTOGETHER BY ME
translated_text: Not altogether by me.

text: WHEREVER SHE PLEASES ONLY I CAN'T WALK FAR
translated_text: Wherever she pleases, only I can't walk far.

text: IT HAS NOT BEEN RUNNING SINCE LAST NIGHT OR IT WOULD BE FULL OF CURIOUS PEOPLE ALL THE TIME HUSTLING TO GET A GLIMPSE OF THIS PLACE
translated_text: It has not been running since last night or it would be full of curious people all the time, hustling to get a glimpse of this place.

text: BUT THEY'LL PUT A MAN ON FOR YOU
translated_text: but they'll put a man on for you.

text: VERY GOOD MANAGE IT AS YOU WILL
translated_text: Very good. Manage it as you will.

text: I'LL WAIT HERE TILL YOU'RE READY EXPLAIN YOURSELF TO THE LADY TELL HER I'M AN OLD AND RHEUMATIC INVALID WHO HAS BEEN USED TO ASKING HIS OWN QUESTIONS
translated_text: I'll wait here till you're ready. Explain yourself to the lady. Tell her I'm an old and romantic invillet who has been used to asking his own questions.

text: AS HER QUIET FIGURE APPEARED IN THE DOORWAY SWEETWATER STOLE A GLANCE AT MISTER GRYCE
translated_text: As her quiet figure appeared in the doorway, sweet water stole a glance at Mr. Christ.

text: THERE WAS NO DOUBTING THEM IN THIS INSTANCE
translated_text: There was no doubting them in this instance.

text: YES
translated_text: Yes.

text: FOR SOME LITTLE TIME THAT IS IT SEEMED LONG THOUGH I BELIEVE IT WAS NOT MORE THAN A MINUTE BEFORE TWO MEN CAME RUNNING FROM THE MUSICIANS GALLERY
translated_text: For some little time, that is, it seemed long, though I believe it was not more than a minute before two men came running from the musician's gallery.

text: YES MANY TIMES
translated_text: Yes, many times.

text: WHAT MADE THE DIFFERENCE
translated_text: What made the difference?

text: MISS CLARKE STARTED AND HER SWEET FACE SHOWED A MOMENT'S PERPLEXITY DID I SHE QUERIED MUSINGLY
translated_text: Miss Clark started, and her sweet face showed a moment's perplexity. Did I? She queried musingly.

text: NO A VERY NATURAL ONE I SHOULD SAY
translated_text: No, a very natural one, I should say.

text: AND THE GLANCE SHE CAST HIM WHILE NOT MEETING HIS EYE SHOWED THAT SHE UNDERSTOOD THE IMPORTANCE OF THE ADMISSION
translated_text: And the glance she cast him while not beating his eye showed that she understood the importance of the admission.

text: I KNOW SHE SAID WHAT YOU ARE GOING TO ASK ME NOW
translated_text: I know she said what you are going to ask me now.

text: THERE WAS NO PONIARD IN THE WOUND
translated_text: There was no point in the wound.

text: THE TIME IS NARROWED DOWN TO ONE AND IN THAT ONE MISS CLARKE WAS THE ONLY PERSON TO TOUCH HER
translated_text: The time is narrowed down to one, and in that one, Ms. Clark was the only person to touch her.

text: I WILL TROUBLE YOU NO FURTHER
translated_text: I will trouble you no further.

text: SWEETWATER HELP ME OUT OF THIS
translated_text: Sweetwater, help me out of this.

text: BUT VIGOUR RETURNED TO HIM BEFORE HE HAD WELL REACHED THE DOOR AND HE SHOWED SOME OF HIS OLD SPIRIT AS HE THANKED MISS CLARKE AND TURNED TO TAKE THE ELEVATOR
translated_text: But Vigor returned to him before he had well reached the door, and he showed some of his old spirit as he thanked Miss Clark and turned to take the elevator.

text: THE NEXT MINUTE SHE WAS IN THIS LADY'S ARMS
translated_text: The next minute she was in this lady's arms.

text: NO WEAPON PROTRUDED FROM THE WOUND NOR WAS ANY FOUND ON OR NEAR HER IN THE MEZZANINE WHAT FOLLOWS
translated_text: No weapon protruded from the wound nor was any found on or near her in the mezzanine. What follows?

text: SHE STRUCK THE BLOW HERSELF AND THE STRENGTH OF PURPOSE WHICH LED HER TO DO THIS GAVE HER THE ADDITIONAL FORCE TO PULL THE WEAPON OUT AND FLING IT FROM HER
translated_text: She struck the blow herself and the strength of purpose which led her to do this gave her the additional force to pull the weapon out and fling it from her

text: IT DID NOT FALL UPON THE FLOOR AROUND HER THEREFORE IT FLEW THROUGH ONE OF THOSE OPENINGS INTO THE LOBBY AND THERE IT EITHER WILL BE OR HAS BEEN FOUND
translated_text: It did not fall upon the floor around her, therefore it flew through one of those openings into the lobby, and there it either will be or has been found.

text: WITH AN EDUCATION WHICH OUGHT TO HAVE ENSURED ME AN HONOURABLE STANDING IN THE WORLD WITH SOME INTELLIGENCE WIT GOOD LITERARY AND SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE AND ENDOWED WITH THOSE ACCIDENTAL PHYSICAL QUALITIES WHICH ARE SUCH A GOOD PASSPORT INTO SOCIETY I FOUND MYSELF AT THE AGE OF TWENTY THE MEAN FOLLOWER OF A SUBLIME ART IN WHICH IF GREAT TALENT IS RIGHTLY ADMIRED MEDIOCRITY IS AS RIGHTLY DESPISED
translated_text: With an education which ought to have ensured me an honorable standing in the world, with some intelligence, wit, good literary and scientific knowledge, and endowed with those accidental physical qualities which are such a good passport into society, I found myself at the age of twenty, the mean follower of a sublime art, in which, if great talent is rightly admired, mediocrity is as rightly despised.

text: I WAS COMPELLED BY POVERTY TO BECOME A MEMBER OF A MUSICAL BAND IN WHICH I COULD EXPECT NEITHER ESTEEM NOR CONSIDERATION AND I WAS WELL AWARE THAT I SHOULD BE THE LAUGHING STOCK OF THE PERSONS WHO HAD KNOWN ME AS A DOCTOR IN DIVINITY AS AN ECCLESIASTIC AND AS AN OFFICER IN THE ARMY AND HAD WELCOMED ME IN THE HIGHEST SOCIETY
translated_text: I was compelled by poverty to become a member of a musical band, in which I could expect neither esteem nor consideration, and I was well aware that I should be the laughing stock of the persons who had known me as a doctor in divinity, as an ecclesiastic, and as an officer in the army, and had welcomed me in the highest society.

text: I FELT THAT IN MY FIRST PROFESSION AS I WAS NOT BLESSED WITH THE VOCATION NECESSARY TO IT I SHOULD HAVE SUCCEEDED ONLY BY DINT OF HYPOCRISY AND I SHOULD HAVE BEEN DESPICABLE IN MY OWN ESTIMATION EVEN IF I HAD SEEN THE PURPLE MANTLE ON MY SHOULDERS FOR THE GREATEST DIGNITIES CANNOT SILENCE A MAN'S OWN CONSCIENCE
translated_text: I felt that, in my first profession, as I was not blessed with the vocation necessary to it, I should have succeeded only by dint of hypocrisy, and I should have been despicable in my own estimation, even if I had seen the purple mantle on my shoulders, for the greatest dignities cannot silence a man's own conscious.

text: BESIDES I WAS OF OPINION THAT A MAN'S PROFESSION WHATEVER IT MIGHT BE OUGHT TO SUPPLY HIM WITH ENOUGH MONEY TO SATISFY ALL HIS WANTS AND THE VERY POOR PAY OF AN OFFICER WOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN SUFFICIENT TO COVER MY EXPENSES BECAUSE MY EDUCATION HAD GIVEN ME GREATER WANTS THAN THOSE OF OFFICERS IN GENERAL
translated_text: Besides, I was of opinion that a man's profession, whatever it might be, ought to supply him with enough money to satisfy all his wants. And the very poor pay of an officer would never have been sufficient to cover my expenses, because my education had given me greater wants than those of officers in general.

text: OUR SCANDALOUS PROCEEDINGS OFTEN EXPOSED US TO THE GREATEST DANGER
translated_text: are scandalous proceedings often exposed to the greatest danger.

text: WE WOULD VERY OFTEN SPEND THE WHOLE NIGHT RAMBLING ABOUT THE CITY INVENTING AND CARRYING INTO EXECUTION THE MOST IMPERTINENT PRACTICAL JOKES
translated_text: We would very often spend the whole night rambling about the city, inventing and carrying into execution the most impertinent practical jokes.

text: WE DID THE SAME WITH PHYSICIANS WHOM WE OFTEN SENT HALF DRESSED TO SOME NOBLEMAN WHO WAS ENJOYING EXCELLENT HEALTH
translated_text: We did the same with physicians, whom we often sent half-dressed to some noblemen who was enjoying excellent health.

text: WHENEVER WE COULD CONTRIVE TO GET INTO A CHURCH TOWER WE THOUGHT IT GREAT FUN TO FRIGHTEN ALL THE PARISH BY RINGING THE ALARM BELL AS IF SOME FIRE HAD BROKEN OUT BUT THAT WAS NOT ALL WE ALWAYS CUT THE BELL ROPES SO THAT IN THE MORNING THE CHURCHWARDENS HAD NO MEANS OF SUMMONING THE FAITHFUL TO EARLY MASS
translated_text: Whenever we could contrive to get into a church tower, we thought a great fun to frighten all the parish by ringing the alarm bell, as if some fire had broken out. But that was not all. We always cut the bell ropes, so that in the morning the church wardens had no means of summoning the faithful to early mass.

text: THIS IS THE AMUSING ADVENTURE WHICH CLOSED OUR EXPLOITS
translated_text: This is the amusing adventure which closed our exploits.

text: IN EVERY ONE OF THE SEVENTY TWO PARISHES OF THE CITY OF VENICE THERE IS A LARGE PUBLIC HOUSE CALLED MAGAZZINO
translated_text: In every one of the 72 perishes of the city of Venice, there is a large public house called Magazino.

text: YET THERE ARE A FEW PRIVATE ROOMS WHICH CONTAIN A TABLE SURROUNDED WITH BENCHES IN WHICH A RESPECTABLE FAMILY OR A FEW FRIENDS CAN ENJOY THEMSELVES IN A DECENT WAY
translated_text: Yet there are a few private rooms which contain a table surrounded with benches, in which a respectable family or a few friends can enjoy themselves in a decent way.

text: THE WAITER OF THE MAGAZZINO CAME TO BE PAID AND OUR CHIEF GAVE HIM WHAT WAS DUE ENJOINING SILENCE UNDER PENALTY OF DEATH
translated_text: The waiter of the magazine came to be paid, and our chief gave him what was due, in joining silence under penalty of death.

text: WE TOOK OUR THREE PRISONERS TO A LARGE BOAT
translated_text: We took our three prisoners to a large boat.

text: WHERE IS MY HUSBAND
translated_text: Where is my husband?

text: NEVER FEAR YOU SHALL SEE HIM AGAIN TO MORROW
translated_text: Never fear you shall see him again tomorrow.

text: MY READERS MAY IMAGINE WHETHER WE FELT INCLINED TO LAUGH WHEN THE CHARMING CREATURE BADE US GOOD NIGHT THANKING US ALL WITH PERFECT GOOD FAITH
translated_text: My readers may imagine whether we felt inclined to laugh when the charming creature beat us goodnight, thanking us all with perfect good faith.

text: TWO DAYS AFTERWARDS OUR NOCTURNAL ORGY BEGAN TO BE TALKED OF
translated_text: Two days afterwards, our nocturnal orgy began to be talked of.

text: IT WENT ON TO SAY THAT THE TWO MEN WHO HAD CARRIED HER OFF HAD TAKEN HER TO SUCH A PLACE WHERE THEY HAD AN HOUR LATER BEEN MET BY THE OTHER SIX AND THAT THEY HAD ALL REPAIRED TO THE TWO SWORDS WHERE THEY HAD SPENT AN HOUR IN DRINKING
translated_text: It went on to say that the two men who had carried her off had taken her to such a place where they had, and hour later, been met by the other six, and that they had all repaired to the two swords where they had spent an hour in drinking.

text: THERE WAS NO COWARDLY TRAITOR AMONGST US ALTHOUGH WE WERE ALL POOR BUT FEAR HAD ITS EFFECT AND OUR NOCTURNAL PRANKS WERE NOT RENEWED
translated_text: There was no cowardly traitor amongst us, although we were all poor. But fear had its effect, and our nocturnal pranks were not renewed.

text: I PICKED IT UP AND COMING UP TO HIM JUST AS HE WAS GOING DOWN THE STEPS I HANDED IT TO HIM
translated_text: I picked it up and coming up to him just to see what was going down the steps, I handed it to him.

text: I TOLD HIM AND HE INSISTED UPON MY COMING WITH HIM IN THE GONDOLA SAYING THAT HE WOULD LEAVE ME AT MY HOUSE
translated_text: I told him, and he insisted upon my coming with him in the Gandhalla, saying that he would leave me at my house.

text: I RUBBED IT WITH ALL MY STRENGTH BUT HE TOLD ME IN A SORT OF INDISTINCT WHISPER THAT THE NUMBNESS WAS SPREADING ALL ALONG THE LEFT SIDE AND THAT HE WAS DYING
translated_text: I rubbed it with all my strength, but he told me in a sort of indistinct whisper that the numbness was spreading all along the left side and that he was dying.

text: I JUMPED OUT OF THE GONDOLA AND FOUND MYSELF ON THE VERY SPOT WHERE THREE YEARS BEFORE I HAD TAUGHT RAZETTA SUCH A FORCIBLE LESSON I ENQUIRED FOR A SURGEON AT THE FIRST COFFEE HOUSE AND RAN TO THE HOUSE THAT WAS POINTED OUT TO ME
translated_text: I jumped out of the gondola and found myself on the very spot where three years before I had taught Rosetta such a forcible lesson. I inquired for a surgeon at the first coffee house and ran to the house that was pointed out to me.

text: TAKING EVERYTHING UPON MYSELF I ORDERED A SERVANT TO HURRY OUT FOR A PHYSICIAN WHO CAME IN A SHORT TIME AND ORDERED THE PATIENT TO BE BLED AGAIN THUS APPROVING THE FIRST BLEEDING PRESCRIBED BY ME
translated_text: Taking everything upon myself, I ordered a servant to hurry out for a physician, who came in a short time, and ordered the patient to be blood again, thus approving the first bleeding prescribed by me.

text: THINKING I HAD A RIGHT TO WATCH THE SICK MAN I SETTLED MYSELF NEAR HIS BED TO GIVE HIM EVERY CARE HE REQUIRED
translated_text: Thinking I had the right to watch the sick man, I settled myself near his bed to give him every care he required.

text: THEY DID NOT KNOW WHO I WAS AND DID NOT LIKE TO ASK ME WHILST I THOUGHT IT BETTER TO PRESERVE A MODEST SILENCE
translated_text: They did not know who I was, and did not like to ask me. Will I thought it better to preserve a modest silence?

text: HE HAD GAMBLED AND LOST A GREAT DEAL AND HIS BROTHER WAS HIS MOST BITTER ENEMY BECAUSE HE WAS INFATUATED WITH THE IDEA THAT HE HAD TRIED TO POISON HIM
translated_text: He had gambled and lost a great deal, and his brother was his most bitter enemy, because he was infatuated with the idea that he had tried to poison him.

text: THE PHYSICIAN WHO ATTENDED HIM WAS NAMED TERRO HE THOUGHT BY SOME PECULIAR TRAIN OF REASONING THAT HE COULD CURE HIM BY APPLYING A MERCURIAL OINTMENT TO THE CHEST TO WHICH NO ONE RAISED ANY OBJECTION
translated_text: The physician who attended him was named Tarot. He thought, by some peculiar train of reasoning that he could cure him by applying a mucurial ointment to the chest, to which no one raised any objection.

text: DELIGHTED WITH SUCH A FORTUNATE RESULT WE LAY DOWN AGAIN
translated_text: Delighted with such a fortunate result, we lay down again.

text: HE ENTREATED ME TO TELL HIM THE TRUTH
translated_text: He entreated me to tell him the truth.

text: WHAT EXTRAORDINARY THINGS WILL SOMETIMES OCCUR FROM MERE CHANCE OR FROM THE FORCE OF CIRCUMSTANCES
translated_text: What extraordinary things will sometimes occur from mere chance or from the force of circumstances?

text: UNWILLING TO HURT HIS VANITY BY TELLING HIM THAT HE WAS MISTAKEN I TOOK THE WILD RESOLUTION OF INFORMING HIM IN THE PRESENCE OF HIS TWO FRIENDS THAT I POSSESSED A CERTAIN NUMERAL CALCULUS WHICH GAVE ANSWERS ALSO IN NUMBERS TO ANY QUESTIONS I LIKED TO PUT
translated_text: unwilling to hurt his vanity by telling him that he was mistaken. I took the wild resolution of informing him in the presence of his two friends that I possessed a certain, numeral, calculus which gave answers, also in numbers, to any questions I like to put.

text: I OBEYED IMPLICITLY AND MET YOUR EXCELLENCY
translated_text: I obeyed implicitly and met your excellency.

text: THE THREE FRIENDS WERE ASTOUNDED
translated_text: The three friends were astounded.

text: I DECLARED MYSELF QUITE WILLING FOR IT WAS NECESSARY TO BRAZEN IT OUT AFTER HAVING VENTURED AS FAR AS I HAD DONE
translated_text: I declared myself quite willing, for it was necessary to brazen it out, after having ventured as far as I had done.

text: HE WROTE THE QUESTION AND GAVE IT TO ME I READ IT I COULD NOT UNDERSTAND EITHER THE SUBJECT OR THE MEANING OF THE WORDS BUT IT DID NOT MATTER I HAD TO GIVE AN ANSWER
translated_text: He wrote the question and gave it to me. I read it. I could not understand either the subject or the meaning of the words, but it did not matter. I had to give an answer.

text: IF THE QUESTION WAS SO OBSCURE THAT I COULD NOT MAKE OUT THE SENSE OF IT IT WAS NATURAL THAT I SHOULD NOT UNDERSTAND THE ANSWER
translated_text: If the question was so obscure that I could not make out the sense of it, it was natural that I should not understand the answer.

text: THEY ALL ASKED ME HOW LONG I WOULD REQUIRE TO TEACH THEM THE RULES OF MY SUBLIME CALCULUS
translated_text: They all ask me how long I would require to teach them the rules of my sublime calculus.

text: NOT VERY LONG I ANSWERED AND I WILL TEACH YOU AS YOU WISH ALTHOUGH THE HERMIT ASSURED ME THAT I WOULD DIE SUDDENLY WITHIN THREE DAYS IF I COMMUNICATED MY SCIENCE TO ANYONE BUT I HAVE NO FAITH WHATEVER IN THAT PREDICTION
translated_text: Not very long, I answered, and I will teach you as you wish, although the hermit assured me that I would die suddenly within three days if I communicated my science to anyone. But I have no faith whatever in that prediction.

text: THEY BELIEVED THAT THROUGH ME THEY POSSESSED THE PHILOSOPHER'S STONE THE UNIVERSAL PANACEA THE INTERCOURSE WITH ALL THE ELEMENTARY HEAVENLY AND INFERNAL SPIRITS THEY HAD NO DOUBT WHATEVER THAT THANKS TO MY SUBLIME SCIENCE THEY COULD FIND OUT THE SECRETS OF EVERY GOVERNMENT IN EUROPE
translated_text: They believe that through me they possessed the Philosopher's Stone, the Universal Panacea, the intercourse with all the elementary, heavenly, and infernal spirits. And they had no doubt whatever that, thanks to my sublime science, they could find out the secrets of every government in Europe.

text: BUT ALTHOUGH BELIEVING FULLY IN MY ORACLES THEY WERE TOO KIND HEARTED TO THINK THEM THE WORK OF THE DEVIL AND IT SUITED THEIR NATURAL GOODNESS BETTER TO BELIEVE MY ANSWERS INSPIRED BY SOME HEAVENLY SPIRIT
translated_text: But, although, believing fully in my oracles, they were too kindhearted to think them the work of the devil, and ensued their natural goodness, better to believe my answers inspired by some heavenly spirit.

text: THEY WERE NOT ONLY GOOD CHRISTIANS AND FAITHFUL TO THE CHURCH BUT EVEN REAL DEVOTEES AND FULL OF SCRUPLES
translated_text: There were not only good Christians and faithful to the Church, but even real devotees and full of screwpals.

text: AS FOR THE EUCHARIST TRANSUBSTANTIATION THE REAL PRESENCE IT WAS ALL NO MYSTERY TO THEM BUT PALPABLE EVIDENCE AND YET THEY WERE NOT JESUITS
translated_text: As for the Eucharist, Transubstantiation, the real Presence, it was all no mystery to them, but palpable evidence, and yet they were not Jesuits.

text: I MIGHT BE TOLD THAT IF I HAD WISHED TO FOLLOW THE RULES OF PURE MORALITY I OUGHT EITHER TO HAVE DECLINED INTIMATE INTERCOURSE WITH THEM OR TO HAVE UNDECEIVED THEM
translated_text: I might be told that if I had wished to follow the rules of pure morality, I ought either to have declined intimate intercourse with them or to have undecieved them.

text: BESIDES I FOUND IT VERY FLATTERING TO MY VANITY TO BECOME THE SUBJECT OF THE SPECULATIVE CHATTERING OF EMPTY FOOLS WHO HAVING NOTHING ELSE TO DO ARE ALWAYS TRYING TO FIND OUT THE CAUSE OF EVERY MORAL PHENOMENON THEY MEET WITH WHICH THEIR NARROW INTELLECT CANNOT UNDERSTAND
translated_text: Besides, I found it very flattering to my vanity to become the subject of the speculative chattering of empty fools who, having nothing else to do, and always trying to find out the cause of every moral phenomena they mate with, which their narrow intellect cannot understand.

text: WHOEVER YOU MAY BE I AM INDEBTED TO YOU FOR MY LIFE
translated_text: Whoever you may be, I am indebted to you for my life.

text: YOUR APARTMENT IS READY YOU MAY SEND YOUR CLOTHES YOU SHALL HAVE A SERVANT A GONDOLA AT YOUR ORDERS MY OWN TABLE AND TEN SEQUINS A MONTH
translated_text: Your apartment is ready. You may send your clothes. You shall have a servant, a gondola at your orders. My own table in 10 sequins a month.

text: YOU NEED NOT THINK OF THE FUTURE THINK ONLY OF ENJOYING YOURSELF AND TAKE ME AS YOUR ADVISER IN EVERYTHING THAT MAY HAPPEN TO YOU IN EVERYTHING YOU MAY WISH TO UNDERTAKE AND YOU MAY BE CERTAIN OF ALWAYS FINDING ME YOUR FRIEND
translated_text: You need not think of the future. Think only of enjoying yourself and take me as your advisor and everything that may happen to you. And everything you may wish to undertake and you may be certain of always finding me your friend.

text: I THREW MYSELF AT HIS FEET TO ASSURE HIM OF MY GRATITUDE AND EMBRACED HIM CALLING HIM MY FATHER
translated_text: I threw myself at his feet, to assure him of my gratitude, and embraced him, calling him my father.

text: SIR EDWARD NOT WHOLLY DISCOURAGED BY THE DENIAL WITH WHICH DORRIFORTH HAD WITH DELICACY ACQUAINTED HIM STILL HOPED FOR A KIND RECEPTION AND WAS SO OFTEN AT THE HOUSE OF MISSUS HORTON THAT LORD FREDERICK'S JEALOUSY WAS EXCITED AND THE TORTURES HE SUFFERED IN CONSEQUENCE CONVINCED HIM BEYOND A DOUBT OF THE SINCERITY OF HIS AFFECTION
translated_text: Sir Edward, not wholly discouraged by the denial with which Doraphorth had, with delicacy acquainted him, still hoped for a kind reception, and was so often at the house of Mrs. Horton that Lord Frederick's jealousy was excited, and the tortures he suffered in consequence convinced him beyond a doubt of the sincerity of his affection.

text: EVERY TIME HE BEHELD THE OBJECT OF HIS PASSION FOR HE STILL CONTINUED HIS VISITS THOUGH NOT SO FREQUENTLY AS HERETOFORE HE PLEADED HIS CAUSE WITH SUCH ARDOUR THAT MISS WOODLEY WHO WAS SOMETIMES PRESENT AND EVER COMPASSIONATE COULD NOT RESIST WISHING HIM SUCCESS
translated_text: Every time he beheld the object of his passion, for he still continued his visits, though not so frequently as here to for, he pleaded his cause with such ardor that Miss Woodley, who was sometimes present and ever compassionate, could not resist wishing him success.

text: YET DID THE WATCHFUL MISS WOODLEY OFTENTIMES HEAR A SIGH ESCAPE FROM HER UNKNOWN TO HERSELF TILL SHE WAS REMINDED OF IT AND THEN A SUDDEN BLUSH WOULD INSTANTLY OVERSPREAD HER FACE
translated_text: Yet did the watchful Miss Whitley oftentimes hear a si-escape from her unknown to herself, till she was reminded of it, and then a sudden blush would instantly overspread her face.

text: NIGHT AFTER NIGHT HIS SLEEP HAD BEEN DISTURBED BY FEARS FOR HER WHEN ABROAD MORNING AFTER MORNING IT HAD BEEN BROKEN BY THE CLAMOUR OF HER RETURN
translated_text: Night after night, his sleep had been disturbed by fears for her when abroad, morning after morning it had been broken by the clamor of her return.

text: I HOPE MISS MILNER YOU PASS THIS EVENING AT HOME
translated_text: I hope Miss Melner you passed this evening at home.

text: I THOUGHT MISS MILNER YOU GAVE ME YOUR WORD THAT YOU WOULD PASS THIS EVENING AT HOME
translated_text: I thought, Miss Milner, you gave me your word that you would pass this evening at home.

text: YES INDEED AND I BELIEVE IT IS RIGHT THAT I SHOULD KEEP MY FIRST PROMISE IS IT NOT
translated_text: Yes, indeed. And I believe it is right that I should keep my first promise, is it not?

text: MISSUS HORTON ROSE FROM HER SEAT MOVED THE DECANTERS AND FRUIT ROUND THE TABLE STIRRED THE FIRE AND CAME BACK TO HER SEAT AGAIN BEFORE ANOTHER WORD WAS UTTERED
translated_text: Mrs. Horton rose from her seat, moved the decantars and fruit round the table, stirred the fire, and came back to her seat again before another word was uttered.

text: NOR HAD THIS GOOD WOMAN'S OFFICIOUS LABOURS TAKEN THE LEAST FROM THE AWKWARDNESS OF THE SILENCE WHICH AS SOON AS THE BUSTLE SHE HAD MADE WAS OVER RETURNED IN ITS FULL FORCE
translated_text: Nor had this good woman's efficious labor has taken the least from the awkwardness of the silence, which as soon as the bustle she had made was over, returned in its full force.

text: MISS MILNER YOU SHALL NOT LEAVE THE HOUSE THIS EVENING SIR
translated_text: Miss Milner, you shall not leave the house this evening. Sir!

text: AND HE WALKED IMMEDIATELY OUT OF THE APARTMENT BY ANOTHER DOOR
translated_text: and he walked immediately out of the apartment by another door.

text: HER HAND FELL MOTIONLESS FROM THAT WHICH SHE HELD SHE APPEARED MOTIONLESS HERSELF TILL MISSUS HORTON BESEECHING HER NOT TO BE UNEASY AT THE TREATMENT SHE HAD RECEIVED MADE HER TEARS FLOW AS IF HER HEART WAS BREAKING
translated_text: Her hand fell motionless from that which she held. She appeared motionless herself, till Mrs. Horton, besieging her not to be uneasy at the treatment she had received, made her tears flow as if her heart was breaking.

text: IT WAS NOT FROM ANY REAL CAUSE OF GRIEF THAT SHE WEPT BUT THERE WAS A MAGNETIC QUALITY IN TEARS WHICH ALWAYS ATTRACTED HER'S
translated_text: It was not from any real cause of grief that she wept, but there was a magnetic quality in tears which always attracted hers.

text: DO YOU THINK I WOULD GO ANSWERED MISS MILNER WITH AN EAGERNESS THAT FOR A TIME SUPPRESSED HER TEARS IN CONTRADICTION TO HIS WILL
translated_text: Do you think I would go, answered Miss Milner with an eagerness that for a time suppressed her tears, in contradiction to his will?

text: IF YOU THINK SO MADAM I SEE NOTHING THAT SHOULD PREVENT ME NOW
translated_text: If you think so, Madam, I see nothing that should prevent me now.

text: NIECE I COMMAND YOU NOT TO STIR OUT OF THIS ROOM THIS EVENING
translated_text: Nice, I command you not to stir out of the room this evening.

text: MISS WOODLEY OBEDIENTLY SAT DOWN AND THOUGH HER THOUGHTS AND HEART WERE IN THE CHAMBER OF HER FRIEND SHE NEVER MARKED BY ONE IMPERTINENT WORD OR BY ONE LINE OF HER FACE THE RESTRAINT SHE SUFFERED
translated_text: Miss Woodley obediently sat down, and though her thoughts and heart were in the chamber of her friend, she never marked by one impertinent word or by one line of her face the restraint she suffered.

text: AT THE USUAL HOUR MISTER DORRIFORTH AND HIS WARD WERE SUMMONED TO TEA HE ENTERED WITH A COUNTENANCE WHICH EVINCED THE REMAINS OF ANGER HIS EYE GAVE TESTIMONY OF HIS ABSENT THOUGHTS AND THOUGH HE TOOK UP A PAMPHLET AFFECTING TO READ IT WAS PLAIN TO DISCERN THAT HE SCARCELY KNEW HE HELD IT IN HIS HAND
translated_text: At the usual hour Mr. Doraphorth and his ward were summoned to tea. He entered with accountonance, which evinced the remains of anger. His eye gave testimony of his absent thoughts, and though he took up a pamphlet affecting to read, it was plain to discern that he scarcely knew he held it in his hand.

text: MISS WOODLEY THOUGHT IT HER DUTY TO BE MUTE AND NOW THE GINGLE OF A TEA SPOON WAS LIKE A DEEP TONED BELL ALL WAS SO QUIET
translated_text: Miss Woodley thought it her duty to be mute, and now the jingle of a teaspoon was like a deep-toned bell all was so quiet.

text: MISSUS HORTON TOO IN THE SELF APPROVING REFLECTION THAT SHE WAS NOT IN A QUARREL OR ALTERCATION OF ANY KIND FELT HERSELF AT THIS MOMENT REMARKABLY PEACEFUL AND CHARITABLE
translated_text: Mrs. Horton, too, in the self-approving reflection that she was not in a quarrel or altercation of any kind, felt herself at this moment remarkably peaceful and charitable.

text: MISS WOODLEY DID NOT RECOLLECT HERSELF SO BUT WAS SO IN REALITY IN HER PEACE AND CHARITY WERE INSTINCTIVE VIRTUES ACCIDENT COULD NOT INCREASE THEM
translated_text: Miss Woodley did not recollect herself so, but was so, in reality, in her peace and charity were instinctive virtues. Accident could not increase them.

text: HE COUGHED DRANK HIS TEA ENDEAVOURED TO TALK BUT FOUND IT DIFFICULT SOMETIMES READ AND IN THIS MANNER NEAR TWO HOURS WERE PASSED AWAY WHEN MISS MILNER CAME INTO THE ROOM NOT DRESSED FOR A BALL BUT AS SHE HAD RISEN FROM DINNER
translated_text: He coughed, drank his tea, in Debra to talk but found it difficult, sometimes read, and in this manner near two hours were passed away when Miss Milner came into the room, not dressed for a ball, but as she had risen from dinner.

text: DORRIFORTH READ ON AND SEEMED AFRAID OF LOOKING UP LEST HE SHOULD SEE WHAT HE COULD NOT HAVE PARDONED
translated_text: Doraforth read on, and seemed afraid of looking up, lest he should see what he could not have pardoned.

text: AFTER A FEW MINUTES PAUSE AND SOME LITTLE EMBARRASSMENT ON THE PART OF MISSUS HORTON AT THE DISAPPOINTMENT SHE HAD TO ENCOUNTER FROM THIS UNEXPECTED DUTIFUL CONDUCT SHE ASKED MISS MILNER IF SHE WOULD NOW HAVE ANY TEA
translated_text: After a few minutes pause and some little embarrassment on the part of Mrs. Horton, at the disappointment she had to encounter from this unexpected, beautiful conduct, she asked Miss Milner if she would now have any tea.

text: DORRIFORTH THEN LAID THE BOOK OUT OF HIS HAND AND BY THE TIME THE SERVANT HAD LEFT THE ROOM THUS BEGAN
translated_text: Doraforth then laid the book out of his hand, and by the time the servant had left the room, thus began.

text: IT IS OFTEN THE UNGRATEFUL TASK OF A FRIEND TO BE TROUBLESOME SOMETIMES UNMANNERLY
translated_text: It is often the ungrateful task of a friend to be troublesome, sometimes unmannerly.

text: FORGIVE THE DUTIES OF MY OFFICE AND BELIEVE THAT NO ONE IS HALF SO MUCH CONCERNED IF IT ROBS YOU OF ANY DEGREE OF HAPPINESS AS I MYSELF AM
translated_text: Forgive the duties of my office, and believe that no one is half so much concerned if it robs you of any degree of happiness as I myself am.

text: WHAT HE SAID HE LOOKED WITH SO MUCH SINCERITY THAT HAD SHE BEEN BURNING WITH RAGE AT HIS LATE BEHAVIOUR SHE MUST HAVE FORGIVEN HIM FOR THE REGRET WHICH HE SO FORCIBLY EXPREST
translated_text: What he said, he looked with so much sincerity that had she been burning with rage at his late behavior, she must have forgiven him for the regret which he so forcibly expressed.

text: SHE WAS GOING TO REPLY BUT FOUND SHE COULD NOT WITHOUT ACCOMPANYING HER WORDS WITH TEARS THEREFORE AFTER THE FIRST ATTEMPT SHE DESISTED
translated_text: She was going to reply, but found she could not, without accompanying her words with tears. Therefore, after the first attempt, she desisted.

text: ON THIS HE ROSE FROM HIS CHAIR AND GOING TO HER SAID ONCE MORE SHEW YOUR SUBMISSION BY OBEYING ME A SECOND TIME TO DAY
translated_text: On this, he rose from his chair and going to her said, once more show your submission by obeying me a second time today.

text: KEEP YOUR APPOINTMENT AND BE ASSURED THAT I SHALL ISSUE MY COMMANDS WITH MORE CIRCUMSPECTION FOR THE FUTURE AS I FIND HOW STRICTLY THEY ARE COMPLIED WITH
translated_text: Keep your appointment, and be assured that I shall issue my commands with more circumspection for the future, as I find how strictly they are complied with.

text: IN THE LAST COMMUNICATION WHICH HE HAD RECEIVED FROM LADY MILBOROUGH SHE HAD SCOLDED HIM IN TERMS THAT WERE FOR HER SEVERE BECAUSE HE HAD NOT RETURNED TO HIS WIFE AND TAKEN HER OFF WITH HIM TO NAPLES
translated_text: In the last communication which he had received from Lady Milbra, she had scolded him in terms that were for her severe, because he had not returned to his wife and taken her off with him to Naples.

text: AND NOW IT HAD COME TO PASS THAT HIS SOLE REMAINING ALLY MISTER SAMUEL BOZZLE THE EX POLICEMAN WAS BECOMING WEARY OF HIS SERVICE
translated_text: And now it had come to pass that his sole remaining ally, Mr. Samuel Basel, the ex-policeman, was becoming weary of his service.

text: AT LAST HE SENT WORD TO SAY THAT HE HIMSELF WOULD BE IN ENGLAND BEFORE THE END OF MARCH AND WOULD SEE THAT THE MAJESTY OF THE LAW SHOULD BE VINDICATED IN HIS FAVOUR
translated_text: At last he sent word to say that he himself would be in England before the end of March, and would see that the majesty of the law should be vindicated in his favor.

text: IN MAKING THIS HE HAD EXPECTED NO SUCCESS THOUGH FROM THE ENERGETIC NATURE OF HIS DISPOSITION HE HAD MADE THE ATTEMPT WITH SOME ZEAL
translated_text: In making this, he had expected no success, though from the energetic nature of his disposition, he had made the attempt with some zeal.

text: MISSUS BOZZLE WAS DISPOSED TO THINK THAT LADIES OF QUALITY AMONG WHOM MADAME T WAS ENTITLED IN HER ESTIMATION TO TAKE RANK WERE SELDOM BETTER THAN THEY OUGHT TO BE AND SHE WAS QUITE WILLING THAT HER HUSBAND SHOULD EARN HIS BREAD BY WATCHING THE LADY OR THE LADY'S LOVER
translated_text: Mrs. Basel was disposed to think that ladies of quality, among whom Madame T was entitled in her estimation to take rank, were seldom better than they ought to be, and she was quite willing that her husband should earn his bread by watching the lady or the lady's lover.

text: AND HAD THE CASE BEEN BROUGHT BEFORE THE JUDGE ORDINARY BY MEANS OF HER HUSBAND'S EXERTIONS SHE WOULD HAVE TAKEN PLEASURE IN READING EVERY WORD OF THE EVIDENCE EVEN THOUGH HER HUSBAND SHOULD HAVE BEEN EVER SO ROUGHLY HANDLED BY THE LAWYERS
translated_text: and had the case been brought before the judge ordinary by means of her husband's exertions, she would have taken pleasure in reading every word of the evidence, even though her husband should have been ever so roughly handled by the lawyers.

text: A DISTINCT PROMISE OF A HUNDRED POUNDS WAS MADE TO HIM IF HE WOULD HAVE THE CHILD READY TO HAND OVER TO TREVELYAN ON TREVELYAN'S ARRIVAL IN ENGLAND
translated_text: A distinct promise of a hundred pounds was made to him if he would have the child ready to hand over to Travellion on Travellion's arrival in England.

text: OF COURSE IT AIN'T SAID MISSUS BOZZLE
translated_text: Of course it ain't," said Mrs. Bossell.

text: THE PATERNAL PARENT HAS A RIGHT TO HIS INFANTS NO DOUBT THAT WAS BOZZLE'S LAW
translated_text: The paternal parent has a right to his infants no doubt. That was Basel's Law.

text: HE CAN'T SUCKLE EM CAN HE
translated_text: He can't suckle him Kenny

text: WHEN A MARRIED WOMAN HAS FOLLOWERS AND THE HUSBAND DON'T GO THE WRONG SIDE OF THE POST TOO OR IT AIN'T PROVED AGAIN HIM THAT HE DO THEY'LL NEVER LET HER HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH THE CHILDREN
translated_text: When a married woman has followers and the husband don't go the wrong side of the post to or it ain't proved again him that he do They'll never let her have nothing to do with the children

text: I'LL TELL YOU WHAT IT IS B EXCLAIMED MISSUS BOZZLE IT'S MY BELIEF AS HE AIN'T QUITE RIGHT UP HERE AND MISSUS BOZZLE TOUCHED HER FOREHEAD
translated_text: I'll tell you what it is, B, exclaimed Mrs. Buzzle. It's my belief as he ain't quite right up here, and Mrs. Buzzle touched her forehead.

text: DRAT EM ALL WHAT IS IT THEY WANTS THEY DON'T KNOW WHAT THEY WANTS
translated_text: Dratamall, what is it they want? They don't know what they want.

text: IT'S THAT AS MAKES EM I WON'T SAY WHAT
translated_text: It's that is makes him, and I won't say what.

text: BUT AS FOR THIS HERE CHILD B
translated_text: but ask for this here child B.

text: TREVELYAN HAD FOLLOWED HIS LETTER QUICKER THAN HE HAD INTENDED WHEN IT WAS WRITTEN AND WAS NOW WITH HIS PRIME MINISTER BEFORE HIS PRIME MINISTER HAD BEEN ABLE TO TAKE ANY ACTION ON THE LAST INSTRUCTION RECEIVED
translated_text: Travellion had followed his letter quicker than he had intended when it was written, and was now with his prime minister, before his prime minister had been able to take any action on the last instruction received.

text: DOES ONE MISTER SAMUEL BOZZLE LIVE HERE ASKED TREVELYAN
translated_text: Does one Mr. Samuel Basel live here ask Travellian?

text: THEN BOZZLE CAME FORWARD AND INTRODUCED HIS WIFE
translated_text: Then, Basel came forward and introduced his wife.

text: BUT TREVELYAN WAS OF A DIFFERENT OPINION AND HE WAS DISGUSTED AND REVOLTED MOST UNREASONABLY BY THE APPEARANCE OF HIS MINISTER'S DOMESTIC ARRANGEMENTS
translated_text: But Travellion was of a different opinion, and he was disgusted and revolted, most unreasonably, by the appearance of his minister's domestic arrangements.

text: BOZZLE HAD ALWAYS WAITED UPON HIM WITH A DECENT COAT AND A WELL BRUSHED HAT AND CLEAN SHOES
translated_text: Basel had always waited upon him with a decent coat and a well-brushed hat and clean shoes.

text: IT IS VERY MUCH EASIER FOR SUCH MEN AS MISTER BOZZLE TO CARRY DECENCY OF APPEARANCE ABOUT WITH THEM THAN TO KEEP IT AT HOME
translated_text: It is very much easier for such men as Mr. Basel to carry decency of appearance about with them than to keep it at home.

text: PERHAPS YOU COULD PUT ON YOUR COAT AND WALK OUT WITH ME FOR A FEW MINUTES SAID TREVELYAN
translated_text: Perhaps you could put on your coat and walk out with me for a few minutes, said Travellian.

text: MISSUS BOZZLE WHO WELL UNDERSTOOD THAT BUSINESS WAS BUSINESS AND THAT WIVES WERE NOT BUSINESS FELT NO ANGER AT THIS AND HANDED HER HUSBAND HIS BEST COAT
translated_text: Mrs. Basel, who well understood that business was business and that wives were not business, felt no anger at this and handed her husband his best coat.

text: BOZZLE AWAY FROM HIS OWN HOME OUT ON BUSINESS WITH HIS COAT BUTTONED OVER HIS BREAST AND HIS BEST HAT IN HIS HAND WAS AWARE THAT HE COMMANDED RESPECT AND HE COULD CARRY HIMSELF ACCORDINGLY
translated_text: Buzzle away from his own home, out on business with his coat buttoned over his breast and his best hat in his hand, was aware that he commanded respect, and he could carry himself accordingly.

text: I DO NOT SUPPOSE THAT ANYBODY WILL QUESTION MY RIGHT TO HAVE THE CARE OF MY OWN CHILD SAID TREVELYAN
translated_text: I do not suppose that anybody will question my right to have the care of my own child," said Travellian.

text: IF YOU WOULD HAVE GONE TO MISTER SKINT SIR SUGGESTED BOZZLE
translated_text: If you would have gone to Mr. Skint sir suggested Basel.

text: AS HE WENT ABOUT HIS EYES WERE EVER CAST DOWNWARDS AND HE WALKED WITH A QUICK SHUFFLING GAIT AND HE SUSPECTED OTHERS FEELING THAT HE HIMSELF WAS SUSPECTED
translated_text: As he went about, his eyes were ever cast downwards, and he walked with a quick shuffling gate, and he suspected others, feeling that he himself was suspected.

text: AND ALL WORK HAD CEASED WITH HIM
translated_text: And all work had ceased with him.

text: HE'S UP IN TOWN SIR A MINDING OF HIS PARLIAMENTARY DUTIES
translated_text: He's up in town, sir, a minding of his parliamentary duties.

text: I'VE WATCHED AS SHARP AS WATCHING CAN GO PRETTY NEAR
translated_text: I've watched a sharp as watching can go pretty near.

text: BUT IF YOU ASK ME MY OPINION WHY IN COURSE THEY'VE BEEN TOGETHER SOMEWHERE
translated_text: But if you ask me my opinion, why in course they've been together somewhere?

text: AND BOZZLE AS HE SAID THIS SMILED ALMOST ALOUD
translated_text: And Basel, as he said this, smiled almost aloud.

text: AND HE DID GO AWAY LEAVING BOZZLE STANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF STONY WALK
translated_text: And he did go away, leaving Basel standing in the middle of Stony Walk.

text: MASTER AND MAN DISMOUNTED FROM THEIR BEASTS AND AS SOON AS THEY HAD SETTLED THEMSELVES AT THE FOOT OF THE TREES SANCHO WHO HAD HAD A GOOD NOONTIDE MEAL THAT DAY LET HIMSELF WITHOUT MORE ADO PASS THE GATES OF SLEEP
translated_text: Master and man dismounted from their beasts, and as soon as they had settled themselves at the foot of the trees, Sancho, who had had a good noon-tine meal that day, let himself, without Moradu, pass the gates of sleep.

text: BUT DON QUIXOTE WHOM HIS THOUGHTS FAR MORE THAN HUNGER KEPT AWAKE COULD NOT CLOSE AN EYE AND ROAMED IN FANCY TO AND FRO THROUGH ALL SORTS OF PLACES
translated_text: But don Quixote, whom his thoughts far more than hunger kept awake, could not close an eye, and roamed in fancy to and fro through all sorts of places.

text: AT ONE MOMENT IT SEEMED TO HIM THAT HE WAS IN THE CAVE OF MONTESINOS AND SAW DULCINEA TRANSFORMED INTO A COUNTRY WENCH SKIPPING AND MOUNTING UPON HER SHE ASS AGAIN THAT THE WORDS OF THE SAGE MERLIN WERE SOUNDING IN HIS EARS SETTING FORTH THE CONDITIONS TO BE OBSERVED AND THE EXERTIONS TO BE MADE FOR THE DISENCHANTMENT OF DULCINEA
translated_text: At one moment it seemed to him that he was in the cave of Maltesinos, and Saul D'Alsania transformed into a country wench, skipping and mounting upon her she asks, again that the words of the sage Merlin were sounding in his ears, setting forth the conditions to be observed, and the exertions to be made for the disenchantment of D'Alsania.

text: WHO IS TOUCHING ME AND UNTRUSSING ME
translated_text: Who is touching me and untrusting me?

text: DULCINEA IS PERISHING THOU ART LIVING ON REGARDLESS I AM DYING OF HOPE DEFERRED THEREFORE UNTRUSS THYSELF WITH A GOOD WILL FOR MINE IT IS HERE IN THIS RETIRED SPOT TO GIVE THEE AT LEAST TWO THOUSAND LASHES
translated_text: Dossenea is perishing. Thou art living on regardless. I am dying of hope deferred. Therefore, untrust myself with a good will. For mine it is here in this retired spot to give thee at least 2,000 lashes.

text: SEEING THIS SANCHO GOT UP AND GRAPPLING WITH HIS MASTER HE GRIPPED HIM WITH ALL HIS MIGHT IN HIS ARMS GIVING HIM A TRIP WITH THE HEEL STRETCHED HIM ON THE GROUND ON HIS BACK AND PRESSING HIS RIGHT KNEE ON HIS CHEST HELD HIS HANDS IN HIS OWN SO THAT HE COULD NEITHER MOVE NOR BREATHE
translated_text: Seeing this, Sancho got up and grappling with his master, he gripped him with all his might in his arms, giving him a trip with the heel, stretched him on the ground on his back, and pressing his right neonist chest held his hands in his own so that he could neither move nor breathe.

text: HOW NOW TRAITOR EXCLAIMED DON QUIXOTE
translated_text: Oh no traitor! Explain, don't wake your day.

text: DOST THOU REVOLT AGAINST THY MASTER AND NATURAL LORD
translated_text: Dust out revolt against thy master and natural lord!

text: DOST THOU RISE AGAINST HIM WHO GIVES THEE HIS BREAD
translated_text: Test the rise against him who gives thee his bread?

text: DON QUIXOTE GAVE HIS PROMISE AND SWORE BY THE LIFE OF HIS THOUGHTS NOT TO TOUCH SO MUCH AS A HAIR OF HIS GARMENTS AND TO LEAVE HIM ENTIRELY FREE AND TO HIS OWN DISCRETION TO WHIP HIMSELF WHENEVER HE PLEASED
translated_text: Don Quixote gave his promise and swore by the life of his thoughts not to touch so much as a hair of his garments, and to leave him entirely free and to his own discretion to whip himself whenever he placed.

text: SANCHO ROSE AND REMOVED SOME DISTANCE FROM THE SPOT BUT AS HE WAS ABOUT TO PLACE HIMSELF LEANING AGAINST ANOTHER TREE HE FELT SOMETHING TOUCH HIS HEAD AND PUTTING UP HIS HANDS ENCOUNTERED SOMEBODY'S TWO FEET WITH SHOES AND STOCKINGS ON THEM
translated_text: Sancho rose and removed some distance from the spot. But as he was about to place himself leaning against another tree, he felt something touch his head. And putting up his hands encountered somebody's two feet with shoes and stockings on them.

text: HE TREMBLED WITH FEAR AND MADE FOR ANOTHER TREE WHERE THE VERY SAME THING HAPPENED TO HIM AND HE FELL A SHOUTING CALLING UPON DON QUIXOTE TO COME AND PROTECT HIM
translated_text: He trembled with fear and made for another tree where the very same thing happened to him, and he fell a shouting, calling upon Dongkyoji to come and protect him.

text: DON QUIXOTE DID SO AND ASKED HIM WHAT HAD HAPPENED TO HIM AND WHAT HE WAS AFRAID OF
translated_text: Don Quio did so and ask him what had happened to him and what he was afraid of.

text: SANCHO REPLIED THAT ALL THE TREES WERE FULL OF MEN'S FEET AND LEGS
translated_text: Sancho replied that all the trees were full of men's feet and legs.

text: DON QUIXOTE WAS ON FOOT WITH HIS HORSE UNBRIDLED AND HIS LANCE LEANING AGAINST A TREE AND IN SHORT COMPLETELY DEFENCELESS HE THOUGHT IT BEST THEREFORE TO FOLD HIS ARMS AND BOW HIS HEAD AND RESERVE HIMSELF FOR A MORE FAVOURABLE OCCASION AND OPPORTUNITY
translated_text: Don Quixote was on foot with his horse unbridled and his lance leaning against a tree, and in short, completely defenseless. He thought it best therefore to fold his arms and bow his head and reserve himself for a more favorable occasion and opportunity.

text: HE WAS MOUNTED UPON A POWERFUL HORSE AND HAD ON A COAT OF MAIL WITH FOUR OF THE PISTOLS THEY CALL PETRONELS IN THAT COUNTRY AT HIS WAIST
translated_text: He was mounted upon a powerful horse and had on a coat of mail with four of the pistols they called peternels in that country at his waist.

text: HE SAW THAT HIS SQUIRES FOR SO THEY CALL THOSE WHO FOLLOW THAT TRADE WERE ABOUT TO RIFLE SANCHO PANZA BUT HE ORDERED THEM TO DESIST AND WAS AT ONCE OBEYED SO THE GIRDLE ESCAPED
translated_text: He saw that his choirs, for so they called those who followed that trade, were about to rifle San Chopanza, but he ordered them to desist and was at once obeyed. So the girdle escaped.

text: HE SAW ME HE PAID COURT TO ME I LISTENED TO HIM AND UNKNOWN TO MY FATHER I LOVED HIM FOR THERE IS NO WOMAN HOWEVER SECLUDED SHE MAY LIVE OR CLOSE SHE MAY BE KEPT WHO WILL NOT HAVE OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SPARE FOR FOLLOWING HER HEADLONG IMPULSES
translated_text: He saw me, he paid court to me, I listened to him, and unknown to my father, I loved him. For there is no woman, however secluded she may live, or close she may be kept, who will not have opportunities and despair for following her head long impulses.

text: IN A WORD HE PLEDGED HIMSELF TO BE MINE AND I PROMISED TO BE HIS WITHOUT CARRYING MATTERS ANY FURTHER
translated_text: In a word, he pledged himself to be mine, and I promised to be his without caring matters any further.

text: GIVE ME MY HORSE AND ARMS AND WAIT FOR ME HERE I WILL GO IN QUEST OF THIS KNIGHT AND DEAD OR ALIVE I WILL MAKE HIM KEEP HIS WORD PLIGHTED TO SO GREAT BEAUTY
translated_text: Give me my horse and arms, and wait for me here. I will go in quest of this night, and, dead or alive, I will make him keep his word plighted to so great beauty."

text: NOBODY NEED HAVE ANY DOUBT ABOUT THAT SAID SANCHO FOR MY MASTER HAS A VERY HAPPY KNACK OF MATCHMAKING IT'S NOT MANY DAYS SINCE HE FORCED ANOTHER MAN TO MARRY WHO IN THE SAME WAY BACKED OUT OF HIS PROMISE TO ANOTHER MAIDEN AND IF IT HAD NOT BEEN FOR HIS PERSECUTORS THE ENCHANTERS CHANGING THE MAN'S PROPER SHAPE INTO A LACQUEY'S THE SAID MAIDEN WOULD NOT BE ONE THIS MINUTE
translated_text: Nobody need have any doubt about that," said Sancio. For my master has a very happy knack of matchmaking. It's not many days since he forced another man to marry, who, in the same way, backed out of his promise to another maiden. And if it had not been for his persecutors, the enchanters, changing the man's proper shape into a lackeys, the said maiden would not be one this minute."

text: THEY MADE HASTE TO OVERTAKE THEM WHICH AS THE PARTY MOVED SLOWLY THEY WERE ABLE TO DO WITH EASE
translated_text: They made haste to overtake them, which as the party moved slowly, they were able to do with these.

text: THE WOUNDED GENTLEMAN OPENED HIS ALL BUT CLOSED EYES AND RECOGNISING CLAUDIA SAID I SEE CLEARLY FAIR AND MISTAKEN LADY THAT IT IS THOU THAT HAST SLAIN ME A PUNISHMENT NOT MERITED OR DESERVED BY MY FEELINGS TOWARDS THEE FOR NEVER DID I MEAN TO NOR COULD I WRONG THEE IN THOUGHT OR DEED
translated_text: The wounded gentleman opened his all but closed eyes, and recognized in Claudia said, I seek clearly fair and mistaken lady, that it is thou that has slain me, a punishment not merited or deserved by my feelings toward thee. For never did I mean to, nor could I, wrong thee in thought or deed.

text: IT IS NOT TRUE THEN SAID CLAUDIA THAT THOU WERT GOING THIS MORNING TO MARRY LEONORA THE DAUGHTER OF THE RICH BALVASTRO
translated_text: It is not true then, Zikladia. That we're going this morning to Mary Leonora, the daughter of the rich Balvestro.

text: ON PERCEIVING THIS CLAUDIA WHEN SHE HAD CONVINCED HERSELF THAT HER BELOVED HUSBAND WAS NO MORE RENT THE AIR WITH HER SIGHS AND MADE THE HEAVENS RING WITH HER LAMENTATIONS SHE TORE HER HAIR AND SCATTERED IT TO THE WINDS SHE BEAT HER FACE WITH HER HANDS AND SHOWED ALL THE SIGNS OF GRIEF AND SORROW THAT COULD BE CONCEIVED TO COME FROM AN AFFLICTED HEART
translated_text: On perceiving this, Claudia, when she had convinced herself that her beloved husband was no more, rent the air with her size, and made the heavens ring with her lamentations. She tore her hair and scattered it to the winds. She beat her face with her hands and showed all the signs of grief and sorrow that could be conceived to come from an afflicted heart.

text: CRUEL RECKLESS WOMAN SHE CRIED HOW EASILY WERT THOU MOVED TO CARRY OUT A THOUGHT SO WICKED
translated_text: cruel, reckless woman, she cried. How easily were thou moved to carry out a thought so wicked?

text: O HUSBAND WHOSE UNHAPPY FATE IN BEING MINE HATH BORNE THEE FROM THE MARRIAGE BED TO THE GRAVE
translated_text: Oh husband, whose unhappy fate in being mine hath borne thee from the marriage bed to the grave.

text: THE SERVANTS WEPT CLAUDIA SWOONED AWAY AGAIN AND AGAIN AND THE WHOLE PLACE SEEMED A FIELD OF SORROW AND AN ABODE OF MISFORTUNE
translated_text: The servants wept. Claudius swooned away again and again, and the whole place seemed a field of sorrow and an abode of misfortune.

text: CLAUDIA TOLD HIM SHE MEANT TO GO TO A MONASTERY OF WHICH AN AUNT OF HERS WAS ABBESS WHERE SHE INTENDED TO PASS HER LIFE WITH A BETTER AND EVERLASTING SPOUSE
translated_text: Claudia told him she meant to go to a monastery of which an ant of hers was a base, where she intended to pass her life with a better and everlasting spouse.

text: CLAUDIA WOULD NOT ON ANY ACCOUNT ALLOW HIM TO ACCOMPANY HER AND THANKING HIM FOR HIS OFFERS AS WELL AS SHE COULD TOOK LEAVE OF HIM IN TEARS
translated_text: Claudia would not on any account allow him to accompany her, and thanking him for his offers as well as she could, took leave of him in tears.

text: SANCHO SAID THEY HAD BUT THAT THREE KERCHIEFS THAT WERE WORTH THREE CITIES WERE MISSING
translated_text: Sanchez said they had, but the three Kirchiffs that were worth three cities were missing.

text: WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT MAN
translated_text: What are you talking about, man?

text: SAID ONE OF THE BYSTANDERS I HAVE GOT THEM AND THEY ARE NOT WORTH THREE REALS
translated_text: said one of the bystanders. I have got them, and they are not worth three reels.

text: AT THIS INSTANT ONE OR TWO OF THOSE SQUIRES WHO WERE POSTED AS SENTINELS ON THE ROADS TO WATCH WHO CAME ALONG THEM AND REPORT WHAT PASSED TO THEIR CHIEF CAME UP AND SAID SENOR THERE IS A GREAT TROOP OF PEOPLE NOT FAR OFF COMING ALONG THE ROAD TO BARCELONA
translated_text: At this instant, one or two of those squires who were posted as sentinels on the roads to watch who came along them and report what passed to their chief came up and said, �Signor, there is a great troop of people not far off coming along the road to Barcelona�

text: WHAT LED ME INTO IT WAS A CERTAIN THIRST FOR VENGEANCE WHICH IS STRONG ENOUGH TO DISTURB THE QUIETEST HEARTS
