translated_text: What led me into it was a certain thirst for vengeance, which is strong enough to disturb the quietest hearts.

text: AND IF YOU HAVE ANY DESIRE TO SHORTEN THE JOURNEY AND PUT YOURSELF EASILY IN THE WAY OF SALVATION COME WITH ME AND I WILL SHOW YOU HOW TO BECOME A KNIGHT ERRANT A CALLING WHEREIN SO MANY HARDSHIPS AND MISHAPS ARE ENCOUNTERED THAT IF THEY BE TAKEN AS PENANCES THEY WILL LODGE YOU IN HEAVEN IN A TRICE
translated_text: And if you have any desire to shorten the journey and put yourself easily in the way of salvation, come with me, and I will show you how to become a knight-errant, a calling wherein so many hardships and mishaps are encountered that if they be taken as penances, they will lodge you in heaven in a trice.

text: AND NOW THE SQUIRES DESPATCHED TO MAKE THE PRIZE CAME UP BRINGING WITH THEM TWO GENTLEMEN ON HORSEBACK TWO PILGRIMS ON FOOT AND A COACH FULL OF WOMEN WITH SOME SIX SERVANTS ON FOOT AND ON HORSEBACK IN ATTENDANCE ON THEM AND A COUPLE OF MULETEERS WHOM THE GENTLEMEN HAD WITH THEM
translated_text: And now the squires dispatched to make the prize came up, bringing with them two gentlemen on horseback, two pilgrims on foot, and a coach full of women with some six servants on foot and on horseback and attendants on them, and a couple of mule tears whom the gentlemen had with them.

text: THE CAPTAINS SHOWED PLAINLY THE CONCERN THEY FELT THE REGENT'S LADY WAS DOWNCAST AND THE PILGRIMS DID NOT AT ALL ENJOY SEEING THEIR PROPERTY CONFISCATED
translated_text: The captains showed plainly the concern they felt. The regents' lady was downcast, and the pilgrims did not at all enjoy seeing their property confiscated.

text: THE REGENT'S LADY ORDERED ONE OF HER SERVANTS TO GIVE THE EIGHTY CROWNS THAT HAD BEEN ASSESSED AS HER SHARE AT ONCE FOR THE CAPTAINS HAD ALREADY PAID DOWN THEIR SIXTY
translated_text: The Regents' Lady ordered one of her servants to give the 80 crowns that had been assessed as her share at once, for the captains had already paid down their 60.

text: ONE OF THE SQUIRES OBSERVED IN HIS MIXTURE OF GASCON AND CATALAN THIS CAPTAIN OF OURS WOULD MAKE A BETTER FRIAR THAN HIGHWAYMAN IF HE WANTS TO BE SO GENEROUS ANOTHER TIME LET IT BE WITH HIS OWN PROPERTY AND NOT OURS
translated_text: One of the squires observed in his mixture of gascon and cattle and this captain of ours would make a better fryer than highwayman. If he wants to be so generous another time, let it be with his own property in not hours.

text: THEY WERE ALL TAKEN ABACK AND NOT ONE OF THEM DARED TO UTTER A WORD SUCH DEFERENCE DID THEY PAY HIM
translated_text: They were all taken aback, and not one of them dared to utter a word. Such deference did they pay him.

text: HE HAD BEEN A CLERK IN A BANKING HOUSE AND WAS TRANSPORTED FOR EMBEZZLEMENT THOUGH BY SOME GRAVE DOUBTS AS TO HIS GUILT WERE ENTERTAINED
translated_text: He had been a clerk in a banking house and was transported for embezzlement, though by some grave doubts as to his guilt were entertained.

text: WHEN THE MUSTER BELL RANG AND THE GANG BROKE UP RUFUS DAWES ON HIS SILENT WAY TO HIS SEPARATE CELL OBSERVED A NOTABLE CHANGE OF CUSTOM IN THE DISPOSITION OF THE NEW CONVICT
translated_text: When the Musterbell rang in that gang broke up, Rufus Dawes on his silent way to a separate cell observed a notable change of custom in the disposition of the new convict.

text: I'M NOT TO GO IN THERE SAYS THE EX BANK CLERK DRAWING BACK IN DISMAY FROM THE CLOUD OF FOUL FACES WHICH LOWERED UPON HIM
translated_text: I'm not to go in there, says the ex-bank clerk, drawing back into Sme from the cloud of foul faces which lowered upon him.

text: WHAT IS HE MORE THAN ANYBODY ELSE SAID THE WRETCHED MAN TO HIMSELF AS HE HUGGED HIS MISERY CLOSE
translated_text: What is he more than anybody else, said the wretched man to himself, as he hugged his misery close?

text: ABOUT DAWN THE NEXT MORNING MISTER NORTH WHO AMONGST OTHER VAGARIES NOT APPROVED OF BY HIS BISHOP HAD A HABIT OF PROWLING ABOUT THE PRISON AT UNOFFICIAL HOURS WAS ATTRACTED BY A DISPUTE AT THE DOOR OF THE DORMITORY
translated_text: About dawn the next morning, Mr. North, who, amongst other vagaries not approved of by his bishop, had a habit of prowling about the prison that unofficial hours was attracted by a dispute at the door of the dormitory.

text: A PRISONER REFRACTORY YOUR REVERENCE SAID THE WATCHMAN
translated_text: A prisoner refractory your reverence said the watchman.

text: WANTS TO COME OUT MISTER NORTH
translated_text: wants to come out. Mr. North.

text: KIRKLAND GHASTLY PALE BLEEDING WITH HIS WOOLLEN SHIRT TORN AND HIS BLUE EYES WIDE OPEN WITH TERROR WAS CLINGING TO THE BARS
translated_text: Kirkland, ghastly pale, bleeding with his will and shirt torn and his blue eyes wide open with terror, was clinging to the bars.

text: AND BEAT ON THE BARS WITH WHITE AND SWEATING HANDS
translated_text: and beat on the bars with white and sweating hands.

text: I ORDER YOU SIR NORTH CRIED INDIGNANT
translated_text: I order you, sir, North Cride, indignant.

text: VERY SORRY YOUR REVERENCE BUT YOUR REVERENCE KNOWS THAT I DAREN'T DO SUCH A THING
translated_text: Very sorry, your reverence, but your reverence knows that I darn do such a thing.

text: OH YOU MINISTERS OF CHRIST WOLVES IN SHEEP'S CLOTHING YOU SHALL BE JUDGED FOR THIS
translated_text: O you ministers of Christ, wolves in sheep's clothing, you shall be judged for this.

text: LET HIM OUT CRIED NORTH AGAIN STAMPING HIS FOOT
translated_text: Let him out, cried North again, stamping his foot.

text: THERE'S MORE TROUBLE WITH YOU BLOODY ARISTOCRATS THAN ENOUGH LIE QUIET
translated_text: There's more trouble with you bloody aristocrats than enough. Lie quiet.

text: YOU CAN GUESS WHAT THAT UNHAPPY BOY HAS SUFFERED
translated_text: You can guess what that unhappy boy has suffered.

text: IMPERTINENT YOUNG BEGGAR SAID BURGESS
translated_text: impertinent young beggar said Burgess.

text: DO HIM GOOD CURSE HIM
translated_text: Do him good. Curse him.

text: IT'S HARD FOR SUCH YOUNG UNS
translated_text: It's hard for such youngins.

text: HAVE YOU EVER BEEN IN THAT THAT PLACE I WAS IN LAST NIGHT ASKED KIRKLAND
translated_text: Have you ever been in that place I was in last night? Ask Kirkland.

text: WHAT DOES HE CARE CARE
translated_text: What does he care? Care.

text: IF YOU FALL WE MUST FALL OVER YOU AND THEN YOU'RE DONE FOR
translated_text: If you fall, we must fall over you. And then you're done for.

text: HE HAD HARDLY UTTERED THE WORDS WHEN THE BOY FLUNG HIMSELF BENEATH THE LOG
translated_text: He had hardly uttered the words when the boy flung himself beneath the log.

text: HOLD ON TO ME MISS NANCY SAID THE GIANT I'M BIG ENOUGH TO CARRY DOUBLE
translated_text: Hold on to me, Miss Nancy said the giant. I'm big enough to carry double.

text: BUT KIRKLAND KEPT STEADILY ON FOR THE RIVER
translated_text: but Kirkland kept steadily on for the river.

text: JUST AS HE REACHED IT HOWEVER THE FIGURE OF MISTER NORTH ROSE FROM BEHIND A PILE OF STONES
translated_text: Just as he reached it, however, the figure of Mr. North rose from behind a pile of stones.

text: KIRKLAND JUMPED FOR THE JETTY MISSED HIS FOOTING AND FELL INTO THE ARMS OF THE CHAPLAIN
translated_text: Kirkland jumped for the jetty, missed his footing, and fell into the arms of the chaplain.

text: OH MISTER NORTH SAYS KIRKLAND WHY DID YOU STOP ME
translated_text: Oh, Mr. Norris says Kirkland. Why did you stop me?

text: MUST STOP THAT FIFTY LASHES TROKE
translated_text: Must stop that. 50 lashes, troke.

text: THAT LAST FELLOW YOU HAD OUGHT TO HAVE BEEN TIED UP HIMSELF
translated_text: That last fellow you had ought to have been tied up himself.

text: I WON'T HAVE MY MEN KNOCKED UP WITH FLOGGING THESE RASCALS
translated_text: I won't have my men knocked up with flogging these rascals.

text: VERY GOOD YOUR HONOUR SAYS TROKE
translated_text: Very good, your honor, says TROKE.

text: CAPTAIN FRERE SAYS THAT THE SCENERY IS DELIGHTFUL
translated_text: Captain Freyr says that the scenery is delightful.

text: ABANDONED INDEED BY GOD AND MAN ALMOST
translated_text: Abandoned indeed by God and man almost.

text: IN THE VALLEY OF THE SHADOW OF DEATH HE IS WITH US
translated_text: and the valley of the shadow of death he is with us.

text: YOU HAVE NOT BEEN LONG IN THE COLONY MISTER MEEKIN
translated_text: You have not been long in the colony, Mr. Meakin.

text: IF YOU PLEASE SAID MEEKIN GRAVELY
translated_text: If you please said me engravely.

text: PRAY HELP YOURSELF TO WINE
translated_text: Pray, help yourself to wine.

text: HAVE YOU MANY VISITORS CAPTAIN BURGESS VERY FEW
translated_text: Have you many visitors, Captain Burgess? Very few.

text: I WAS QUARTERED WITH HIM AT SARAH ISLAND
translated_text: I was courted with him at Sarah Island.

text: SO HE'S A FRIEND OF YOURS EH
translated_text: So he's a friend of yours, eh?

text: I HAD THE PLEASURE OF MEETING HIM IN SOCIETY
translated_text: I had the pleasure of meeting him in society.

text: HE IS JUST MARRIED YOU KNOW IS HE SAID BURGESS
translated_text: He is just married, you know. Is he said Burgess?

text: THE DEVIL HE IS I HEARD SOMETHING ABOUT IT TOO
translated_text: The devil he is, I heard something about it too.

text: YES ONE OUGHTN'T TO LEAVE THE COLONY WITHOUT SEEING IT SAYS BURGESS IT'S WORTH SEEING
translated_text: Yes, one oughten to leave the colony without seeing it, says Burgess. It's worth seeing.

text: IN FACT THE RINGLEADER JOHN REX GAVE ME HIS CONFESSION AND I SENT IT TO THE BISHOP
translated_text: In fact, the ringleader, John Rex, gave me his confession, and I sent it to the bishop.

text: A GREAT RASCAL PUT IN NORTH
translated_text: a great rascal put in north.

text: WELL NOW SAID MEEKIN WITH ASPERITY I DON'T AGREE WITH YOU
translated_text: Well now, said Meacon with disparity. I don't agree with you.

text: HE SEEMS TO ME TO BE TRULY PENITENT FOR HIS OFFENCES A MISGUIDED BUT NOT A HYPOCRITICAL MAN IF MY KNOWLEDGE OF HUMAN NATURE GOES FOR ANYTHING I HOPE HE IS SAID NORTH
translated_text: He seems to me to be truly penitent for his offenses. A misguided but not a hypocritical man, if my knowledge of human nature goes for anything, I hope he has said north.

text: THERE'S NO FEAR OF HIM SAID BURGESS CHEERILY IF HE GROWS UPROARIOUS WE'LL SOON GIVE HIM A TOUCH OF THE CAT
translated_text: There's no fear of him said Burgess cheerly. If he grows up rorious, we'll soon give him a touch of the cat."

text: I SUPPOSE SEVERITY IS NECESSARY RETURNED MEEKIN THOUGH TO MY EARS A FLOGGING SOUNDS A LITTLE DISTASTEFUL
translated_text: I suppose severity is necessary, Return Meacon, though to my ears a flogging sounds a little distasteful.

text: I HAVE THESE ATTACKS AT TIMES
translated_text: I have these attacks at times.

text: THE REVEREND MEEKIN EYED HIS CLERICAL BROTHER WITH HORROR THE REVEREND MEEKIN WAS NOT ACCUSTOMED TO CLERGYMEN WHO WORE BLACK NECKTIES SMOKED CLAY PIPES CHEWED TOBACCO AND DRANK NEAT BRANDY OUT OF TUMBLERS
translated_text: The Reverend Meacon eyed his clerical brother with horror. The Reverend Meacon was not accustomed to clergymen who wore black neckties, smoked clay pipes, chewed tobacco, and drank neat brandy out of tumblers.

text: SO THEY WENT ON TO THE VERANDAH AND LOOKED DOWN UPON THE LIGHTS OF THE PRISON AND LISTENED TO THE SEA LAPPING THE SHORE
translated_text: So they went onto the veranda and looked down upon the lights of the prison and listened to the sea lapping the shore.

text: BY AND BY A SHORT FIGURE SMOKING A CHEROOT CAME UP OUT OF THE DARK AND PROVED TO BE DOCTOR MACKLEWAIN WHO HAD BEEN PREVENTED FROM ATTENDING THE DINNER BY REASON OF AN ACCIDENT TO A CONSTABLE AT NORFOLK BAY WHICH HAD CLAIMED HIS PROFESSIONAL ATTENTION
translated_text: Buy and buy a short figure, smoking a shirute, came up out of the dark and proved to be Dr. McElwain, who had been prevented from attending the dinner by reason of an accident to a constable at Norfolk Bay, which had claimed his professional attention.

text: DEAD SAID DOCTOR MACKLEWAIN
translated_text: Dead said Dr. McElwain.

text: DELIGHTED TO SEE YOU MISTER MEEKIN
translated_text: Delighted to see you, Mr. Meakin.

text: BUT MACKLEWAIN WAS TIRED AND WANTED TO GET HOME
translated_text: but McElwain was tired and wanted to get home.

text: OUR ROADS LIE TOGETHER DOCTOR
translated_text: Our roads lie together, doctor.

text: BEFORE THE TWO CLERGYMEN HAD GOT HALF WAY DOWN THE STEEP PATH THAT LED FROM THE COMMANDANT'S HOUSE TO THE FLAT ON WHICH THE COTTAGES OF THE DOCTOR AND CHAPLAIN WERE BUILT MACKLEWAIN REJOINED THEM
translated_text: Before the two clergymen had got halfway down the steep path that led from the common dance house to the flat on which the cottages of the doctrine Chaplin were built, Maccawain rejoined them.

text: ANOTHER FLOGGING TO MORROW SAID HE GRUMBLINGLY
translated_text: Another flogging tomorrow said he grumblingly.

text: WHOM IS HE GOING TO FLOG NOW
translated_text: Whom is he going to vlog now?

text: YOU DON'T MEAN TO SAY HE'S GOING TO FLOG KIRKLAND
translated_text: You don't mean to say he's going to flag Kirkland.

text: PERHAPS YOU'LL HAVE THE GOODNESS TO ALLOW ME TO BE THE BEST JUDGE OF THAT RETURNED MACKLEWAIN DRAWING UP HIS LITTLE BODY TO ITS LEAST INSIGNIFICANT STATURE
translated_text: Perhaps you'll have the goodness to allow me to be the best judge of that return, McElwain, drawing up his little body to its least insignificant stature.

text: MISTER MEEKIN EXPRESSED SOME ALARM BUT DOCTOR MACKLEWAIN RE ASSURED HIM
translated_text: Mr. Meekin expressed some alarm, but Dr. McElwain reassured him.

text: WE CAN'T DO ANYTHING WITHOUT EVIDENCE COMPLAIN
translated_text: We can't do anything without evidence. Complain.

text: I SHALL FIND MY PORTMANTEAU IN MY ROOM YOU SAID YES YES
translated_text: I shall find my port Montau in my room, you said. Yes, yes.

text: HE SLEEPS AT THE BACK AND NORTH HURRIED OFF
translated_text: He sleeps at the back and north hurried off.

text: AN IMPULSIVE GENTLEMAN SAID MEEKIN TO MACKLEWAIN AS THE SOUND OF MISTER NORTH'S FOOTSTEPS DIED AWAY IN THE DISTANCE
translated_text: An impulsive gentleman said meek into McElwain, as a sound of Mr. North's footsteps died away in the distance.

text: MACKLEWAIN SHOOK HIS HEAD SERIOUSLY
translated_text: McElwain shook his head seriously.

text: HE HAS THE STRANGEST FITS AT TIMES
translated_text: He is the strangest fits at times.

text: UNLESS IT'S A CANCER IN THE STOMACH I DON'T KNOW WHAT IT CAN BE CANCER IN THE STOMACH
translated_text: Unless it's a cancer in the stomach, I don't know what it can be. Cancer in the stomach.

text: DOCTOR WE ALL HAVE OUR CROSSES HAVE WE NOT
translated_text: Doctor, we all have our crosses, have we not?

text: HOW DELIGHTFUL THE GRASS SMELLS
translated_text: How delightful the grass smells!

text: GOOD NIGHT SIR I HOPE YOU WILL BE COMFORTABLE
translated_text: Good night, sir. I hope you will be comfortable.

text: I'LL TEACH MY PRISONERS TO ATTEMPT SUICIDE
translated_text: I'll teach my prisoners to attempt suicide.

text: THAT'S MACKLEWAIN'S BUSINESS
translated_text: That's Matt McLean's business.

text: THEN DON'T YOU INTERFERE WITH ME SIR
translated_text: Then don't you interfere with me, sir.

text: I'VE GIVEN MY ORDERS SIR
translated_text: I've given my orders, sir.

text: THEN CAPTAIN BURGESS CRIED NORTH HIS PALE FACE FLUSHING I TELL YOU THE BOY'S BLOOD WILL BE ON YOUR HEAD
translated_text: Then Captain Burgess cried north, his pale face flushing. I tell you the boy's blood will be on your head.

text: I AM A MINISTER OF GOD SIR AND I FORBID YOU TO COMMIT THIS CRIME
translated_text: I am a minister of God, sir, and I forbid you to commit this crime.

text: DAMN YOUR IMPERTINENCE SIR BURST OUT BURGESS
translated_text: Damn you're impertinence served burst out, Burgess.

text: YOU'RE A DISMISSED OFFICER OF THE GOVERNMENT SIR
translated_text: You're a dismissed officer of the government, sir.

text: THIS OF COURSE WAS MERE BRAVADO ON THE PART OF THE COMMANDANT
translated_text: This, of course, was mere bravado in the part of the common-dont.

text: NORTH KNEW WELL THAT HE WOULD NEVER DARE TO ATTEMPT ANY SUCH ACT OF VIOLENCE BUT THE INSULT STUNG HIM LIKE THE CUT OF A WHIP
translated_text: North knew well that he would never dare to attempt any such act of violence, but the insults stung him like the cut of a whip.

text: SHOW MISTER NORTH OUT HE SAID AND GO DOWN TO THE BARRACKS AND TELL TROKE THAT KIRKLAND IS TO HAVE A HUNDRED LASHES TO MORROW
translated_text: Show Mr. North out, he said, and go down to the barracks until troke that Kirkland is to have a hundred lashes tomorrow.

text: I'LL SHOW YOU WHO'S MASTER HERE MY GOOD SIR
translated_text: I'll show you who's master here, my good sir.

text: THIS IS MURDEROUS
translated_text: This is murderous.

text: THE GOVERNMENT MAY GO TO AND YOU TOO ROARED BURGESS GET OUT
translated_text: The government may go to, and you too, Ward Burgess, get out.

text: THEY SHALL NOT FLOG THAT BOY HE SAID
translated_text: They shall not flag that boy," he said.

text: I'LL REPORT THIS TO THE GOVERNMENT
translated_text: I'll report this to the government.

text: I WISH I HADN'T TAKEN THAT BRANDY HE SAID FOOL THAT I AM
translated_text: I wish I hadn't taken that brandy he said, fool that I am.

text: OH GOD GIVE ME STRENGTH AID ME HELP ME
translated_text: Oh God, give me strength, aid me, help me.

text: O LORD LOOK DOWN UPON ME
translated_text: O Lord, look down upon me.

text: HE MIXED A TEASPOONFUL OF THIS IN A PANNIKIN OF WATER AND DRANK IT
translated_text: He mixed a teaspoon of this synopanic anew water and drank it.

text: IT RELIEVED HIM FOR A WHILE
translated_text: It relieved him for a while.

text: IT WAS AS THOUGH HE HAD REACHED THE CRISIS OF A DISEASE WHICH HAD BEEN FOR DAYS GATHERING FORCE
translated_text: It was as though he had reached the crisis of a disease, which had been for days gathering force.

text: I MUST HAVE A TEASPOONFUL HE SAID TO ALLAY THE CRAVING
translated_text: I must have a teaspoon full, he said, to allay the craving.

text: TWICE HE PAUSED ON THE WAY TO THE SITTING ROOM AND TWICE WAS HE DRIVEN ON BY A POWER STRONGER THAN HIS WILL
translated_text: Twice he paused on the way to the sitting room, and twice was he driven on by a power stronger than his will.

text: HE SMELT THE NUTTY AROMA OF THE SPIRIT
translated_text: He smelt the nutty aroma of the spirit.

text: THAT AT ALL TIMES DEBASING AT THIS PARTICULAR TIME IT WAS INFAMOUS THAT A VICE UNWORTHY OF ANY MAN WAS DOUBLY SINFUL IN A MAN OF EDUCATION AND A MINISTER OF GOD IN VAIN
translated_text: that at all times debasing, at this particular time it was infamous, that a vice unworthy of any man was doubly sinful in a man of education and a minister of God, in vain.

text: IN THE MIDST OF HIS ARGUMENTS HE FOUND HIMSELF AT THE CUPBOARD WITH THE BOTTLE AT HIS LIPS IN AN ATTITUDE THAT WAS AT ONCE LUDICROUS AND HORRIBLE
translated_text: In the midst of his arguments, he found himself at the cupboard with the bottle-led his lips in an attitude that was at once ludicrous and horrible.

text: HER MEETING WITH LETTY WAS INDESCRIBABLY TENDER AND THE DAYS THAT FOLLOWED WERE PRETTY EQUALLY DIVIDED BETWEEN HER AND HER BROTHER IN NURSING THE ONE AND LOVING THE OTHER
translated_text: Her meeting with Ledy was indescribably tender, and the days that followed were pretty equally divided between her and her brother, in nursing the one and loving the other.

text: BUT EVEN WHILE SHE ENJOYED EVERY HOUR OF LIFE AND BEGRUDGED THE TIME GIVEN TO SLEEP SHE FELT AS IF THE DREAM WAS TOO BEAUTIFUL TO LAST AND OFTEN SAID
translated_text: But even while she enjoyed every hour of life and begrudged the time given to sleep, she felt as if the dream was too beautiful to last and often said.

text: SO CHRISTIE TURNED A DEAF EAR TO HER PROPHETIC SOUL AND GAVE HERSELF UP TO THE BLISSFUL HOLIDAY THAT HAD COME AT LAST
translated_text: So Christi turned a deaf ear to her prophetic soul and gave herself up to the blissful holiday that had come at last.

text: NOTHING CAN SURPRISE ME NOW I'M PREPARED FOR ANY THING EVEN THE SIGHT OF MY QUAKERISH LOVER DANCING A JIG
translated_text: Nothing can surprise me now. I'm prepared for anything, even the sight of my quakerish lover dancing a jick.

text: I FEEL LIKE A BOY OUT OF SCHOOL OR RATHER A MAN OUT OF PRISON AND MUST ENJOY MY LIBERTY IN SOME WAY
translated_text: I feel like a boy out of school, or rather a man out of prison, and must enjoy my liberty in some way.

text: I'M NOT A TALKER YOU KNOW AND AS THE LAWS OF GRAVITATION FORBID MY SOARING ALOFT ANYWHERE I CAN ONLY EXPRESS MY JOYFULLY UPLIFTED STATE OF MIND BY PRANCING AS YOU CALL IT
translated_text: I'm not a talker, you know, and, as the laws of gravitation forbid my soaring aloft anywhere, I can only express my joyfully uplifted state of mind by prancing, as you call it.

text: I DON'T WANT YOU TO I LOVE TO SEE YOU SO YOUNG AND HAPPY ONLY YOU ARE NOT THE OLD DAVID AND I'VE GOT TO GET ACQUAINTED WITH THE NEW ONE
translated_text: I don't want you two. I love to see you so young and happy. Only you are not the old David and I've got to get acquainted with the new one.

text: I HOPE YOU'LL LIKE HIM BETTER THAN THE FROST BITTEN OLD DAVID YOU FIRST KNEW AND WERE KIND ENOUGH TO LOVE
translated_text: I hope you like him better than the frostbitten old David you first knew and we're kind enough to love

text: MOTHER SAYS I'VE GONE BACK TO THE TIME BEFORE WE LOST LETTY AND I SOMETIMES FEEL AS IF I HAD
translated_text: Mother says I've gone back to the time before we lost Letti, and I sometimes feel as if I had.

text: IN THAT CASE YOU WILL FIND ME A PROUD IMPETUOUS AMBITIOUS FELLOW CHRISTIE AND HOW WILL THAT SUIT
translated_text: In that case, you will find me a proud and petuous, ambitious fellow, Christie. At How Will That Suit?

text: EXCELLENTLY I LIKE PRIDE OF YOUR SORT IMPETUOSITY BECOMES YOU FOR YOU HAVE LEARNED TO CONTROL IT IF NEED BE AND THE AMBITION IS BEST OF ALL
translated_text: Excellent. I like pride of your sort. Impetuosity becomes you, for you have learned to control it if need be. And the ambition is best of all.

text: I SHALL WAIT FOR TIME TO SHOW
translated_text: I shall wait for time to show.

text: THEN THEY WENT BACK TO THEIR WORK LITTLE DREAMING AS THEY TIED ROSES AND TWINED SMILAX WREATHS HOW NEAR THAT OTHER CHANCE WAS HOW SOON THEY WERE TO BE CALLED UPON TO KEEP THEIR PROMISE AND HOW WELL EACH WAS TO PERFORM THE PART GIVEN THEM IN LIFE AND DEATH
translated_text: Then they went back to their work, little dreaming as they tied roses and twine similar trees, how near that other chance was, how soon they were to be called upon to keep their promise, and how well each was to perform the part given them in life and death.

text: TO NO HOME IN THE LAND DID THE GREAT TROUBLE BRING A MORE SUDDEN CHANGE THAN THE LITTLE COTTAGE IN THE LANE
translated_text: To know home in the land did the great trouble bring a more sudden change than the little cottage in the lane.

text: DAVID WAS SOBER ENOUGH NOW AND WENT ABOUT HIS WORK WITH A GRIM SET TO HIS LIPS AND A SPARK IN HIS EYES THAT MADE THE THREE WOMEN LOOK AT ONE ANOTHER PALE WITH UNSPOKEN APPREHENSION
translated_text: David was sober enough now and went about his work with a grim set to his lips, and a spark in his eyes that made the three women look at one another pale with unspoken apprehension.

text: IT IS TERRIBLE AND YET GLORIOUS
translated_text: It is terrible and yet glorious.

text: DAVID HELD IT CLOSE IN BOTH OF HIS SAYING GRATEFULLY THANK YOU MOTHER THEN FIXING HIS EYES ON THE YOUNGER YET NOT DEARER WOMEN HE ADDED WITH A RING IN HIS VOICE THAT MADE THEIR HEARTS ANSWER WITH A PROMPT AY AY IN SPITE OF LOVE OR FEAR
translated_text: David held it close in both of his, saying gratefully, thank you, mother. Then fixing his eyes on the younger, yet not dearer women, he added with a ring in his voice that made their hearts answer with a prompt, I, I, in spite of love or fear.

text: THE BOYS BLESS THEIR BRAVE HEARTS HAVE DONE NOBLY BUT OLDER MEN ARE NEEDED NOW WE CANNOT SACRIFICE ALL THE GALLANT LADS AND WE WHO HAVE MORE TO LOSE THAN THEY MUST TAKE OUR TURN AND TRY TO DO AS WELL
translated_text: The boys bless their brave hearts, have done nobly, but older men are needed now. We cannot sacrifice all the gallant lads, and we who have more to lose than they must take our turn and try to do as well.

text: YES DAVID SISTER AND SWEETHEART ANSWERED BRAVELY FORGETTING IN THE FERVOR OF THE MOMENT WHAT HEAVY CONSEQUENCES GOD MIGHT SEE FIT TO SEND GOOD
translated_text: Yes, David. Sister in sweet heart answered, bravely forgetting in the fervor of the moment, what heavy consequences God might see fit to send. Good.

text: BENNET WILL TAKE THE GARDEN AND GREEN HOUSE OFF MY HANDS THIS AUTUMN FOR A YEAR OR LONGER IF I LIKE
translated_text: Then it will take the garden in the greenhouse off my hands to Sodom for a year or longer if I like.

text: HE'S A KIND NEIGHBORLY MAN AND HIS BOY WILL TAKE MY PLACE ABOUT THE HOUSE AND PROTECT YOU FAITHFULLY
translated_text: He's a kind, neighborly man, and his boy will take my place about the house and protect you faithfully.

text: I KNEW YOU WOULD GO I SAW YOU GETTING READY AND I MADE UP MY MIND TO FOLLOW
translated_text: I knew you would go. I saw you getting ready and I made up my mind to follow.

text: YOU WILL LET ME DO IT AND IN RETURN I WILL MARRY YOU WHENEVER YOU ASK ME ANSWERED CHRISTIE SEALING THE PROMISE WITH A KISS THAT SILENCED HIM
translated_text: You will let me do it, and in return I will marry you whenever you ask me answered Christie, sealing the promise with a kiss that silenced him.

text: YOU'VE SOMETHING TO TELL ME I SEE IT IN YOUR FACE DEAR I MUST GO
translated_text: You have something to tell me. I see it in your face. Dear, I must go.

text: NEXT EVENING AS MISSUS STERLING SAT ALONE IN THE TWILIGHT A TALL MAN IN ARMY BLUE ENTERED QUIETLY STOOD WATCHING THE TRANQUIL FIGURE FOR A MOMENT THEN WENT AND KNELT DOWN BESIDE IT SAYING WITH A MOST UNSOLDIERLY CHOKE IN THE VOICE
translated_text: Next evening, as Mrs. Sterling sat alone in the twilight, a tall man in army blue entered quietly, stood watching the tranquil figure for a moment, then went and knelt down beside it, saying with the most unsoldurally choking the voice.

text: THE LOYAL FRENZY FELL UPON THE THREE QUIET WOMEN AND THEY COULD NOT DO TOO MUCH FOR THEIR COUNTRY
translated_text: The loyal friends fell upon the three quiet women and they could not do too much for their country.

text: IT WOULD HAVE TAKEN MANY KNAPSACKS TO HOLD ALL THE GIFTS SHOWERED UPON HIM BY HIS FRIENDS AND NEIGHBORS
translated_text: It would have taken many napsacks to hold all the gifts showered upon him by his friends and neighbors.

text: FINDING THAT LISHA SHOWED LITTLE ENTHUSIASM ON THE SUBJECT SHE TRIED TO ROUSE HIM BY PATRIOTIC APPEALS OF VARIOUS SORTS
translated_text: Finding that Leisha showed little enthusiasm on the subject. She tried to rouse him by patriotic appeals of various sorts.

text: VERY WELL SAID MISSUS WILKINS RESOLUTELY TO HERSELF EF I CAN'T MAKE NO IMPRESSION ON HIS SOUL I WILL ON HIS STOMMICK AND SEE HOW THAT'LL WORK
translated_text: Very well said Mrs. Wilkins, resolutely to herself. If I can't make no impression on his soul, I will on his stomach and see how that'll work.

text: WE CAN'T AFFORD NO NICE VITTLES NOW WHEN OUR MEN ARE SUFFERIN SO
translated_text: We can't afford no nice fiddles now when our men are suffering so.

text: HE WAS NOT AS UNMOVED AS HE SEEMED BY THE GENERAL EXCITEMENT AND HAD FELT SUNDRY MANLY IMPULSES TO UP AND AT EM WHEN HIS COMRADES IN THE SHOP DISCUSSED THE CRISIS WITH IREFUL BRANDISHING OF AWLS AND VENGEFUL POUNDING OF SOLE LEATHER AS IF THE REBELS WERE UNDER THE HAMMER
translated_text: He was not as unmoved as he seemed by the general excitement, and had felt sundry manly in pulses to up an atom, when his comrades in the shop discussed the crisis with iron-fold brandishing of alls and vengeful pounding of soul leather, as if the rebels were under the hammer.

text: TO SAY THAT THE FISH ROSE AT ONCE AND SWALLOWED THE BAIT HOOK AND ALL BUT FEEBLY EXPRESSES THE JUSTICE DONE TO THE CAKES BY THAT LONG SUFFERING MAN
translated_text: To say that the fish rose at once and swallowed the bait hook and all, but feebly expresses the justice done to the cakes by that long-suffering man.

text: CAN YOU REMEMBER WHAT HEPSEY TOLD US AND CALL THEM POOR LONG SUFFERIN CREETERS NAMES
translated_text: Can you remember what Hepsy told us and call them poor, long, suffering creators names?

text: NO HE AIN'T IT'S A TRAINER ADDED ANN LIZY
translated_text: No, he ain't. It's a trainer, added and Lizzy.

text: NOW CYNTHY BE YOU SATISFIED
translated_text: Now, Cynthia, be you satisfied.

text: AND THE INCONSISTENT WOMAN FELL UPON HIS BUTTONY BREAST WEEPING COPIOUSLY
translated_text: And the inconsistent woman fell upon his butty breast, weeping copiously.

text: HIS WIFE FED HIM WITH THE FAT OF THE LAND REGARDLESS OF CONSEQUENCES HIS CHILDREN REVOLVED ABOUT HIM WITH TIRELESS CURIOSITY AND WONDER HIS NEIGHBORS FLOCKED IN TO APPLAUD ADVISE AND ADMIRE EVERY ONE TREATED HIM WITH A RESPECT MOST GRATEFUL TO HIS FEELINGS HE WAS AN OBJECT OF INTEREST AND WITH EVERY HOUR HIS IMPORTANCE INCREASED SO THAT BY NIGHT HE FELT LIKE A COMMANDER IN CHIEF AND BORE HIMSELF ACCORDINGLY
translated_text: His wife said him with the fat of the land, regardless of consequences. His children revolved about him with tireless curiosity and wonder. His neighbors flocked into a plot, advise, and admire. Every one treated him with respect most grateful to his feelings. He was an object of interest, and with every hour his importance increased, so that by night he felt like a commander in chief, and bore himself accordingly.

text: THEN THE GOOD SOUL OPENLY SHOULDERED THE BURDEN SHE HAD BORNE SO LONG IN SECRET AND BRAVELY TRUDGED ON ALONE
translated_text: Then the goods saw openly shorted the boat and she had borne so long in secret and bravely treged on alone.

text: THE WOMEN DROPPED THEIR WORK TO LOOK AND LISTEN FOR HIS VISITS WERE FEW AND SHORT AND EVERY INSTANT WAS PRECIOUS
translated_text: The women dropped their work to look and listen for his visits were few and short and every instant was precious.

text: THEY KNEW WHAT IT WAS WITHOUT A WORD MISSUS STERLING CLASPED HER HANDS AND BOWED HER HEAD
translated_text: They knew what it was without a word. Mrs. Sterling clasped her hands and bowed her head.

text: NOW LET'S BE BRAVE AND ENJOY EVERY MINUTE OF IT
translated_text: Now let's be brave and enjoy every minute of it.

text: WE WILL WHAT CAN I DO FOR YOU DAVY ASKED CHRISTIE WONDERFULLY SUPPORTED BY THE THOUGHT THAT SHE WAS GOING TOO
translated_text: We will. What can I do for your Davy, asked Christy wonderfully supported by the thought that she was going to?

text: AS A MARRIED WOMAN YOU WILL GET ON BETTER AS MY WIFE YOU WILL BE ALLOWED TO COME TO ME IF I NEED YOU AND AS MY HE STOPPED THERE FOR HE COULD NOT ADD AS MY WIDOW YOU WILL HAVE MY PENSION TO SUPPORT YOU
translated_text: As a married woman, you will get on better. As my wife, you will be allowed to come to me if I need you. And as my... He stopped here for he could not add. As my widow, you will have my pension to support you.

text: NOTHING CAN PART US ANY MORE NOT EVEN DEATH FOR LOVE LIKE OURS WILL LAST FOR EVER
translated_text: Nothing can part us anymore, not even death, for love like ours will last forever.

text: NOT ONE DAVID THAT'S TRUE LOVE CHRISTIE
translated_text: Not one, David. That's true love, Christy.

text: THEN THEY STOOD QUITE STILL FOR A TIME AND IN THE SILENCE THE TWO HEARTS TALKED TOGETHER IN THE SWEET LANGUAGE NO TONGUE CAN UTTER
translated_text: Then they stood quite still for a time, and in the silence the two hearts talked together in the sweet language, no tongue can utter.

text: SURELY I SHALL IF I GIVE YOU AND MYSELF TO THE CAUSE AND I DO IT GLADLY THOUGH I KNOW THAT MY HEART HAS GOT TO ACHE AS IT NEVER HAS ACHED YET WHEN MY COURAGE FAILS AS IT WILL BY AND BY AND MY SELFISH SOUL COUNTS THE COST OF MY OFFERING AFTER THE EXCITEMENT IS OVER
translated_text: Surely I shall, if I give you and myself to the cause, and I do it gladly, though I know that my heart has got to ache as it never has ached yet, when my courage fails, as it will buy and buy, and my selfish soul counts the cost of my offering after the excitement is over.

text: DAVID CAUGHT THE EXALTATION AND GAVE NO FURTHER THOUGHT TO ANY THING BUT THE DUTY OF THE HOUR FINDING HIMSELF STRONGER AND BRAVER FOR THAT LONG LOOK INTO THE ILLUMINATED FACE OF THE WOMAN HE LOVED
translated_text: David caught the exaltation and gave no further thought to anything but the duty of the hour, finding himself stronger and braver for that long look into the illuminated face of the woman he loved.

text: THE ROSES ARE FOR THEY REMIND ME OF POOR HELEN AND THE FIRST WORK I DID WITH DAVID WAS ARRANGING FLOWERS LIKE THESE FOR A DEAD BABY'S LITTLE COFFIN
translated_text: The roses are, for they remind me of poor Helen, and the first twerk I did with David was arranging flowers like these for a dead baby's little coffin.

text: BUT I THINK FEW BRIDES DRESS WITH A BRAVER HAPPIER HEART THAN MINE THOUGH I DO CHOOSE A SOBER WEDDING GOWN ANSWERED CHRISTIE SMILING AGAIN AS SHE TOOK FROM A HALF PACKED TRUNK HER NEW HOSPITAL SUIT OF SOFT GRAY WOOLLEN STUFF
translated_text: But I think few broad stress with a braver, happier heart than mine, though I do choose this over wedding gown answered Christie smiling again, as she took from a half-packed trunk her new hospital suit of soft grey wool and stuff.

text: MISTER POWER IS WAITING ARE YOU READY LOVE QUITE READY
translated_text: Mr. Powers, waiting. Are you ready, love? Quite ready.

text: YOU YOUNG FOLKS TAKE A WEDDING TRIP TO THE GREEN HOUSE WHILE WE SEE HOW WELL WE CAN GET ON WITHOUT YOU
translated_text: You young folks take a wedding trip to the greenhouse while we see how well we can get on without you.

text: DAVID AND CHRISTIE WENT SMILING AWAY TOGETHER AND IF THEY SHED ANY TEARS OVER THE BRIEF HAPPINESS NO ONE SAW THEM BUT THE FLOWERS AND THEY LOYALLY KEPT THE SECRET FOLDED UP IN THEIR TENDER HEARTS
translated_text: David and Christy went smiling away together, and if they shed any tears over the brief happiness, no one saw them but the flowers, and they loyally kept the secret folded up in their tender hearts.

text: A VERY SIMPLE LITTLE MARRIAGE FEAST BUT MORE LOVE GOOD WILL AND TENDER WISHES ADORNED THE PLAIN TABLE THAN IS OFTEN FOUND AT WEDDING BREAKFASTS AND BETTER THAN ANY SPEECH OR SONG WAS LETTY'S BROKEN WHISPER AS SHE FOLDED HER ARMS ROUND DAVID'S EMPTY CHAIR WHEN NO ONE SAW HER HEAVEN BLESS AND KEEP AND BRING HIM BACK TO US
translated_text: A very simple little marriage feast, but more love, good will, and tender wishes adorn the plain table than is often found at wedding breakfasts. Embedded than any speech her song was let his broken whisper, as she folded her arms around David's empty chair when no one saw her. Heaven bless and keep and bring him back to us.

text: ALL WATCHED WITH QUICKENED BREATH AND PROUD SOULS THAT LIVING WAVE BLUE BELOW AND BRIGHT WITH A STEELY GLITTER ABOVE AS IT FLOWED DOWN THE STREET AND AWAY TO JOIN THE SEA OF DAUNTLESS HEARTS THAT FOR MONTHS HAD ROLLED UP AGAINST THE SOUTH AND EBBED BACK REDDENED WITH THE BLOOD OF MEN LIKE THESE
translated_text: All watched with quickened breath, and proud souls that living waves blew below and bright with a steely glitter above, as it flowed down the street in a way to join the sea of don'tless hearts that for months had rolled up against the south, and ebbed back reddened with the blood of men like these.

text: THEN SHE SAW DAVID AND THE REGIMENT BECAME ONE MAN TO HER
translated_text: Then she saw David and the regiment became one man to her.

text: I COULD NOT LOVE THEE DEAR SO MUCH LOVED I NOT HONOR MORE
translated_text: I could not love the beer so much. Love, die, not honor more.

text: EVERY ELEVATION OF THE TYPE MAN HAS HITHERTO BEEN THE WORK OF AN ARISTOCRATIC SOCIETY AND SO IT WILL ALWAYS BE A SOCIETY BELIEVING IN A LONG SCALE OF GRADATIONS OF RANK AND DIFFERENCES OF WORTH AMONG HUMAN BEINGS AND REQUIRING SLAVERY IN SOME FORM OR OTHER
translated_text: Every elevation of the type man has either too been the work of an aristocratic society, and so it will always be, a society believing in a long scale of gradations of rank and differences of worth among human beings, and requiring slavery in some form or other.

text: THE DISTINCTIONS OF MORAL VALUES HAVE EITHER ORIGINATED IN A RULING CASTE PLEASANTLY CONSCIOUS OF BEING DIFFERENT FROM THE RULED OR AMONG THE RULED CLASS THE SLAVES AND DEPENDENTS OF ALL SORTS
translated_text: The distinctions of moral values have either originated in a ruling caste, pleasantly conscious of being different from the ruled, or among the ruled class, the slaves, and dependents of all sorts.

text: WE TRUTHFUL ONES THE NOBILITY IN ANCIENT GREECE CALLED THEMSELVES
translated_text: We truthful ones, the nobility in ancient Greece, called themselves.

text: IT IS OBVIOUS THAT EVERYWHERE THE DESIGNATIONS OF MORAL VALUE WERE AT FIRST APPLIED TO MEN AND WERE ONLY DERIVATIVELY AND AT A LATER PERIOD APPLIED TO ACTIONS IT IS A GROSS MISTAKE THEREFORE WHEN HISTORIANS OF MORALS START WITH QUESTIONS LIKE WHY HAVE SYMPATHETIC ACTIONS BEEN PRAISED
translated_text: It is obvious that everywhere the designations of moral value were at first applied to men, and were only derivatively and at a later period applied to actions. It is a gross mistake, therefore, when historians of morals start with questions like, why have sympathetic actions been praised?

text: HE HONOURS WHATEVER HE RECOGNIZES IN HIMSELF SUCH MORALITY EQUALS SELF GLORIFICATION
translated_text: He honors whatever he recognizes in himself. Such morality equals self-lorification.

text: PROBABLY A PESSIMISTIC SUSPICION WITH REGARD TO THE ENTIRE SITUATION OF MAN WILL FIND EXPRESSION PERHAPS A CONDEMNATION OF MAN TOGETHER WITH HIS SITUATION
translated_text: Probably a pessimistic suspicion with regard to the entire situation of man will find expression, perhaps a condemnation of man, together with his situation.

text: HERE IS THE SEAT OF THE ORIGIN OF THE FAMOUS ANTITHESIS GOOD AND EVIL POWER AND DANGEROUSNESS ARE ASSUMED TO RESIDE IN THE EVIL A CERTAIN DREADFULNESS SUBTLETY AND STRENGTH WHICH DO NOT ADMIT OF BEING DESPISED
translated_text: Here is the seat of the origin of the famous antithesis, good and evil. Power and dangerousness are assumed to reside in the evil, a certain dreadfulness, subtlety, and strength which do not admit of being despised.

text: ACCORDING TO SLAVE MORALITY THEREFORE THE EVIL MAN AROUSES FEAR ACCORDING TO MASTER MORALITY IT IS PRECISELY THE GOOD MAN WHO AROUSES FEAR AND SEEKS TO AROUSE IT WHILE THE BAD MAN IS REGARDED AS THE DESPICABLE BEING
translated_text: According to slave morality, therefore, the evil man arouses fear. According to master morality, it is precisely the good man who arouses fear and seeks to arouse it, while the bad man is regarded as the despicable being.

text: EVERYWHERE THAT SLAVE MORALITY GAINS THE ASCENDANCY LANGUAGE SHOWS A TENDENCY TO APPROXIMATE THE SIGNIFICATIONS OF THE WORDS GOOD AND STUPID
translated_text: Everywhere that slave morality gains the ascendancy, language shows a tendency to approximate the significations of the word good and stupid.

text: OR HE WILL EVEN SAY FOR MANY REASONS I CAN DELIGHT IN THE GOOD OPINION OF OTHERS PERHAPS BECAUSE I LOVE AND HONOUR THEM AND REJOICE IN ALL THEIR JOYS PERHAPS ALSO BECAUSE THEIR GOOD OPINION ENDORSES AND STRENGTHENS MY BELIEF IN MY OWN GOOD OPINION PERHAPS BECAUSE THE GOOD OPINION OF OTHERS EVEN IN CASES WHERE I DO NOT SHARE IT IS USEFUL TO ME OR GIVES PROMISE OF USEFULNESS ALL THIS HOWEVER IS NOT VANITY
translated_text: Or he will even say, for many reasons I can delight in the good opinion of others, perhaps because I love and honor them, and rejoice in all their joys. Perhaps also because their good opinion endorses and strengthens my belief in my own good opinion. Perhaps because the good opinion of others, even in cases where I do not share it, is useful to me, or gives promise of usefulness. All this, however, is not vanity.

text: IN FACT CONFORMABLY TO THE SLOW RISE OF THE DEMOCRATIC SOCIAL ORDER AND ITS CAUSE THE BLENDING OF THE BLOOD OF MASTERS AND SLAVES THE ORIGINALLY NOBLE AND RARE IMPULSE OF THE MASTERS TO ASSIGN A VALUE TO THEMSELVES AND TO THINK WELL OF THEMSELVES WILL NOW BE MORE AND MORE ENCOURAGED AND EXTENDED BUT IT HAS AT ALL TIMES AN OLDER AMPLER AND MORE RADICALLY INGRAINED PROPENSITY OPPOSED TO IT AND IN THE PHENOMENON OF VANITY THIS OLDER PROPENSITY OVERMASTERS THE YOUNGER
translated_text: In fact, conformably to the slow rise of the democratic social order and its cause, the blending of the blood of masters and slaves, the original noble and rare impulse of the masters to assign a value to themselves and to think well of themselves will now be more and more encouraged and extended. But it has at all times an older, ample and more radically ingrained propensity opposed to it, and in the phenomenon of vanity this older propensity overmasters the younger.

text: THE MOST VARIED EXPERIENCE TEACHES IT WHAT ARE THE QUALITIES TO WHICH IT PRINCIPALLY OWES THE FACT THAT IT STILL EXISTS IN SPITE OF ALL GODS AND MEN AND HAS HITHERTO BEEN VICTORIOUS THESE QUALITIES IT CALLS VIRTUES AND THESE VIRTUES ALONE IT DEVELOPS TO MATURITY
translated_text: The most varied experience teaches it what are the qualities to which it principally owes the fact that it still exists, in spite of all gods and men, and has hitherto been victorious. These qualities, it calls virtues, and these virtues alone it develops to maturity.

text: VARIATIONS WHETHER THEY BE DEVIATIONS INTO THE HIGHER FINER AND RARER OR DETERIORATIONS AND MONSTROSITIES APPEAR SUDDENLY ON THE SCENE IN THE GREATEST EXUBERANCE AND SPLENDOUR THE INDIVIDUAL DARES TO BE INDIVIDUAL AND DETACH HIMSELF
translated_text: Variations, whether they be deviations into the higher, finer, and rarer, or deteriorations and monstrosities, appear suddenly on the scene in the greatest exuberance and splendor. The individual dares to be individual and attach himself.

text: AT THIS TURNING POINT OF HISTORY THERE MANIFEST THEMSELVES SIDE BY SIDE AND OFTEN MIXED AND ENTANGLED TOGETHER A MAGNIFICENT MANIFOLD VIRGIN FOREST LIKE UP GROWTH AND UP STRIVING A KIND OF TROPICAL TEMPO IN THE RIVALRY OF GROWTH AND AN EXTRAORDINARY DECAY AND SELF DESTRUCTION OWING TO THE SAVAGELY OPPOSING AND SEEMINGLY EXPLODING EGOISMS WHICH STRIVE WITH ONE ANOTHER FOR SUN AND LIGHT AND CAN NO LONGER ASSIGN ANY LIMIT RESTRAINT OR FORBEARANCE FOR THEMSELVES BY MEANS OF THE HITHERTO EXISTING MORALITY
translated_text: At this turning point of history, there manifest themselves, side by side, and often mixed and entangled together, a magnificent, manifold, virgin-forest-like, upgrowth, and upstriving, a kind of tropical tempo in the rivalry of growth, and an extraordinary decay and self-destruction, owing to the savagely opposing and seemingly exploding egoisms, which strive with one another for sun and light, and can no longer assign any limit restraint or forbearance for themselves by means of the hitherto existing morality.

text: NOTHING BUT NEW WHYS NOTHING BUT NEW HOWS NO COMMON FORMULAS ANY LONGER MISUNDERSTANDING AND DISREGARD IN LEAGUE WITH EACH OTHER DECAY DETERIORATION AND THE LOFTIEST DESIRES FRIGHTFULLY ENTANGLED THE GENIUS OF THE RACE OVERFLOWING FROM ALL THE CORNUCOPIAS OF GOOD AND BAD A PORTENTOUS SIMULTANEOUSNESS OF SPRING AND AUTUMN FULL OF NEW CHARMS AND MYSTERIES PECULIAR TO THE FRESH STILL INEXHAUSTED STILL UNWEARIED CORRUPTION
translated_text: Nothing but new wise, nothing but new howls, no common formulas any longer, misunderstanding and disregard in league with each other, decay, deterioration, and the loftiest desires frightfully entangled, the genius of the race overflowing from all the conucopias of good and bad, a portentious simultaneousness of spring and autumn, full of new charms and mysteries peculiar to the fresh, still exhausted, still unwirried corruption.

text: DANGER IS AGAIN PRESENT THE MOTHER OF MORALITY GREAT DANGER THIS TIME SHIFTED INTO THE INDIVIDUAL INTO THE NEIGHBOUR AND FRIEND INTO THE STREET INTO THEIR OWN CHILD INTO THEIR OWN HEART INTO ALL THE MOST PERSONAL AND SECRET RECESSES OF THEIR DESIRES AND VOLITIONS
translated_text: Danger is again present, the mother of morality great danger. This time shifted into the individual, into the neighbor and friend, into the street, into their own child, into their own heart, into all the most personal and secret recesses of their desires and volitions.

text: WHAT WILL THE MORAL PHILOSOPHERS WHO APPEAR AT THIS TIME HAVE TO PREACH
translated_text: What will the moral philosophers who appear at this time have to preach?

text: THIS IS THE PROBLEM OF RACE
translated_text: This is the problem of race.

text: IN OUR VERY DEMOCRATIC OR RATHER VERY PLEBEIAN AGE EDUCATION AND CULTURE MUST BE ESSENTIALLY THE ART OF DECEIVING DECEIVING WITH REGARD TO ORIGIN WITH REGARD TO THE INHERITED PLEBEIANISM IN BODY AND SOUL
translated_text: In our very democratic or rather very plebeian age, education and culture must be essentially the art of deceiving, deceiving with regard to origin, with regard to the inherited plebeianism in body and soul.

text: THE NOBLE SOUL ACCEPTS THE FACT OF HIS EGOISM WITHOUT QUESTION AND ALSO WITHOUT CONSCIOUSNESS OF HARSHNESS CONSTRAINT OR ARBITRARINESS THEREIN BUT RATHER AS SOMETHING THAT MAY HAVE ITS BASIS IN THE PRIMARY LAW OF THINGS IF HE SOUGHT A DESIGNATION FOR IT HE WOULD SAY IT IS JUSTICE ITSELF
translated_text: The noble soul accepts the fact of his egoism without question, and also without consciousness of harshness, constraint, or arbitraryness therein. But rather, there is something that may have its basis in the primary law of things. If he sought a designation for it, he would say, it is justice itself.

text: ON THIS ACCOUNT THE PEOPLE OF ONE NATION UNDERSTAND ONE ANOTHER BETTER THAN THOSE BELONGING TO DIFFERENT NATIONS EVEN WHEN THEY USE THE SAME LANGUAGE OR RATHER WHEN PEOPLE HAVE LIVED LONG TOGETHER UNDER SIMILAR CONDITIONS OF CLIMATE SOIL DANGER REQUIREMENT TOIL THERE ORIGINATES THEREFROM AN ENTITY THAT UNDERSTANDS ITSELF NAMELY A NATION
translated_text: On this account, the people of one nation understand one another better than those belonging to different nations, even when they use the same language. Or rather, when people have lived long together under similar conditions of climate, soil, danger, requirement, toil, their originates, their from and entity that understands itself, namely a nation.

text: THE GREATER THE DANGER THE GREATER IS THE NEED OF AGREEING QUICKLY AND READILY ABOUT WHAT IS NECESSARY NOT TO MISUNDERSTAND ONE ANOTHER IN DANGER THAT IS WHAT CANNOT AT ALL BE DISPENSED WITH IN INTERCOURSE
translated_text: The greater the danger, the greater is the need of agreeing quickly and readily about what is necessary. Not to misunderstand one another in danger. That is what cannot at all be dispensed within intercourse.

text: ALSO IN ALL LOVES AND FRIENDSHIPS ONE HAS THE EXPERIENCE THAT NOTHING OF THE KIND CONTINUES WHEN THE DISCOVERY HAS BEEN MADE THAT IN USING THE SAME WORDS ONE OF THE TWO PARTIES HAS FEELINGS THOUGHTS INTUITIONS WISHES OR FEARS DIFFERENT FROM THOSE OF THE OTHER
translated_text: Also, in all loves and friendships, one has the experience that nothing of the kind continues when the discovery has been made that in using the same words, one of the two parties has feelings, thoughts, intuitions, wishes, or fears, different from those of the other.

text: WHICHEVER GROUPS OF SENSATIONS WITHIN A SOUL AWAKEN MOST READILY BEGIN TO SPEAK AND GIVE THE WORD OF COMMAND THESE DECIDE AS TO THE GENERAL ORDER OF RANK OF ITS VALUES AND DETERMINE ULTIMATELY ITS LIST OF DESIRABLE THINGS
translated_text: Whichever groups of sensations within a soul awaken most readily, begin to speak and give the word of command, these decide as to the general order of rank of its values, and determine ultimately its list of desirable things.

text: A MAN'S ESTIMATES OF VALUE BETRAY SOMETHING OF THE STRUCTURE OF HIS SOUL AND WHEREIN IT SEES ITS CONDITIONS OF LIFE ITS INTRINSIC NEEDS
translated_text: A man's estimates of value betray something of the structure of his soul, and wherein it sees its conditions of life, its intrinsic needs.

text: PROFOUND SUFFERING MAKES NOBLE IT SEPARATES ONE OF THE MOST REFINED FORMS OF DISGUISE IS EPICURISM ALONG WITH A CERTAIN OSTENTATIOUS BOLDNESS OF TASTE WHICH TAKES SUFFERING LIGHTLY AND PUTS ITSELF ON THE DEFENSIVE AGAINST ALL THAT IS SORROWFUL AND PROFOUND
translated_text: Profound suffering makes noble. It separates. One of the most refined forms of disguise is epicurism, along with a certain ostentatious boldness of taste, which takes suffering lightly and puts itself on the defensive against all that is sorrowful and profound.

text: THE HIGHEST INSTINCT FOR PURITY PLACES HIM WHO IS AFFECTED WITH IT IN THE MOST EXTRAORDINARY AND DANGEROUS ISOLATION AS A SAINT FOR IT IS JUST HOLINESS THE HIGHEST SPIRITUALIZATION OF THE INSTINCT IN QUESTION
translated_text: The highest instinct for purity places him who is affected with it in the most extraordinary and dangerous isolation as a saint. For it is just holiness, the highest spiritualization of the instinct in question.

text: OCCASIONALLY TOO THE WAKING CALL COMES TOO LATE THE CHANCE WHICH GIVES PERMISSION TO TAKE ACTION WHEN THEIR BEST YOUTH AND STRENGTH FOR ACTION HAVE BEEN USED UP IN SITTING STILL AND HOW MANY A ONE JUST AS HE SPRANG UP HAS FOUND WITH HORROR THAT HIS LIMBS ARE BENUMBED AND HIS SPIRITS ARE NOW TOO HEAVY
translated_text: Occasionally, to the waking call comes too late. The chance which gives permission to take action when their best youth and strength for action have been used up in sitting still, and how many of one just as he sprang up, has found with horror that his limbs are benumbed, and his spirits are now too heavy.

text: AND WHOEVER THOU ART WHAT IS IT THAT NOW PLEASES THEE
translated_text: And whoever thou art, what is it that now pleases thee?

text: ONLY NAME IT WHATEVER I HAVE I OFFER THEE
translated_text: Only name it, whatever I have I offer thee.

text: BUT YOU MISUNDERSTAND HIM WHEN YOU COMPLAIN ABOUT IT
translated_text: but you must understand him when you complain about it.

text: THERE MUST BE A SORT OF REPUGNANCE IN ME TO BELIEVE ANYTHING DEFINITE ABOUT MYSELF IS THERE PERHAPS SOME ENIGMA THEREIN
translated_text: There must be a sort of repuglance in me to believe anything definite about myself. Is there perhaps some enigma therein?

text: PROBABLY BUT FORTUNATELY NOTHING FOR MY OWN TEETH PERHAPS IT BETRAYS THE SPECIES TO WHICH I BELONG BUT NOT TO MYSELF AS IS SUFFICIENTLY AGREEABLE TO ME BUT WHAT HAS HAPPENED TO YOU
translated_text: Probably, but fortunately nothing from my own teeth. Perhaps it betrays the species to which I belong, but not to myself as it is sufficiently agreeable to me. But what has happened to you?

text: I DO NOT KNOW HE SAID HESITATINGLY PERHAPS THE HARPIES HAVE FLOWN OVER MY TABLE
translated_text: I do not know," he said, as it tatingly, perhaps the harpies have flown over my table.

text: TO SUFFOCATE WITH HIS MEMORIES TO HIM WHO HAS THE DESIRES OF A LOFTY AND DAINTY SOUL AND ONLY SELDOM FINDS HIS TABLE LAID AND HIS FOOD PREPARED THE DANGER WILL ALWAYS BE GREAT NOWADAYS HOWEVER IT IS EXTRAORDINARILY SO
translated_text: to suffocate with his memories. To him who has the desires of a lofty and dainty soul and only seldom finds his table-lead and his food prepared, the danger will always be great. Nowadays, however, it is extraordinarily so.

text: AND TO CHOOSE FOR COMPANY THAT ROGUISH AND CHEERFUL VICE POLITENESS
translated_text: and to choose for company that Rogus and Cheerful Vice Perlikeness.

text: IT WAS ABOUT NOON WHEN CAPTAIN WAVERLEY ENTERED THE STRAGGLING VILLAGE OR RATHER HAMLET OF TULLY VEOLAN CLOSE TO WHICH WAS SITUATED THE MANSION OF THE PROPRIETOR
translated_text: It was about noon when Captain Wave really entered the straggling village or rather hamlet of Tulee Veilon, close to which was situated the mansion of the proprietor.

text: THE HOUSES SEEMED MISERABLE IN THE EXTREME ESPECIALLY TO AN EYE ACCUSTOMED TO THE SMILING NEATNESS OF ENGLISH COTTAGES
translated_text: The houses seemed miserable in the extreme, especially to an eye accustomed to the smiling neatness of English cottages.

text: OCCASIONALLY INDEED WHEN SUCH A CONSUMMATION SEEMED INEVITABLE A WATCHFUL OLD GRANDAM WITH HER CLOSE CAP DISTAFF AND SPINDLE RUSHED LIKE A SIBYL IN FRENZY OUT OF ONE OF THESE MISERABLE CELLS DASHED INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE PATH AND SNATCHING UP HER OWN CHARGE FROM AMONG THE SUNBURNT LOITERERS SALUTED HIM WITH A SOUND CUFF AND TRANSPORTED HIM BACK TO HIS DUNGEON THE LITTLE WHITE HEADED VARLET SCREAMING ALL THE WHILE FROM THE VERY TOP OF HIS LUNGS A SHRILLY TREBLE TO THE GROWLING REMONSTRANCES OF THE ENRAGED MATRON
translated_text: Occasionally, indeed, when such a consummation seemed inevitable, a watchful old grandam with her close cap, disstaff, and spindle, rushed like a sibil in frenzy out of one of these miserable cells, dashed into the middle of the path, and snatching up her own charge from among the sun-burnt loiterers, saluted him with a sound cuff, and transported him back to his dungeon. The little white-headed, violet screaming all the while from the very top of his lungs a shrilly, trebled to the growling remonstrances of the enraged matron.

text: THE EVIL AND REMEDY SUCH AS IT IS STILL EXIST BUT THIS IS REMOTE FROM OUR PRESENT PURPOSE AND IS ONLY THROWN OUT FOR CONSIDERATION OF THE COLLECTORS UNDER MISTER DENT'S DOG BILL
translated_text: The evil and remedies such as it is still exist. But this is remote from our present purpose and is only thrown out for consideration of the collectors under Mr. Dent's dog bill.

text: YET THE PHYSIOGNOMY OF THE PEOPLE WHEN MORE CLOSELY EXAMINED WAS FAR FROM EXHIBITING THE INDIFFERENCE OF STUPIDITY THEIR FEATURES WERE ROUGH BUT REMARKABLY INTELLIGENT GRAVE BUT THE VERY REVERSE OF STUPID AND FROM AMONG THE YOUNG WOMEN AN ARTIST MIGHT HAVE CHOSEN MORE THAN ONE MODEL WHOSE FEATURES AND FORM RESEMBLED THOSE OF MINERVA
translated_text: Yet the physiognomy of the people, when more closely examined, was far from exhibiting the indifference of stupidity, their features were rough, but remarkably intelligent. Grave. But the very reverse of stupid, and from among the young women an artist might have chosen more than one model whose features and form resembled those of Minerva.

text: THIS AVENUE WAS STRAIGHT AND OF MODERATE LENGTH RUNNING BETWEEN A DOUBLE ROW OF VERY ANCIENT HORSE CHESTNUTS PLANTED ALTERNATELY WITH SYCAMORES WHICH ROSE TO SUCH HUGE HEIGHT AND NOURISHED SO LUXURIANTLY THAT THEIR BOUGHS COMPLETELY OVER ARCHED THE BROAD ROAD BENEATH
translated_text: This avenue was straight and of moderate length, running between a double row of very ancient horse chestnuts. Plant it alternately with sycamores which rose to such huge heights and nourished so luxuriantly that their bows completely over arched the broad road beneath.

text: IT WAS ONE OF THOSE EFFECTS WHICH A PAINTER LOVES TO REPRESENT AND MINGLED WELL WITH THE STRUGGLING LIGHT WHICH FOUND ITS WAY BETWEEN THE BOUGHS OF THE SHADY ARCH THAT VAULTED THE BROAD GREEN ALLEY
translated_text: It was one of those effects which a painter loves to represent, and mingled well with the struggling light, which found its way between the bows of the shady arc that vaulted the broad green alley.

text: THE HOUSE WHICH SEEMED TO CONSIST OF TWO OR THREE HIGH NARROW AND STEEP ROOFED BUILDINGS PROJECTING FROM EACH OTHER AT RIGHT ANGLES FORMED ONE SIDE OF THE INCLOSURE
translated_text: the house which seemed to consist of two or three high narrow and steep-roofed buildings, projecting from each other at right angles formed one side of the enclosure.

text: IT HAD BEEN BUILT AT A PERIOD WHEN CASTLES WERE NO LONGER NECESSARY AND WHEN THE SCOTTISH ARCHITECTS HAD NOT YET ACQUIRED THE ART OF DESIGNING A DOMESTIC RESIDENCE
translated_text: It had been built at a period when castles were no longer necessary and when the Scottish architects had not yet acquired the art of designing a domestic residence.

text: NEITHER DID THE FRONT INDICATE ABSOLUTE SECURITY FROM DANGER
translated_text: Neither did the front indicate absolute security from danger.

text: STABLES AND OTHER OFFICES OCCUPIED ANOTHER SIDE OF THE SQUARE
translated_text: Stables in other offices occupied another side of the square.

text: TWO BATTLEMENTED WALLS ONE OF WHICH FACED THE AVENUE AND THE OTHER DIVIDED THE COURT FROM THE GARDEN COMPLETED THE INCLOSURE
translated_text: Two battle-minted walls, one of which faced the avenue and the other divided the court from the garden, completed the enclosure.

text: THIS WORK OF ART WAS THE WONDER OF THE COUNTRY TEN MILES ROUND
translated_text: This work of art was the wonder of the country 10 miles round.

text: THE COURT WAS SPACIOUS WELL PAVED AND PERFECTLY CLEAN THERE BEING PROBABLY ANOTHER ENTRANCE BEHIND THE STABLES FOR REMOVING THE LITTER
translated_text: The court was spacious, well paved and perfectly clean. There are probably probably another entrance behind the stables for removing the litter.

text: EVERYTHING AROUND APPEARED SOLITARY AND WOULD HAVE BEEN SILENT BUT FOR THE CONTINUED PLASHING OF THE FOUNTAIN AND THE WHOLE SCENE STILL MAINTAINED THE MONASTIC ILLUSION WHICH THE FANCY OF WAVERLEY HAD CONJURED UP
translated_text: Everything around appeared solitary, and would have been silent, but for the continued plashing of the fountain, and the whole scene still maintained the monastic illusion, which the fancy of Wey-Rally had conjured up.

text: CHAPTER THIRTY THREE A CONFIDANT
translated_text: Chapter 33, A Confident.

text: MISTER MORTON REPLIED THAT FAR FROM MAKING ANY CLAIM UPON HIS GOOD OPINION HIS ONLY WISH AND THE SOLE PURPOSE OF HIS VISIT WAS TO FIND OUT THE MEANS OF DESERVING IT
translated_text: Mr. Morton replied, the far from making any claim upon his good opinion, his only wish and the sole purpose of his visit was to find out the means of deserving it.

text: EVIL TO HIM THAT THINKS OTHERWISE SAID MISTER MORTON OR WHO HOLDS CHURCH GOVERNMENT AND CEREMONIES AS THE EXCLUSIVE GAGE OF CHRISTIAN FAITH OR MORAL VIRTUE
translated_text: "'Evil to him that thinks otherwise,' said Mr. Morton. "'Or who holds Church government and ceremonies as the exclusive gauge of Christian faith or moral for two?'

text: MISTER MORTON SEEMED PARTICULARLY STRUCK WITH THE ACCOUNT OF WAVERLEY'S VISIT TO DONALD BEAN LEAN
translated_text: Mr. Morton seemed particularly struck with the account of Waverly's visit to Donald Bean, Lean.

text: WHEN I WAS A YOUNG MAN LIKE YOU MISTER WAVERLEY ANY SUCH HAIR BRAINED EXPEDITION I BEG YOUR PARDON FOR THE EXPRESSION WOULD HAVE HAD INEXPRESSIBLE CHARMS FOR ME
translated_text: When I was a young man like you, Mr. Waverly, any such hair-brained expedition I beg your pardon for the expression would have had an expressable charms for me.

text: HE CERTAINLY POSSESSES TALENTS BEYOND THE RUDE SPHERE IN WHICH HE MOVES AND BEING NEITHER DESTITUTE OF AMBITION NOR ENCUMBERED WITH SCRUPLES HE WILL PROBABLY ATTEMPT BY EVERY MEANS TO DISTINGUISH HIMSELF DURING THE PERIOD OF THESE UNHAPPY COMMOTIONS
translated_text: He certainly possesses talents beyond the root sphere in which he moves, and being neither destitute of ambition, nor encumbered with spruples. He will probably attempt by every means to distinguish himself during the period of these unhappy commotions.

text: MISTER MORTON THEN MADE A CAREFUL MEMORANDUM OF THE VARIOUS PARTICULARS OF WAVERLEY'S INTERVIEW WITH DONALD BEAN LEAN AND THE OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES WHICH HE HAD COMMUNICATED
translated_text: Mr. Morton then made a careful memorandum of the various particulars of way-release interview with Donald B. Leigh, and the other circumstances which he had communicated.

text: HE HAD NEITHER SYMPATHY WITH MY INNOCENCE NOR WITH MY WRETCHEDNESS AND THE PETRIFYING ACCURACY WITH WHICH HE ATTENDED TO EVERY FORM OF CIVILITY WHILE HE TORTURED ME BY HIS QUESTIONS HIS SUSPICIONS AND HIS INFERENCES WAS AS TORMENTING AS THE RACKS OF THE INQUISITION
translated_text: He had neither sympathy with my innocence nor with my wretchedness, and the petrifying accuracy with which he attended to every form of civility, while he tortured me by his questions, his suspicions, and his inferences, was as tormenting as the racks of the inquisition.

text: THEY HELD CONVENTICLES IN THE OPEN FIELDS AND BEING TREATED WITH GREAT VIOLENCE AND CRUELTY BY THE SCOTTISH GOVERNMENT MORE THAN ONCE TOOK ARMS DURING THOSE REIGNS
translated_text: They held conventables in the open fields and being treated with great violence in cruelty by the Scottish government, more than once took arms during those rains.

text: SINCE THAT TIME THEIR NUMBERS HAVE GRADUALLY DIMINISHED BUT A GOOD MANY ARE STILL TO BE FOUND IN THE WESTERN COUNTIES AND SEVERAL WITH A BETTER TEMPER THAN IN SEVENTEEN O SEVEN HAVE NOW TAKEN ARMS FOR GOVERNMENT
translated_text: Since that time, their numbers have gradually diminished. But a good many are still to be found in the Western counties and several, with a better temper than in 1707, have now taken arms for government.

text: IT HAD NO ORNAMENTATION BEING EXCEEDINGLY PLAIN IN APPEARANCE
translated_text: It had no ornamentation, being exceedingly plain in appearance.

text: HERE SAID ONE OF THEIR GUIDES AS THE PROCESSION HALTED BEFORE THE LITTLE STONE BUILDING IS THE PALACE OF TOURMALINE WHO IS OUR QUEEN
translated_text: Here," said one of their guides, as the procession halted before the little stone building, is the palace of Tormelene, who is our queen.

text: WHAT THAT LITTLE CABIN
translated_text: What? That little cabin?

text: EXCLAIMED TROT OF COURSE
translated_text: Explain, Trot. Of course.

text: DID YOU SUPPOSE A PALACE WOULD BE LIKE ONE OF OUR HANDSOME RESIDENCES ASKED THE WOMAN EVIDENTLY SURPRISED
translated_text: Did you suppose a palace would be like one of our handsome residences? Ask the woman evidently surprised.

text: THESE INTRUDERS ARE VERY PECULIAR PEOPLE REMARKED A MAN IN THE CROWD
translated_text: These intruders are very peculiar people remarked to man in the crowd.

text: THEY SEEM VERY IGNORANT POOR THINGS SAID ANOTHER IN REPLY
translated_text: They seem very ignorant poor things. Set another in reply.

text: THE PEOPLE MUST WAIT OUTSIDE FOR THERE IS NO ROOM FOR THEM IN THE PALACE
translated_text: The people must wait outside for there is no room for them in the palace.

text: SO THEY FOLLOWED HER THROUGH THE LOW ARCHWAY AND IN A ROOM BEYOND VERY SIMPLY FURNISHED SAT A YOUNG GIRL ENGAGED IN DARNING A PAIR OF PINK STOCKINGS
translated_text: So they followed her through the low archway and in a room beyond, very simply furnished, sat a young girl engaged in a darning a pair of pink stockings.

text: SHE WAS A BEAUTIFUL GIRL OF ABOUT SEVENTEEN YEARS OF AGE NOT FAT LIKE ALL THE REST OF THE PINKIES BUT SLENDER AND WELL FORMED ACCORDING TO OUR OWN IDEAS OF BEAUTY
translated_text: She was a beautiful girl of about 17 years of age, not fat like all the rest of the pinkies, but slender and well-formed according to our own ideas of beauty.

text: HER COMPLEXION WAS NOT A DECIDED PINK BUT A SOFT ROSY TINT NOT MUCH DEEPER THAN THAT OF TROT'S SKIN
translated_text: Her complexion was not a decided pink, but a soft rosy tint, not much deeper than that of trot skin.

text: WHAT IS IT CORALIE SHE ASKED THE WOMAN
translated_text: What is it, Coralie? Chias the Woman.

text: THE QUEEN GAZED UPON OUR FRIENDS WITH EVIDENT INTEREST
translated_text: The Queen Gays, upon our friends with evident interest.

text: SHE SMILED A LITTLE SADLY AT TROT SEEMED TO APPROVE BUTTON BRIGHT'S OPEN FRANK FACE AND WAS QUITE SURPRISED BECAUSE CAP'N BILL WAS SO MUCH BIGGER THAN HER OWN PEOPLE
translated_text: She smiled, a little sadly at trot, seemed to approve of button-bright's open, frank face, and was quite surprised because Capembel was so much bigger than her own people.

text: ARE YOU A GIANT
translated_text: Are you a giant?

text: PERHAPS YOU ARE TRYING TO RIDICULE ME SHE CONTINUED REGARDING THE SAILOR'S FACE CLOSELY
translated_text: Perhaps you are trying to ridicule me, she continued, regarding the Sailor's face closely.

text: THERE IS NOTHING MAJESTIC ABOUT ME AS YOU KNOW VERY WELL
translated_text: There is nothing majestic about me as you know very well.

text: CORALIE DO YOU CONSIDER MAJESTY A PROPER WORD TO USE WHEN ADDRESSING A QUEEN
translated_text: Corley, do you consider majesty a proper word to use when addressing a queen?

text: EVEN IN AMERICA EVER'BODY BOWS LOW TO OUR PRESIDENT AN THE BLUESKINS ARE SO FRAID O THEIR BOOLOOROO THAT THEY TREMBLE WHENEVER THEY GO NEAR HIM
translated_text: Even in America, everybody bows low to our president, and the blue skins are so afraid of their Bula Roo that they tremble whenever they go near him.

text: BUT SURELY THAT IS ALL WRONG SAID TOURMALINE GRAVELY
translated_text: But surely that is all wrong, said Tormelian gravely.

text: THEREFORE I AM A MERE AGENT TO DIRECT THE LAWS WHICH ARE THE WILL OF THE PEOPLE AND AM ONLY A PUBLIC SERVANT OBLIGED CONSTANTLY TO GUARD THE WELFARE OF MY SUBJECTS
translated_text: Therefore, I am a mere agent to direct the laws, which are the will of the people, and I'm only a public servant obliged constantly to guard the welfare of my subjects.

text: IN THAT CASE SAID BUTTON BRIGHT YOU'RE ENTITLED TO THE BEST THERE IS TO PAY FOR YOUR TROUBLE
translated_text: In that case, said button bright, you're entitled to the best there is, to pay for your trouble.

text: IF I LIVED AS LUXURIOUSLY AS MY PEOPLE DO AND HAD SERVANTS AND COSTLY GOWNS THE GOOD PINKIES WOULD SAY THAT THEIR QUEEN HAD MORE THAN THEY THEMSELVES AND IT WOULD BE TRUE
translated_text: If I lived as luxurious as my people do, and had servants and costly gowns, the good pinkies would say that their queen had more than they themselves, and it would be true.

text: NO OUR WAY IS BEST
translated_text: No, our way is best.

text: THE QUEEN HAS NOTHING BUT THE POWER TO EXECUTE THE LAWS TO ADJUST GRIEVANCES AND TO COMPEL ORDER
translated_text: The queen is nothing but the power to execute the laws, to adjust grievances and to compel order.

text: I HAVE ONE GREAT PRIVILEGE
translated_text: I have one great privilege.

text: AFTER MY DEATH A PINK MARBLE STATUE OF ME WILL BE SET UP IN THE GRAND COURT WITH THE STATUES OF THE OTHER KINGS AND QUEENS WHO HAVE RULED THIS LAND AND ALL THE PINKIES IN AGES TO COME WILL THEN HONOR ME AS HAVING BEEN A JUST AND UPRIGHT QUEEN THAT IS MY REWARD
translated_text: After my death, the pink marble statue of me will be set up in the Grand Court. With the statues of the other kings and queens who have ruled this land, and all the pinkies and ages to come, well then honor me as having been a just and upright queen. That is my reward.

text: A MISFORTUNE OF BIRTH PLACED ME HERE AND I CANNOT ESCAPE MY FATE
translated_text: I miss fortune of birth placed me here and I cannot escape my fate.

text: IT IS MUCH MORE DESIRABLE TO BE A PRIVATE CITIZEN HAPPY AND CARE FREE
translated_text: It is much more desirable to be a private citizen happy and carefree.

text: YES IT WAS WET AN STICKY ALL RIGHT AGREED THE SAILOR BUT THE BIG FROG HELPED US AN WE GOT THROUGH ALL RIGHT
translated_text: Yes, it was wet and sticky all rat. Agreed the sailor. But the big frog helped us and we got through all rat.

text: YOU ARE NOT LIKE MY PEOPLE THE PINKIES AND THERE IS NO PLACE FOR YOU IN OUR COUNTRY
translated_text: You are not like my people, the pinkies, and there is no place for you in our country.

text: IN ALL OUR HISTORY YOU ARE THE FIRST PEOPLE FROM OUTSIDE OUR BORDERS WHO HAVE EVER STEPPED A FOOT IN OUR LAND
translated_text: In all our history, you are the first people from outside our borders who have ever stepped a foot in our land.

text: WE DO NOT HATE YOU AS YOU SAY THE BLUESKINS DO NOR ARE WE SAVAGE OR CRUEL BUT WE DO NOT WANT YOU HERE AND I AM REALLY PUZZLED WHAT TO DO WITH YOU
translated_text: We do not hate you as you say the blue skins do, nor are we savage or cruel, but we do not want you here and I'm really puzzled what to do with you.

text: I'LL LOOK IN THE GREAT BOOK FIRST
translated_text: I'll look in the great book first.

text: THE SAVAGE PHILOSOPHER THE DUAL MIND
translated_text: The Savage philosopher, the dual mind.

text: THE ORIGINAL ATTITUDE OF THE AMERICAN INDIAN TOWARD THE ETERNAL THE GREAT MYSTERY THAT SURROUNDS AND EMBRACES US WAS AS SIMPLE AS IT WAS EXALTED
translated_text: The original attitude of the American Indian toward the eternal, the great mystery that surrounds and embraces us, was as simple as it was exalted.

text: IT WAS SILENT BECAUSE ALL SPEECH IS OF NECESSITY FEEBLE AND IMPERFECT THEREFORE THE SOULS OF MY ANCESTORS ASCENDED TO GOD IN WORDLESS ADORATION
translated_text: It was silent because all speech is of necessity, feeble and imperfect. Therefore, the souls of my ancestors ascend to God in wordless adoration.

text: NONE MIGHT EXHORT OR CONFESS OR IN ANY WAY MEDDLE WITH THE RELIGIOUS EXPERIENCE OF ANOTHER
translated_text: None might exhort or confess or in any way metal with the religious experience of another.

text: AMONG US ALL MEN WERE CREATED SONS OF GOD AND STOOD ERECT AS CONSCIOUS OF THEIR DIVINITY
translated_text: Among us all men were created sons of God and stood erect as conscious of their divinity.

text: THAT SOLITARY COMMUNION WITH THE UNSEEN WHICH WAS THE HIGHEST EXPRESSION OF OUR RELIGIOUS LIFE IS PARTLY DESCRIBED IN THE WORD BAMBEDAY LITERALLY MYSTERIOUS FEELING WHICH HAS BEEN VARIOUSLY TRANSLATED FASTING AND DREAMING
translated_text: That solitary communion with the unseen, which was the highest expression of our religious life, is partly described in the word Bambide, literally mysterious feeling, which has been variously translated, fasting and dreaming.

text: THE FIRST BAMBEDAY OR RELIGIOUS RETREAT MARKED AN EPOCH IN THE LIFE OF THE YOUTH WHICH MAY BE COMPARED TO THAT OF CONFIRMATION OR CONVERSION IN CHRISTIAN EXPERIENCE
translated_text: The first, then, day, or religious retreat marked an epoch in the life of the youth, which may be compared to that of confirmation or conversion in the Christian experience.

text: KNOWING THAT GOD SETS NO VALUE UPON MATERIAL THINGS HE TOOK WITH HIM NO OFFERINGS OR SACRIFICES OTHER THAN SYMBOLIC OBJECTS SUCH AS PAINTS AND TOBACCO
translated_text: Knowing that God sets no value upon material things, he took with him no offerings or sacrifices other than symbolic objects such as paints and tobacco.

text: AT THE SOLEMN HOUR OF SUNRISE OR SUNSET HE TOOK UP HIS POSITION OVERLOOKING THE GLORIES OF EARTH AND FACING THE GREAT MYSTERY AND THERE HE REMAINED NAKED ERECT SILENT AND MOTIONLESS EXPOSED TO THE ELEMENTS AND FORCES OF HIS ARMING FOR A NIGHT AND A DAY TO TWO DAYS AND NIGHTS BUT RARELY LONGER
translated_text: At the solemn hour of sunrise or sunset, he took up his position overlooking the glories of earth and facing the great mystery. And there he remained, naked erect silent and motionless, exposed to the elements and forces of his arming, for a night and a day to two days and nights, but rarely longer.

text: WHEN HE RETURNED TO THE CAMP HE MUST REMAIN AT A DISTANCE UNTIL HE HAD AGAIN ENTERED THE VAPOR BATH AND PREPARED HIMSELF FOR INTERCOURSE WITH HIS FELLOWS
translated_text: When he returned to the camp, he must remain at a distance until he had again entered the vapor bath and prepared himself for intercourse with his fellows.

text: IT WAS NOT THEN WHOLLY FROM IGNORANCE OR IMPROVIDENCE THAT HE FAILED TO ESTABLISH PERMANENT TOWNS AND TO DEVELOP A MATERIAL CIVILIZATION
translated_text: It was not then, wholly from ignorance or improvedance, that he failed to establish permanent towns and to develop a material civilization.

text: TO THE UNTUTORED SAGE THE CONCENTRATION OF POPULATION WAS THE PROLIFIC MOTHER OF ALL EVILS MORAL NO LESS THAN PHYSICAL
translated_text: To the untudored sage, the concentration of population was the prolific mother of all evils, moral, no less than physical.

text: IN THIS TYPE OF PRAYER THERE WAS NO BESEECHING OF FAVOR OR HELP
translated_text: In this type of prayer, there was no besieging of favor or help.

text: FROM THE SUN AS THE UNIVERSAL FATHER PROCEEDS THE QUICKENING PRINCIPLE IN NATURE AND IN THE PATIENT AND FRUITFUL WOMB OF OUR MOTHER THE EARTH ARE HIDDEN EMBRYOS OF PLANTS AND MEN
translated_text: From the sun, as the universal Father proceeds the quickening principle in nature, and in the patient and fruitful womb of our mother, the earth, are hidden embryos of plants and men.

text: THIS IS THE MATERIAL OR PHYSICAL PRAYER
translated_text: This is the material or physical prayer.

text: NOTHING OF THE MARVELOUS COULD ASTONISH HIM AS THAT A BEAST SHOULD SPEAK OR THE SUN STAND STILL
translated_text: Nothing of the marvelous could astonish him, as that a beast should speak, or the sun stands till.

text: WHO MAY CONDEMN HIS SUPERSTITION
translated_text: who may condemn his superstition.

text: HERE IS THE SUPREME MYSTERY THAT IS THE ESSENCE OF WORSHIP WITHOUT WHICH THERE CAN BE NO RELIGION AND IN THE PRESENCE OF THIS MYSTERY OUR ATTITUDE CANNOT BE VERY UNLIKE THAT OF THE NATURAL PHILOSOPHER WHO BEHOLDS WITH AWE THE DIVINE IN ALL CREATION
translated_text: Here is the supreme mystery that is the essence of worship, without which there can be no religion and in the presence of this mystery our attitude cannot be very unlike that of the natural philosopher who beholds with awe the divine and all creation.

text: IN HIS OWN THOUGHT HE ROSE SUPERIOR TO THEM HE SCORNED THEM EVEN AS A LOFTY SPIRIT ABSORBED IN ITS STERN TASK REJECTS THE SOFT BEDS THE LUXURIOUS FOOD THE PLEASURE WORSHIPING DALLIANCE OF A RICH NEIGHBOR
translated_text: In his own thought he rose superior to them. He scorned them, even as lofty spirit absorbed in its stern task rejects the soft beds, the luxurious food, the pleasure worshipping dalliance of the rich neighbor.

text: THE HISTORIANS OF THE WHITE RACE ADMIT THAT THE INDIAN WAS NEVER THE FIRST TO REPUDIATE HIS OATH
translated_text: The historians of the White Race admit that the Indian was never the first to repudiate his oath.

text: HE HAD NEITHER A NATIONAL ARMY NOR AN ORGANIZED CHURCH
translated_text: He had neither a National Army nor an organized church.

text: HER ATTITUDE AND SECRET MEDITATIONS MUST BE SUCH AS TO INSTILL INTO THE RECEPTIVE SOUL OF THE UNBORN CHILD THE LOVE OF THE GREAT MYSTERY AND A SENSE OF BROTHERHOOD WITH ALL CREATION
translated_text: Her attitude and secret meditations must be such as to instill into the receptive soul of the unborn child the love of the great mystery and the sense of brotherhood with all creation.

text: THE ORDEAL IS BEST MET ALONE WHERE NO CURIOUS OR PITYING EYES EMBARRASS HER WHERE ALL NATURE SAYS TO HER SPIRIT TIS LOVE TIS LOVE THE FULFILLING OF LIFE
translated_text: The ordeal is best met alone, where no curious or pitiying eyes embarrass her, where all nature says to her spirit, to his love, to his love, the fulfilling of life.

text: THIS WILD MOTHER HAS NOT ONLY THE EXPERIENCE OF HER MOTHER AND GRANDMOTHER AND THE ACCEPTED RULES OF HER PEOPLE FOR A GUIDE BUT SHE HUMBLY SEEKS TO LEARN A LESSON FROM ANTS BEES SPIDERS BEAVERS AND BADGERS
translated_text: This wild mother has not only the experience of her mother and grandmother, in the accepted rules of her people for a guide, but she humbly seeks to learn a lesson from ants, bees, spiders, beavers, and badgers.

text: IN DUE TIME THE CHILD TAKES OF HIS OWN ACCORD THE ATTITUDE OF PRAYER AND SPEAKS REVERENTLY OF THE POWERS
translated_text: In due time, the child takes of his own accord, the attitude of prayer and speaks reverently of the powers.

text: INDEED THE DISTINCTIVE WORK OF BOTH GRANDPARENTS IS THAT OF ACQUAINTING THE YOUTH WITH THE NATIONAL TRADITIONS AND BELIEFS
translated_text: Indeed, the distinctive work of both grandparents is that of acquainting the youth with the national traditions and beliefs.

text: THE FAMILY WAS NOT ONLY THE SOCIAL UNIT BUT ALSO THE UNIT OF GOVERNMENT
translated_text: The family was not only the social unit, but also the unit of government.

text: THE REMOTER DEGREES OF KINSHIP WERE FULLY RECOGNIZED AND THAT NOT AS A MATTER OF FORM ONLY FIRST COUSINS WERE KNOWN AS BROTHERS AND SISTERS THE NAME OF COUSIN CONSTITUTED A BINDING CLAIM AND OUR RIGID MORALITY FORBADE MARRIAGE BETWEEN COUSINS IN ANY KNOWN DEGREE OR IN OTHER WORDS WITHIN THE CLAN
translated_text: The remote degrees of kinship were fully recognized, and that not as a matter of form only, first cousins were known as brothers and sisters. The name of cousin constituted a binding claim, an rigid morality for bad marriage between cousins in any known degree, or in other words within the clan.

text: WHEN SHE FELL THE WHOLE RACE FELL WITH HER
translated_text: when she fell, the whole race fell with her.

text: BEFORE THIS CALAMITY CAME UPON US YOU COULD NOT FIND ANYWHERE A HAPPIER HOME THAN THAT CREATED BY THE INDIAN WOMAN
translated_text: Before this calamity came upon us, you could not find anywhere happier home than that created by the Indian woman.

text: HIS DAILY DEVOTIONS WERE MORE NECESSARY TO HIM THAN DAILY FOOD
translated_text: His daily devotions were more necessary to him than daily food.

text: WHENEVER IN THE COURSE OF THE DAILY HUNT THE RED HUNTER COMES UPON A SCENE THAT IS STRIKINGLY BEAUTIFUL OR SUBLIME A BLACK THUNDERCLOUD WITH THE RAINBOW'S GLOWING ARCH ABOVE THE MOUNTAIN A WHITE WATERFALL IN THE HEART OF A GREEN GORGE A VAST PRAIRIE TINGED WITH THE BLOOD RED OF SUNSET HE PAUSES FOR AN INSTANT IN THE ATTITUDE OF WORSHIP
translated_text: Whenever, in the course of the Daily Hunt, the red hunter comes upon a scene that is strikingly beautiful or sublime, a black thunder cloud with the rainbows glowing arch above the mountain. A white waterfall in the heart of the green gorge, a vast prairie tinged with the blood red of sunset, he pauses for an instant in the attitude of worship.

text: WHEN HE BECOMES AN OLD MAN HE LOVES TO MAKE A NOTABLE EFFORT TO PROVE HIS GRATITUDE
translated_text: When he becomes an old man, he loves to make a notable effort to prove his gratitude.

text: HE CUTS OFF THE CHOICEST MORSEL OF THE MEAT AND CASTS IT INTO THE FIRE THE PUREST AND MOST ETHEREAL ELEMENT
translated_text: He cuts off the choices morsel of the meat and casts it into the fire, the purest and most ethereal element.

text: THE HOSPITALITY OF THE WIGWAM IS ONLY LIMITED BY THE INSTITUTION OF WAR
translated_text: The hospitality of the wigwom is only limited by the institution of war.

text: OUR HONOR IS THE GUARANTEE FOR HIS SAFETY SO LONG AS HE IS WITHIN THE CAMP
translated_text: Our honor is the guarantee for safety, so long as he is within the camp.

text: LOVE BETWEEN MAN AND WOMAN IS FOUNDED ON THE MATING INSTINCT AND IS NOT FREE FROM DESIRE AND SELF SEEKING
translated_text: Love between men and woman is founded on the mating instinct and is not free from desire and self-seeking.

text: BUT TO HAVE A FRIEND AND TO BE TRUE UNDER ANY AND ALL TRIALS IS THE MARK OF A MAN
translated_text: But to have a friend and to be true under any and all trials is the mark of a man.

text: THIS BOND IS BETWEEN MAN AND MAN IS USUALLY FORMED IN EARLY YOUTH AND CAN ONLY BE BROKEN BY DEATH
