translated_text: This bond is between man and man is usually formed in early youth and can only be broken by death.

text: REINCARNATION AND THE CONVERSE OF SPIRITS
translated_text: reincarnation and the converse of spirits.

text: THEREFORE HE COURTS DEATH IN BATTLE ON THE OTHER HAND HE WOULD REGARD IT AS DISGRACEFUL TO BE KILLED IN A PRIVATE QUARREL
translated_text: Therefore, he courts death and battle, on the other hand, he would regard it as disgraceful to be killed in a private quarrel.

text: THE MEN BLACKEN THEIR FACES AND WIDOWS OR BEREAVED PARENTS SOMETIMES GASH THEIR ARMS AND LEGS TILL THEY ARE COVERED WITH BLOOD
translated_text: The men black in their faces and widows are bereaved parents, sometimes gash their arms and legs till they are covered with blood.

text: GIVING THEMSELVES UP WHOLLY TO THEIR GRIEF THEY ARE NO LONGER CONCERNED ABOUT ANY EARTHLY POSSESSION AND OFTEN GIVE AWAY ALL THAT THEY HAVE TO THE FIRST COMERS EVEN TO THEIR BEDS AND THEIR HOME
translated_text: Giving themselves up holy to their grief, they are no longer concerned about any earthly possession, and often give away all that they have to the first comers, even to their beds and their home.

text: IT WAS PREPARED BY DRESSING IN THE FINEST CLOTHES TOGETHER WITH SOME PERSONAL POSSESSIONS AND ORNAMENTS WRAPPED IN SEVERAL ROBES AND FINALLY IN A SECURE COVERING OF RAW HIDE
translated_text: It was prepared by dressing in the finest clothes, together with some personal possessions and ornaments wrapped in several robes and finally in a secure covering of raw hide.

text: AS A SPECIAL MARK OF RESPECT THE BODY OF A YOUNG WOMAN OR A WARRIOR WAS SOMETIMES LAID OUT IN STATE IN A NEW TEEPEE WITH THE USUAL HOUSEHOLD ARTICLES AND EVEN WITH A DISH OF FOOD LEFT BESIDE IT NOT THAT THEY SUPPOSED THE SPIRIT COULD USE THE IMPLEMENTS OR EAT THE FOOD BUT MERELY AS A LAST TRIBUTE
translated_text: As a special mark of respect, the body of a young woman or a warrior was sometimes laid out in state in a new teepee, with the usual household articles and even with a dish of food left beside it, not that they supposed the spirit could use the implements or eat the food but merely as a last tribute.

text: IF A MAN WERE SLAIN IN BATTLE IT WAS AN OLD CUSTOM TO PLACE HIS BODY AGAINST A TREE OR ROCK IN A SITTING POSITION ALWAYS FACING THE ENEMY TO INDICATE HIS UNDAUNTED DEFIANCE AND BRAVERY EVEN IN DEATH
translated_text: If a man were slain in battle, it was an old custom to place his body against a tree or rock in a sitting position, always facing the enemy to indicate his undaunted defiance and bravery even in death.

text: AT EVERY MEAL TIME A DISH OF FOOD WAS PLACED UNDER IT AND SOME PERSON OF THE SAME SEX AND AGE AS THE ONE WHO WAS GONE MUST AFTERWARD BE INVITED IN TO PARTAKE OF THE FOOD
translated_text: At every meal time, a dish of food was placed under it, and some person of the same sex and age as the one who was gone must afterward be invited in to partake of the food.

text: AT THE END OF A YEAR FROM THE TIME OF DEATH THE RELATIVES MADE A PUBLIC FEAST AND GAVE AWAY THE CLOTHING AND OTHER GIFTS WHILE THE LOCK OF HAIR WAS INTERRED WITH APPROPRIATE CEREMONIES
translated_text: At the end of the year from the time of death, the relatives made a public feast and gave away the clothing and other gifts, while the lock of hair was interred with appropriate ceremonies.

text: IT IS WELL KNOWN THAT THE AMERICAN INDIAN HAD SOMEHOW DEVELOPED OCCULT POWER AND ALTHOUGH IN THE LATTER DAYS THERE HAVE BEEN MANY IMPOSTORS AND ALLOWING FOR THE VANITY AND WEAKNESS OF HUMAN NATURE IT IS FAIR TO ASSUME THAT THERE MUST HAVE BEEN SOME EVEN IN THE OLD DAYS YET THERE ARE WELL ATTESTED INSTANCES OF REMARKABLE PROPHECIES AND OTHER MYSTIC PRACTICE
translated_text: It is well known that the American Indian had somehow developed a cult power, and although in the latter days there have been many imposter and allowing for the vanity and weakness of human nature, it is fair to assume that there must have been some even in the old days, yet there are well attested instances of remarkable prophecies and other mystic practice.

text: NO DOUBT MANY PREDICTIONS HAVE BEEN COLORED TO SUIT THE NEW AGE AND UNQUESTIONABLY FALSE PROPHETS FAKIRS AND CONJURERS HAVE BECOME THE PEST OF THE TRIBES DURING THE TRANSITION PERIOD
translated_text: No doubt many predictions have been colored to suit the new age, and unquestionably false profits, fakers, and conjurers have become the pest of the tribes during the transition period.

text: THIS WAS CARRIED OUT TO THE LETTER
translated_text: This was carried out to the letter.

text: THIS WAS ONLY ONE OF HIS REMARKABLE PROPHECIES
translated_text: This was only one of his remarkable prophecies.

text: ANOTHER FAMOUS MEDICINE MAN WAS BORN ON THE RUM RIVER ABOUT ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY YEARS AGO AND LIVED TO BE OVER A CENTURY OLD
translated_text: Another famous medicine man was born on the Rum River about 150 years ago and lived to be over a century old.

text: AT THE AGE OF ABOUT SEVENTY FIVE YEARS HE SAVED HIS BAND FROM UTTER DESTRUCTION AT THE HANDS OF THEIR ANCESTRAL ENEMIES BY SUDDENLY GIVING WARNING RECEIVED IN A DREAM OF THE APPROACH OF A LARGE WAR PARTY
translated_text: At the age of about 75 years he saved his band from utter destruction at the hands of their ancestral enemies by suddenly giving warning received in a dream of the approach of a large war party.

text: FIVE YEARS LATER HE REPEATED THE SERVICE AND AGAIN SAVED HIS PEOPLE FROM AWFUL SLAUGHTER
translated_text: Five years later, he repeated the service and again saved his people from awful slaughter.

text: THERE ARE MANY TRUSTWORTHY MEN AND MEN OF CHRISTIAN FAITH TO VOUCH FOR THESE AND SIMILAR EVENTS OCCURRING AS FORETOLD
translated_text: There are many trustworthy men and men of Christian faith to vouch for these in similar events occurring as foretold.

text: AT ANOTHER TIME WHEN I WAS FOURTEEN YEARS OLD WE HAD JUST LEFT FORT ELLIS ON THE ASSINIBOINE RIVER AND MY YOUNGEST UNCLE HAD SELECTED A FINE SPOT FOR OUR NIGHT CAMP
translated_text: At another time when I was 14 years old we had just left Fort Ellis on the Ascente Bone River and my youngest uncle had selected a fine spot for a night camp.

text: MANY OF THE INDIANS BELIEVED THAT ONE MAY BE BORN MORE THAN ONCE AND THERE WERE SOME WHO CLAIMED TO HAVE FULL KNOWLEDGE OF A FORMER INCARNATION
translated_text: Many of the Indians believed that one may be born more than once, and there were some who claimed who had full knowledge of a former incarnation.

text: THERE WAS A WELL KNOWN SIOUX WAR PROPHET WHO LIVED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE LAST CENTURY SO THAT HE IS STILL REMEMBERED BY THE OLD MEN OF HIS BAND
translated_text: There was a well-known Sue War prophet who lived in the middle of the last century, so that he is still remembered by the old men of his band.

text: SHILOH
translated_text: Shiloh.

text: THIS WAS THE FIRST BIG BATTLE IN WHICH OUR REGIMENT HAD EVER BEEN ENGAGED
translated_text: This was the first big battle in which our regiment had ever been engaged.

text: I DO NOT PRETEND TO TELL OF WHAT COMMAND DISTINGUISHED ITSELF OF HEROES OF BLOOD AND WOUNDS OF SHRIEKS AND GROANS OF BRILLIANT CHARGES OF CANNON CAPTURED ET CETERA
translated_text: I did not pretend to tell of what command distinguished itself of heroes, of blood and wounds, of shrieks and groans, of brilliant charges, of canon captured, etc.

text: ABOUT DAYLIGHT ON SUNDAY MORNING CHALMERS BRIGADE RELIEVED GLADDEN'S
translated_text: About daylight on Sunday morning, Chalmers Brigade relieved the ladders.

text: AS GLADDEN RODE BY US A COURIER RODE UP AND TOLD HIM SOMETHING
translated_text: As Gladden wrote by us, a courier wrote up and told him something.

text: ON SUNDAY MORNING A CLEAR BEAUTIFUL AND STILL DAY THE ORDER WAS GIVEN FOR THE WHOLE ARMY TO ADVANCE AND TO ATTACK IMMEDIATELY
translated_text: On Sunday morning, a clear, beautiful and still day, the order was given for the whole army to advance and to attack immediately.

text: WE WERE SUPPORTING AN ALABAMA BRIGADE
translated_text: We were supporting an Alabama brigade.

text: THAT'S RIGHT MY BRAVE FIRST TENNESSEE GIVE EM HAIL COLUMBIA
translated_text: That's right, my brave first Tennessee. Give them a hail, Columbia.

text: THE FACT WAS KEPT FROM THE TROOPS
translated_text: The fact was kept from the troops.

text: WE HAD TO PASS OVER THE GROUND WHERE TROOPS HAD BEEN FIGHTING ALL DAY
translated_text: We had to pass over the ground where troops had been fighting all day.

text: I HAD HEARD AND READ OF BATTLEFIELDS SEEN PICTURES OF BATTLEFIELDS OF HORSES AND MEN OF CANNON AND WAGONS ALL JUMBLED TOGETHER WHILE THE GROUND WAS STREWN WITH DEAD AND DYING AND WOUNDED BUT I MUST CONFESS THAT I NEVER REALIZED THE POMP AND CIRCUMSTANCE OF THE THING CALLED GLORIOUS WAR UNTIL I SAW THIS
translated_text: I had heard and read of battlefields, seen pictures of battlefields, of horses and men of cannon and wagons all jumbled together, while the ground was strewn with dead and dying and wounded. But I must confess that I never realized the pomp and circumstance of the thing called glorious war until I saw this.

text: I HAD BEEN FEELING MEAN ALL THE MORNING AS IF I HAD STOLEN A SHEEP BUT WHEN THE ORDER TO CHARGE WAS GIVEN I GOT HAPPY
translated_text: I had been feeling mean all the morning as if I had stolen a sheep, but when they ordered to charge who was given, I got happy.

text: OFFICERS COULD NOT CURB THE MEN TO KEEP IN LINE
translated_text: Officers could not curb the men to keep in line.

text: ON MONDAY THE TIDE WAS REVERSED
translated_text: On Monday, the tide was reversed.

text: BUT AS I SAID BEFORE READER A PRIVATE SOLDIER IS BUT AN AUTOMATON AND KNOWS NOTHING OF WHAT IS GOING ON AMONG THE GENERALS AND I AM ONLY GIVING THE CHRONICLES OF LITTLE THINGS AND EVENTS THAT CAME UNDER MY OWN OBSERVATION AS I SAW THEM THEN AND REMEMBER THEM NOW
translated_text: But as I said before, Reader, a private soldier is but an automaton, and there was nothing of what is going on among the generals. And I am only giving the chronicles of little things and events that came under my own observation as I saw them then, and remember them now.

text: SHOULD YOU DESIRE TO FIND OUT MORE ABOUT THE BATTLE I REFER YOU TO HISTORY
translated_text: Should you desire to find out more about the battle, I refer you to history.

text: ABOUT THE TIME HE PULLED TRIGGER A STRAY BALL FROM SOME DIRECTION STRUCK HIM IN THE SIDE AND HE FELL OFF DEAD AND HIS HORSE BECOMING FRIGHTENED GALLOPED OFF DRAGGING HIM THROUGH THE CONFEDERATE LINES
translated_text: About the time he pulled trigger a stray ball from some direction struck him in the side and he fell off dead and his horse becoming frightened galloped off, dragging him through the Confederate lines.

text: ON MONDAY MORNING I TOO CAPTURED ME A MULE
translated_text: On Monday morning I too captured me a mule.

text: HE WAS WISE IN HIS OWN CONCEIT
translated_text: He was wise and his own conceit.

text: I FREQUENTLY THOUGHT IT WOULD BE PLEASANT TO SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE WITH THAT MULE AND I WOULD GLADLY HAVE DONE SO IF I COULD HAVE GOTTEN ONE HALF OF HIS NO
translated_text: I frequently thought it would be pleasant to split the difference with that mule, and I would gladly have done so if I could have gotten one half of his know.

text: MULE DID NOT DESIRE TO CROSS WHILE I WAS TRYING TO PERSUADE HIM WITH A BIG STICK A ROCK IN HIS EAR AND A TWISTER ON HIS NOSE
translated_text: Mule did not desire to cross, while I was trying to persuade him with a big stick, a rock and his ear, and a twister on his nose.

text: SO HE GOT A LARGE TWO INCH ROPE TIED ONE END AROUND THE MULE'S NECK AND THE OTHER TO THE CAISSON AND ORDERED THE DRIVER TO WHIP UP
translated_text: So we got a large 2-inch rope tied one end around the mules neck and the other to the case on and ordered the driver to whip up.

text: THE ROPE HOWEVER WAS STRONGER THAN THE MULE'S NO AND HE WAS FINALLY PREVAILED UPON BY THE STRENGTH OF THE ROPE TO CROSS THE CREEK
translated_text: The rope, however, was stronger than the mules know, and he was finally prevailed upon by the strength of the rope to cross the creek.

text: ON MY TAKING THE ROPE OFF HE SHOOK HIMSELF AND SEEMED TO SAY YOU THINK THAT YOU ARE MIGHTY SMART FOLKS BUT YOU ARE A LEETLE TOO SMART
translated_text: And while I'm taking the rope off, he shook himself and seemed to say, you think that you are mighty smart folks, but you are a little too smart.

text: WE REMAINED SEVERAL MONTHS BUT SOON WE WERE ON THE TRAMP AGAIN
translated_text: We remain several months, but soon we were on the tramp again.

text: THE FEDERAL ARMY WAS CONCENTRATING AT NASHVILLE THERE WAS NO REST FOR THE WEARY
translated_text: The Federal Army was concentrating at Nashville. There was no rest for the weary.

text: OUR ARMY STOPPED AT MURFREESBORO
translated_text: Our Army stopped at Murphreesboro.

text: FROM TIME TO TIME DIFFERENT REGIMENTS WERE SENT FORWARD TO DO PICKET DUTY
translated_text: From time to time, different regiments were sent forward to do picket duty.

text: THE YANKEE PICKET LINES WERE NOT A HALF MILE OFF
translated_text: The Yankee Picket Lines were not a half mile off.

text: I AM A VIDET YOU KNOW THE RESPONSIBILITY RESTING ON ME
translated_text: I am a vidette. You know the responsibility resting on me.

text: SAYS HE I WOULD NOT TRUST A SECESH ON HIS WORD OATH OR BOND MARCH I SAY
translated_text: Says he, I would not trust a secession on his word, oath or bond. March, I say.

text: I SOON FOUND OUT THAT HE HAD CAUGHT SIGHT OF THE RELIEF ON THE ROAD AND WAS AFRAID TO SHOOT I QUICKLY MADE UP MY MIND
translated_text: I soon found out that he had caught sight of the relief on the road and was afraid to shoot. I quickly made up my mind.

text: MY GUN WAS AT MY FEET AND ONE STEP WOULD GET IT
translated_text: My gun was at my feet and one step would get it.

text: I MADE A QUICK GLANCE OVER MY SHOULDER AND GRABBED AT MY GUN
translated_text: I made a quick glance over my shoulder and grabbed my gun.

text: HE DIVINED MY MOTIVE AND FIRED THE BALL MISSED ITS AIM
translated_text: He devined my motive and fired. The ball missed its aim.

text: I THINK WE MUST HAVE KILLED A GOOD MANY IN THE OLD FIELD BECAUSE WE WERE FIRING ALL THE TIME AT THE SOLID LINE AS THEY ADVANCED UPON US
translated_text: I think we must have killed a good many in the old field, because we were firing all the time at the solid line as they advanced upon us.

text: WE KEPT FALLING BACK AND FIRING ALL DAY AND WERE RELIEVED BY ANOTHER REGIMENT ABOUT DARK WE REJOINED OUR REGIMENT
translated_text: We kept falling back and firing all day and were relieved by another regiment about dark. We rejoined our regiment.

text: LINE OF BATTLE WAS FORMED ON THE NORTH BANK OF STONE'S RIVER ON THE YANKEE SIDE
translated_text: Line of battle was formed on the north bank of Stone's River on the Yankee side.

text: BAD GENERALSHIP I THOUGHT IT WAS CHRISTMAS
translated_text: Bad general shit by thought it was Christmas

text: THE PRIVATE COULD BUT HE WAS NO GENERAL YOU SEE
translated_text: The private good, but he was no general you see

text: I CALLED LIEUTENANT COLONEL FRIERSON'S ATTENTION TO THE YANKEES AND HE REMARKED WELL I DON'T KNOW WHETHER THEY ARE YANKEES OR NOT BUT IF THEY ARE THEY WILL COME OUT OF THERE MIGHTY QUICK
translated_text: I call Lieutenant Colonel Fryerson's attention to the Yankees, and he remarked, �Well, I don't know whether they are Yankees or not, but if they are, they will come out of their mighty quick.�

text: THE YANKEES MARCHED OVER THE HILL OUT OF SIGHT
translated_text: The Yankees marched over the hill out of sight.

text: WE WERE ORDERED FORWARD TO THE ATTACK
translated_text: We were ordered forward to the attack.

text: WE WERE RIGHT UPON THE YANKEE LINE ON THE WILKERSON TURNPIKE
translated_text: We were right upon the Yankee line on the Wilkerson turnpike.

text: WE WERE NOT TWENTY YARDS OFF FROM THE YANKEES AND THEY WERE POURING THE HOT SHOT AND SHELLS RIGHT INTO OUR RANKS AND EVERY MAN WAS YELLING AT THE TOP OF HIS VOICE CEASE FIRING YOU ARE FIRING ON YOUR OWN MEN CEASE FIRING YOU ARE FIRING ON YOUR OWN MEN
translated_text: We were not twenty yards off from the Yankees and they were pouring the hot shot and shells right into our ranks and every man was yelling at the top of his voice, sees firing you are firing on your own men, sees firing you are firing on your own men.

text: OAKLEY COLOR BEARER OF THE FOURTH TENNESSEE REGIMENT RAN RIGHT UP IN THE MIDST OF THE YANKEE LINE WITH HIS COLORS BEGGING HIS MEN TO FOLLOW
translated_text: Oakley, color bearer of the fourth Tennessee Regiment, ran right up in the midst of the Yankee line with his colors, begging his men to follow.

text: THE LEADEN HAIL STORM SWEPT THEM OFF THE FIELD THEY FELL BACK AND RE FORMED
translated_text: The leaden hailstorm swept them off the field. They fell back and reformed.

text: WE WERE AT THAT TIME AT LEAST A HUNDRED YARDS IN ADVANCE OF THE BRIGADE CHEATHAM ALL THE TIME CALLING UPON THE MEN TO COME ON
translated_text: We were at that time at least a hundred yards in advance of the brigade. Cheat them all the time calling upon the men to come on.

text: I SAW AND FELT THAT HE WAS NOT FIGHTING FOR GLORY BUT THAT HE WAS FIGHTING FOR HIS COUNTRY BECAUSE HE LOVED THAT COUNTRY AND HE WAS WILLING TO GIVE HIS LIFE FOR HIS COUNTRY AND THE SUCCESS OF OUR CAUSE
translated_text: I saw and felt that he was not fighting for glory, but that he was fighting for his country because he loved that country, and he was willing to give his life for his country and the success of our cause.

text: I THOUGHT IT HAD BEEN TORN FROM MY SHOULDER
translated_text: I thought it had been torn for my shoulder.

text: AS I WENT BACK TO THE FIELD HOSPITAL I OVERTOOK ANOTHER MAN WALKING ALONG
translated_text: As I went back to the field hospital, I overtook another man walking along.

text: I LOOKED AT IT PRETTY CLOSE AND I SAID GREAT GOD
translated_text: I looked at it pretty close, and I said, great God!

text: HE WAS WALKING ALONG WHEN ALL AT ONCE HE DROPPED DOWN AND DIED WITHOUT A STRUGGLE OR A GROAN
translated_text: He was walking along, and all at once he dropped down and died without a struggle or a grown.

text: BUT I COULD NOT BEAR THE THOUGHT OF WEARING DEAD MEN'S SHOES
translated_text: But it could not bear the thought of wearing dead men's shoes.

text: HE WAS STONE DEAD BUT I DROPPED THAT FOOT QUICK
translated_text: He was stone dead, but I dropped that foot quick.

text: BEFORE WE ARRIVED AT THE HOUSE WE SAW A BODY OF YANKEES APPROACHING AND AS WE STARTED TO RUN BACK THEY FIRED UPON US
translated_text: Before we arrived at the house, we saw a body of Yankees approaching, and as we started to run back, they fired upon us.

text: OUR PICKETS HAD RUN IN AND REPORTED A NIGHT ATTACK
translated_text: Our pickets had run in and reported a night attack.

text: ADVANCE INTO TENNESSEE
translated_text: Advance into Tennessee.

text: YANK SAYS WHAT YOU DOING JOHNNY
translated_text: Yank says, what are you doing, Johnny?

text: WE PASSED AROUND ATLANTA CROSSED THE CHATTAHOOCHEE AND TRAVELED BACK OVER THE SAME ROUTE ON WHICH WE HAD MADE THE ARDUOUS CAMPAIGN UNDER JOE JOHNSTON
translated_text: We passed around Atlanta, crossed the Chattahoochi, and traveled back over the same route on which we had made the arduous campaign under Joe Johnson.

text: OUTSIDE OF THESE OCCASIONAL REMINDERS WE COULD SEE NO EVIDENCE OF THE DESOLATION OF THE TRACK OF AN INVADING ARMY
translated_text: Outside of these occasional reminders, we could see no evidence of the desolation of the track of an invading army.

text: WE SAW THE UNITED STATES FLAG FLYING FROM THE RAMPARTS AND THOUGHT THAT YANK WOULD PROBABLY BE ASLEEP OR CATCHING LICE OR MAYBE ENGAGED IN A GAME OF SEVEN UP
translated_text: We saw the United States flag flying from the ramparts and thought that Yank would probably be a sleep or catching ice or maybe engaged in a game of seven up.

text: HE WALKED UP AND SAYS HELLO BOYS WHAT IS IT BOSS
translated_text: He walked up and says hello boys. What is it boss?

text: A YANKEE ALWAYS SAYS NAGER
translated_text: A Yankee always says, Nagger.

text: THEY PERSUADED ELOQUENTLY
translated_text: They persuaded eloquently.

text: A MAN IN THE WELL
translated_text: Amen and the well.

text: THE VOICE APPEARED TO BE OVERHEAD
translated_text: The voice appeared to be overhead.

text: RIGHT BEFORE ME I SAW THE LONG DRY GRASS ALL BENDING TOWARD A COMMON CENTER AND I KNEW THAT IT WAS AN OLD WELL AND THAT MY COMRADE HAD FALLEN IN IT
translated_text: Right before me I saw the long, dry grass all bending toward a common center, and I knew that it was an old well, and that my comrade had fallen in it.

text: BUT HOW TO GET HIM OUT WAS THE UNSOLVED PROBLEM
translated_text: But how to get him out was the unsolved problem.

text: THE POOR FELLOW STAYED IN THAT WELL ALL NIGHT
translated_text: The poor fellow stayed in that well all night.

text: WE LOOKED ALL AROUND AND THOUGHT THAT THE COAST WAS CLEAR
translated_text: We looked all around and thought that the coast was clear.

text: I DON'T THINK HIS GUN WAS LOADED THOUGH BECAUSE WE DID NOT HEAR THE BALL WHISTLE
translated_text: I don't think his gun was loaded though, because we did not hear the ball whistle.

text: WE WALKED OVER THIS FLOATING BRIDGE AND SOON FOUND OURSELVES ON THE TENNESSEE SIDE OF TENNESSEE RIVER
translated_text: We walked over this floating bridge, and soon found ourselves on the Tennessee side of Tennessee River.

text: WE HAD BEEF FOR SUPPER THAT NIGHT
translated_text: We had beef for supper that night.

text: HOW EVERY PULSE DID BEAT AND LEAP AND HOW EVERY HEART DID THROB WITH EMOTIONS OF JOY WHICH SEEMED NEARLY AKIN TO HEAVEN WHEN WE RECEIVED THE GLAD INTELLIGENCE OF OUR ONWARD MARCH TOWARD THE LAND OF PROMISE AND OF OUR LOVED ONES
translated_text: How every pulse to beat and leap, and how every heart to throb with emotions of joy, which seemed nearly akin to heaven, when we received the glad intelligence of our onward march toward the land of promise and of our loved ones.

text: WE WERE INURED TO PRIVATIONS AND HARDSHIPS HAD BEEN UPON EVERY MARCH IN EVERY BATTLE IN EVERY SKIRMISH IN EVERY ADVANCE IN EVERY RETREAT IN EVERY VICTORY IN EVERY DEFEAT
translated_text: We were ennured to privations and hardships, had been upon every march in every battle, in every skirmish, in every advance, in every retreat, in every victory, in every defeat.

text: HE WANTED TO GO BY HOME AND TELL HIS WIFE AND CHILDREN GOOD BYE AND TO GET HIS CLOTHES IT WAS NO GO
translated_text: He wanted to go by home and tell his wife and children goodbye and to get his clothes. It was no go.

text: BUT AFTER AWHILE JIM SAYS GENTLEMEN AY GANNY THE LAW
translated_text: But after a while Jim says, gentlemen, I GANNY THE LAW.

text: YOU SEE JIM KNOWED THE LAW
translated_text: You see, Jim knows the law.

text: THOSE OLD SOLDIERS HAD LONG LONG AGO FORGOTTEN ABOUT THAT OLD LAW OF THE LONG GONE PAST BUT JIM HAD TREASURED IT UP IN HIS MEMORY LO THESE MANY YEARS AND HE THOUGHT IT WOULD SERVE HIM NOW AS IT HAD NO DOUBT FREQUENTLY DONE IN THE PAST
translated_text: Those old soldiers had long, long ago forgotten about that old law of the long gone past, but Jim had treasured it up in his memory, low these many years, and he thought it would serve him now as it had no doubt frequently done in the past.

text: THE THIRD DAY IT WAS REPORTED THAT THE YANKEES HAD TAKEN POSITION ON THE MURFREESBORO PIKE
translated_text: The third day it was reported that the Yankees had taken position on the Murphy's Borough Pike.

text: A REGIMENT WAS SENT TO THE ATTACK IT WAS JIM'S REGIMENT
translated_text: A regiment was sent to the attack. It was Jim's regiment.

text: HE HADN'T SEEN ANYTHING TO SHOOT AT BUT HE BLAZED AWAY HE LOADED AND FIRED THE SECOND TIME WHEN THEY WERE ORDERED TO RETREAT
translated_text: He hadn't seen anything to shoot at, but he blazed away. He loaded and fired the second time when they were ordered to retreat.

text: BUT IS LAUGHTER A SYNONYM OF JOY
translated_text: but is laughter a synonym of joy?

text: SUCH PERFECT COMPLETENESS IS NOT IN NATURE
translated_text: Such perfect completeness is not in nature.

text: HAD GWYNPLAINE WHEN A CHILD BEEN SO WORTHY OF ATTENTION THAT HIS FACE HAD BEEN SUBJECTED TO TRANSMUTATION WHY NOT
translated_text: Had Gwen plain, when a child been so worthy of attention, that his face had been subjected to transmutation? Why not?

text: ACCORDING TO ALL APPEARANCE INDUSTRIOUS MANIPULATORS OF CHILDREN HAD WORKED UPON HIS FACE
translated_text: According to all appearance, industrious manipulators of children had worked upon his face.

text: IT SEEMED EVIDENT THAT A MYSTERIOUS AND PROBABLY OCCULT SCIENCE WHICH WAS TO SURGERY WHAT ALCHEMY WAS TO CHEMISTRY HAD CHISELLED HIS FLESH EVIDENTLY AT A VERY TENDER AGE AND MANUFACTURED HIS COUNTENANCE WITH PREMEDITATION
translated_text: It seemed evident that a mysterious and probably occult science, which was to surgery what alchemy was to chemistry, had chiseled his flesh, evidently at a very tender age, and manufactured his countenance with premeditation.

text: GWYNPLAINE WAS A MOUNTEBANK
translated_text: Gwynn plain was a mountabank.

text: HE SHOWED HIMSELF ON THE PLATFORM
translated_text: He showed himself on the platform.

text: IT WAS GWYNPLAINE'S LAUGH WHICH CREATED THE LAUGHTER OF OTHERS YET HE DID NOT LAUGH HIMSELF
translated_text: It was Gwen Plain's laugh which created the laughter of others, yet he did not laugh himself.

text: THE OUTSIDE DID NOT DEPEND ON THE INTERIOR
translated_text: The outside did not depend on the interior.

text: NO ONE COULD ESCAPE FROM THIS RICTUS
translated_text: No one could escape from this rictus.

text: ALL HIS EMOTIONS WHATEVER THEY MIGHT HAVE BEEN AUGMENTED HIS STRANGE FACE OF JOY OR TO SPEAK MORE CORRECTLY AGGRAVATED IT
translated_text: All his emotions, whatever they might have been, augmented his strange face of joy, or to speak more correctly aggravated it.

text: AN EVERLASTING LAUGH
translated_text: and everlasting laugh.

text: THE MANICHAEANS BELIEVED THE ABSOLUTE OCCASIONALLY GIVES WAY AND THAT GOD HIMSELF SOMETIMES ABDICATES FOR A TIME SO ALSO OF THE WILL
translated_text: The Manikians believed the Absolute Occasionally gives way, and that God Himself sometimes abdicates for a time. So also of the will.

text: THE WHOLE OF EXISTENCE RESEMBLES A LETTER MODIFIED IN THE POSTSCRIPT
translated_text: The whole of existence resembles a letter modified in the post script.

text: WITH THIS EXCEPTION GWYNPLAINE'S LAUGH WAS EVERLASTING
translated_text: With this exception, Gwen Plain's laugh was ever lasting.

text: THE JOYOUS CONVULSION OF LAUGHTER WAS AS A TRIBUTE PAID THEY SUBMITTED TO IT GLADLY BUT ALMOST MECHANICALLY
translated_text: The joys, convulsion of laughter was as a tribute paid. They submitted to it gladly, but almost mechanically.

text: BESIDES WE MUST REMEMBER THAT THEY HAD IN THOSE TIMES MEANS OF PUTTING PATIENTS TO SLEEP AND OF SUPPRESSING ALL SUFFERING ONLY THEN IT WAS CALLED MAGIC WHILE NOW IT IS CALLED ANAESTHESIA
translated_text: Besides, we must remember that they had in those times means of putting patience to sleep and of suppressing all suffering. Only then it was called magic. While now it is called anesthesia.

text: BESIDES THIS FACE THOSE WHO HAD BROUGHT HIM UP HAD GIVEN HIM THE RESOURCES OF A GYMNAST AND AN ATHLETE
translated_text: Besides this face, those who had brought him up had given him the resources of a gymnast and an athlete.

text: GWYNPLAINE HAD YELLOW HAIR
translated_text: Gwynn plain had yellow hair.

text: HIS HAIR HAVING PROBABLY BEEN DYED WITH SOME CORROSIVE PREPARATION HAD LEFT IT WOOLLY AND ROUGH TO THE TOUCH
translated_text: His hair having probably been dyed with some corrosive preparation had left it woolly and rough to the touch.

text: ITS YELLOW BRISTLES RATHER A MANE THAN A HEAD OF HAIR COVERED AND CONCEALED A LOFTY BROW EVIDENTLY MADE TO CONTAIN THOUGHT
translated_text: Its yellow bristles, rather amane than a head of hair, covered and concealed a lofty brow, evidently made to contain thought.

text: THE OPERATION WHATEVER IT HAD BEEN WHICH HAD DEPRIVED HIS FEATURES OF HARMONY AND PUT ALL THEIR FLESH INTO DISORDER HAD HAD NO EFFECT ON THE BONY STRUCTURE OF HIS HEAD
translated_text: The operation, whatever it had been, which had deprived his features of harmony and put all their flesh into disorder, had had no effect on the boni structure of his head.

text: WHAT TRUE THINGS ARE TOLD IN STORIES
translated_text: What true things are told in stories?

text: IN GWYNPLAINE EVIL THOUGHTS NEVER RIPENED AND HE HAD THEREFORE NO REMORSE
translated_text: In Gwyn Plain's evil thoughts never ripened, and he had therefore no remorse.

text: WHAT WAS THIS NOTHING
translated_text: What was this? Nothing.

text: FROM SIXTEEN EIGHTY TO SEVENTEEN O FOUR A GREAT CHANGE HAD TAKEN PLACE
translated_text: From 1680 to 1704, a great change had taken place.

text: THE WHEELS WERE ALL OF THE SAME SIZE AND HIGH AS WAGON WHEELS
translated_text: The wheels were all of the same size and high as wagon wheels.

text: THIS GREEN COLOUR HAD SUCCEEDED IN DRAWING ATTENTION TO THE CARRIAGE WHICH WAS KNOWN IN ALL THE FAIR GROUNDS AS THE GREEN BOX
translated_text: This green color had succeeded in drawing attention to the carriage, which was known in all the fairgrounds as the green box.

text: ON THE ROOF FROM A TUBE PAINTED GREEN LIKE THE REST SMOKE AROSE
translated_text: On the roof from a two-painted green like the rest, smoke arose.

text: THE ASTONISHMENT WITH WHICH THE VILLAGERS REGARDED THIS MACHINE WAS OVERWHELMING
translated_text: The astonishment with which the villagers regarded this machine was overwhelming.

text: THIS WAS THE OLD ESTABLISHMENT OF URSUS ITS PROPORTIONS AUGMENTED BY SUCCESS AND IMPROVED FROM A WRETCHED BOOTH INTO A THEATRE
translated_text: This was the old establishment of ursis, its proportions augmented by success, and improved from a wretched booth into a theater.

text: UNKNOWN PEOPLE HAD WORKED UPON HIS FACE HE ON THE OTHER HAND HAD WORKED ON HIS MIND AND BEHIND THIS WELL EXECUTED MASK HE HAD PLACED ALL THAT HE COULD OF THOUGHT
translated_text: Unknown people had worked upon his face. He, on the other hand, had worked on his mind. And behind this well-executed mask he had placed all that he could have thought.

text: THE EFFECT OF HIS APPEARANCE HAD BEEN SURPRISING
translated_text: The effect of his appearance had been surprising.

text: SOME BELIEVED IT TO BE NATURAL OTHERS DECLARED IT TO BE ARTIFICIAL AND AS CONJECTURE WAS ADDED TO REALITY EVERYWHERE AT EVERY CROSS ROAD ON THE JOURNEY IN ALL THE GROUNDS OF FAIRS AND FETES THE CROWD RAN AFTER GWYNPLAINE
translated_text: Some believed it to be natural. Others declared it to be artificial. And as conjecture was added to reality, everywhere at every crossroad on the journey. In all the grounds of fairies and fates, the crowd ran after Gwenplain.

text: THE CURIOSITY OF ONE PLACE EXHAUSTED THEY PASSED ON TO ANOTHER
translated_text: The curiosity of one place exhausted, they passed on to another.

text: THIS FORTUNE HAD ALLOWED URSUS WHO WAS THE ADMINISTRATOR OF GWYNPLAINE'S SUCCESS TO HAVE THE CHARIOT OF HIS DREAMS CONSTRUCTED THAT IS TO SAY A CARAVAN LARGE ENOUGH TO CARRY A THEATRE AND TO SOW SCIENCE AND ART IN THE HIGHWAYS
translated_text: This fortune had allowed Urses, who was the administrator of Gwynn Plain's success, to have the chariot of his dreams constructed. That is to say, a caravan large enough to carry a theater, and to sow science and art in the highways.

text: FOR THESE READ FIBI AND VINOS THAT WE MAY CONFORM TO ENGLISH PRONUNCIATION
translated_text: For these red Phoebe and Venus that we may conform to English pronunciation.

text: PHOEBE COOKED VENUS SCRUBBED THE TEMPLE
translated_text: Phoebe cooked, Venus grabbed the temple.

text: URSUS AND HOMO TOOK CHARGE OF EACH OTHER
translated_text: Ursus and Homo took charge of each other.

text: THIS HUT IN A CORNER AT THE BACK TO THE RIGHT OF THE DOOR SERVED AS BEDCHAMBER AND DRESSING ROOM TO URSUS AND GWYNPLAINE
translated_text: This hut, in a corner at the back, to the right of the door, served as bed chamber and dressing room to Ursus in Gwynplain.

text: THE CARAVAN WAS DIVIDED INTO THREE COMPARTMENTS PARTITIONED FROM EACH OTHER
translated_text: The caravan was divided into three compartments, partitioned from each other.

text: A LOFT UNDER THE ARCH OF THE ROOF CONTAINED THE SCENES AND ON OPENING A TRAP DOOR LAMPS APPEARED PRODUCING WONDERS OF LIGHT
translated_text: A loft under the arch of the roof contained the scenes, and on opening a trap door lamps appeared, producing wonders of light.

text: URSUS WAS THE POET OF THESE MAGICAL REPRESENTATIONS HE WROTE THE PIECES
translated_text: Ersis was the poet of these magical representations. He wrote the pieces.

text: THEN I LOOK PERHAPS LIKE WHAT I AM
translated_text: Then I look perhaps like what I am.

text: THIS OPENING LOOKED FOR ALL THE WORLD LIKE A MOUTH OF HELL IN THE WORDS OF THE ITINERANT PURITAN PREACHERS WHO TURNED AWAY FROM IT WITH HORROR
translated_text: This opening looked for all the world like a mouth of hell. In the words of the itinerant Puritan preachers, who turned away from it with horror.

text: URSUS WAS IN EVERYTHING IN THE PIECE IN THE COMPANY IN THE KITCHEN IN THE ORCHESTRA
translated_text: Urses was in everything, in the piece, in the company, in the kitchen, in the orchestra.

text: IT WAS ESTABLISHED AT SOUTHWARK
translated_text: It was established at South Work.

text: THE DOME OF SAINT PAUL'S WAS A DELIGHT TO URSUS
translated_text: The dome of St. Paul's was a delight to Ursus.

text: SAINT PAUL IS A SAINT ONLY WITH EXTENUATING CIRCUMSTANCES
translated_text: St. Paul is a saint only with extenuating circumstances.

text: HE ENTERED HEAVEN ONLY BY THE ARTISTS DOOR
translated_text: He entered heaven only by the artist's door.

text: IT MIGHT HAVE BEEN ORDERED FOR THE GREEN BOX
translated_text: It might have been ordered for the green box.

text: IT WAS A THEATRE READY MADE
translated_text: It was a theater ready made.

text: AGAINST THIS WALL WAS PLACED THE GREEN BOX WHICH THEY WERE ABLE TO DRAW INTO THE YARD OWING TO THE HEIGHT OF THE GATE
translated_text: against this wall was placed the green box, which they were able to draw into the yard, owing to the height of the gate.

text: THE PLACARD GWYNPLAINE THE LAUGHING MAN TAKEN FROM ITS NAIL IN THE GREEN BOX WAS HUNG UP CLOSE TO THE SIGN OF THE INN
translated_text: The placard, Gwen, playing the Laughing Man, taken from its nail in the green box, was hung up close to the sign of the inn.

text: BY THE SIDE OF THE DOOR WAS CONSTRUCTED OFF HAND BY MEANS OF AN EMPTY BARREL A BOX FOR THE MONEY TAKER WHO WAS SOMETIMES FIBI AND SOMETIMES VINOS
translated_text: By the side of the door was constructed off-hand, by means of an empty barrel, a box for the money-taker who was sometimes Phoebe and sometimes Phenos.

text: WE ARE IN LONDON SAID URSUS WE MUST BE PREPARED FOR THE GENTRY
translated_text: We are in London, said Urses. We must be prepared for the gentry.

text: THEY BEGAN THEIR PERFORMANCES
translated_text: They began their performances.

text: WITH THAT EXCEPTION THEIR SUCCESS BECAME SO GREAT THAT NO MOUNTEBANK MEMORY COULD RECALL ITS PARALLEL
translated_text: With that exception, their success became so great that no amount of bank memory could recall its parallel.

text: ALL SOUTHWARK RAN IN CROWDS TO ADMIRE THE LAUGHING MAN
translated_text: All South work running crowds to admire the laughing man.

text: THE MERRY ANDREWS AND MOUNTEBANKS OF TARRINZEAU FIELD WERE AGHAST AT GWYNPLAINE
translated_text: The Mary Andrews and Mountabanks of Turinzo Field were a gastric wind plane.

text: GWYNPLAINE ATE UP THEIR PUBLIC
translated_text: Gwynnplain, eight up their public.

text: BESIDES THE SMALL FRY THE SWALLOWERS OF SWORDS AND THE GRIMACE MAKERS REAL PERFORMANCES TOOK PLACE ON THE GREEN
translated_text: Besides the small fry, the swallows of swords and the grimace makers, real performances took place on the green.

text: EVEN THIS COMEDIAN OF JAWS AND CLAWS WAS ECLIPSED IN SUCCESS
translated_text: Even this comedian of JAWS and Clause was eclipsed in success.

text: THAT SUCCESS WAS PRODIGIOUS STILL IT REMAINED LOCAL
translated_text: That success was prodigious. Still, it remained local.

text: IT TOOK A HUNDRED AND THIRTY YEARS FOR THE NAME OF SHAKESPEARE TO PENETRATE FROM ENGLAND INTO FRANCE
translated_text: It took 130 years for the name of Shakespeare to penetrate from England into France.

text: THE GLORY OF GWYNPLAINE HAD NOT PASSED LONDON BRIDGE
translated_text: The glory of Gwynplain had not passed London Bridge.

text: THESE WERE REMARKABLE TALENTS
translated_text: These were remarkable talents.

text: BESIDES THIS HE HARANGUED LIKE CICERO AS WE HAVE JUST SEEN SOLD HIS DRUGS ATTENDED SICKNESS AND EVEN HEALED THE SICK
translated_text: Besides this, he heranged like Cicero, as we have just seen, sold his drugs, attended sickness, and even healed the sick.

text: URSUS WAS SATISFIED WITH THE APPLAUSE OF SOUTHWARK BUT BY NO MEANS ASTONISHED
translated_text: Urses was satisfied with the applause of South work, but by no means astonished.

text: AT EVERY PERFORMANCE THE YARD OF THE INN TRANSFORMED INTO A PIT WAS FILLED WITH A RAGGED AND ENTHUSIASTIC AUDIENCE
translated_text: At every performance the yard of the inn transformed into a pit, was filled with a ragged and enthusiastic audience.

text: THE EMPTYING OF TANKARDS DID NOT DECREASE THEIR SUCCESS
translated_text: The emptying of tankards did not decrease their success.

text: THIS CONNOISSEUR WAS SUDDENLY FASCINATED AND HAD ADOPTED THE LAUGHING MAN
translated_text: This connoisseur was suddenly fascinated and had adopted the laughing man.

text: HE DID NOT COME EVERY EVENING BUT WHEN HE CAME HE LED THE PUBLIC APPLAUSE GREW INTO ACCLAMATION SUCCESS ROSE NOT TO THE ROOF FOR THERE WAS NONE BUT TO THE CLOUDS FOR THERE WERE PLENTY OF THEM
translated_text: He did not come every evening, but when he came he led the public. A plaza grew into acclimation. Success rose not to the roof, for there was none, but to the clouds, for there were plenty of them.

text: WHICH CLOUDS SEEING THAT THERE WAS NO ROOF SOMETIMES WEPT OVER THE MASTERPIECE OF URSUS
translated_text: which clouds, seeing that there was no roof, sometimes wept over the masterpiece of urses.

text: HIS ENTHUSIASM CAUSED URSUS TO REMARK THIS MAN AND GWYNPLAINE TO OBSERVE HIM
translated_text: His enthusiasm caused urses to remark this man and Gwyn plane to observe him.

text: THEY HAD A GREAT FRIEND IN THIS UNKNOWN VISITOR
translated_text: They had a great friend in this unknown visitor.

text: ONE EVENING URSUS WAS IN THE SIDE SCENE WHICH WAS THE KITCHEN DOOR OF THE GREEN BOX SEEING MASTER NICLESS STANDING BY HIM SHOWED HIM THIS MAN IN THE CROWD AND ASKED HIM
translated_text: One evening, Ursa's was in the side-scene, which was the kitchen door of the green box, seeing Master Nicholas standing by him, showed him this man in the crowd and asked him.

text: WHAT A PITY THAT HE SHOULD NOT BE A LORD
translated_text: What a pity that he should not be a Lord.

text: HE WOULD MAKE A FAMOUS SCOUNDREL
translated_text: He would make a famous scoundrel.

text: AT THAT HOUR THERE WAS NO ONE IN THE FAIR GROUND EXCEPT PERHAPS SOME REELING DRUNKARD MAKING STAGGERING SHADOWS IN DARK CORNERS
translated_text: At that hour there was no one in the fairground, except perhaps some reeling drunkard, making staggering shadows and dark corners.

text: ON THE SECOND OF THE MONTH AT TWO IN THE MORNING OUR PRECIOUS CARGO OF LUGGAGE WAS TAKEN ON BOARD THE GOOD SHIP VALKYRIE
translated_text: On the second of the month, at two in the morning, our precious cargo of luggage was taken on board the Goodship Volkary.

text: BUT IN THE CAUSE OF SCIENCE MEN ARE EXPECTED TO SUFFER
translated_text: but in the cause of science men are expected to suffer.

text: WELL AND HAVE WE A FAIR WIND
translated_text: Well, and have we a fair wind?

text: MY UNCLE WAS DELIGHTED FOR MYSELF MOODY AND DISSATISFIED I APPEARED ALMOST TO EXPECT A GLIMPSE OF THE GHOST OF HAMLET
translated_text: My uncle was delighted. For myself, Moody and dissatisfied, I appeared almost to expect a glimpse of the ghost of Hamlet.

text: BUT NO GHOST OR ANYTHING ELSE APPEARED UPON THE ANCIENT WALLS
translated_text: But no ghost or anything else appeared upon the ancient walls.

text: THE FACT IS THE CASTLE IS MUCH LATER THAN THE TIME OF THE HEROIC PRINCE OF DENMARK
translated_text: The fact is, the castle is much later than the time of the heroic Prince of Denmark.

text: NO MISTER HARDWIGG SAID THE CAPTAIN NO FEAR OF THAT
translated_text: No, Mr. Hardwig said the captain. No fear of that.

text: AT ALL EVENTS WE SHALL GET THERE SOME DAY
translated_text: At all events, we shall get there someday.

text: ON THE ELEVENTH DAY WE SIGHTED CAPE PORTLAND OVER WHICH TOWERED MOUNT MYRDALS YOKUL WHICH THE WEATHER BEING CLEAR WE MADE OUT VERY READILY
translated_text: On the eleventh day we sighted Cape Portland over which towered mountain midrules Yoko, which the weather being clear we made out very readily.

text: THE VALKYRIE KEPT OFF THE COAST STEERING TO THE WESTWARD
translated_text: The Volkery kept off the coast, steering to the westward.

text: ON ALL SIDES WERE TO BE SEEN WHOLE SCHOOLS OF WHALES AND SHARKS
translated_text: On all sides were to be seen whole schools of whales and sharks.

text: NEARLY THE WHOLE POPULATION OF THE TOWN WAS ON FOOT TO SEE US LAND
translated_text: Nearly the whole population of the town was on foot to CS land.

text: THE FACT WAS THAT SCARCELY ANY ONE OF THEM BUT EXPECTED SOME GOODS BY THE PERIODICAL VESSEL
translated_text: The fact was that scarcely any one of them but expected some goods by the periodical vessel.

text: THEN WITHOUT FURTHER REMARK HE PUT HIS FINGER TO HIS LIPS FROWNED DARKLY AND DESCENDED INTO THE SMALL BOAT WHICH AWAITED US
translated_text: Then, without further remark, he put his finger to his lips, frowned darkly, and descended into the small boat which awaited us.

text: HE WAS HOWEVER BUT A CIVIL SERVANT A MAGISTRATE THE GOVERNOR OF THE ISLAND BARON TRAMPE
translated_text: He was, however, but a civil servant, a magistrate, the governor of the island, Baron Tramp.

text: THE PROFESSOR KNEW WHOM HE HAD TO DEAL WITH
translated_text: The professor knew whom he had to deal with.

text: THIS MODEST SCHOLAR SPOKE NO LANGUAGES SAVE ICELANDIC AND LATIN
translated_text: This modest scholar spoke no languages save Icelandic in Latin.

text: WHEN THEREFORE HE ADDRESSED HIMSELF TO ME IN THE LANGUAGE OF HORACE WE AT ONCE CAME TO UNDERSTAND ONE ANOTHER
translated_text: When, therefore, he addressed himself to me in the language of Horus, we at once came to understand one another.

text: NOW HARRY SAID MY UNCLE RUBBING HIS HANDS AN GOES WELL THE WORSE DIFFICULTY IS NOW OVER
translated_text: Now Harry said my uncle rubbing his hands. On goes well. The worst difficulty is now over.

text: IN THE MEANTIME THERE IS NOT AN HOUR TO LOSE
translated_text: In the meantime, there is not an hour to lose.

text: VERY LIKELY I MAY FIND THERE SOME MANUSCRIPTS FROM THE HAND OF SAKNUSSEMM
translated_text: Very likely I may find there's some manuscripts from the hand of Suck Newsom.

text: I SHALL BE GLAD TO CONSULT THEM
translated_text: I shall be glad to consult them.

text: THEY WERE NOW HOWEVER ABSENT ON DUTY
translated_text: They were now, however, absent on duty.

text: THOUGH NOT VERY LARGE IT APPEARED NOT LIKELY TO BE FILLED FOR CENTURIES
translated_text: Though not very large, it appeared not likely to be filled for centuries.

text: I HAVE NOT THE SLIGHTEST DOUBT THAT IN HIGH WINDS ITS RED TILES WERE BLOWN OUT TO THE GREAT ANNOYANCE OF THE PASTOR AND CONGREGATION
translated_text: I have not the slightest doubt that in high winds, its red tiles were blown out to the great annoyance of the pastor in congregation.

text: THANKS TO THE HEAT OF THESE RESIDENCES GRASS GROWS ON THE ROOF WHICH GRASS IS CAREFULLY CUT FOR HAY
translated_text: Thanks to the heat of these residences, grass grows in the roof, which grass is carefully cut for hay.

text: I SAW BUT FEW INHABITANTS DURING MY EXCURSION BUT I MET A CROWD ON THE BEACH DRYING SALTING AND LOADING CODFISH THE PRINCIPAL ARTICLE OF EXPORTATION
translated_text: I saw but few inhabit and stirring my excursion, but I met a crowd on the beach drying, salting, and loading codfish, the principal article of exportation.

text: THE MEN APPEARED ROBUST BUT HEAVY FAIR HAIRED LIKE GERMANS BUT OF PENSIVE MIEN EXILES OF A HIGHER SCALE IN THE LADDER OF HUMANITY THAN THE ESKIMOS BUT I THOUGHT MUCH MORE UNHAPPY SINCE WITH SUPERIOR PERCEPTIONS THEY ARE COMPELLED TO LIVE WITHIN THE LIMITS OF THE POLAR CIRCLE
translated_text: The men appeared robust but heavy, fair-haired like Germans, but of pensive mean, exiles of a higher scale in the latter of humanity than the Eskimos, but I thought much more unhappy, since with superior perceptions they are compelled to live within the limits of the polar circle.

text: I BEGAN TO ENJOY THE EXHILARATING DELIGHT OF TRAVELING A LIFE OF DESIRE GRATIFICATION AND LIBERTY
translated_text: I began to enjoy the exhilarating delight of traveling, a life of desire, gratification, and liberty.

text: HANS OUR EXTRAORDINARY GUIDE WENT FIRST WALKING WITH A STEADY RAPID UNVARYING STEP
translated_text: Hans, our extraordinary guide, went first, walking with a steady, rapid, unvering step.

text: OUR TWO HORSES WITH THE LUGGAGE FOLLOWED OF THEIR OWN ACCORD WITHOUT REQUIRING WHIP OR SPUR
translated_text: Our two horses with the luggage, followed of their own accord, without requiring whip or spur.

text: GEOGRAPHERS HAVE DIVIDED IT INTO FOUR PARTS AND WE HAD TO CROSS THE SOUTHWEST QUARTER WHICH IN THE VERNACULAR IS CALLED SUDVESTR FJORDUNGR
translated_text: Geographers have divided it into four parts, and we had to cross the southwest quarter, which in the vernacular is called, Sudvest Fjordinger.

text: WE TOOK OUR WAY THROUGH POOR AND SPARSE MEADOWS WHICH MADE A DESPERATE EFFORT EVERY YEAR TO SHOW A LITTLE GREEN
translated_text: We took our way through poor and sparse meadows, which made a desperate effort every year to show a little green.

text: THEY VERY RARELY SUCCEED IN A GOOD SHOW OF YELLOW
translated_text: They very rarely succeeded in a good show of yellow.

text: I COULD NOT HELP SMILING TO SEE HIM LOOK SO BIG ON HIS LITTLE HORSE HIS LONG LEGS NOW AND THEN TOUCHING THE GROUND MADE HIM LOOK LIKE A SIX FOOTED CENTAUR
translated_text: I could not help smiling to see him look so big on his little horse. His long legs now and then touching the ground made him look like a six-footed centaur.

text: SNOW TEMPEST IMPRACTICABLE ROADS ROCKS ICEBERGS NOTHING STOPS HIM
translated_text: Snow, tempest, impractical roads, rocks, icebergs, nothing stops him.

text: WE MAY DO SO WAS MY REPLY BUT WHAT ABOUT OUR WORTHY GUIDE
translated_text: We may do so was my reply, but what about our worthy guide?

text: I SHOULD HAVE A VIOLENT ATTACK OF THE CRAMP IF I WERE NOT TO HAVE SOME SORT OF EXERCISE
translated_text: I should have a violent attack of the cramp if I were not to have some sort of exercise.

text: MY ARMS ARE RIGHT BUT MY LEGS ARE GETTING A LITTLE STIFF
translated_text: My arms are right, but my legs are getting a little stiff.

text: HERE AND THERE COULD BE SEEN AN ISOLATED FARM SOME SOLITARY BUR OR ICELANDIC HOUSE BUILT OF WOOD EARTH FRAGMENTS OF LAVA LOOKING LIKE BEGGARS ON THE HIGHWAY OF LIFE
translated_text: Here and there could be seen an isolated farm, some solitary burr or Icelandic house, built of wood, earth, fragments of lava, looking like beggars in the highway of life.

text: A FEW STRAY COWS AND SHEEP WERE ONLY SEEN OCCASIONALLY
translated_text: A few stray cows and sheep were only seen occasionally.

text: LITTLE DID I EXPECT HOWEVER THE SPECTACLE WHICH AWAITED US WHEN WE REACHED THE PENINSULA OF SNEFFELS WHERE AGGLOMERATIONS OF NATURE'S RUINS FORM A KIND OF TERRIBLE CHAOS
translated_text: Little did I expect, however, the spectacle which awaited us when we reached the peninsula of sniffles, where agglomerations of nature's ruins form a kind of terrible chaos.

text: IT CONSISTS SIMPLY OF A FEW HOUSES NOT WHAT IN ENGLAND OR GERMANY WE SHOULD CALL A HAMLET
translated_text: It consists simply of a few houses, not what in England or Germany we should call a hamlet.

text: I TOOK OCCASION TO CONSULT THE MAP TO SEE WHERE GARDAR WAS TO BE FOUND
translated_text: I took occasion to consult the map to see where Garder was to be found.

text: THESE SACRED EDIFICES ARE HOWEVER VERY MUCH LIKE THESE PEOPLE WHO DO WITHOUT WATCHES AND NEVER MISS THEM
translated_text: These sacred edifices are, however, very much like these people who do without watches and never miss them.

text: TO RIDE OVER SALT WATER UPON THE BACK OF A LITTLE HORSE SEEMED TO ME ABSURD
translated_text: To write a result water upon the back of a little horse seemed to me absurd.

text: IN ANY CASE I SHALL TRUST RATHER TO MY OWN INTELLIGENCE THAN THEIRS
translated_text: In any case, I shall trust rather to my own intelligence than theirs.

text: BUT MY UNCLE WAS IN NO HUMOR TO WAIT
translated_text: But my uncle wasn't no humor to wait.

text: AT LENGTH THE STURDY LITTLE PONY SPREADING OUT HIS LEGS IN A STIFF AND LUDICROUS ATTITUDE GOT FROM UNDER THE PROFESSOR'S LEGS AND LEFT HIM STANDING WITH BOTH FEET ON A SEPARATE STONE LIKE THE COLOSSUS OF RHODES
translated_text: At length, the sturdy little pony, spreading out his legs in a stiff and ludicrous attitude, got from under the professor's legs and left him standing, with both feet on a separate stone like the colossus of Rhodes.

text: HE SAYS TIDE REPLIED MY UNCLE TRANSLATING THE DANISH WORD FOR MY INFORMATION
translated_text: He says, Tide replied my uncle, translating the Danish word for my information.

text: I THOROUGHLY UNDERSTOOD AND APPRECIATED THE NECESSITY FOR WAITING BEFORE CROSSING THE FJORD FOR THAT MOMENT WHEN THE SEA AT ITS HIGHEST POINT IS IN A STATE OF SLACK WATER
translated_text: I thoroughly understood and appreciated the necessity for waiting before crossing the fjord, for that moment when the sea at its highest point is in a state of slack water.

text: ACCUSTOMED AS I HAD BEEN TO THE STEAM FERRY BOATS OF THE ELBE I FOUND THE LONG OARS OF THE BOATMEN BUT SORRY MEANS OF LOCOMOTION
translated_text: accustomed, as I had been to the steam ferry boats of the Elbe, I found the long ores of the boatmen but sorry means of locomotion.

text: BUT THIS POWER OF DISCERNMENT WAS DENIED THEM AND ONLY IN AFTER YEARS WITH THE LOVED ONES OF THEIR OWN FIRESIDES CLOSE ABOUT THEM WAS THE WHOLE PICTURE REVEALED
translated_text: But this power of disarmament was denied them, and only in after years, with the loved ones of their own fire sides close about them, was the whole picture revealed.

text: ONE DARK NIGHT AT THE HEAD OF A SCORE OF HIS TRIBE HE FELL UPON WABIGOON'S CAMP HIS OBJECT BEING THE ABDUCTION OF THE PRINCESS
translated_text: One dark knight, at the head of a score of his tribe, he fell upon Wobigawan's camp, his object being the abduction of the princess.

text: WHILE THE ATTACK WAS SUCCESSFUL IN A WAY ITS MAIN PURPOSE FAILED
translated_text: While the attack was successful in a way, its main purpose failed.

text: A COUNTER ATTACK WAS MADE UPON WOONGA AND HE WAS DRIVEN DEEP INTO THE WILDERNESS WITH GREAT LOSS
translated_text: A counterattack was made upon Wunga, and he was driven deep into the wilderness with great loss.

text: THREE DAYS LATER MINNETAKI BECAME NEWSOME'S WIFE AT THE HUDSON BAY POST
translated_text: Three days later, Minnetake became Newsom's wife at the Hudson Bay Post.

text: FROM THAT HOUR DATED ONE OF THE MOST SANGUINARY FEUDS IN THE HISTORY OF THE GREAT TRADING COMPANY A FEUD WHICH AS WE SHALL SEE WAS DESTINED TO LIVE EVEN UNTO THE SECOND GENERATION
translated_text: From that hour, dated one of the most sanguinary feuds in the history of the great trading company, a feud which, as we shall see, was destined to live even under the second generation.

text: MEANWHILE TWO CHILDREN CAME TO BLESS THE HAPPY UNION OF NEWSOME AND HIS LOVELY INDIAN WIFE
translated_text: Meanwhile, two children came to bless the happy union of Newsom and his lovely Indian wife.

text: THE OTHER WAS A GIRL THREE YEARS YOUNGER AND NEWSOME INSISTED THAT SHE BE CALLED MINNETAKI
translated_text: The other was a girl, three years younger, and Newsom insisted that she be called Minnetaki.

text: CURIOUSLY ENOUGH THE BLOOD OF WABI RAN ALMOST PURE TO HIS INDIAN FOREFATHERS WHILE MINNETAKI AS SHE BECAME OLDER DEVELOPED LESS OF THE WILD BEAUTY OF HER MOTHER AND MORE OF THE SOFTER LOVELINESS OF THE WHITE RACE HER WEALTH OF SOFT JET BLACK HAIR AND HER GREAT DARK EYES CONTRASTING WITH THE LIGHTER SKIN OF HER FATHER'S BLOOD
translated_text: Curiously enough, the blood of Wabi ran almost pure to his Indian forefathers, while Minnetaki, as she became older, developed less of the wild beauty of her mother and more of the softer loveliness of the white race, her wealth of soft jet black hair and her great dark eyes contrasting with the lighter skin of her father's blood.

text: WABI ON THE OTHER HAND WAS AN INDIAN IN APPEARANCE FROM HIS MOCCASINS TO THE CROWN OF HIS HEAD SWARTHY SINEWY AS AGILE AS A LYNX AND WITH EVERY INSTINCT IN HIM CRYING FOR THE LIFE OF THE WILD
translated_text: Wabi, on the other hand, was an Indian in appearance from his moccasins to the crown of his head, Swarrii, Sinyui, and Agile as a links, and with every instinct in him crying for the life of the wild.

text: ONE OF NEWSOME'S CHIEF PLEASURES IN LIFE HAD BEEN THE EDUCATING OF HIS WOODLAND BRIDE AND IT WAS THE AMBITION OF BOTH THAT THE LITTLE MINNETAKI AND HER BROTHER BE REARED IN THE WAYS OF WHITE CHILDREN
translated_text: One of Nusom's chief pleasures in life had been the educating of his woodland bride, and it was the ambition of both that the little Minotalki and her brother be reared in the ways of white children.

text: CONSEQUENTLY BOTH MOTHER AND FATHER BEGAN THEIR EDUCATION AT THE POST THEY WERE SENT TO THE FACTOR'S SCHOOL AND TWO WINTERS WERE PASSED IN PORT ARTHUR THAT THEY MIGHT HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF THOROUGHLY EQUIPPED SCHOOLS
translated_text: Consequently, both mother and father began their education at the post. They were sent to the factor school, and two winters were passed in poor Arthur, that they might have the advantage of thoroughly equipped schools.

text: THE CHILDREN PROVED THEMSELVES UNUSUALLY BRIGHT PUPILS AND BY THE TIME WABI WAS SIXTEEN AND MINNETAKI TWELVE ONE WOULD NOT HAVE KNOWN FROM THEIR MANNER OF SPEECH THAT INDIAN BLOOD RAN IN THEIR VEINS
translated_text: The children proved themselves unusually bright pupils, and by the time Wabi was 16 and Minotaki 12, one would not have known from their manner of speech that Indian blood ran in their veins.

text: IT WAS AT ABOUT THIS TIME IN THEIR LIVES THAT THE WOONGAS BECAME ESPECIALLY DARING IN THEIR DEPREDATIONS
translated_text: It was at about this time in their lives that the Wungas became especially daring in their depredations.

text: AT LAST SO DARING DID HE BECOME THAT THE PROVINCIAL GOVERNMENT PLACED A PRICE UPON HIS HEAD AND UPON THOSE OF A NUMBER OF HIS MOST NOTORIOUS FOLLOWERS
translated_text: At last, so daring did he become that the provincial government placed a price upon his head and upon those of a number of his most notorious followers.

text: BUT EACH WEEK ADDED TO HIS LONELINESS AND HIS LONGINGS FOR MINNETAKI AND HIS FORESTS
translated_text: but each week added to his loneliness and his longings for Minotaki and his forests.

text: NECESSITY HAD BECOME HIS GRIM MASTER AND THE FOLLOWING WEEK HE WAS GOING TO WORK
translated_text: necessity had become his grim master and the following week he was going to work.

text: A THOUSAND PLANS WERE MADE A THOUSAND ADVENTURES PICTURED AND THE MOTHER WOULD SMILE AND LAUGH AND PLAN WITH THEM
translated_text: A thousand to plans were made, a thousand adventures pictured, and the mother would smile and laugh and plan with them.

text: BUT IN TIME THE END OF IT ALL CAME AND WABI WENT BACK TO THE PRINCESS MOTHER TO MINNETAKI AND TO HIS FORESTS
translated_text: But in time, the end of it all came, and while he went back to the Princess Mother to Minotalki and to his forests.

text: THERE WERE TEARS IN THE BOYS EYES WHEN THEY PARTED AND THE MOTHER CRIED FOR THE INDIAN BOY WHO WAS RETURNING TO HIS PEOPLE
translated_text: There were tears in the boy's eyes when they parted, and the mother cried for the Indian boy who was returning to his people.

text: SPRING CAME AND PASSED AND THEN SUMMER
translated_text: Spring came in past and then summer.

text: WE SHALL MAKE MORE MONEY UP HERE THIS WINTER THAN YOU COULD EARN IN DETROIT IN THREE YEARS
translated_text: We shall make more money up here this winter than you could earn in Detroit in three years.

text: WE WILL HUNT WOLVES THE COUNTRY IS ALIVE WITH THEM AND THE GOVERNMENT GIVES A BOUNTY OF FIFTEEN DOLLARS FOR EVERY SCALP TAKEN
translated_text: We will hunt wolves, the country is alive with them, and the government gives a bounty of $15 for every scalp taken.

text: THREE WEEKS LATER CAME WABIGOON'S REPLY
translated_text: Three weeks later, Cain will big oons reply.

text: ON THE TENTH OF OCTOBER HE WOULD MEET ROD AT SPRUCEWOOD ON THE BLACK STURGEON RIVER
translated_text: On the 10th of October, he would meet Rod at Sprucewood on the Black Sturgeon River.

text: THERE WAS LITTLE TIME TO LOSE IN MAKING PREPARATIONS AND THE FOURTH DAY FOLLOWING THE RECEIPT OF WABI'S LETTER FOUND ROD AND HIS MOTHER WAITING FOR THE TRAIN WHICH WAS TO WHIRL THE BOY INTO HIS NEW LIFE
translated_text: There was little time to lose in making preparations. And the fourth day, following the receipt of Wabby's letter, found Rod and his mother waiting for the train which was to whirl the boy into his new life.

text: CHAPTER SEVEN THE HOMECOMING
translated_text: Chapter 7. The Homecoming

text: COLONEL LEONIDAS TALBOT REGARDED THE WHITE FLAG WITH FEELINGS IN WHICH TRIUMPH AND SADNESS WERE MINGLED STRANGELY
translated_text: Crenelianitis Talbot regarded the white flag with feelings in which triumph and sadness were mingled strangely.

text: BUT THE EMOTIONS OF HARRY AND HIS COMRADES WERE FOR THE MOMENT THOSE OF VICTORY ONLY
translated_text: but the emotions of Harry and his comrades were, for the moment, those of victory only.

text: BOATS PUT OUT BOTH FROM THE FORT AND THE SHORE
translated_text: Boats put out both from the Ford and the Shore.

text: THE SMOKE ITSELF WHICH HAD FORMED A VAST CLOUD OVER HARBOR FORTS AND CITY WAS NOW DRIFTING OUT TO SEA LEAVING ALL THINGS ETCHED SHARPLY IN THE DAZZLING SUNLIGHT OF A SOUTHERN SPRING DAY
translated_text: The smoke itself, which had formed a vast cloud over the harbor, forts and city, was now drifting out to sea, leaving all things etched sharply in the dazzling sunlight of a southern spring day.

text: THAT WHITE FLAG AND THOSE BOATS GOING OUT MEAN THAT SUMTER IS OURS
translated_text: That white flag and those boats going out mean that some are ours.

text: BUT THE NEGOTIATIONS WERE SOON COMPLETED
translated_text: But the negotiations were soon completed.

text: ALL THE AMENITIES WERE PRESERVED BETWEEN THE CAPTURED GARRISON AND THEIR CAPTORS
translated_text: All the amenities were preserved between the captured garrison and their captors.

text: THE GREAT STATE OF VIRGINIA MOTHER OF PRESIDENTS WENT OUT OF THE UNION AT LAST AND NORTH CAROLINA TENNESSEE AND ARKANSAS FOLLOWED HER BUT MARYLAND KENTUCKY AND MISSOURI STILL HUNG IN THE BALANCE
translated_text: The great state of Virginia, mother of presidents, went out of the Union at last. At North Carolina, Tennessee and Arkansas followed her, but Maryland, Kentucky and Missouri still hung in the balance.

text: LINCOLN HAD CALLED FOR VOLUNTEERS TO PUT DOWN A REBELLION BUT HARRY HEARD EVERYWHERE IN CHARLESTON THAT THE CONFEDERACY WAS NOW SECURE
translated_text: Lincoln had called for volunteers to put down a rebellion, but Harry heard everywhere in Charleston that the Confederacy was now secure.

text: THE PROGRESS OF PRESIDENT DAVIS TO THE NEW CAPITAL SET IN THE VERY FACE OF THE FOE WAS TO BE ONE HUGE TRIUMPH OF FAITH AND LOYALTY
translated_text: The progress of President Davis to the new capital set in the very face of the foe was to be one huge triumph of faith and loyalty.

text: THERE WAS NOT A SINGLE NOTE OF GLOOM
translated_text: There was not a single note of gloom.

text: EUROPE WHICH MUST HAVE ITS COTTON WOULD FAVOR THE SUCCESS OF THE SOUTH
translated_text: Europe, which must have its cotton, would favor the success of the South.

text: AN EXTRAORDINARY WAVE OF EMOTION SWEPT OVER THE SOUTH CARRYING EVERYBODY WITH IT
translated_text: an extraordinary wave of emotions swept over the south, carrying everybody with it.

text: BEAUREGARD AT ONCE WROTE AN ORDER
translated_text: Borough Guard at once wrote an order.

text: COLONEL KENTON WRITES WISELY
translated_text: Colonel Kenton writes wisely.

text: WE NEED KENTUCKY AND I UNDERSTAND THAT A VERY LITTLE MORE MAY BRING THE STATE TO US GO WITH YOUR FATHER I UNDERSTAND THAT YOU HAVE BEEN A BRAVE YOUNG SOLDIER HERE AND MAY YOU DO AS WELL UP THERE
translated_text: We need Kentucky and I understand that a very little more may bring the state to us. Go with your father. I understand that you have been a brave young soldier here and may you do as well up there.

text: HARRY FEELING PRIDE BUT NOT SHOWING IT SALUTED AND LEFT THE ROOM GOING AT ONCE TO MADAME DELAUNAY'S WHERE HE HAD LEFT HIS BAGGAGE
translated_text: Harry, feeling pride but not showing it, saluted and left the room, going at once to Madame Doolanese, where he had left his baggage.

text: HE INTENDED TO LEAVE EARLY IN THE MORNING BUT FIRST HE SOUGHT HIS FRIENDS AND TOLD THEM GOOD BYE
translated_text: He intended to leave early in the morning, but first he saw his friends and told them goodbye.

text: HARRY GAVE HIS FAREWELLS WITH DEEP AND GENUINE REGRET
translated_text: Harry gave his farewells with deep and genuine regret.

text: WHETHER THEIR MANNER WAS GRAVE OR FRIVOLOUS HE KNEW THAT THESE WERE GOOD FRIENDS OF HIS AND HE SINCERELY HOPED THAT HE WOULD MEET THEM AGAIN
translated_text: Whether their manner was grave or frivolous, he knew that these were good friends of his, and he sincerely hoped that he would meet them again.

text: IT WAS A DIFFERENT HARRY WHO STARTED HOME LATE IN APRIL
translated_text: It was a different Harry who started home late in April.

text: FOUR MONTHS HAD MADE GREAT CHANGES HE BORE HIMSELF MORE LIKE A MAN HIS MANNER WAS MUCH MORE CONSIDERED AND GRAVE
translated_text: Four months had made great changes. He bore himself more like a man. His manner was much more considered and grave.

text: HE HAD SEEN GREAT THINGS AND HE HAD DONE HIS SHARE OF THEM
translated_text: He had seen great things and he had done his share of them.

text: HE GAZED UPON A WORLD FULL OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND PERILS
translated_text: He gazed upon a world full of responsibilities and perils.

text: BUT HE LOOKED BACK AT CHARLESTON THE GAY THE VOLATILE AND THE BEAUTIFUL WITH REAL AFFECTION
translated_text: But he looked back at Charleston, the gay, the vault on the beautiful, with real affection.

text: IT WAS ALMOST BURIED NOW IN FLOWERS AND FOLIAGE
translated_text: It was almost buried now in flowers and foliage.

text: HE WAS GOING HOME AFTER VICTORY
translated_text: He was going home after victory.

text: HE SOON LEFT CHARLESTON OUT OF SIGHT
translated_text: He soon left Charleston out of sight.

text: HE FELT THE DIFFERENCE AS SOON AS HE REACHED THE HILLS OF HIS NATIVE STATE
translated_text: He felt the difference as soon as he reached the hills of his native state.

text: PEOPLE WERE COOLER HERE AND THEY WERE MORE PRONE TO LOOK AT THE TWO SIDES OF A QUESTION
translated_text: People were cooler here, and they were more prone to look at the two sides of a question.

text: THE AIR TOO WAS UNLIKE THAT OF SOUTH CAROLINA THERE WAS A SHARPER TANG TO IT
translated_text: The air too was unlike that of South Carolina. There was a sharper tang to it.

text: IT WHIPPED HIS BLOOD AS IT BLEW DOWN FROM THE SLOPES AND CRESTS
translated_text: It whipped his blood as it blew down from the slopes and crests.

text: IT WAS AFTERNOON WHEN HE REACHED THE LITTLE STATION OF WINTON AND LEFT THE TRAIN A TALL STURDY BOY THE SUPERIOR OF MANY A MAN IN SIZE STRENGTH AND AGILITY
translated_text: It was afternoon when he reached the little station of Wynton, and left the train, a tall, sturdy boy, disappear of many a man in size, strength, and agility.

text: THERE WERE NEVER BEFORE SUCH TIMES IN OLD KENTUCKY
translated_text: There were never before such times in old Kentucky.

text: BILL SKELLY AN HIS GANG THEM MOUNTAINEERS ARE UP
translated_text: Bill Skelley and his gang, then Mountaineers are up.

text: HE DID NOT SAY THE LAST AS A BOAST BUT MERELY AS AN ASSURANCE TO THE LIVERYMAN WHO HE SAW WAS ANXIOUS ON HIS ACCOUNT
translated_text: He did not say the last as a boast, but merely as an assurance to the delivery man, who he saw was anxious on his account.

text: IF YOU'VE GOT PISTOLS JUST YOU THINK ONCE BEFORE YOU SHOOT SAID COLLINS
translated_text: If you've got pistols, just you think once before you shoot," said Collins.

text: HARRY THANKED HIM THREW HIS SADDLE BAGS ACROSS THE HORSE A POWERFUL BAY AND GIVING A FINAL WAVE OF HIS HAND TO THE SYMPATHETIC LIVERYMAN RODE AWAY
translated_text: Harry thanked him through his saddlebags across the horse, a powerful bay, and giving a final wave of his hand to the sympathetic liveryman, wrote away.

text: THIS WAS NOT THE FASHION OF A YEAR AGO WHEN THEY EXCHANGED A FRIENDLY WORD OR TWO BUT HARRY KNEW ITS CAUSE NOW NOBODY COULD TRUST ANYBODY ELSE
translated_text: This was not the fashion of a year ago when they exchanged a friendly word or two, but Harry knew its cause, now nobody could trust anybody else.

text: BUT HE SAW NOTHING THAT MOVED THERE NO SIGNAL LIGHTS TWINKLED
translated_text: But he saw nothing to move there. No signal lights twinkled.

text: ONE WINTER EVENING AS SOON AS HIS WORK WAS OVER FOR THE DAY JOSEPH LOCKED THE DOOR OF HIS SMITHY WASHED HIMSELF WELL PUT ON CLEAN CLOTHES AND TAKING HIS VIOLIN SET OUT FOR TESTBRIDGE MARY WAS EXPECTING HIM TO TEA
translated_text: One winter evening. As soon as his work was over for the day Joseph locked the door of his smithy, washed himself well, put on clean clothes, and taking his vial in set out for test-bridge. Mary was expecting him to tea.

text: IT WAS THE AFTERNOON OF A HOLIDAY AND SHE HAD CLOSED EARLY
translated_text: It was the afternoon of a holiday, and she had closed early.

text: WAS THERE EVER A HAPPIER MAN THAN JOSEPH THAT NIGHT AS HE STRODE ALONG THE FOOTPATH
translated_text: Was there ever a happier man than Joseph that night is he strode along the footpath?

text: HE PRESSED HIS VIOLIN CASE TO HIS HEART AS IF IT WERE A LIVING THING THAT COULD KNOW THAT HE LOVED IT
translated_text: He pressed his violin case to his heart as if it were a living thing that could know that he loved it.

text: EARTH WAS GONE AND HEAVEN WAS ALL
translated_text: Earth was gone, and heaven was all.

text: BLESSED AM I HERE NOW MY GOD AND BLESSED SHALL I BE THERE THEN
translated_text: Blessed am I here now, my God, and blessed shall I be there then.

text: WHEN HE REACHED THE SUBURBS THE LIGHT OF HOMES WAS SHINING THROUGH CURTAINS OF ALL COLORS
translated_text: When he reached the suburbs, the light of homes was shining through curtains of all colors.

text: JUST THEN HE WAS IN NO MOOD TO THINK OF THE SORROWS
translated_text: Just then, he was in no mood to think of the sorrows.

text: THE NETTLE AND THE DOCK SAID JOSEPH
translated_text: The nettle in the dock said Joseph.

text: HE WAS IN A MOOD FOR MUSIC WAS HE NOT
translated_text: He was in a mood for music, was he not?

text: HE LAID DOWN HIS VIOLIN AND SEATED HIMSELF WHERE MARY TOLD HIM IN HER FATHER'S ARM CHAIR BY THE FIRE
translated_text: He laid down his vial in and seated himself where Mary told him in her father's armchair by the fire.

text: LETTY FINDING HERSELF NOT QUITE EQUAL TO THE EMERGENCY CAME IN HER TURN TO CALL MARY SHE WENT AS QUIETLY AS IF SHE WERE LEAVING A TIRESOME VISITOR
translated_text: Letty, finding herself not quite equal to the emergency, came in her turn to call Mary. She went as quietly as if she were leaving a tiresome visitor.

text: THE MUSIC WAS BROKEN AND JOSEPH LEFT ALONE WITH THE DUMB INSTRUMENTS
translated_text: The music was broken. And Joseph left alone with the dumb instruments.

text: BUT IN HIS HANDS SOLITUDE AND A VIOLIN WERE SURE TO MARRY IN MUSIC
translated_text: But in his hands, solitude and a violin were sure to marry in music.

text: THEY SAT DOWN AND LISTENED IN SILENCE
translated_text: They sat down and listened in silence.

text: HER HEART SEEMED TO SWELL UP INTO HER THROAT AND IT WAS ALL SHE COULD DO TO KEEP FROM WEEPING
translated_text: Her heart seemed to swell up into her throat, and it was all she could do to keep from weeping.

text: A LITTLE LONGER AND SHE WAS COMPELLED TO YIELD AND THE SILENT TEARS FLOWED FREELY
translated_text: A little longer, and she was compelled to yield, and the silent tears flowed freely.

text: LETTY TOO WAS OVERCOME MORE THAN EVER SHE HAD BEEN BY MUSIC
translated_text: Letty too was overcome, more than ever she had been by music.

text: LET BUT A MOOD BE STRONG ENOUGH AND THE SOUL CLOTHING ITSELF IN THAT MOOD AS WITH A GARMENT CAN WALK ABROAD AND HAUNT THE WORLD
translated_text: Let but a mood be strong enough. And the soul, clothing itself in that mood, is with a garment, can walk abroad, and haunt the world.

text: IT CRIED ALOUD THAT ETERNITY WAS VERY LONG AND LIKE A GREAT PALACE WITHOUT A QUIET ROOM
translated_text: It cried aloud that eternity was very long, and like a great palace, without a quiet room.

text: NOR WAS THIS EXACTLY THE SHAPE THE THING TOOK TO THE CONSCIOUSNESS OF THE MUSICIAN
translated_text: Nor was this exactly the shape the thing took to the consciousness of the musician.

text: I LOVE THEE I LOVE THEE CRIED THE VIOLIN AND THE WORSHIP WAS ENTREATY THAT KNEW NOT ITSELF
translated_text: I love the, I love the cried the violin, and the worship was in treaty that knew not itself.

text: HAST THOU YET TO LEARN THAT THE LOVE OF THE HUMAN IS LOVE IS DIVINE IS BUT A LOWER FORM OF A PART OF THE LOVE OF GOD
translated_text: has thou yet to learn that the love of the human is love, is divine, is but a lower form of the part of the love of God.

text: WHEN THOU LOVEST MAN OR WOMAN OR CHILD YEA OR EVEN DOG ARIGHT THEN WILT THOU NO LONGER NEED THAT I TELL THEE HOW GOD AND HIS CHRIST WOULD NOT BE CONTENT WITH EACH OTHER ALONE IN THE GLORIES EVEN OF THE ETERNAL ORIGINAL LOVE BECAUSE THEY COULD CREATE MORE LOVE
translated_text: When that love is man, or woman, or child, ye, or even dog, or right, then will thou no longer need that I tell thee? How God and His Christ would not be content with each other alone in the glories even of the eternal, original love, because they could create more love.

text: HE THAT LOVETH NOT HIS BROTHER WHOM HE HATH SEEN HOW SHALL HE LOVE GOD WHOM HE HATH NOT SEEN
translated_text: He that loveeth not his brother, whom he hath seen. How shall we love God whom he hath not seen?

text: A SOB LIKE A BIRD NEW BORN BURST FROM MARY'S BOSOM
translated_text: A sob, like a bird newborn, burst from Mary's bosom.

text: THAT ENCHANTMENT HAD POSSESSED HIM USURPING AS IT WERE THE THRONE OF HIS LIFE AND DISPLACING IT WHEN IT CEASED HE WAS NOT HIS OWN MASTER
translated_text: that enchantment had possessed him, assurping as it were the throne of his life and displacing it. When it ceased, he was not his own master.

text: HE STARTED TO CONSCIOUS CONFUSION ONLY NEITHER KNOWING WHERE HE WAS NOR WHAT HE DID
translated_text: He started to conscious confusion only, neither knowing where he was nor what he did.

text: HOW IT HAPPENED HE NEVER COULD TELL BUT HE BROUGHT DOWN HIS VIOLIN WITH A CRASH AGAINST THE PIANO THEN SOMEHOW STUMBLED AND ALL BUT FELL
translated_text: How it happened he never could tell, but he brought down his violin with a crash against the piano, then somehow stumbled and all but fell.

text: IN THE ACT OF RECOVERING HIMSELF HE HEARD THE NECK OF HIS INSTRUMENT PART FROM THE BODY WITH A TEARING DISCORDANT CRY LIKE THE SOUND OF THE RUIN OF A LIVING WORLD
translated_text: In the act of recovering himself, he heard the neck of his instrument part from the body with a tearing, discordant cry, like the sound of the ruin of a living world.

text: HIS VIOLIN WAS BROKEN BUT HIS BEING WAS MADE WHOLE
translated_text: His violin was broken, but his being was made whole.

text: HIS TREASURE TAKEN TYPE OF HIS SELF AND A WOMAN GIVEN HIM INSTEAD
translated_text: His treasure taken, type of his self, and a woman given him instead.

text: IT'S JUST LIKE HIM HE MURMURED
translated_text: It's just like him. He murmured.

text: YOU'LL ALL BE OVER IF YOU DON'T HAVE A CARE
translated_text: You'll all be over if you don't have a care.

text: LOOKS LIKE A CLUMP OF BUSHES DOWN THERE BUT I AIN'T SURE CAN YOU MAKE IT OUT
translated_text: Looks like a ton of bushes down there, but I ain't sure. Can you make it out?

text: YES AGREED TAD THAT DOES LOOK LIKE BUSHES
translated_text: Yes, agree, Ted. That does look like bushes.

text: DON'T MOVE AROUND LIE PERFECTLY STILL WARNED THE GUIDE ARE YOU HURT
translated_text: Don't move around like perfectly still warns the guide. Are you hurt?

text: AND THAT TUMBLE'S ENOUGH TO KNOCK THE SENSE OUT OF A FULL GROWN MAN
translated_text: and that tumble's enough to knock the scents out of a full grown man.

text: I COULD NOT THINK OF ALLOWING ANY OF MY CHARGES TO TAKE SO TERRIBLE A RISK AND
translated_text: I could not think of allowing any of my charges to take so terrible risk at

text: NO I AM THE LIGHTER OF THE TWO URGED TAD
translated_text: No, I am the lighter of the two, urged Tad.

text: I AM THE ONE TO GO AFTER WALT IF ANYONE HAS TO I'LL GO DOWN MISTER THOMAS
translated_text: I am the one to go after Walt if anyone has to. I'll go down, Mr. Thomas.

text: MASTER TAD IS RIGHT DECIDED THE GUIDE GAZING AT THE TWO BOYS APPROVINGLY
translated_text: Master Ted is right, decided the guide gazing at the two boys approvingly.

text: I PROTEST SHOUTED THE PROFESSOR
translated_text: I protest, shouted the professor.

text: YOU'D HAVE BOTH OF US AT THE BOTTOM IF I LEFT IT TO YOU TO TAKE CARE OF THIS END
translated_text: You'd have both of us at the bottom if I left it to you to take care of this end.

text: BE SURE TO FASTEN HIM SECURELY TO THE LOOP BEFORE YOU GIVE THE SIGNAL TO HAUL UP WARNED THE GUIDE
translated_text: Be sure to fasten him securely to the loop before you get the signal to haul up. Warn the guide.

text: ARE YOU READY YES
translated_text: Are you ready? Yes.

text: HE TILTED HIS HEAD TO LOOK UP
translated_text: He told it his head to look up.

text: THE MOVEMENT SENT HIS BODY SWAYING GIDDILY FROM SIDE TO SIDE
translated_text: The movement sent his body swaying giddily from side to side.

text: CAUTIOUSLY PLACING A HAND AGAINST THE ROCKS TO STEADY HIMSELF TAD WISELY CONCLUDED THAT HEREAFTER IT WOULD NOT PAY TO BE TOO CURIOUS
translated_text: cautiously placing a hand against the rock, dissenting himself. Ted wisely concluded that hereafter, it would not pay to be too curious.

text: SLOWLY BUT STEADILY THE SLENDER LINE WAS PAID OUT AMID A TENSE SILENCE ON THE PART OF THE LITTLE GROUP AT THE TOP OF THE CANYOU
translated_text: Slowly but steadily, the slender line was paid out, amid its tense silence on the part of the little group at the top of the canyon.

text: AFTER WHAT SEEMED TO THEM HOURS A SHARP CALL FROM THE DEPTHS REACHED THEIR EARS
translated_text: After what seemed to them hours, a sharp call from the depths reached their ears.

text: LIGE QUICKLY MADE FAST THE LINE TO A TREE
translated_text: Lies quickly make fast the line to a tree.

text: I SEE HIM CALLED TAD HIS VOICE SOUNDING HOLLOW AND UNNATURAL TO THOSE ABOVE
translated_text: I see him called Tad, his voice sending hollow and unnatural to those above.

text: HE'S SO FAR TO THE RIGHT OF ME THAT I CAN'T REACH HIM
translated_text: He is so far to the right of me that I can't reach him.

text: LODGED IN THE BRANCHES OF A PINYON TREE I THINK IT IS BUT HE DOESN'T ANSWER ME
translated_text: launched in the branches of opinion tree, I think it is, but he doesn't answer me.

text: LIGE LEANING OVER THE BRINK WAS ABLE TO FOLLOW THE BOY'S MOVEMENTS BY THE AID OF THE THIN ARC OF LIGHT MADE BY THE TORCH IN TAD'S HAND
translated_text: Lies, leaning over the brink, was able to follow the boy's movements by the aid of a thin arc of light made by the torch in Tad's hand.

text: BUT FROM THE CAUTIOUS MOVEMENTS OF THE LIGHT FAR BELOW THEM THE GUIDE UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LAD WAS AT WORK CARRYING OUT HIS PART OF THE TASK OF RESCUE TO THE BEST OF HIS ABILITY
translated_text: But from the cautious movements of the light far below them, the guide understood that the lad was at work carrying out his part of the task of rescue to the best of his ability.

text: MEBBY YOU THINK HE'S HAVING SOME SORT OF A PICNIC DOWN THERE EH GLARED LIGE
translated_text: Maybe you think he's having some sort of a picnic down there, eh? Laird Lodge.

text: SHALL WE HAUL UP ASKED LIGE MAKING A MEGAPHONE OF HIS HANDS YES HAUL AWAY
translated_text: Shall we haul up S. Lysh making a megaphone of his hands? Yes, haul away!

text: SURE THING ANSWERED THE BOY
translated_text: Sure thing answered the boy.

text: NOR WAS HIS SENSE OF SECURITY INCREASED WHEN IN SHIFTING HIS POSITION THE TORCH FELL FROM HIS GRASP THE FAGOTS SCATTERING AS THEY SLIPPED DOWN BETWEEN THE LIMBS OF THE TREE AND WHIRLING IN EVER DIMINISHING CIRCLES UNTIL FINALLY HE HEARD THEM CLATTER ON THE ROCKS BELOW
translated_text: Nor was the sense of security increased when, in shifting his position, the torch fell from his grasp. The faggot's scattering is a slip down between the limbs of the tree, and whirling in ever diminishing circles, until finally he heard them platter on the rocks below.

text: HE NO DOUBT WOULD BRING FOOD OF SOME KIND WITH HIM
translated_text: He no doubt would bring food of some kind with him.

text: WITH A SHOUT THE BOYS DASHED PELL MELL TO MEET THE PACK TRAIN AND FALLING IN BEHIND THE SLOW MOVING BURROS URGED THEM ON WITH DERISIVE SHOUTS AND SUNDRY RESOUNDING SLAPS ON THE ANIMALS FLANKS
translated_text: With a shout the boys dash pale male to meet the pack train, and falling in behind the slow-moving burrows urged them on with the rissif shouts and sundry resounding slaps on the animals' flanks.

text: COLD WATER IS THE MOST NOURISHING THING WE'VE TOUCHED SINCE LAST NIGHT
translated_text: Cold water is the most nourishing thing we've touched since last night.

text: WE DID NOT IT MUST HAVE COME TO LIFE SOME TIME DURING THE NIGHT AND DUG ITS WAY OUT LAUGHED TAD
translated_text: We did not. It must have come to life some time during the night and dug its way out, left head.

text: AND WE'VE GOT A SURPRISE FOR YOU ANNOUNCED STACY SWELLING WITH PRIDE
translated_text: and we've got a surprise for you and now it's Stacy swelling with pride.

text: JAM EXCLAIMED CHUNKY STRETCHING HIS NECK AND EYEING THE DISH LONGINGLY
translated_text: Jam, explain chunky, stretching his neck and eyeing the dish longingly.

text: NOW FALL TO YOUNG GENTLEMEN DIRECTED THE PROFESSOR
translated_text: Now fall to young gentleman directed the professor.

text: I AM FREE TO ADMIT THAT I AM HUNGRY TOO
