translated_text: I am free to admit that I am hungry too.

text: HE BURIED HIS BISCUIT UNDER A LAYER OF JAM OVER WHICH HE SPREAD A THICK COATING OF HONEY
translated_text: He buried his biscuit under a layer of jam, over which he spread a thick coating of honey.

text: PRESIDENT BROWN I WITHDRAW MY CRITICISM I OFFER YOU MY HUMBLE APOLOGIES
translated_text: President Brown, I withdraw my criticism. I offer you my humble apologies.

text: I RECKON THERE ARE SMILED THE GUIDE WE ARE IN THE BEAR COUNTRY NOW
translated_text: I reckon there are smiled the guide. We are in the bear country now.

text: YES THE COUNTRY IS FULL OF CAVES
translated_text: Yes, the country is full of caves.

text: THIS ANNOUNCEMENT FILLED THE BOYS WITH EXCITEMENT
translated_text: This announcement filled the boys with excitement!

text: BUT I KNOW AN OLD SETTLER WHO WILL LEND US HIS DOG IF IT IS NOT OUT
translated_text: But I know an old settler who will let us his dog if it is not out.

text: SUPPER HAVING BEEN FINISHED THE PARTY GATHERED ABOUT THE CAMP FIRE FOR THEIR EVENING CHAT AFTER WHICH ADMONISHING STACY TO KEEP WITHIN HIS TENT AND NOT TO GO BORROWING TROUBLE THE BOYS TURNED IN FOR A SOUND SLEEP
translated_text: Sipper having been finished, the party gathered about the campfire for their evening chat, after which it's managing Sacy to keep with his tent and not to go borrowing trouble, the boys turned in for a sound sleep.

text: AS YET THEY HAD BEEN UNABLE TO ATTEMPT ANY FANCY RIDING WITH THEIR PONIES OWING TO THE RUGGED NATURE OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH WHICH THEY HAD BEEN JOURNEYING
translated_text: And yet they had been unable to attempt any fancy writing with their ponies owing to the rugged nature of the country through which they had been journeying.

text: THE BOYS WERE NOW ALL ANXIETY TO START WHILE THE PONIES AFTER THEIR SUNDAY REST WERE ALMOST AS FULL OF LIFE AS WERE THEIR OWNERS
translated_text: The boys were now all anxiety to start, while the ponies after their Sunday rest were almost as full of life as were their owners.

text: THE LITTLE ANIMALS WERE BECOMING MORE SURE FOOTED EVERY DAY AND NED SAID THAT BEFORE THE TRIP WAS FINISHED JIMMIE WOULD BE ABLE TO WALK A SLACK ROPE
translated_text: The little animals were becoming more surefooted every day, and Ned said that before the trip was finished, Jimmy would be able to walk a slack rope.

text: AN EARLY START WAS MADE SO THAT THE PARTY REACHED THE PROMISED TABLE LANDS SHORTLY BEFORE TEN O'CLOCK IN THE FORENOON
translated_text: An early start was made so that the party reached the promised table-end shortly before 10 o'clock in the forenoon.

text: A TEMPORARY CAMP WAS QUICKLY PITCHED
translated_text: A temporary camp was quickly pitched.

text: THE GREAT GREEN FIELD SURROUNDED ON ALL SIDES BY TALL TREES MADE THE PLACE AN IDEAL ONE FOR THEIR PURPOSE
translated_text: The great greenfield, surrendered on all sides by tall trees, made the place an ideal one for their purpose.

text: IT WAS A BEAUTIFUL RACE THE LITTLE INDIAN PONIES SEEMING TO ENTER THOROUGHLY INTO THE SPIRIT OF THE CONTEST STRETCHING THEMSELVES OUT TO THEIR FULL LENGTHS AND WITH HEADS ON A LEVEL WITH THEIR BACKS FAIRLY FLEW ACROSS THE GREAT PLOT OF GREEN
translated_text: It was a beautiful race, the little Indian pony seeming to enter thoroughly into the spirit of the contest, stretching themselves out to their full lengths, and with heads on a level with their backs fairly flew across the great plot of green.

text: ALL AGREED THAT TAD'S SUPERIOR HORSEMANSHIP ALONE HAD WON THE RACE FOR HIM
translated_text: All agreed that Ted superior horsemanship alone had won the race for him.

text: GALLOPING INTO CAMP THE BOY FETCHED HIS SOMBRERO WHICH HE CARRIED WELL OUT INTO THE FIELD AND TOSSED AWAY
translated_text: Galloping into camp, the boy fetched his sombrero, which he carried well out into the field and tossed away.

text: THEN BIDDING THE BOYS RIDE UP NEAR THE SPOT TO WATCH HIM HE DREW OFF SOME TEN RODS AND WHEELING SPURRED HIS PONY TO A RUN
translated_text: Then, milling the boys right up near the spot to watch him, he drew off some ten rods, and wheeling spurred his ponytail red.

text: GRASPING THE POMMEL WITH THE LEFT HAND HE APPEARED TO DIVE HEAD FIRST TOWARD THE GROUND
translated_text: grasping the pummel with the left hand, he appeared to dive headfirst toward the ground.

text: THEY SAW HIS LONG HAIR ALMOST BRUSH THE GRASS ONE OF HIS HANDS SWEPT DOWN AND UP AND ONCE MORE TAD BUTLER ROSE STANDING IN HIS STIRRUPS UTTERING A COWBOY YELL AS HE WAVED THE SOMBRERO ON HIGH
translated_text: They saw his long hair almost brush the grass. One of his hands swept down and up, and once more, Ted Butler rose standing in his strips, uttering a cowboy yell as he waved his sombrero and high.

text: THE BOYS HOWLED WITH DELIGHT THAT IS ALL DID SAVE STACY BROWN
translated_text: That boy is held with delight. That is all did save Stacey Brown.

text: TAD IS AN EXPERIENCED RIDER
translated_text: Ted is an experienced writer.

text: THE FIRST TIME HE RODE SWIFTLY BY IT LEANING OVER TO LOOK AT THE HAT AS HE PASSED HOLDING TO THE POMMEL FIRMLY WITH HIS LEFT HAND
translated_text: The first time he rode swiftly by it, leading over to look at the hat as he passed, holding to the pommel firmly with his left hand.

text: WHAT'S THAT FOR DEMANDED NED WONDERINGLY
translated_text: What's that for demanded Ned wonderingly?

text: HAT TOO CLOSE TO ME I COULDN'T GET IT EXPLAINED CHUNKY THE BOYS ROARED
translated_text: Hat too close to me. I couldn't get it explained, chunky. The boys roared.

text: WHY DON'T YOU MOVE THE PONY
translated_text: Why don't you move the pony?

text: ONCE MORE STACY APPROACHED THE SOMBRERO HIS PONY RUNNING WELL AND AS HE DREW NEAR IT THEY SAW HIM RISE IN HIS SADDLE JUST AS TAD BUTLER HAD DONE A FEW MINUTES BEFORE
translated_text: Once more Stacey approached the sombrero, his pony running well. In Essie Drew near it, they saw him rise in the saddle, just as Ted Butler had done a few minutes before.

text: AT THE MOMENT WHEN HE FREED HIS LEFT FOOT FROM THE STIRRUP HE THREW HIS BODY SHARPLY TO THE RIGHT REACHING FOR THE HAT WITHOUT TAKING THE PRECAUTION TO GRASP THE POMMEL
translated_text: At the moment when he freed his left foot from the stirrup, he threw his body sharply to the right, reaching for the hat without taking the precaution to grasp the pommel.

text: AS A RESULT INSTEAD OF STOPPING WHEN HE REACHED THE HAT THE BOY KEPT ON GOING
translated_text: As a result, instead of stopping when he reached the hat, the boy kept on going.

text: CHAPTER FOUR THE FIRST NIGHT IN CAMP
translated_text: Chapter 4, The First Night in Camp.

text: EVEN IF I CAN'T SING I CAN BEAT THAT
translated_text: Even if I can't sing, I can beat that.

text: NOT ON THE RANGE WHY NOT DEMANDED THE BOY
translated_text: No, not on the range. Why not, demanded the boy?

text: A LOUD LAUGH FOLLOWED AT CHUNKY'S EXPENSE
translated_text: A loud laugh followed at Chumkey's expense.

text: THE PONY DID MOST OF IT ADMITTED THE LAD I JUST GAVE HIM HIS HEAD AND THAT'S ALL THERE WAS TO IT
translated_text: The pony did most of it, admitted the lad. I just gave him his head, and that's all there was to it.

text: WALTER HAD GONE OUT WITH THE SECOND GUARD AND THE OTHERS HAD GATHERED AROUND THE CAMP FIRE FOR THEIR NIGHTLY STORY TELLING
translated_text: Walter had gone out with the second guard, and the others had gathered around the campfire for their nightly storytelling.

text: NONE OF YOU WILL BE FIT FOR DUTY TO MORROW
translated_text: None of you will be fit for duty tomorrow.

text: WE'VE GOT A HARD DRIVE BEFORE US AND EVERY MAN MUST BE FIT AS A FIDDLE
translated_text: We've got a hard drive before us and every man best be fit as a fiddle.

text: HUMPH GRUNTED CURLEY ADAMS
translated_text: Oh, guarded curly atoms.

text: THE COWBOY DID THIS VERY THING BUT WITHIN AN HOUR HE FOUND HIMSELF ALONE THE OTHERS HAVING TURNED IN ONE BY ONE
translated_text: The cowboy did this very thing, but within an hour he found himself alone. The others, having turned in, one by one.

text: THE LADS FOUND THAT A PAIR OF BLANKETS HAD BEEN ASSIGNED TO EACH OF THEM WITH AN ORDINARY WAGON SHEET DOUBLED FOR A TARPAULIN
translated_text: The lads found that a pair of blankets had been assigned to each of them, with an ordinary wagon sheet doubled for a tarpoline.

text: THESE THEY SPREAD OUT ON THE GROUND USING BOOTS WRAPPED IN COATS FOR PILLOWS
translated_text: These they spread out on the ground using boots wrapped in coats for pillows.

text: STACY BROWN PROVED THE ONLY GRUMBLER IN THE LOT DECLARING THAT HE COULD NOT SLEEP A WINK ON SUCH A BED AS THAT
translated_text: Stacey Brown proved the only grumbler in the lot, declaring that he could not sleep a week on such a bad as that.

text: THE HORSES OF THE OUTFIT SAVE THOSE THAT WERE ON NIGHT DUTY AND TWO OR THREE OTHERS THAT HAD DEVELOPED A HABIT OF STRAYING HAD BEEN TURNED LOOSE EARLY IN THE EVENING FOR ANIMALS ON THE TRAIL ARE SELDOM STAKED DOWN
translated_text: The horses of the outfit saved those that were on night duty and two or three others that had developed a habit of straying had been turned loose early in the evening for animals on the trail or seldom staked down.

text: IN SPITE OF THEIR HARD COUCHES THE PONY RIDERS SLEPT SOUNDLY EVEN PROFESSOR ZEPPLIN HIMSELF NEVER WAKING THE WHOLE NIGHT THROUGH
translated_text: In spite of their hard couches, the pony riders slept soundly, even Professor Zeppelin himself never waking the whole night through.

text: STACY GRUMBLED TURNED OVER AND WENT TO SLEEP AGAIN
translated_text: It's actually grumbled, turned over, and went to sleep again.

text: YOU WON'T BE SO FAST TO WAKE UP HARD WORKING COWBOYS AFTER THAT I RECKON
translated_text: You won't be so fast to wake up hardworking cowboys after that, I reckon.

text: LUMPY BATES CAME RUNNING TOWARD HIM NOT DARING TO CALL OUT FOR FEAR OF WAKING THE CAMP
translated_text: Lumpy Bates came running toward him, not daring to call out for fear of waking the camp.

text: HI THERE HISSED LUMPY FILLED WITH INDIGNATION THAT ANYONE SHOULD ATTEMPT TO MOUNT A PONY FROM THE RIGHT SIDE
translated_text: Hi there, his lumpy, filled with dignity nation that anyone should attempt to mount a pony from the right side.

text: STACY BROWN'S LEFT LEG SWUNG OVER THE SADDLE
translated_text: Sacy Brown's left leg swung over the saddle.

text: WHERE ARE THEY ASKED THE BOY
translated_text: Where are they? Ask the boy?

text: KEEP A GOING AND IF YOU'RE LUCKY YOU'LL RUN PLUMB INTO THEM WAS THE JEERING ANSWER AS THE SLEEPY COWMEN SPURRED THEIR PONIES ON TOWARD CAMP MUTTERING THEIR DISAPPROVAL OF TAKING ALONG A BUNCH OF BOYS ON A CATTLE DRIVE
translated_text: Keep it going, and if your lucky old run plum into them was the jeering answers, the sleepy cowman spurred their ponies on toward camp, muttering their disapproval of taking a long bunch of boys on the cattle drive.

text: ALMOST BEFORE THE ECHOES OF HIS VOICE HAD DIED AWAY A SHRILL VOICE PIPED UP FROM THE TAIL END OF THE CHUCK WAGON
translated_text: Unless before the echoes of his voice and died away, a shrill voice piped up from the tail end of the chuck wagon.

text: GRUB PI LE GRUB PI LE
translated_text: Grip pile, grip pile

text: WHO IS THE WRANGLER THIS MORNING ASKED THE FOREMAN GLANCING ABOUT AT HIS MEN
translated_text: Who is the Wrangler this morning? Ask the foreman, glancing about at his men.

text: A WRANGLER'S A WRANGLER ANSWERED BIG FOOT STOLIDLY
translated_text: A Wrangler is a Wrangler answered bigfoot stottily.

text: HE'S A FELLOW WHO'S ALL THE TIME MAKING TROUBLE ISN'T HE ASKED STACY INNOCENTLY
translated_text: He's a fellow who's all the time making trouble isn't he? S. D.C. In the silly.

text: OH NO THIS KIND OF A WRANGLER ISN'T LAUGHED THE FOREMAN
translated_text: Oh no, this kind of a wrangler isn't left, the foreman.

text: HE'S A TROUBLE CURER NOT A TROUBLEMAKER EXCEPT FOR HIMSELF
translated_text: He's a troubled cure, not a troubled maker, except for himself.

text: PONG TELL THE YOUNG GENTLEMEN WHAT WOULD BECOME OF YOU IF YOU WERE TO SERVE BAD MEALS TO THIS OUTFIT OF COWPUNCHERS
translated_text: Pong, tell the young gentleman what would become of you if you were to serve bad meals to this output of cowpenters.

text: HOW ASKED TAD
translated_text: How? Asked Pad?

text: WE HAD BETTER START THE DRIVE THIS MORNING
translated_text: We had better start the drive this morning.

text: WHAT A FUSS IS MADE ABOUT YOU MY DEAR LITTLE FRIENDS
translated_text: What a fuss is made about you, my dear little friends.

text: YOU SURELY CANNOT SUPPOSE THAT IN A NATURAL STATE YOU WOULD BE FORCED TO CLIMB REGULARLY UP ONE TALL BARE STICK SUCH AS I SEE YOU UPON NOW
translated_text: You surely cannot suppose that in a natural state you would be forced to climb regularly up one tall bare stick, such as I see you upon now.

text: YOUR COUSIN THE WILD CONVOLVULUS WHOM I LEFT IN THE FIELDS THIS MORNING DOES NO SUCH THING I ASSURE YOU
translated_text: Your cousin, the wild convolvulus, whom I left in the fields this morning, does no such thing I assure you.

text: MY YOUNG PLANTS REQUIRE HEAT OR THEY WOULD NOT LIVE AND THE POTS WE ARE KEPT IN PROTECT US FROM THOSE CRUEL WIRE WORMS WHO DELIGHT TO DESTROY OUR ROOTS
translated_text: My young plants require heat, or they would not live. And the pots we are kept in protect us from those cruel wire worms who delight to destroy our roots.

text: WHY NOT ALLOW YOUR SILVER TUFTS TO LUXURIATE IN A NATURAL MANNER
translated_text: Why not allow your silver tufts to luxuriate in a natural manner?

text: STILL THE ROSE TREE STOOD OUT THAT THERE MUST BE SOME GREAT ADVANTAGES IN A GARDENER'S CARE FOR SHE COULD NOT PRETEND TO BE IGNORANT OF HER OWN SUPERIORITY TO ALL HER WILD RELATIONS IN THE WOODS
translated_text: Still, the rose tree stood out that there must be some great advantages in a gardener's care, for she could not pretend to be ignorant of her own superiority to all her wild relations and the woods.

text: THEN THE WIND TOOK ANOTHER FROLIC ROUND THE GARDEN AND MADE UP TO THE LARGE WHITE LILY INTO WHOSE REFINED EAR HE WHISPERED A DOUBT AS TO THE NECESSITY OR ADVANTAGE OF HER THICK POWERFUL STEM BEING PROPPED UP AGAINST A STUPID UGLY STICK
translated_text: Then the wind took another frolic round the garden, and made up to the large white lily, into whose refined ear he whispered a doubt as to the necessity or advantage of her thick, powerful stem being propped up against a stupid ugly stick.

text: HE REALLY GRIEVED TO SEE IT
translated_text: He really grieved to see it.

text: DID THAT LOVELY CREATURE SUPPOSE THAT NATURE WHO HAD DONE SO MUCH FOR HER THAT THE FAME OF HER BEAUTY EXTENDED THROUGHOUT THE WORLD HAD YET LEFT HER SO WEAK AND FEEBLE THAT SHE COULD NOT SUPPORT HERSELF IN THE POSITION MOST CALCULATED TO GIVE HER EASE AND PLEASURE
translated_text: Did that lovely creature suppose that nature, who had done so much for her that the fame of her beauty extended throughout the world, had yet left her so weak and feeble that she could not support herself in the position most calculated to give her ease and pleasure?

text: INDEED NOT A FLOWER ESCAPED HIS MISCHIEVOUS SUGGESTIONS
translated_text: Indeed, not a flower escaped his mischievous suggestions.

text: ECHOED THE FLOWERS TREMULOUSLY AS WITH A SORT OF FEARFUL PLEASURE THEY AWAITED HIS APPROACH
translated_text: echoed the flowers, tremulously, as with a sort of fearful pleasure, they awaited his approach.

text: MAKING A SORT OF EDDYING CIRCUIT ROUND THE GARDEN HE KNOCKED OVER THE CONVOLVULUS POLE TORE THE STRIPS FROM THE STICK THAT HELD UP THE WHITE LILY LOOSED ALL THE CARNATION FLOWERS FROM THEIR FASTENINGS BROKE THE ROSE TREE DOWN AND LEVELLED THE SWEET PEAS TO THE GROUND
translated_text: Making a sort of eddying circuit round the garden, he knocked over the convolvillus pole, tore the strips from the stick that held up the white lily, loosed all the carnation flowers from their fastenings, broke the rose tree down and levelled the sweet peas to the ground.

text: MEANWHILE HOW FARED IT WITH THE FLOWERS
translated_text: Meanwhile, how fair did it with the flowers?

text: OH THAT SHE WERE ONCE MORE CLIMBING UP THE FRIENDLY FIR POLE
translated_text: Oh, that she were once more climbing up the friendly fur pole!

text: THE HONEYSUCKLE ESCAPED NO BETTER AND THE CARNATION WAS READY TO DIE OF VEXATION AT FINDING THAT HER COVETED FREEDOM HAD LEVELLED HER TO THE DIRT
translated_text: The honey-suckle escaped no better, and the carnation was ready to die of vexation, at finding that her coveted freedom had leveled her to the dirt.

text: BEFORE THE DAY CLOSED THE GARDENER CAME WHISTLING FROM HIS FARM WORK TO LOOK OVER HIS PRETTY CHARGES
translated_text: Before the day closed, the gardener came whistling from his farm work to look over his pretty charges.

text: BUT FOR THE SIGHT THAT AWAITED HIM HE WAS NOT PREPARED AT ALL
translated_text: But for the sight that awaited him, he was not prepared at all.

text: WEEDS MEANWHILE SPRANG UP AND A DREARY CONFUSION REIGNED IN THE ONCE ORDERLY AND BRILLIANT LITTLE GARDEN
translated_text: Weeds, meanwhile, sprang up, and a dreary confusion reigned in the once-orderly and brilliant little garden.

text: THE MISTRESS HAD RETURNED AND THE YOUNG LADY WAS WITH HER AND HURRIED AT ONCE TO HER FAVOURITE GARDEN
translated_text: The mistress had returned, and the young lady was with her, and hurried at once to her favorite garden.

text: IN THIS POSITION SHE REMAINED UNTIL A GENTLE HAND WAS LAID UPON HER SHOULDER
translated_text: In this position, she remained until a gentle hand was laid upon her shoulder.

text: I AM NOT THINKING ABOUT THE GARDEN MAMMA REPLIED THE YOUNG GIRL WITHOUT LIFTING UP HER FACE WE CAN PLANT NEW FLOWERS AND TIE UP EVEN SOME OF THESE AFRESH
translated_text: I am not thinking about the garden, Mama," replied the young girl, without lifting up her face. We can plant new flowers and tie up even some of these afresh.

text: IN THOSE VERY EARLY TIMES THERE WAS A MAN NAMED DEUCALION AND HE WAS THE SON OF PROMETHEUS
translated_text: In those very early times there was a man named Ducailian, and he was the son of Prometheus.

text: AFTER JUPITER HAD BOUND PROMETHEUS ON MOUNT CAUCASUS AND HAD SENT DISEASES AND CARES INTO THE WORLD MEN BECAME VERY VERY WICKED
translated_text: After Jupiter had bound Prometheus on Mount Caucasus and had sent diseases and cares into the world, men became very, very wicked.

text: THESE MEN HE SAID TO HIS MIGHTY COMPANY ARE NOTHING BUT A SOURCE OF TROUBLE
translated_text: These men, he said to his mighty company, are nothing but a source of trouble.

text: BUT MEN KEPT ON FIGHTING AND ROBBING EVEN WHILE THE RAIN WAS POURING DOWN AND THE SEA WAS COMING UP OVER THE LAND
translated_text: But men kept on fighting and robbing, even while the rain was pouring down, and the sea was coming up over the land.

text: NO ONE BUT DEUCALION THE SON OF PROMETHEUS WAS READY FOR SUCH A STORM
translated_text: No one but to Calian, the son of Prometheus, was ready for such a storm.

text: THE DAY IS COMING SAID PROMETHEUS WHEN JUPITER WILL SEND A FLOOD TO DESTROY MANKIND FROM THE EARTH
translated_text: The day is coming," said Pometheus. When Jupiter will send a flood to destroy mankind from the earth,

text: BUT DEUCALION AND PYRRHA WERE VERY SAD FOR THEY KNEW THAT THEY WERE THE ONLY PERSONS WHO WERE LEFT ALIVE IN ALL THE LAND
translated_text: But Dukalian and Pira were very sad, for they knew that they were the only persons who were left alive in all the land.

text: IS THERE ANYTHING THAT YOU WISH HE ASKED
translated_text: Is there anything that you wish? He asked.

text: WE SHOULD LIKE ABOVE ALL THINGS SAID DEUCALION TO SEE THIS LAND FULL OF PEOPLE ONCE MORE FOR WITHOUT NEIGHBORS AND FRIENDS THE WORLD IS A VERY LONELY PLACE INDEED
translated_text: We should like above all things," said Eukalyin. To see this land full of people once more, for without neighbors and friends, the world is a very lonely place indeed.

text: GO ON DOWN THE MOUNTAIN SAID MERCURY AND AS YOU GO CAST THE BONES OF YOUR MOTHER OVER YOUR SHOULDERS BEHIND YOU AND WITH THESE WORDS HE LEAPED INTO THE AIR AND WAS SEEN NO MORE
translated_text: Go on down the mountain," said Mercury. And as you go, cast the bones of your mother over your shoulders behind you. And with these words, he leapt into the air and was seen no more.

text: WHAT DID HE MEAN ASKED PYRRHA
translated_text: What did he mean? Asked Perra.

text: SURELY I DO NOT KNOW SAID DEUCALION
translated_text: Surely I do not know," said Duke Alien.

text: WHEN AT LAST THEY REACHED THE PLAIN THEY FOUND THEMSELVES AT THE HEAD OF A NOBLE COMPANY OF HUMAN BEINGS ALL EAGER TO SERVE THEM
translated_text: When at last they reached the plain, they found themselves at the head of a noble company of human beings, all eager to serve them.

text: WHEN AT LAST THE QUEEN GAVE BIRTH TO A DAUGHTER THE KING WAS SO OVERJOYED THAT HE GAVE A GREAT CHRISTENING FEAST THE LIKE OF WHICH HAD NEVER BEFORE BEEN KNOWN
translated_text: When at last the queen gave birth to a daughter, the king was so overjoyed that he gave a great christening feast, the like of which had never before been known.

text: ONE OF THE YOUNG FAIRIES OVERHEARING HER AND FANCYING SHE MIGHT WORK SOME MISCHIEF TO THE LITTLE BABY WENT AND HID HERSELF BEHIND THE HANGINGS IN THE HALL SO AS TO BE ABLE TO HAVE THE LAST WORD AND UNDO ANY HARM THE OLD FAIRY MIGHT WISH TO WORK
translated_text: One of the young fairies, overhearing her, and bansing she might work some mischief to the little baby, went and hid herself behind the hangings in the hall, so as to be able to have the last word and undo any harm the old fairy might wish to work.

text: THE TURN OF THE OLD FAIRY HAD NOW COME AND SHE DECLARED WHILE HER HEAD SHOOK WITH MALICE THAT THE PRINCESS SHOULD PIERCE HER HAND WITH A SPINDLE AND DIE OF THE WOUND
translated_text: The turn of the old fairy had now come, and she declared, while her head shook with malice, that the princess should pierce her hand with a spindle and die of the wound.

text: IT IS TRUE I CANNOT ENTIRELY UNDO WHAT MY ELDER HAS DONE
translated_text: It is true I can on entirely undo what my elder has done.

text: NOW FIFTEEN YEARS AFTER THE PRINCESS WAS BORN SHE WAS WITH THE KING AND QUEEN AT ONE OF THEIR CASTLES AND AS SHE WAS RUNNING ABOUT BY HERSELF SHE CAME TO A LITTLE CHAMBER AT THE TOP OF A TOWER AND THERE SAT AN HONEST OLD WOMAN SPINNING FOR SHE HAD NEVER HEARD OF THE KING'S EDICT
translated_text: Now, fifteen years after the princess was born, she was with the king and queen, one of their castles, and as she was running about by herself, she came to a little chamber at the top of a tower, and there sat an honest old woman spinning, but she had never heard of the king's edict.

text: SHE HAD NO SOONER TAKEN UP THE SPINDLE THAN BEING HASTY AND CARELESS SHE PIERCED HER HAND WITH THE POINT OF IT AND FAINTED AWAY
translated_text: She had no sooner taken up the spindle than being hasty and careless. She pierced her hand with the point of it and famed it away.

text: HE KNEW THAT SHE WOULD NOT AWAKE FOR A HUNDRED YEARS
translated_text: He knew that she would not awake for a hundred years.

text: ONE SAID IT WAS AN ENCHANTED CASTLE ANOTHER THAT WITCHES LIVED THERE BUT MOST BELIEVED THAT IT WAS OCCUPIED BY A GREAT OGRE WHICH CARRIED THITHER ALL THE CHILDREN HE COULD CATCH AND ATE THEM UP ONE AT A TIME FOR NOBODY COULD GET AT HIM THROUGH THE WOOD
translated_text: One said it was an enchanted castle, another that witches lived there. But most believed that it was occupied by a great ogre, which carried the other all the children he could catch and ate them up one at a time, for nobody could get Adams through the wood.

text: THE YOUNG PRINCE AT THESE WORDS FELT HIMSELF ON FIRE
translated_text: The young prince at these words, felt himself on fire.

text: SCARCELY HAD HE COME TO THE WOOD WHEN ALL THE TREES AND THORNS WHICH HAD MADE SUCH AN IMPENETRABLE THICKET OPENED ON ONE SIDE AND THE OTHER TO OFFER HIM A PATH
translated_text: Scarsely had he come to the wood, when all the trees and thorns which had made such an impenetable thicket, opened on one side and the other to offer him a path.

text: HE ENTERED A LARGE FORECOURT AND STOOD STILL WITH AMAZEMENT AND AWE
translated_text: He entered a large forecourt and stood still with amazement and awe.

text: BUT THE FACES OF THE MEN WERE ROSY AND THE GOBLETS BY THEM HAD A FEW DROPS OF WINE LEFT
translated_text: But the faces of the men were rosy, and the goblets by them had a few drops of wine left.

text: HE ENTERED THE GUARD ROOM THERE THE GUARDS STOOD DRAWN UP IN LINE WITH CARBINES AT THEIR SHOULDERS BUT THEY WERE SOUND ASLEEP
translated_text: He entered the guard room. There the guards stood drawn up in line with carbines at their shoulders. But they were sound asleep.

text: HE PASSED THROUGH ONE APARTMENT AFTER ANOTHER WHERE WERE LADIES AND GENTLEMEN ASLEEP IN THEIR CHAIRS OR STANDING
translated_text: He passed through one apartment after another, where were ladies and gentlemen asleep in their chairs or standing.

text: I HAVE WAITED LONG FOR YOU
translated_text: I have waited long for you.

text: THEY TALKED FOR FOUR HOURS AND HAD NOT THEN SAID HALF THAT WAS IN THEIR HEADS TO SAY
translated_text: They talked for four hours, and had not then said half that was in their heads to say.

text: MEANWHILE ALL THE REST OF THE PEOPLE IN THE CASTLE HAD BEEN WAKENED AT THE SAME MOMENT AS THE PRINCESS AND THEY WERE NOW EXTREMELY HUNGRY
translated_text: Meanwhile, all the rest of the people in the castle had been awakened at the same moment as the princess, and they were now extremely hungry.

text: THE LADY IN WAITING BECAME VERY IMPATIENT AND AT LENGTH ANNOUNCED TO THE PRINCESS THAT THEY ALL WAITED FOR HER
translated_text: The lady in waiting became very impatient, and at length announced to the princess that they all waited for her.

text: THEN THE PRINCE TOOK THE PRINCESS BY THE HAND SHE WAS DRESSED IN GREAT SPLENDOUR BUT HE DID NOT HINT THAT SHE LOOKED AS HE HAD SEEN PICTURES OF HIS GREAT GRANDMOTHER LOOK HE THOUGHT HER ALL THE MORE CHARMING FOR THAT
translated_text: Then the prince took the princess by the hand. She was dressed in great splendor. But he did not hint that she looked as he had seen pictures of his great grandmother look. He thought her all the more charming for that.

text: THE VIOLINS AND HAUT BOYS PLAYED OLD BUT EXCELLENT PIECES OF MUSIC AND AFTER SUPPER TO LOSE NO TIME THE GRAND ALMONER MARRIED THE ROYAL LOVERS IN THE CHAPEL OF THE CASTLE
translated_text: The violins and hoboys played old but excellent pieces of music, and after supper, to lose no time, the grand almener married the royal lovers and the chapel of the castle.

text: HE TURNED TO SHOW THEM THE CASTLE BUT BEHOLD
translated_text: He turned to show them the castle, but behold.

text: WHEN SHE SAID GOOD NIGHT TO BEENIE AND WENT TO HER CHAMBER OVER THAT WHERE THE LOVED PARENT AND FRIEND WOULD FALL ASLEEP NO MORE SHE FELT AS IF SHE WENT WALKING ALONG TO HER TOMB
translated_text: When she said goodnight to Beanie and went to her chamber, over that where the loved parent and friend would fall asleep no more, she felt as if she went walking along to her tomb.

text: AT THE TIME MARY HAD NOTED NOTHING OF THESE THINGS NOW SHE SAW THEM ALL AS FOR THE FIRST TIME IN MINUTE DETAIL WHILE SLOWLY SHE WENT UP THE STAIR AND THROUGH THE NARROWED WAYS AND HEARD THE SAME WIND THAT RAVED ALIKE ABOUT THE NEW GRAVE AND THE OLD HOUSE INTO WHICH LATTER FOR ALL THE BALES BANKED AGAINST THE WALLS IT FOUND MANY A CHINK OF ENTRANCE
translated_text: At the time Mary had noted nothing of these things, now she saw them all. As for the first time, in minute detail, while slowly she went up the stair and threw the narrowed ways, and heard the same wind that raved alike about the new grave and the old house, into which latter, for all the bails banked against the walls, it found many a chink of entrance.

text: WHEN SHE OPENED THE DOOR OF IT THE BRIGHT FIRE WHICH BEENIE UNDESIRED HAD KINDLED THERE STARTLED HER THE ROOM LOOKED UNNATURAL UNCANNY BECAUSE IT WAS CHEERFUL
translated_text: When she opened the door of it, the bright fire which beanie undesired had kindled there startled her. The room looked unnatural, uncanny, because it was cheerful.

text: SHE STOOD FOR A MOMENT ON THE HEARTH AND IN SAD DREAMY MOOD LISTENED TO THE HOWLING SWOOPS OF THE WIND MAKING THE HOUSE QUIVER AND SHAKE
translated_text: She stood for a moment on the hearth, and in sad, dreamy mood, listened to the howling swoops of the wind, making the house quiver and shake.

text: THIS WAS HER DREAM AS NEARLY AS SHE COULD RECALL IT WHEN SHE CAME TO HERSELF AFTER WAKING FROM IT WITH A CRY
translated_text: This was her dream, as nearly as she could recall it, when she came to herself after waking from it with a cry.

text: SHE WAS ONE OF A LARGE COMPANY AT A HOUSE WHERE SHE HAD NEVER BEEN BEFORE A BEAUTIFUL HOUSE WITH A LARGE GARDEN BEHIND
translated_text: She was one of a large company at a house where she had never been before, a beautiful house, with a large garden behind.

text: IT WAS A SUMMER NIGHT AND THE GUESTS WERE WANDERING IN AND OUT AT WILL AND THROUGH HOUSE AND GARDEN AMID LOVELY THINGS OF ALL COLORS AND ODORS
translated_text: It was a summer night, and the guests were wandering in and out at will, and through house and garden amid lovely things of all colors and odors.

text: BUT SHE KNEW NOBODY AND WANDERED ALONE IN THE GARDEN OPPRESSED WITH SOMETHING SHE DID NOT UNDERSTAND
translated_text: But she knew nobody, and wandered alone in the garden, oppressed with something she did not understand.

text: AT THE END OF IT SHE WAS IN A PLACE OF TOMBS
translated_text: At the end of it, she was in a place of tombs.

text: SHE ENTERED AND THE SERVANTS SOFT FOOTED AND SILENT WERE BUSY CARRYING AWAY THE VESSELS OF HOSPITALITY AND RESTORING ORDER AS IF ALREADY THEY PREPARED FOR ANOTHER COMPANY ON THE MORROW NO ONE HEEDED HER
translated_text: She entered, and the servants, soft-footed and silent, were busy carrying away the vessels of hospitality and restoring order, as if already they prepared for another company on the Morrow. No one heated her.

text: SHE WAS LOST LOST UTTERLY WITH AN ETERNAL LOSS
translated_text: She was lost, lost utterly, with an eternal loss.

text: SHE KNEW NOTHING OF THE PLACE HAD NOWHERE TO GO NOWHERE SHE WANTED TO GO HAD NOT A THOUGHT TO TELL HER WHAT QUESTION TO ASK IF SHE MET A LIVING SOUL
translated_text: She knew nothing of the place had nowhere to go, know where she wanted to go, had not a thought to tell her what question to ask if she met a living soul.

text: BUT LIVING SOUL THERE COULD BE NONE TO MEET
translated_text: but living soul there could be none to meet.

text: SHE HAD LOST HIM YEARS AND YEARS BEFORE AND NOW SHE SAW HIM HE WAS THERE AND SHE KNEW HIM
translated_text: She had lost him years and years before, and now she saw him. He was there and she knew him.

text: HE CAME TO HER SIDE AND SHE GAVE HIM NO GREETING
translated_text: He came to her side and she gave him no greeting.

text: I KNOW IT AND THERE IS NO WAKING
translated_text: I know it, and there is no waking.

text: THE OLD TIME WAS BUT A THICKER DREAM AND THIS IS TRUER BECAUSE MORE SHADOWY
translated_text: The old time was but a thicker dream, and this is truer because more shadowy.

text: HER ONLY LIFE WAS THAT SHE WAS LOST
translated_text: her only life was that she was lost.

text: SHALL I POUR OUT MY SOUL INTO THE EAR OF A MIST A FUME FROM MY OWN BRAIN
translated_text: Shall I pour out my soul into the ear of a mist, a fume from my own brain.

text: THUS WAS SHE BORNE AWAY CAPTIVE OF HER DEAD NEITHER WILLING NOR UNWILLING OF LIFE AND DEATH EQUALLY CARELESS
translated_text: Thus was she born away captive of her dead, neither willing nor unwilling, of life and death equally careless.

text: WITH THAT CAME A PANG OF INTENSE PAIN
translated_text: with that came a pain of intense pain.

text: SHE HERSELF SHOULD HAVE BEEN A POEM A LYRIC IN A WHITE GOWN AND GREEN SCARF COMING TO HIM THROUGH THE LONG GRASS UNDER THE BLOSSOMED BOUGHS
translated_text: She herself should have been a poem, a lyric in a white gown and green scarf, coming to him through the long grass under the blossomed boughs.

text: HER HANDS SHOULD HAVE BEEN FULL OF BLUEBELLS AND SHE SHOULD HAVE HELD THEM UP TO HIS FACE IN MAIDENLY DEFENCE AS HE SPRANG FORWARD TO TAKE HER IN HIS ARMS
translated_text: Her hands should have been full of bluebells, and she should have held them up to his face and made inly defense as he sprang forward to take her in his arms.

text: YOU SEE THAT SHE KNEW EXACTLY HOW A TRYST IS CONDUCTED IN THE PAGES OF THE STANDARD POETS AND OF THE CHEAPER WEEKLY JOURNALS
translated_text: You see that she knew exactly how a trist is conducted in the pages of the standard poets and of the cheaper weekly journals.

text: SHE HAD TO THE FULL LIMIT ALLOWED OF HER READING AND HER ENVIRONMENT THE LITERARY SENSE
translated_text: She had to the full limit allowed of her reading in her environment, the literary sense.

text: AND CURIOUSLY ENOUGH SHE WAS HARDLY CURIOUS AT ALL ABOUT WHAT HE MIGHT HAVE TO SAY
translated_text: And curiously enough, she was hardly curious at all about what he might have to say.

text: SHE ONLY WISHED FOR MAY AND THE ORCHARD INSTEAD OF JANUARY AND THE DINGY DUSTY WAITING ROOM THE PLAIN FACED PREOCCUPIED TRAVELLERS THE DIM DESOLATE WEATHER
translated_text: She only wished for May and the orchard, instead of January and the dingy dusty waiting-room, the plain-faced preoccupied travelers, the dim, desolate weather.

text: THE SETTING OF THE SCENE SEEMED TO HER ALL IMPORTANT
translated_text: The setting of the scene seemed to her all-important.

text: IT WAS BITTERLY COLD BUT THE EMBANKMENT WAS MORE ROMANTIC THAN A RAILWAY CARRIAGE
translated_text: It was bitterly cold, but the embankment was more romantic than a railway carriage.

text: HE HAD BEEN LATE HE HAD OFFERED NO EXCUSE NO EXPLANATION
translated_text: He had been late. He had offered no excuse, no explanation.

text: BUT HERE THE ONLY THING THAT OCCURRED TO HER WAS TO STOP AND LOOK IN ONE OF THE SHOPS TILL HE SHOULD ASK HER WHAT SHE WAS LOOKING AT
translated_text: But here, the only thing that occurred to her was to stop and look in one of the shops till he should ask her what she was looking at.

text: THE KEEN WIND THRUST ITSELF EVEN INSIDE THE HIGH COLLAR OF HER JACKET
translated_text: The keen wind thrust itself even inside the high collar of her jacket.

text: HER HANDS AND FEET WERE ACHING WITH COLD
translated_text: Her hands and feet were aching with cold.

text: SHE WOULD HAVE SHARED HIS SORROW AND SHOWN HERSELF HALF WIFE HALF ANGEL FROM HEAVEN IN THIS DARK HOUR
translated_text: She would have shared his sorrow and shown herself half-wife, half-angel from heaven in this dark hour.

text: SHE SAID HOW FRIGHTFULLY COLD IT IS
translated_text: She said, how frightfully cold it is.

text: AND YESTERDAY I HAD A LETTER FROM HER AND SHE SEEMS TO EXPECT TO THINK AND I THOUGHT I OUGHT TO TELL YOU DARLING
translated_text: And yesterday I had a letter from her and she seems to expect to think and I thought I had to tell you darling.

text: A SHOCK OF UNBELIEVABLE RELIEF TINGLED THROUGH HER SO THAT WAS ALL WHAT WAS IT COMPARED WITH HER FEARS
translated_text: A shock of unbelievable relief tingled through her, so that was all, but was it compared with her fears?

text: WHAT OPINION WOULD HE FORM OF THE PURITY OF HER MIND THE INNOCENCE OF HER SOUL IF AN INCIDENT LIKE THIS FAILED TO SHOCK HER DEEPLY
translated_text: What opinion would he form of the purity of her mind, the innocence of her soul, if an incident like this failed to shock her deeply?

text: FOLLOWING THE TINGLE OF RELIEF CAME A SHARP SICKENING PINCH OF JEALOUSY AND MORTIFICATION THESE INSPIRED HER
translated_text: Following the tingle of relief came a sharp sickening pinch of jealousy and mortification. These inspired her.

text: I DON'T WONDER YOU WERE AFRAID TO TELL ME SHE BEGAN YOU DON'T LOVE ME YOU'VE NEVER LOVED ME I WAS AN IDIOT TO BELIEVE YOU DID
translated_text: I don't wonder you were afraid to tell me she began. You don't love me. You've never loved me. I was an idiot to believe you did.

text: THOSE FOUR TRUE WORDS WOUNDED HER MORE THAN ALL THE REST
translated_text: Those four true words wounded her more than all the rest.

text: COULDN'T HELP IT THEN HOW CAN I EVER TRUST YOU
translated_text: Couldn't help it. Then how can I ever trust you?

text: DO YOU THINK I'M NOT SORRY NOW
translated_text: Do you think I'm not sorry now?

text: NO IT'S ONLY PAINFUL FOR BOTH OF US
translated_text: No, it's only painful for both of us.

text: I DIDN'T THINK A DECENT MAN COULD DO SUCH THINGS SHE WAS PULLING ON HER GLOVES GO HOME AND GLOAT OVER IT ALL
translated_text: I didn't think a decent man could do such things. She was pulling on her gloves. Go home and glowed over it all.

text: HE STOOD UP SUDDENLY DO YOU MEAN IT
translated_text: He stood up suddenly. Do you mean it?

text: ARE YOU REALLY GOING TO THROW ME OVER FOR A THING LIKE THIS
translated_text: Are you really going to throw me over for a thing like this?

text: AND HE STRODE DOWN BETWEEN THE MARBLE TABLES AND OUT BY THE SWING DOOR IT WAS A VERY GOOD EXIT
translated_text: And he strode down between the marble tables and out by the swing door. It was a very good exit.

text: AT THE CORNER HE REMEMBERED THAT HE HAD GONE AWAY WITHOUT PAYING FOR THE TEA AND HIS NATURAL IMPULSE WAS TO GO BACK AND REMEDY THAT ERROR
translated_text: At the corner, he remembered that he had gone away without paying for the tea, and his natural impulse was to go back and remedy that error.

text: HE CHECKED THE SILLY IMPULSE
translated_text: He checked the psyllium pulse.

text: SO HE ENLISTED AND WENT TO SOUTH AFRICA AND HE NEVER CAME HOME COVERED WITH MEDALS AND GLORY WHICH WAS RATHER HIS IDEA TO THE FEW SIMPLE WORDS OF EXPLANATION THAT WOULD HAVE MADE ALL STRAIGHT AND REPAID HER AND HIM FOR ALL THE PAST
translated_text: So he enlisted and went to South Africa, and he never came home covered with medals and glory, which was rather his idea, to the few simple words of explanation that would have made all straight, and repaid her and him for all the past.

text: THE LAST STRAINS OF THE ILL TREATED ILL FATED INTERMEZZO HAD DIED AWAY AND AFTER THEM HAD DIED AWAY ALSO THE RUMBLING OF THE WHEELS OF THE MURDEROUS BARREL ORGAN THAT HAD SO GAILY EXECUTED THAT ALONG WITH THE NINE OTHER TUNES OF ITS REPERTORY TO THE ADMIRATION OF THE HOUSEMAID AT THE WINDOW OF THE HOUSE OPPOSITE AND THE CROWING DELIGHT OF THE TWO BABIES NEXT DOOR
translated_text: The last strains of the ill-treated, ill-fated intermezzo had died away, and after them had died away also the rumbling of the wheels of the murderous barrel-organ that had so galley executed that, along with the nine other tunes of its repatory, to the admiration of the housemaid at the window of the house opposite, and the crowing delight of the two babies next door.

text: THE YOUNG MAN DREW A DEEP BREATH OF RELIEF AND LIGHTED THE WAX CANDLES IN THE SOLID SILVER CANDLESTICKS ON HIS WRITING TABLE FOR NOW THE LATE SUMMER DUSK WAS FALLING AND THAT ORGAN PLEASE HEAVEN MADE FULL THE MEASURE OF THE DAY'S APPOINTED TORTURE
translated_text: The young man drew a deep breath of relief, and lighted the wax candles in the solid silver candle sticks on his writing table. For now the late summer dusk was falling, and that organ, please heaven, made full the measure of the days appointed torture.

text: THEN THERE WAS SILENCE THEN A SIGH AND THE SOUND OF LIGHT MOVING FEET ON THE GRAVEL
translated_text: Then there was silence, then a sigh, and the sound of light moving feet on the gravel.

text: AND AGAIN HE LISTENED WITH A QUIET PLEASURE
translated_text: And again, he listened with a quiet pleasure.

text: NEVER HAD ANY ACT SEEMED SO IMPOSSIBLE
translated_text: Never had any act seem so impossible.

text: THERE IS A SEAT IN THE GARDEN AT THE SIDE OF THE HOUSE AGAIN SHE HESITATED
translated_text: There is a seat in the garden at the side of the house. Again, she hesitated.

text: THEN SHE TURNED TOWARDS THE QUARTER INDICATED AND DISAPPEARED ROUND THE LAUREL BUSHES
translated_text: Then she turned towards the quarter indicated and disappeared around the laurel bushes.

text: LOOK HERE HE SAID THIS IS ALL NONSENSE YOU KNOW YOU ARE TIRED OUT AND THERE'S SOMETHING WRONG WHAT IS IT
translated_text: Look here, he said. This is all nonsense, you know. You are tired out. And there's something wrong. What is it?

text: DO DRINK THIS AND THEN TELL ME PERHAPS I CAN HELP YOU
translated_text: Do drink this and then tell me, perhaps I can help you.

text: HE HURRIEDLY CUT CAKE AND PRESSED IT UPON HER
translated_text: He hurriedly cut cake and pressed it upon her.

text: HE HAD NO TIME TO THINK BUT HE WAS AWARE THAT THIS WAS THE MOST EXCITING ADVENTURE THAT HAD EVER HAPPENED TO HIM
translated_text: He had no time to think, but he was aware that this was the most exciting adventure that had ever happened to him.

text: IS IT ONLY THAT YOU'RE POOR WHY THAT'S NOTHING I'M POOR TOO SHE LAUGHED
translated_text: Is it only that you're poor? Why that's nothing, I'm poor too. She laughed.

text: HER LITTLE FOOT TAPPED THE GRAVEL IMPATIENTLY
translated_text: Her little foot tapped the gravel impatiently.

text: HE TOLD ME TO STAY ON AT THE HOTEL AND I DID AND THEN ONE NIGHT WHEN I WAS AT THE THEATRE MY MAID A HORRID FRENCH THING WE GOT IN PARIS PACKED UP ALL MY TRUNKS AND TOOK ALL MY MONEY AND PAID THE BILL AND WENT
translated_text: He told me to stay on at the hotel, and I did, and then one night when I was at the theater, my maid, a hoard-french thing we got in Paris, packed up all my trunks and took all my money and paid the bill and went.

text: SHE SAID AGAIN YOU ARE KIND
translated_text: She said again, you are kind.

text: WELL THEN I WENT INTO LODGINGS THAT WICKED WOMAN HAD LEFT ME ONE STREET SUIT AND TO DAY THEY TURNED ME OUT BECAUSE MY MONEY WAS ALL GONE
translated_text: Well, then, I went into lodgings that wicked woman had left me one street suit, and today they turned me out because my money was all gone.

text: LET ME THINK HE SAID OH HOW GLAD I AM THAT YOU HAPPENED TO COME THIS WAY
translated_text: Let me think, he said, how glad I am that you happen to come this way.

text: I SHALL LOCK UP ALL THE DOORS AND WINDOWS IN THE HOUSE AND THEN I SHALL GIVE YOU MY LATCH KEY AND YOU CAN LET YOURSELF IN AND STAY THE NIGHT HERE THERE IS NO ONE IN THE HOUSE
translated_text: I shall lock up all the doors and windows in the house, and then I shall give you my latch key, and you can let yourself in and stay the night here. There is no one in the house.

text: I WILL CATCH THE NIGHT TRAIN AND BRING MY MOTHER UP TO MORROW THEN WE WILL SEE WHAT CAN BE DONE
translated_text: I will catch the night train and bring my mother up tomorrow. Then we will see what can be done.

text: YOU SEE PAPA'S SO VERY RICH AND AT HOME THEY EXPECT ME TO TO GET ACQUAINTED WITH DUKES AND THINGS AND SHE STOPPED
translated_text: You see, Papaso very rich, and at home they expect me to get acquainted with dukes and things, and she stopped.

text: IT WASN'T I WHO SAID THAT SAID THE GIRL SMILING BUT THAT'S SO ANYHOW AND THEN SHE SIGHED
translated_text: It wasn't I who said that said the girl smiling but that's so anyhow and then she sighed

text: ALL THE SAME HE ADDED IRRELEVANTLY YOU SHALL HAVE THE LATCH KEY
translated_text: All the same, he added to relevantly, you shall have the latch key.

text: YOU ARE KIND SHE SAID FOR THE THIRD TIME AND REACHED HER HAND OUT TO HIM HE DID NOT KISS IT THEN ONLY TOOK IT IN HIS AND FELT HOW SMALL AND COLD IT WAS THEN IT WAS TAKEN AWAY
translated_text: He R kind. She said for the third time and reached her hand out to him. He did not kiss it then, only took it in his and felt how small and cold it was. Then it was taken away.

text: THE LADY AND THE GUITAR CERTAINLY PASSED THE NIGHT AT HILL VIEW VILLA BUT WHEN HIS MOTHER VERY ANGRY AND VERY FRIGHTENED CAME UP WITH HIM AT ABOUT NOON THE HOUSE LOOKED JUST AS USUAL AND NO ONE WAS THERE BUT THE CHARWOMAN
translated_text: The lady and the guitar certainly passed the night at Hillview Villa, but when his mother very angry and very frightened came up with him at about noon the house looked just as usual, and no one was there but the char woman.

text: THE SILVER IS ALL RIGHT THANK GOODNESS SHE SAID BUT YOUR BANJO GIRL HAS TAKEN A PAIR OF YOUR SISTER'S SILK STOCKINGS AND THOSE NEW SHOES OF HERS WITH THE SILVER BUCKLES AND SHE'S LEFT THESE
translated_text: The silver is all right. Thank goodness, she said. But your banjo girl has taken a pair of your sister's silk stockings and those new shoes of hers with the silver buckles. And she's left these.

text: IT WAS PLAIN THAT HIS CASTANET GIRL HIS MOTHER AND SISTER TOOK A PLEASURE IN CREDITING HER DAILY WITH SOME FRESH AND UNPLEASING INSTRUMENT COULD HAVE HAD NEITHER TASTE MONEY NOR HONESTY TO SUCH A POINT AS THIS
translated_text: It was plain that his castenette girl, his mother and sister took a pleasure in crediting her daily with some fresh and unpleasing instrument. Could have had neither taste, money, nor honesty to such a point as this.

text: ASPARAGUS SALAD COOK THE ASPARAGUS IN SALTED WATER DRAIN AND CHILL
translated_text: Asparagus salad. Cook the Asparagus in salted water, drain and chill.

text: BIRDS NEST SALAD HAVE READY AS MANY CRISP LEAVES OF LETTUCE AS MAY BE REQUIRED TO MAKE A DAINTY LITTLE NEST FOR EACH PERSON
translated_text: Bird's Nest Salad. Have ready as many crisp leaves of lettuce as may be required to make a dainty little nest for each person.

text: SERVE WITH FRENCH DRESSING HIDDEN UNDER THE LEAVES OF THE NEST
translated_text: serve with French dressing hidden under the leaves of the nest.

text: CABBAGE SALAD CHOP OR SHAVE FINE HALF A MEDIUM SIZE HEAD OF CABBAGE THAT HAS BEEN LEFT IN COLD WATER UNTIL CRISP THEN DRAIN
translated_text: Cabbage salad. Chop or shave fine, half a medium-sized head of cabbage that has been left in cold water until crisp, then drain.

text: ADD TWO TABLESPOONS THICK SOUR CREAM TWO TABLESPOONS SUGAR A SPRINKLE OF MUSTARD AND HALF CUP OF VINEGAR
translated_text: Add 2 tablespoons thick sour cream, 2 tablespoons sugar, a sprinkle of mustard and half cup of vinegar.

text: BEAT UNTIL THOROUGHLY MIXED POUR OVER THE CABBAGE AND TOSS LIGHTLY UNTIL UNIFORMLY SEASONED
translated_text: Beat until thoroughly mixed, pour over the cabbage and toss lightly until uniformly seasoned.

text: CAULIFLOWER MAYONNAISE TAKE COLD BOILED CAULIFLOWER BREAK INTO BRANCHES ADDING SALT PEPPER AND VINEGAR TO SEASON
translated_text: cauliflower mayonnaise. Take cold boiled cauliflower, break into branches, adding salt, pepper, and vinegar to season.

text: SURROUND WITH A GARNISH OF COOKED AND DICED CARROTS TURNIPS GREEN PEAS
translated_text: Surround with a garnish of cooked and diced carrots, turnips, green peas.

text: POUR MAYONNAISE OVER ALL CHILL AND SERVE
translated_text: poor mayonnaise, overall, chill and serve.

text: CELERY AND NUT SALAD CUT ENOUGH CELERY FINE TO MEASURE TWO CUPS ADD ONE CUP OF FINELY SHREDDED OR SHAVED CABBAGE AND ONE AND ONE HALF CUPS OF WALNUT MEATS BROKEN IN SMALL PIECES BUT NOT CHOPPED
translated_text: celery and nut salad. Cut enough celery fine to measure two cups. Add one cup of finely shredded or shaved cabbage and one and one half cups of walnut meats broken in small pieces but not chopped.

text: STIR THE SOAKED GELATIN IN WHILE THE CUCUMBER IS HOT
translated_text: Stir the soaked gelatin in while the cucumber is hot.

text: SET INTO A COLD PLACE TO CHILL AND BECOME FIRM
translated_text: Set into a cold place to chill and become firm.

text: SALAD TWO CUPS OF APPLES CUT INTO SMALL PIECES ONE CUP CELERY CUT INTO SMALL PIECES ONE CUP ENGLISH WALNUTS
translated_text: Salad. Two cups of apples cut into small pieces, one cup celery cut into small pieces, one cup English walnuts.

text: SERVE ON A LETTUCE LEAF WITH MAYONNAISE DRESSING MADE WITHOUT MUSTARD AND THINNED WITH CREAM
translated_text: Serve unalettus leaf with mayonnaise dressing, made without mustard, and thinned with cream.

text: GARNISH DISH THAT DRESSING IS MADE IN WITH A LITTLE GARLIC
translated_text: Garnish dish that dressing is made in with a little garlic.

text: PUT THE PULP INTO A BASIN WITH TWO OUNCES OF MELTED BUTTER TWO TABLESPOONFULS OF LEMON JUICE HALF A POUND OF CHESTNUTS BOILED AND GRATED AND SEASONING OF SALT AND WHITE PEPPER TO TASTE
translated_text: Put the pulp into a basin with two ounces of melted butter, two tablespoonfuls of lemon juice, half a pound of chestnuts boiled and grated, and seasoning of salt and white pepper to taste.

text: TOMATO BASKETS TOMATO BASKETS ARE CHARMING ACCESSORIES FOR HOLDING VEGETABLE SALAD CHICKEN SHRIMPS COLD BEANS ASPARAGUS TIPS SHREDDED CELERY CUCUMBERS CUT IN CUBES AND MINCED PEPPERS
translated_text: Tomato baskets. Tomato baskets are charming accessories for holding vegetable salad, chicken, shrimps, cold beans, asparagus tips, shredded celery, cucumbers cut in cubes and minced peppers.

text: HANDLES OF WATERCRESS MAY BE ATTACHED TO THESE BASKETS
translated_text: Handles of watercress may be attached to these baskets.

text: THIS DRESSING SHOULD STAND IN THE ICE BOX FOUR OR FIVE HOURS TO BECOME SEASONED
translated_text: This dressing should stand in the icebox for or five hours to become seasoned.

text: WHEN THICKENED STRAIN AND COOL
translated_text: when thickened, strain and cool.

text: STRAIN AND BOTTLE AND PUT IN ICE BOX SHAKE BEFORE USING EACH TIME
translated_text: Strain and bottle and put in icebox, shake before using each time.

text: SAN FRANCISCO'S CARE FREE SPIRIT WAS FULLY EXEMPLIFIED BEFORE THE ASHES OF THE GREAT FIRE OF NINETEEN O SIX WERE COLD
translated_text: San Francisco's Carefree Spirit was fully exemplified before the ashes of the great fire of 1906 were cold.

text: THOMPSON OPENED A LARGE RESTAURANT IN O'FARRELL STREET JUST ABOVE FILLMORE AND FOR TWO YEARS OR MORE DID A THRIVING BUSINESS HIS PLACE BEING NOTED FOR ITS GOOD COOKING AND ITS SPLENDID SERVICE
translated_text: Thompson opened a large restaurant in Oferrall Street, just above Fillmore, and for two years or more did a thriving business, his place being noted for its good cooking and its splendid service.

text: ONE OF HIS WAITERS PHIL TYSON WAS ONE OF THE EARLIER ONES TO GO BACK INTO THE BURNED DISTRICT TO BEGIN BUSINESS AND HE OPENED A RESTAURANT CALLED THE DEL MONTE IN POWELL STREET NEAR MARKET BUT IT WAS TOO EARLY FOR SUCCESS AND CLOSED AFTER A SHORT CAREER
translated_text: One of his waiters, Phil Tyson, was one of the earlier ones to go back into the Byrne District to begin business, and he opened a restaurant called the Del Monte in Powell Street near market. But it was too early for success and closed after a short career.

text: HERE AS WELL AS IN A NUMBER OF OTHER PLACES ONE CAN WELL APPRECIATE THE COLLOQUIAL DEFINITION OF CABARET
translated_text: Here, as well as in a number of other places, one can well appreciate the colloquial definition of cabaret.

text: HERE THERE IS ALWAYS GOOD MUSIC AND FOOD WELL COOKED AND WELL SERVED AND ALWAYS A LIVELY CROWD DURING THE LUNCHEON DINNER AND AFTER THEATRE HOURS THE ROOM IS NOT LARGE BUT ITS DIMENSIONS ARE GREATLY MAGNIFIED OWING TO THE COVERING OF MIRRORS WHICH LINE THE WALLS
translated_text: Here, there is always good music and food well cooked and well served, and always a lively crowd during the luncheon, dinner, and after theater hours. The room is not large, but its dimensions are greatly magnified, owing to the covering of mirrors which line the walls.

text: THIS GARISH DISPLAY OF MIRRORS AND ELABORATE DECORATION OF CEILING AND PILLARS GIVES IT THE APPEARANCE OF THE ABODE OF SATURNALIA BUT DECORUM IS THE RULE AMONG THE PATRONS
translated_text: This garish display of mirrors and elaborate decoration of ceiling and pillars gives it the appearance of the abode of Saturnalia, but decorum is the rule among the patrons.

text: JOHN TAIT IS THE PRESIDING SPIRIT HERE HE HAVING MADE REPUTATION AS CLUB MANAGER AND THEN AS MANAGER OF THE CLIFF HOUSE
translated_text: John Tate is the presiding spirit here. He having made reputation as club manager and then as manager of the Cliff House.

text: THE POODLE DOG HAS A HOTEL ATTACHMENT WHERE ONE MAY GET ROOMS OR FULL APARTMENTS
translated_text: The Poodle Dog has a hotel attachment where one may get rooms or full apartments.

text: IF YOU KNOW HOW TO ORDER AND DO NOT CARE TO COUNT THE COST WHEN YOU ORDER PROBABLY THE BEST DINNER AT THESE RESTAURANTS CAN BE HAD AT EITHER BLANCO'S OR THE POODLE DOG
translated_text: If you know how to order and do not care to count the cost when you order, probably the best dinner at these restaurants can be had at either Blanco's or the Poodle Dog.

text: THE CUISINE IS OF THE BEST AND THE CHEFS RANK AT THE TOP OF THEIR ART
translated_text: The cuisine is of the best and the chef's rank at the top of their art.

text: AT THE TWO MENTIONED ONE PAYS FOR THE SURROUNDINGS AS WELL AS FOR THE FOOD AND SOMETIMES THIS IS WORTH PAYING FOR
translated_text: At the two mentioned, one pays for the surroundings, as well as for the food, and sometimes this is worth paying for.

text: THE RESTAURANTS OF THE PRESENT DAY THAT APPROACH NEAREST THE OLD BOHEMIAN RESTAURANTS OF PRE FIRE DAYS OF THE FRENCH CLASS ARE JACK'S IN SACRAMENTO STREET BETWEEN MONTGOMERY AND KEARNY FELIX IN MONTGOMERY STREET BETWEEN CLAY AND WASHINGTON AND THE POODLE DOG BERGEZ FRANKS IN BUSH STREET BETWEEN KEARNY AND GRANT AVENUE
translated_text: The restaurants of the present day that approach nearest the old Bohemian restaurants of pre-fire days of the French class are jacks in Sacramento street between Montgomery and Kearney, Felix in Montgomery street between Clay and Washington, and the Poodle dog Berga's Franks in Bush street between Kearney and Grant Avenue.

text: IN EITHER OF THESE RESTAURANTS YOU WILL BE SERVED WITH THE BEST THE MARKET AFFORDS COOKED THE RIGHT WAY
translated_text: In either of these restaurants you will be served with the best the market affords, cooked the right way.

text: IN THIS SAME DISTRICT IS THE MINT IN COMMERCIAL STREET BETWEEN MONTGOMERY AND KEARNY STREETS
translated_text: In this same district is the Mint in commercial street between Montgomery and Kierney streets.

text: IT HAS CHANGED FROM WHAT IT WAS IN THE OLD DAYS BUT IS STILL AN EXCELLENT PLACE TO DINE
translated_text: It is changed from what it was in the old days, but is still an excellent place to dine.

text: IT IS AN IDEA THAT IS WORTH WHILE BUT UNFORTUNATELY THE PROPRIETORS DEPEND TOO MUCH ON THE DECORATIVE FEATURE AND TOO LITTLE ON THE FOOD AND HOW THEY SERVE IT
translated_text: It is an idea that is worthwhile, but, unfortunately, the proprietors depend too much on the decorative feature and too little on the food and how they serve it.

text: THE FLY TRAP AND CHARLIE'S FASHION THE FIRST IN SUTTER STREET NEAR KEARNY AND THE OTHER IN MARKET NEAR SUTTER SERVE WELL COOKED FOODS ESPECIALLY SOUP SALADS AND FISH
translated_text: The flytrap and Charlie's fashion, the first in Sutter Street near Keirney and the other in market near Sutter, serve well-cooked foods, especially soup, salads and fish.

text: OF COURSE THESE ARE NOT THE ENTIRE MENUS BUT OF ALL THE WELL PREPARED DISHES THESE ARE THEIR BEST
translated_text: Of course, these are not the entire menus, but of all the well-prepared dishes, these are their best.

text: BOTH SERVE GOOD SPANISH DINNERS AT REASONABLE PRICES
translated_text: both serve good Spanish dinners at reasonable prices.

text: HIS PRICES ARE MODERATE AND HIS COOKING AND VIANDS OF THE BEST AND WILL SATISFY THE MOST CRITICAL OF THE GOURMETS
translated_text: His prices are moderate and his cooking in vions of the best, and will satisfy the most critical of the gourmet's.

text: AT THE CORNER OF MARKET AND EDDY STREETS IS THE ODEON DOWN IN A BASEMENT WITH DECORATIONS OF MOST GARISH ORDER
translated_text: At the corner of Market in Eddie Streets is the Odin, down in a basement, with decorations of most garish order.

text: ONE CAN ALMOST IMAGINE HIMSELF IN ONE OF THE FAMOUS RATHSKELLERS OF OLD HEIDELBERG NOT AT THE SCHLOSS OF COURSE FOR HERE YOU CANNOT LOOK DOWN ON THE WEISER AS IT FLOWS BENEATH THE WINDOWS OF THE GREAT WINE STUBE ON THE HILL
translated_text: One can almost imagine himself in one of the famous rath-scalers of Old Heidelberg. Not at the Schloss, of course. For here you cannot look down on the visor as it flows beneath the windows of the great winech through the hill.

text: BUT IF YOU REALLY LOVE GOOD MUSIC MUSIC THAT HAS MELODY AND RHYTHM AND SOOTHING CADENCES GO TO THE HEIDELBERG INN AND LISTEN TO THE CONCERT WHICH IS A FEATURE OF THE PLACE EVERY EVENING
translated_text: But if you really love good music, music that has melody and rhythm and soothing cadences, go to the Heidelberg Inn and listen to the concert, which is a feature of the place every evening.

text: WE FINALLY GOT HIM TO SELECT THE ONE PRIZED ABOVE ALL OTHERS AND THIS IS WHAT CHEF SCHEILER GAVE US
translated_text: We finally got him to select the one prized above all others, and this is what Chef Schiller gave us.

text: TO THE PICKLE ADD TWO LARGE ONIONS CUT IN QUARTERS TWO FRESH CARROTS AND ABOUT ONE OUNCE OF MIXED WHOLE ALLSPICE BLACK PEPPERS CLOVES AND BAY LEAVES
translated_text: To the pickle, add two large onions, cut in quarters, two fresh carrots, and about one ounce of mixed whole-all-spice black peppers, cloves, and bay leaves.

text: PUT IN THE OVEN AND BROWN TO A GOLDEN COLOR
translated_text: Put in the oven and brown to a golden color.

text: THEN TAKE IT OUT OF THE ROASTING PAN AND PUT IT INTO A CASSEROLE AFTER SPRINKLING IT WITH TWO OUNCES OF FLOUR
translated_text: Then, take it out of the roasting pan and put it into a casserole after sprinkling it with two ounces of flour.

text: PUT INTO THE OVEN AGAIN AND COOK FOR HALF AN HOUR BASTING FREQUENTLY WITH THE ORIGINAL BRINE
translated_text: Put into the oven again and cook for half an hour, basting frequently with the original brine.

text: WHEN DONE TAKE THE MEAT OUT OF THE SAUCE
translated_text: When done, take the meat out of the sauce.

text: STRAIN THE SAUCE THROUGH A FINE COLLANDER AND ADD A FEW RAISINS A PIECE OF HONEY CAKE OR GINGER SNAPS AND THE MEAT OF ONE FRESH TOMATO
translated_text: Strain the sauce through a fine colander and add a few raisins, a piece of honey cake or ginger snaps, and the meat of one fresh tomato.

text: SEASON WITH SALT AND PEPPER AND A LITTLE SUGAR TO TASTE
translated_text: Season with salt and pepper and a little sugar to taste.

text: THE HOF BRAU HOWEVER IS LESS DISTINCTIVELY GERMAN AS THE GREATER NUMBER OF ITS PATRONS ARE AMERICANS
translated_text: The Hofbrough, however, is less distinctively German, as the greater number of its patrons are Americans.

text: THEY ALSO HAVE AS THE CHEF IN CHARGE OF THE ABALONE DISHES HERBERT FORMERLY CHEF FOR ONE OF THE YACHT CLUBS OF THE COAST WHO CLAIMS TO HAVE THE ONLY PROPER RECIPE FOR MAKING ABALONE'S TENDER
translated_text: They also have as the chef in charge of the Abelone dishes Herbert, formerly chef of one of the yacht clubs of the coast, who claims to have the only proper recipe for making Abelone's tender.

text: UNDER ORDINARY CIRCUMSTANCES THE ABALONE IS TOUGH AND UNPALATABLE BUT AFTER THE DEFT MANIPULATION OF HERBERT THEY ARE TENDER AND MAKE A FINE DISH EITHER FRIED AS CHOWDER OR A LA NEWBERG
translated_text: Under ordinary circumstances, the Abolone is tough and unpalatable. But after the deft manipulation of Herbert, they are tender and make a fine dish, either fried, as chowder or alanooburg.

text: IN ADDITION TO ABALONE'S THE HOF BRAU MAKES A SPECIALTY OF LITTLE OREGON CRAWFISH
translated_text: In addition to abalone, the Hofbrough makes a specialty of little Oregon craft fish.

text: NEVER DRINK ANY HARD LIQUORS SUCH AS WHISKY BRANDY GIN OR COCKTAILS WITH OYSTERS OR CLAMS AS IT IS LIABLE TO UPSET YOU FOR THE REST OF THE EVENING
translated_text: Never drink any hard liquors such as whiskey, brandy, gin or cocktails with oysters or clams as it is liable to upset you for the rest of the evening.

text: MICHAELIS THE TICKET OF LEAVE APOSTLE WAS SPEAKING IN AN EVEN VOICE A VOICE THAT WHEEZED AS IF DEADENED AND OPPRESSED BY THE LAYER OF FAT ON HIS CHEST
translated_text: My callus, the ticket of leave apostle, was speaking in an even voice, a voice that weased as of deadened and oppressed by the layer of fat on his chest.

translated_text: And ever since, he had never managed to get his weight down as much as announced.

text: WITH HIS ELBOW PRESENTING NO APPEARANCE OF A JOINT BUT MORE LIKE A BEND IN A DUMMY'S LIMB THROWN OVER THE BACK OF A CHAIR HE LEANED FORWARD SLIGHTLY OVER HIS SHORT AND ENORMOUS THIGHS TO SPIT INTO THE GRATE
translated_text: With his elbow presenting no appearance of a joint, but more like a bend in a dummy's limb thrown over the back of a chair, he leaned forward slightly over his short and enormous thighs to spit into the grate.

text: YES I HAD THE TIME TO THINK THINGS OUT A LITTLE HE ADDED WITHOUT EMPHASIS
translated_text: Yes, I had the time to think things out a little. He added without emphasis.

text: WHEN HE ROSE PAINFULLY THE THRUSTING FORWARD OF A SKINNY GROPING HAND DEFORMED BY GOUTY SWELLINGS SUGGESTED THE EFFORT OF A MORIBUND MURDERER SUMMONING ALL HIS REMAINING STRENGTH FOR A LAST STAB
translated_text: When he rose painfully, the thrusting forward of a skinny, groping hand, formed by gouty swallings, suggested the effort of a morbid murderer, summoning all his remaining strength for a last stab.

text: HIS ENUNCIATION WOULD HAVE BEEN ALMOST TOTALLY UNINTELLIGIBLE TO A STRANGER
translated_text: his enunciation would have been almost totally unintelligible to a stranger.

text: THE OLD TERRORIST TURNED SLOWLY HIS HEAD ON HIS SKINNY NECK FROM SIDE TO SIDE
translated_text: The old terrace turns slowly his head on a skinny neck from side to side.

text: AND I COULD NEVER GET AS MANY AS THREE SUCH MEN TOGETHER
translated_text: And I could never get as many as three such men together.

text: THE POSSESSORS OF PROPERTY HAD NOT ONLY TO FACE THE AWAKENED PROLETARIAT BUT THEY HAD ALSO TO FIGHT AMONGST THEMSELVES YES
translated_text: The possessors of property had not only the face they awakened Politariet, but they had also defied amongst themselves. Yes.

text: STRUGGLE WARFARE WAS THE CONDITION OF PRIVATE OWNERSHIP IT WAS FATAL
translated_text: Struggle warfare was the condition of private ownership. It was fatal.

text: AH HE DID NOT DEPEND UPON EMOTIONAL EXCITEMENT TO KEEP UP HIS BELIEF NO DECLAMATIONS NO ANGER NO VISIONS OF BLOOD RED FLAGS WAVING OR METAPHORICAL LURID SUNS OF VENGEANCE RISING ABOVE THE HORIZON OF A DOOMED SOCIETY NOT HE
translated_text: Ah, he did not depend upon emotional excitement to keep up his belief. No declinations, no anger, no visions of blood-red flags waving, or metaphorical lured sons of vengeance rising above the horizon of a doomed society. Not he.

text: DON'T YOU THINK THAT IF I HAD NOT BEEN THE OPTIMIST I AM I COULD NOT HAVE FOUND IN FIFTEEN YEARS SOME MEANS TO CUT MY THROAT
translated_text: Don't you think that, if I had not been the optimist I am, I could not have found in fifteen years some means to cut my throat?

text: A HARSH LAUGH FROM COMRADE OSSIPON CUT THE TIRADE DEAD SHORT IN A SUDDEN FALTERING OF THE TONGUE AND A BEWILDERED UNSTEADINESS OF THE APOSTLE'S MILDLY EXALTED EYES
translated_text: A harsh laugh from Conrad Ossipan cut the tirade dead short in a sudden faltering of the tongue, and he bewildered unsteveness of the apostles mildly exalted eyes.

text: ALEXANDER OSSIPON GOT UP TALL IN HIS THREADBARE BLUE SERGE SUIT UNDER THE LOW CEILING SHOOK OFF THE STIFFNESS OF LONG IMMOBILITY AND STROLLED AWAY INTO THE KITCHEN DOWN TWO STEPS TO LOOK OVER STEVIE'S SHOULDER
translated_text: Alexander Ossupin got up tall on his threadbare blue surge suit under the low ceiling. Shekhoff the stiffness of long immobility, installed the way into the kitchen, down two steps, to look over Stevie's shoulder.

text: VERY CHARACTERISTIC PERFECTLY TYPICAL
translated_text: very characteristic, perfectly typical.

text: YOU WOULD CALL THAT LAD A DEGENERATE WOULD YOU MUMBLED MISTER VERLOC
translated_text: You would call that ladded gentleman, would you? Memble, Mr. Verlock.

text: IT WAS KARL YUNDT WHO WAS HEARD IMPLACABLE TO HIS LAST BREATH
translated_text: It was Carl Jungt, who was heard, implacable to his last breath.

text: LOMBROSO IS AN ASS
translated_text: Lombrosia was an ass.

text: FOR HIM THE CRIMINAL IS THE PRISONER SIMPLE IS IT NOT
translated_text: For him, the criminal is the prisoner. Simple, is it not?

text: THERE WAS AN EXTRAORDINARY FORCE OF SUGGESTION IN THIS POSTURING
translated_text: There was an extraordinary force of suggestion in this posturing.

text: THE FAMOUS TERRORIST HAD NEVER IN HIS LIFE RAISED PERSONALLY AS MUCH AS HIS LITTLE FINGER AGAINST THE SOCIAL EDIFICE
translated_text: The famous terrorist had never in his life raised personally as much as his little finger against the social edifice.

text: THE SHADOW OF HIS EVIL GIFT CLUNG TO HIM YET LIKE THE SMELL OF A DEADLY DRUG IN AN OLD VIAL OF POISON EMPTIED NOW USELESS READY TO BE THROWN AWAY UPON THE RUBBISH HEAP OF THINGS THAT HAD SERVED THEIR TIME
translated_text: The shadow of his evil gift clung to him, yet like the smell of a deadly drug in an old vial of poison emptied now, useless, ready to be thrown away upon the rubbish heap of things that had served their time.

text: MICHAELIS THE TICKET OF LEAVE APOSTLE SMILED VAGUELY WITH HIS GLUED LIPS HIS PASTY MOON FACE DROOPED UNDER THE WEIGHT OF MELANCHOLY ASSENT
translated_text: McAllis, the ticket-of-leave apostle, smiled vaguely with his glued lips. His pasty moon-face drooped under the weight of Melancholyo scent.

text: HE HAD BEEN A PRISONER HIMSELF
translated_text: He had been a prisoner himself.

text: HIS OWN SKIN HAD SIZZLED UNDER THE RED HOT BRAND HE MURMURED SOFTLY
translated_text: his own skin had sizzled under the red hot brand, Team Merritt Softly.

text: YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND HE BEGAN DISDAINFULLY BUT STOPPED SHORT INTIMIDATED BY THE DEAD BLACKNESS OF THE CAVERNOUS EYES IN THE FACE TURNED SLOWLY TOWARDS HIM WITH A BLIND STARE AS IF GUIDED ONLY BY THE SOUND
translated_text: You don't understand, he began to stay in belief, but stopped short, intimidated by the dead blackness of the cavernous eyes in the face, turned slowly towards him with a blind stare, as if guided only by the sound.

text: HE GAVE THE DISCUSSION UP WITH A SLIGHT SHRUG OF THE SHOULDERS
translated_text: He gave the discussion up with a slight shrug of the shoulders.

text: STEVIE ACCUSTOMED TO MOVE ABOUT DISREGARDED HAD GOT UP FROM THE KITCHEN TABLE CARRYING OFF HIS DRAWING TO BED WITH HIM
translated_text: Stevie, accustomed to move about disregarded, had got up from the kitchen table, carrying off his drawing to bed with him.

text: THE SHEET OF PAPER COVERED WITH CIRCLES DROPPED OUT OF HIS FINGERS AND HE REMAINED STARING AT THE OLD TERRORIST AS IF ROOTED SUDDENLY TO THE SPOT BY HIS MORBID HORROR AND DREAD OF PHYSICAL PAIN
translated_text: The sheet of paper covered with circles dropped out of his fingers, and here remains staring at the old terrorist, as if rooted suddenly to the spot by his morbid horror and dread of physical pain.

text: HIS SCARED EYES BLAZED WITH INDIGNATION IT WOULD HURT TERRIBLY HIS MOUTH DROPPED OPEN
translated_text: His scared eyes blazed with indignation. It would hurt terribly. His mouth dropped open.

text: COMRADE OSSIPON'S FACE TWITCHED WITH EXASPERATION
translated_text: Comment, Ossipons face, twitched with exasperation.

text: I DON'T SAY THAT PROTESTED MICHAELIS GENTLY
translated_text: I don't say that protested my cows gently.

text: HIS VISION OF TRUTH HAD GROWN SO INTENSE THAT THE SOUND OF A STRANGE VOICE FAILED TO ROUT IT THIS TIME
translated_text: His vision of truth had grown so intense that the sound of a strange voice failed to rat it this time.

text: THE COALS IN THE GRATE SETTLED DOWN WITH A SLIGHT CRASH AND MICHAELIS THE HERMIT OF VISIONS IN THE DESERT OF A PENITENTIARY GOT UP IMPETUOUSLY
translated_text: The coal is in the great tettled down with a slight crash, and the callus, the hermit of visions in the desert of a penitentiary, got up impetuously.

text: THE DISDAINFUL POUT OF COMRADE OSSIPON'S THICK LIPS ACCENTUATED THE NEGRO TYPE OF HIS FACE
translated_text: The disdainful pout of comet-oscipens thick lips accentuated the negrotype of his face.

text: HE PAUSED THEN ADDED WITH MODEST FIRMNESS
translated_text: He paused and added with a modest firmness.

text: I WOULD CALL IT CANNIBALISTIC THAT'S WHAT IT IS
translated_text: I would call it cannibalistic. That's what it is.

text: THEY ARE NOURISHING THEIR GREED ON THE QUIVERING FLESH AND THE WARM BLOOD OF THE PEOPLE NOTHING ELSE
translated_text: They are nourishing their greed on the quivering flesh and the warm blood of the people. Nothing else.

text: STEVIE SWALLOWED THE TERRIFYING STATEMENT WITH AN AUDIBLE GULP AND AT ONCE AS THOUGH IT HAD BEEN SWIFT POISON SANK LIMPLY IN A SITTING POSTURE ON THE STEPS OF THE KITCHEN DOOR
translated_text: Stevie swallowed the terrifying statement with an audible gulp, and at once, as though it had been swift poison, sank limply in a sitting posture on the steps of the kitchen door.

text: HE CLOSED THE DOOR BEHIND THEIR BACKS WITH RESTRAINED VIOLENCE TURNED THE KEY SHOT THE BOLT
translated_text: He closed the door behind their backs with restrained violence. Turn the key, shot the bolt.

text: HE WAS NOT SATISFIED WITH HIS FRIENDS
translated_text: He was not satisfied with his friends.

text: WITH THE INSIGHT OF A KINDRED TEMPERAMENT HE PRONOUNCED HIS VERDICT
translated_text: With the insight of a kindred temperament, he pronounced his verdict.

text: THERE ARE NATURES TOO TO WHOSE SENSE OF JUSTICE THE PRICE EXACTED LOOMS UP MONSTROUSLY ENORMOUS ODIOUS OPPRESSIVE WORRYING HUMILIATING EXTORTIONATE INTOLERABLE THOSE ARE THE FANATICS
translated_text: There are natures too to whose sense of justice the press exacted looms up monstrously enormous, odious, oppressive, worrying, humiliating, extortionate, intolerable. Those are the fanatics.

text: IN ANY CASE HE HAD NOT THE TIME
translated_text: In any case, he had not the time.

text: LOAFING WAS ALL VERY WELL FOR THESE FELLOWS WHO KNEW NOT MISTER VLADIMIR AND HAD WOMEN TO FALL BACK UPON WHEREAS HE HAD A WOMAN TO PROVIDE FOR
translated_text: Lothing was all very well for these fellows who knew not Mr. Vladimir and had women to fall back upon, whereas he had a woman to provide for.

text: THESE WERE BUT FEW AND FOR THE FIRST TIME SINCE HE OPENED HIS SHOP HE TOOK A COMMERCIAL SURVEY OF ITS VALUE
translated_text: These were but a few, and for the first time since he opened this shop he took a commercial survey of its value.

text: THIS SURVEY WAS UNFAVOURABLE
translated_text: The survey was unfavorable.

text: HE TOOK THE CASH BOX OUT OF THE DRAWER AND TURNING TO LEAVE THE SHOP BECAME AWARE THAT STEVIE WAS STILL DOWNSTAIRS
translated_text: He took the cash box out of the drawer and turning to leave the shop became aware that Stevie was still downstairs.

text: HE LOOKED DUBIOUSLY AT HIS BROTHER IN LAW BUT HE DID NOT ASK HIM FOR INFORMATION
translated_text: He looks dubiously at his brother-in-law, but he did not ask him for information.

text: MISTER VERLOC PERCEIVED WITH SOME SURPRISE THAT HE DID NOT KNOW REALLY WHAT TO SAY TO STEVIE
translated_text: Mr. Verlock perceived with some surprise that he did not know really what to say to Stevie.

text: HE STOOD STILL IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PARLOUR AND LOOKED INTO THE KITCHEN IN SILENCE
translated_text: He stood still in the middle of the parlor and looked into the kitchen in silence.

text: HE WATCHED HIM GESTICULATING AND MURMURING IN THE KITCHEN
translated_text: He watched him just eat a murmuring in the kitchen.

text: STEVIE PROWLED ROUND THE TABLE LIKE AN EXCITED ANIMAL IN A CAGE
translated_text: Steepy prowled around the table like an excited animal in a cage.

text: THE LIGHT THROWN DOWN BY THE SHADE FELL DAZZLINGLY ON THE WHITE PILLOW SUNK BY THE WEIGHT OF HER HEAD REPOSING WITH CLOSED EYES AND DARK HAIR DONE UP IN SEVERAL PLAITS FOR THE NIGHT
translated_text: The light thrown down by the shade fell dazzlingly on the white pillow, sunk by the weight of her head, reposing with closed eyes and dark hair, done up in several plates for the night.

text: HER BARE FEET AS IF POKED THROUGH THE BOTTOM OF AN UNADORNED SLEEVED CALICO SACK BUTTONED TIGHTLY AT NECK AND WRISTS FELT OVER THE RUG FOR THE SLIPPERS WHILE SHE LOOKED UPWARD INTO HER HUSBAND'S FACE
translated_text: Her bare feet, as if poked through the bottom of an unadorned, sleeved, calical sack, button tightly at neck and wrists, felt over the rug for the slippers while she looked upward into her husband's face.

text: THERE IS NO OCCUPATION THAT FAILS A MAN MORE COMPLETELY THAN THAT OF A SECRET AGENT OF POLICE
translated_text: There is no occupation that fails a man more completely than that of a secret agent of police.

text: IT'S LIKE YOUR HORSE SUDDENLY FALLING DEAD UNDER YOU IN THE MIDST OF AN UNINHABITED AND THIRSTY PLAIN
translated_text: It's like your horse suddenly falling dead under you, in the midst of an uninhabited and thirsty plane.

text: THE COMPARISON OCCURRED TO MISTER VERLOC BECAUSE HE HAD SAT ASTRIDE VARIOUS ARMY HORSES IN HIS TIME AND HAD NOW THE SENSATION OF AN INCIPIENT FALL
translated_text: The comparison occurred to Mr. Reloq because he had satisfied various army horses in his time, and had now the sensation of an incipient fall.

text: THE PROSPECT WAS AS BLACK AS THE WINDOW PANE AGAINST WHICH HE WAS LEANING HIS FOREHEAD
translated_text: The prospect was as black as the window painted against which he was leaning his forehead.

text: YES NOT AT ALL WELL
translated_text: Yes, not at all well.

text: DOWN BELOW IN THE QUIET NARROW STREET MEASURED FOOTSTEPS APPROACHED THE HOUSE THEN DIED AWAY UNHURRIED AND FIRM AS IF THE PASSER BY HAD STARTED TO PACE OUT ALL ETERNITY FROM GAS LAMP TO GAS LAMP IN A NIGHT WITHOUT END AND THE DROWSY TICKING OF THE OLD CLOCK ON THE LANDING BECAME DISTINCTLY AUDIBLE IN THE BEDROOM
translated_text: Down below in the quiet narrow street measured footsteps approach the house, then died away unhurried infirm, as if the passerby had started to pace out all eternity from gas lamp to gas nap in a night without end. And the drowsy ticking of the old clock on the landing became distinctly audible in the bedroom.

text: THAT POOR BOY IS IN A VERY EXCITED STATE TO NIGHT SHE MURMURED AFTER A PAUSE WHICH LASTED FOR THREE TICKS OF THE CLOCK
translated_text: That poor boy is in a very excited state to not cheer Mermerin after a pause which lasted for three ticks of the clock.

text: THIS DREAD LED HIM TO MAKE THE REMARK THAT STEVIE HAD DISREGARDED HIS SUGGESTION TO GO TO BED
translated_text: This dread led him to make the remark that Stevie had disregarded his suggestion to go to bed.

text: THERE WAS NO YOUNG MAN OF HIS AGE IN LONDON MORE WILLING AND DOCILE THAN STEPHEN SHE AFFIRMED NONE MORE AFFECTIONATE AND READY TO PLEASE AND EVEN USEFUL AS LONG AS PEOPLE DID NOT UPSET HIS POOR HEAD
translated_text: There was no young man of his age in London more willing and docile than Stephen, she affirmed. None more affectionate and ready to please, and even useful, as long as people did not upset his poor head.

text: MISTER VERLOC'S ANXIETIES HAD PREVENTED HIM FROM ATTACHING ANY SENSE TO WHAT HIS WIFE WAS SAYING
translated_text: Mr. Verlox and Zioides had prevented him from attaching any sense to what his wife was saying.

text: THAT BOY HEARS TOO MUCH OF WHAT IS TALKED ABOUT HERE
translated_text: That boy hears too much of what is talked about here.

text: IF I HAD KNOWN THEY WERE COMING TO NIGHT I WOULD HAVE SEEN TO IT THAT HE WENT TO BED AT THE SAME TIME I DID
translated_text: If I had known they were coming tonight, I would have seen to it that he went to bed at the same time I did.

text: HE WAS OUT OF HIS MIND WITH SOMETHING HE OVERHEARD ABOUT EATING PEOPLE'S FLESH AND DRINKING BLOOD WHAT'S THE GOOD OF TALKING LIKE THAT
translated_text: He was out of his mind with something he overheard about eating people's flesh and drinking blood. What's the good of talking like that?

text: MISTER VERLOC WAS FULLY RESPONSIVE NOW
translated_text: Mr. Verluck was fully responsive now.

text: ASK KARL YUNDT HE GROWLED SAVAGELY
translated_text: As Carl Yunt, he grouts savagely.

text: HE ISN'T FIT TO HEAR WHAT'S SAID HERE HE BELIEVES IT'S ALL TRUE
translated_text: He's fit to hear what said here. He believes it's all true.

text: HE KNOWS NO BETTER HE GETS INTO HIS PASSIONS OVER IT
translated_text: He knows no better. He gets into his passions over it.

text: HE GLARED AT ME AS IF HE DIDN'T KNOW WHO I WAS WHEN I WENT DOWNSTAIRS
translated_text: He glared at me, as if he didn't know who I was when he went downstairs.

text: I WISH HE HAD NEVER BEEN TO SCHOOL MISSUS VERLOC BEGAN AGAIN BRUSQUELY
translated_text: I wish he had never been to school, and Mrs. Verlock began again, brusquely.

text: HE GETS A RED FACE PORING OVER THEM
translated_text: He gets a red face pouring over them.

text: I WOULDN'T GIVE A HALFPENNY FOR THE WHOLE LOT
translated_text: I wouldn't give a half penny for the whole lot.

text: THE OTHER DAY STEVIE GOT HOLD OF ONE AND THERE WAS A STORY IN IT OF A GERMAN SOLDIER OFFICER TEARING HALF OFF THE EAR OF A RECRUIT AND NOTHING WAS DONE TO HIM FOR IT THE BRUTE
translated_text: The other day Stevie got hold of one, and there was a story in it of a German soldier officer tearing half off the ear of a recruit, and nothing was done to him for it. The brute!

text: HE CAN'T STAND THE NOTION OF ANY CRUELTY
translated_text: He can't stand the notion of any cruelty.

text: COMFORTABLE DEAR
translated_text: Comfortable dear?

text: THROUGH THE INFLUENCE OF HON THOMAS L HAMER HE WAS ADMITTED AT WEST POINT IN EIGHTEEN THIRTY NINE
translated_text: Through the influence of honorable Thomas L. Hammer, he was admitted at West Point in 1839.

text: AT THIS TIME GRANT WAS NOT TAKEN WITH WAR AND PROBABLY EVINCED LITTLE INTEREST IN ARMY TACTICS
translated_text: At this time Grant was not taken with war, and probably even a little interest in army tactics.

text: GRANT ACTED AS MUSTERING OFFICER UNTIL BEING COMMISSIONED COLONEL OF THE TWENTY FIRST ILLINOIS VOLUNTEERS HE TOOK THE FIELD
translated_text: Grant acted as a mustering officer until being commissioned colonel of the 21st Illinois volunteers he took the field.

text: GENERAL HALLECK IN SPEAKING OF THIS BATTLE SAID
translated_text: General Helik, in speaking of this battle, said,

text: INDEED IF EVER A GENERAL DESERVED HONOR GRANT HAD WON IT HE HAD OPENED THE MISSISSIPPI TO NAVIGATION AND HAD CAPTURED NEARLY ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND PRISONERS AND ARMS
translated_text: Indeed, if ever a general deserved honor, Grant had won it. He had opened the Mississippi to navigation, and had captured nearly 100,000 prisoners and arms.

text: HE WAS NOW COMMANDER OF ALL THE FEDERAL FORCES
translated_text: He was now commander of all the federal forces.

text: THE CAPTURE OF LEE WAS A FAR MORE DIFFICULT UNDERTAKING
translated_text: The capture of Lee was a far more difficult undertaking.

text: TIME WORE AWAY AND ON THE NINTH OF APRIL EIGHTEEN SIXTY FIVE GRANT CAPTURED THE CONFEDERATE ARMY UNDER LEE THUS VIRTUALLY ENDING THE WAR
