translated_text: Time wore away, and on 9 April 1865, Grant captured the Confederate Army under Lee, thus virtually ending the war.

text: WHEN HIS PUBLIC SERVICES WERE FINISHED HE STARTED IN COMPANY WITH HIS WIFE SON JESSE AND A FEW FRIENDS
translated_text: When his public services were finished, he started in company with his wife, son Jesse, and a few friends.

text: HIS SUCCESS SEEMS TO HAVE BEEN THE OUTGROWTH OF HARD STUDY AND ABILITY TO PERFORM THE MOST EXHAUSTIVE LABOR WITHOUT FATIGUE
translated_text: His success seems to have been the outgrowth of hard study and ability to perform the most exhaustive labor without fatigue.

text: SOME ARE WONDERFULLY WROUGHT PRETTY LITTLE HOMES FOR BIRDIKINS
translated_text: Some are wonderfully wrought, pretty little homes for verticals.

text: INDEED IT IS NOT A NEST AT ALL ONLY THE BEGINNING OF ONE
translated_text: Indeed, it is not a nest at all, only the beginning of one.

text: AND THERE IS AN OLD STORY ABOUT THIS WHICH I SHALL TELL YOU
translated_text: And there is an old story about this, which I shall tell you.

text: OH WHAT SHALL WE DO FOR A HOME
translated_text: Oh, what shall we do for a home?

text: AND THE POOR SILLY THINGS RUFFLED UP THEIR FEATHERS AND LOOKED MISERABLE AS ONLY A LITTLE BIRD CAN LOOK WHEN IT IS UNHAPPY
translated_text: And the poor silly things ruffled up their feathers and looked miserable as only a little bird can look when it is unhappy.

text: SHE WAS INDEED A CLEVER BIRD
translated_text: She was indeed a clever bird.

text: SHE POPPED INTO HER NEW HOUSE AND SAT THERE COMFORTABLY PEERING OUT THROUGH THE WINDOW SLITS WITH HER SHARP LITTLE EYES
translated_text: She popped into her new house and sat there comfortably, peering out through the windowslits with her sharp little eyes.

text: AND SHE SAW THE OTHER BIRDS HOPPING ABOUT AND TWITTERING HELPLESSLY
translated_text: and she saw all the other birds hopping about and twittering helplessly.

text: THEN ALL THE OTHER BIRDS CHIRPED EAGERLY YES YES LET US ASK HER TO TEACH US
translated_text: Then all the other birds chirped eagerly. Yes, yes, let us ask her to teach us.

text: SO IN A GREAT COMPANY THEY CAME FLUTTERING HOPPING TWITTERING UP TO THE ELM TREE WHERE MOTHER MAGPIE NESTLED COMFORTABLY IN HER NEW HOUSE
translated_text: So in a great company, they came fluttering, hopping, twittering up to the Elm Tree where mother magpie nestled comfortably in her new house.

text: O WISE MOTHER MAGPIE DEAR MOTHER MAGPIE THEY CRIED TEACH US HOW TO BUILD OUR NESTS LIKE YOURS FOR IT IS GROWING NIGHT AND WE ARE TIRED AND SLEEPY
translated_text: Oh, why is Mother Magpie dear Mother Magpie? They cried. Teach us how to build our nests like yours, for it is growing night, and we are tired and sleepy.

text: THE MAGPIE SAID SHE WOULD TEACH THEM IF THEY WOULD BE A PATIENT DILIGENT OBEDIENT CLASS OF LITTLE BIRDS
translated_text: The magpie said she would teach them, if they would be a patient, diligent, obedient class of little birds.

text: AND WHERE EACH BIRD PERCHED THERE IT WAS TO BUILD ITS NEST
translated_text: and where each bird perched, there it was to build its nest.

text: SHE BEGAN TO SHOW THEM HOW TO WEAVE THE BITS OF THINGS TOGETHER INTO NESTS AS THEY SHOULD BE MADE
translated_text: She began to show them how to weave the bits of things together into nests, as they should be made.

text: AND SOME OF THE BIRDS WHO WERE ATTENTIVE AND CAREFUL SOON SAW HOW IT WAS DONE AND STARTED NICE HOMES FOR THEMSELVES
translated_text: And some of the birds who were attentive and careful soon saw how it was done and started nice homes for themselves.

text: I THOUGHT THAT WAS THE WAY TO BEGIN
translated_text: I thought that was the way to begin.

text: CERTAINLY OF COURSE SCREAMED THE JACKDAW
translated_text: Certainly, of course, scream the Jack-Daw.

text: HERE WOOD PIGEON SAID MOTHER MAGPIE YOU MUST PLACE THOSE STICKS THROUGH AND ACROSS CRISS CROSS CRISS CROSS SO
translated_text: Here would pigeon, said Mother Bagpie, you must place those sticks through and across, criss-cross, criss-cross, so.

text: CRISS CROSS CRISS CROSS SO INTERRUPTED THE WOOD PIGEON
translated_text: crisscross, crisscross, soul, interrupt the wood pigeon.

text: YOU SAY YOU KNOW ALL ABOUT IT THEN GO ON AND FINISH YOUR NESTS BY YOURSELVES
translated_text: You say you know all about it, then go on and finish your nests by yourselves.

text: MUCH LUCK MAY YOU HAVE
translated_text: Much luck may you have.

text: AND AWAY SHE FLEW TO HER OWN COSY NEST IN THE ELM TREE WHERE SHE WAS SOON FAST ASLEEP FORGETTING ALL ABOUT THE MATTER
translated_text: and a way she flew to her own cosiness in the Elm Tree, where she was soon fast asleep, forgetting all about the matter.

text: BUT THE WOOD PIGEON WAS IN THE WORST CASE OF THEM ALL
translated_text: But the wood pigeon was in the worst case of them all.

text: FOR SHE HAD ONLY THE FOUNDATION LAID CRISS CROSS AS THE MAGPIE HAD SHOWN HER
translated_text: for she had only the foundation laid criss-cross as the Meg-by-head shown her.

text: A PERSON WOULD THINK THAT AFTER A FAMILY HAD LIVED SO LONG IN A PLACE ALL THE NEIGHBORS WOULD BE FOND OF THEM YET IT IS NOT SO
translated_text: A person would think that after a family had lived so long in a place. All the neighbors would be fond of them. Yet it is not so.

text: IT IS DISGRACEFUL
translated_text: It is disgraceful.

text: THEY THOUGHT THE TROUBLE CAME FROM BAD BRINGING UP OR NO BRINGING UP AT ALL
translated_text: They thought the trouble came from bad bringing up, or no bringing up at all.

text: THEY ALWAYS ATE PLAIN FOOD AND PLENTY OF IT AND THEY NEVER ATE BETWEEN MEALS
translated_text: They always ate plain food and plenty of it and they never ate between meals.

text: YOU WOULD THINK THAT WITH SIX LEGS APIECE AND THREE JOINTS IN EACH LEG THEY MIGHT WALK QUITE FAST YET THEY NEVER DID
translated_text: You would think that with six legs a piece and three joints in each leg, they might walk quite fast, yet they never did.

text: THEY DID NOT BREATHE IT INTO THEIR MOUTHS OR THROUGH GILLS BUT TOOK IT IN THROUGH SOME OPENINGS IN THE BACK PART OF THEIR BODIES
translated_text: They did not breathe it into their mouths or through gills, but took it in through some openings in the back part of their bodies.

text: BOTH LIPS ASKED THE LARVAE
translated_text: Both lips ask the larvae.

text: WELL OUR LOWER LIPS ANYWAY ANSWERED THE NYMPH
translated_text: Well, our lower lips anyway answered the nymph.

text: OUR UPPER LIPS ARE SO SMALL THEY DON'T MATTER
translated_text: Our upper lips are so small they don't matter.

text: THEY KNEW THAT WHENEVER THEY STUCK OUT THEIR LOWER LIPS AT THE SMALL FISHES AND BUGS THEY SWAM AWAY AS FAST AS THEY COULD
translated_text: They knew that whenever they stuck out their lower lips at the small fishes and bugs, they swam away as fast as they could.

text: INDEED THE LOWER LIP OF A DRAGON FLY CHILD MIGHT WELL FRIGHTEN PEOPLE FOR IT IS FASTENED ON A LONG JOINTED ARM LIKE THING AND HAS PINCERS ON IT WITH WHICH IT CATCHES AND HOLDS ITS FOOD
translated_text: Indeed, the lower lip of a dragonfly child might well frighten people, for it is fastened on a long, jointed arm-like thing, and has pincers on it, with which it catches and holds its food.

text: BUT SOMETIMES HE STRAIGHTENS THE JOINT AND HOLDS HIS LIP OUT BEFORE HIM AND THEN ITS PINCERS CATCH HOLD OF THINGS HE DOES THIS WHEN HE IS HUNGRY
translated_text: But sometimes he straightens the joint and holds his lip out before him, and then its pincers catch hold of things. He does this when he is hungry.

text: SCARED DAH WHO'S AFRAID ANSWERED HE
translated_text: Scared? Duh! Who's afraid? Answered he.

text: HERE COMES THE SNAPPING TURTLE
translated_text: Here comes the snappy turtle!

text: SURE ENOUGH THERE HE CAME THROUGH THE SHALLOW WATER HIS WET BACK SHELL PARTLY OUT OF IT AND SHINING IN THE SUNLIGHT
translated_text: Sure enough, there he came through the shallow water, his wet backshell partly out of it and shining in the sunlight.

text: THEY THOUGHT HE MIGHT BE GOING TO TAKE A NAP AFTER HIS DINNER
translated_text: They thought he might be going to take a nap after his dinner.

text: HE BEGAN TO DRAW IN HIS LEGS VERY VERY SLOWLY AND JUST AS HIS GREAT HARD LOWER SHELL TOUCHED THE MUD THE LAST LARVA CRAWLED OUT UNDER HIS TAIL
translated_text: He began to draw in his legs very, very slowly, and just as his great heart lower shell touched the mud, the last larva crawled out under his tail.

text: THE NYMPHS HAD ALREADY GOTTEN AWAY
translated_text: The nymphs had already gotten away.

text: FERDINAND MEDITATES OVER HIS GOOD FORTUNE
translated_text: Ferdinand meditates over his good fortune.

text: IN MOMENTS OF DEEP FEELING ALIKE SUDDEN BURSTS OF PROSPERITY AS IN DARKER HOURS MAN MUST BE ALONE
translated_text: In moments of deep feeling, alike sudden bursts of prosperity as in darker hours, man must be alone.

text: IT REQUIRES SOME SELF COMMUNION TO PREPARE OURSELVES FOR GOOD FORTUNE AS WELL AS TO ENCOUNTER DIFFICULTY AND DANGER AND DISGRACE
translated_text: It requires some self-communion to prepare ourselves for good fortune, as well as to encounter difficulty, and danger, and disgrace.

text: THIS VIOLENT AND TRIUMPHANT REVOLUTION IN HIS PROSPECTS AND HIS FORTUNES WAS HARDLY YET COMPLETELY COMPREHENDED BY OUR FRIEND FERDINAND ARMINE AND WHEN HE HAD LEFT A NOTE FOR THE GENEROUS MIRABEL WHOSE SLUMBERS HE WOULD NOT DISTURB AT THIS EARLY HOUR EVEN WITH GOOD NEWS HE STROLLED ALONG UP CHARLES STREET AND TO THE PARK IN ONE OF THOSE WILD AND JOYOUS REVERIES IN WHICH WE BROOD OVER COMING BLISS AND CREATE A THOUSAND GLORIOUS CONSEQUENCES
translated_text: This violent and triumphant revolution in his prospects and his fortunes was hardly yet completely comprehended by our friend Ferdinand Armin, and when he had left a note for the generous Mirobel, whose slumbers he would not disturb at this early hour, even with good news, he strolled along UpCharles Street and to the park, in one of those wild and joyous reveries in which we brood overcoming bliss and create a thousand glorious consequences.

text: FERDINAND FELT HIS FREEDOM AS WELL AS HIS HAPPINESS
translated_text: Ferdinand felt his freedom as well as his happiness.

text: IT WAS INDEED HER HANDWRITING
translated_text: It was indeed her handwriting.

text: RESTLESS WITH IMPENDING JOY HE SAUNTERED TO THE BRIDGE AND LEANT OVER THE BALUSTRADE GAZING ON THE WATERS IN CHARMED AND CHARMING VACANCY
translated_text: Restless with impending joy, he sauntered to the bridge and leaned over the ballast drain, gazing on the waters in charmed and charming vacancy.

text: HOW MANY INCIDENTS HOW MANY CHARACTERS HOW MANY FEELINGS FLITTED OVER HIS MEMORY OF WHAT SWEET AND BITTER EXPERIENCE DID HE NOT CHEW THE CUD
translated_text: How many incidents, how many characters, how many feelings flitted over his memory of what sweet and bitter experience did he not chew the cud?

text: FOUR AND TWENTY HOURS AGO AND HE DEEMED HIMSELF THE MOST MISERABLE AND FORLORN OF HUMAN BEINGS AND NOW ALL THE BLESSINGS OF THE WORLD SEEMED SHOWERED AT HIS FEET
translated_text: 4 and 20 hours ago, and he deemed himself the most miserable and forlorn of human beings. And now all the blessings of the world seem showered at his feet.

text: THE MOST GIFTED INDIVIDUALS IN THE LAND EMULATED EACH OTHER IN PROVING WHICH ENTERTAINED FOR HIM THE MOST SINCERE AFFECTION
translated_text: The most gifted individuals in the land emulated each other, improving which entertained for him the most sincere affection.

text: HE COULD NOT FLATTER HIMSELF THAT HE INDEED MERITED SUCH SINGULAR BLESSINGS AND YET WITH ALL HIS FAULTS WHICH WITH HIM WERE BUT THE CONSEQUENCES OF HIS FIERY YOUTH FERDINAND HAD BEEN FAITHFUL TO HENRIETTA
translated_text: He could not flatter himself that he indeed merited such singular blessings, and yet with all his faults, which with him were but the consequences of his fiery youth, verdant and had been faithful to Henrietta.

text: HIS CONSTANCY TO HER WAS NOW REWARDED
translated_text: His constancy to her was now rewarded.

text: AS FOR HIS FRIENDS THE FUTURE MUST PROVE HIS GRATITUDE TO THEM
translated_text: As for his friends, the future must prove his gratitude to them.

text: IT WAS INDEED DANCING ON A VOLCANO
translated_text: It was indeed dancing on a volcano.

text: AND NOW ALL HAD ENDED SO HAPPILY
translated_text: And now all had ended so happily.

text: WAS IT NOT ALL A DREAM OF HIS OWN CREATION WHILE HIS EYE HAD BEEN FIXED IN ABSTRACTION ON THAT BRIGHT AND FLOWING RIVER
translated_text: Was it not all a dream of his own creation while his eye had been fixed in abstraction on that bright and flowing river?

text: HE MIGHT BE ENCHANTED BUT THAT WAS THE TALISMAN
translated_text: He might be enchanted, but that was the talisman.

text: IN THE PRESENT UNSETTLED THOUGH HOPEFUL STATE OF AFFAIRS FERDINAND WOULD NOT GO HOME
translated_text: In the present unsettled, though hopeful state of affairs, Ferdinand would not go home.

text: IN EXACTLY TEN MINUTES IT IS IN THE POWER OF EVERY MAN TO FREE HIMSELF FROM ALL THE TUMULT OF THE WORLD THE PANGS OF LOVE THE THROBS OF AMBITION THE WEAR AND TEAR OF PLAY THE RECRIMINATING BOUDOIR THE CONSPIRING CLUB THE RATTLING HELL AND FIND HIMSELF IN A SUBLIME SYLVAN SOLITUDE SUPERIOR TO THE CEDARS OF LEBANON AND INFERIOR ONLY IN EXTENT TO THE CHESTNUT FORESTS OF ANATOLIA
translated_text: In exactly ten minutes it is in the power of every man to free himself from all the tumult of the world, the pangs of love, the throbs of ambition, the wear and tear of play, the recriminating buddhwar, the conspiring club, the rattling hell, and find himself in a sublime Sylvan solitude superior to the cedars of Lebanon, an inferior only in extent to the chestnut forest of Anatolia.

text: IS PAPA ALONE ENQUIRED MISS TEMPLE
translated_text: Is Papa alone in Quiredness Temple?

text: GRANT WAS ONLY A FEW MILES AWAY BUT ALTHOUGH COMMANDER IN CHIEF HE KNEW NOTHING OF THE HARDEST FOUGHT BATTLE OF THE CIVIL WAR UNTIL IT WAS OVER
translated_text: Grant was only a few miles away, but although the commander in chief, he knew nothing of the hardest fought battle of the Civil War until it was over.

text: MY OWN REGIMENT WAS IN THE ADVANCE
translated_text: My own regiment was in the advance.

text: OUR BRIGADE WAS FEARFULLY OUTNUMBERED
translated_text: Our brigade was fearfully outnumbered.

text: THERE WERE NO BREASTWORKS YET THAT ONE LITTLE BRIGADE OF HAMILTON'S DIVISION STOOD THERE IN THE OPEN AND REPULSED ASSAULT AFTER ASSAULT
translated_text: There were no breastworks, yet that one little brigade of Hamilton's division stood there in the open and repulsed assault after assault.

text: NOT BALAKLAVA NOR THE ALMA SAW SUCH FIGHTING IT WAS A DUEL TO THE DEATH
translated_text: Not by the clava, nor the alma saw such fighting. It was the duel to the death.

text: NO BATTERY IN THE WHOLE FOUR YEARS WAR LOST SO MANY MEN IN SO SHORT A TIME
translated_text: No battery in the whole four years' war lost so many men and so short a time.

text: ONE DARING REBEL WAS SHOT DOWN AND BAYONETED CLEAR BEHIND THE LINE OF COMPANY B WHERE HE HAD BROKEN THROUGH TO SEIZE THE FLAG OF MY REGIMENT
translated_text: One daring rebel was shot down and bayoneted, clear behind the line of company B, where he had broken through to seize the flag of my regiment.

text: THAT NIGHT THE ENEMY SLIPPED AWAY LEAVING HUNDREDS AND HUNDREDS OF HIS DEAD AND WOUNDED ON THE FIELD
translated_text: That night the enemy slipped away, leaving hundreds and hundreds of his dead and wounded on the field.

text: WITH A FEW LANTERNS OUR MEN THEN WENT ABOUT AND TRIED TO GATHER UP THE WOUNDED THE DEAD WERE LEFT TILL MORNING
translated_text: With a few lanterns, our men then went about and tried to gather up the wounded. The dead were left till morning.

text: IT WAS NOT A QUESTION WHO WAS DEAD OR WOUNDED BUT WHO WAS NOT
translated_text: It was not a question of who was dead or wounded, but who was not?

text: FIFTEEN OFFICERS OF OUR LITTLE HALF REGIMENT WERE DEAD OR WOUNDED
translated_text: 15 officers of our little half regiment were dead or wounded.

text: I REMAINED AWAKE ALL NIGHT TALKING WITH A COMRADE WHO SHARED MY BLANKET WITH ME POOR JIMMY KING
translated_text: I remained awake all night, talking with a comrade who shared my blanket with me. Poor Jimmy King.

text: HE SURVIVED THE WAR ONLY TO BE MURDERED LATER ON A PLANTATION IN MISSISSIPPI
translated_text: He survived the war only to be murdered later on a plantation in Mississippi.

text: WHEN MORNING CAME THE FIRING OPENED AND FOR ALL THAT DAY THE BATTLE RAGED FIERCELY AT THE LEFT AND CENTER LEFT WE GETTING THE WORST OF IT TOO
translated_text: When morning came, the firing opened, and for all that day the battle raged fiercely at the left and center left. We getting the worst of it too.

text: THAT EVENING AN ORDER CAME FOR US HAMILTON'S DIVISION TO ASSAULT THE ENEMY'S LEFT FLANK AT MIDNIGHT
translated_text: That evening an order came for us, Hamilton's division, to assault the enemy's left flank at midnight.

text: UNDER THE SAME QUIET MOONLIGHT AND ONLY SIX HUNDRED YARDS AWAY FROM US ALSO LAY THE VICTORIOUS REBEL ARMY
translated_text: Under the same quiet moonlight and only 600 yards away from us, also lay the victorious Rebel Army.

text: ONCE IN THE NIGHT I SLIPPED AWAY FROM THE BIVOUAC AND HURRIED TO THE OLD TISHIMINGO HOTEL TO SEE A LIEUTENANT OF MY COMPANY WHO HAD BEEN SHOT THROUGH THE BREAST
translated_text: Once in a night, I slipped away from the Bivouac and hurried to the old Tishimingo Hotel to see a lieutenant of my company who had been shot through the breast.

text: I COULD NOT HELP MY FRIEND
translated_text: I could not help my friend.

text: GO BACK TO THE REGIMENT HE SAID SMILING ALL WILL BE NEEDED
translated_text: Go back to the regiment he said smiling. All will be needed.

text: MY FRIEND WITH MANY OTHERS WAS BEING CARRIED OUT TO DIE ELSEWHERE
translated_text: My friend, with many others, was being carried out to die elsewhere.

text: I HASTENED BACK TO THE LINES
translated_text: I hasten back to the lines.

text: THE CLOUD OF REBELS WE HAD SEEN DIVIDED ITSELF INTO THREE COLUMNS
translated_text: The cloud or rebels we had seen divided itself into three columns.

text: A PERFECT BLAZE OF CLOSE RANGE MUSKETRY TOO MOWED THEM DOWN LIKE GRASS
translated_text: A perfect blaze of close range musketry to move them down like grass.

text: THEY LAY IN HEAPS OF DOZENS EVEN CLOSE UP TO THE WORKS
translated_text: They lay in heaps of dozens, even close up to the works.

text: THAT NIGHT I STOOD GUARD UNDER AN OAK TREE ON THE BATTLEFIELD AMONG THE UNBURIED DEAD
translated_text: That night I stood guard under an oak tree on the battlefield, among the unburied dead.

text: INDEED WE OF THE RANK AND FILE HAD LITTLE CONFIDENCE IN GRANT IN THOSE DAYS
translated_text: Indeed, we of the rank and file had little confidence in grant in those days.

text: ROSECRANS PROTESTED IT WAS IN VAIN
translated_text: Rose Crance protested. It was in vain.

text: IT REQUIRED MONTHS AND GREAT EVENTS TO MAKE GRANT THE HERO OF THE ARMY WHICH HE AFTERWARD BECAME
translated_text: It required months and great events to make grant the hero of the army which he afterward became.

text: FOR SOME REASON THE DEAD AT HATCHIE BRIDGE WERE NOT BURIED
translated_text: For some reason, the dead at Hatchee Bridge were not buried.

text: A WEEK AFTER THE BATTLE MY BROTHER RODE BY THERE ON A CAVALRY EXPEDITION AND MADE THE HORRIBLE DISCOVERY THAT HOGS WERE EATING UP THE BODIES OF OUR DEAD HEROES THAT TOO WAS WAR
translated_text: A week after the battle, my brother rode by there on a cavalry expedition and made the horrible discovery that hogs were eating up the bodies of our dead heroes. That too was war.

text: LONG AGO THERE LIVED A MERCHANT WHO HAD THREE DAUGHTERS
translated_text: Long ago, they lived in Merchant who had three daughters.

text: EVERY YEAR AT A CERTAIN DAY OF A CERTAIN MONTH HE WENT AWAY TO A DISTANT CITY TO COLLECT MONEY ON AN ACCOUNT
translated_text: Every year, at a certain day of a certain month, he went away to a distant city to collect money when an account.

text: HOW DO YOU KNOW ASKED THEIR FATHER I AM OLDER AND WISER THAN YOU ARE AND I KNOW THAT THERE ARE MANY EVILS WHICH MIGHT COME UPON YOU
translated_text: How do you know, Astor Father? I am older and wiser than you are, and I know that there are many evils which might come upon you.

text: WHEN IT WAS EVENING HE LED HIS BAND INTO A NEARBY STREET AND IN HIS DISGUISE APPROACHED THE MERCHANT'S HOUSE HE KNOCKED AT THE DOOR
translated_text: When it was evening, he led his band into a nearby street and in his disguise approached the merchant's house. He knocked at the door.

text: HAVE PITY UPON A POOR UNFORTUNATE ONE HE CALLED OUT
translated_text: Have pity upon a poor unfortunate one," he called out.

text: LET ME ENTER I PRAY YOU TO PASS THE NIGHT UNDER YOUR ROOF
translated_text: Let me enter, I pray you, to pass the night under your roof.

text: IT'S SURELY A TERRIBLE STORM OUTSIDE SAID THE MERCHANT'S ELDEST DAUGHTER AS THE WIND RATTLED THE TILES OF THE ROOF AND THE RAIN BEAT IN TORRENTS AGAINST THE DOORS AND WINDOWS
translated_text: It's surely a terrible storm outside, so the merchant's eldest daughter, as the wind rattled the tiles of the roof and the rain beat in torrents against the doors and windows.

text: HE IS OLD AS WELL AS POOR SHE SAID
translated_text: He is old as well as poor, she said.

text: IF WE DECIDE TO SHOW MERCY TO THIS POOR BEGGAR IT IS NOT FOR YOU TO OPPOSE IT
translated_text: If we decide to share mercy to this poor beggar, it is not for you to oppose it.

text: BUI WE SHOULD NOT FORGET OUR PROMISE TO OUR FATHER CRIED THE YOUNGEST DAUGHTER
translated_text: But we should not forget our promise to our father, cried the youngest daughter.

text: HOWEVER IN SPITE OF ALL SHE COULD SAY THE ELDER SISTERS OPENED THE DOOR AND ADMITTED THE BEGGAR
translated_text: However, in spite of all she could say, the elder sisters opened the door and admitted the bigger.

text: IT IS A FEARFUL NIGHT TO SEND AWAY A BEGGAR SAID THE ELDEST SISTER WHILE THEY WERE EATING
translated_text: It is a fearful night to send away a bigger, said the eldest sister while they were eating.

text: WHILE THEY WERE TALKING THE BEGGAR HAD TAKEN THE APPLES WHICH THE GIRLS WERE TO EAT FOR DESSERT AND HAD SPRINKLED A SLEEPING POWDER OVER THEM
translated_text: While they were talking, the beggar had taken the apples, which the girls were to eat for dessert, and had sprinkled a sleeping powder over them.

text: THE TWO ELDEST ATE THEIR APPLES BUT THE YOUNGEST COULD NOT EAT THAT NIGHT SHE THREW THE APPLE AWAY
translated_text: The two eldest ate their apples, but the youngest could not eat that night. She threw the apple away.

text: SHE DID NOT STIR AND HE KNEW THAT THE SLEEPING POWDER HAD THOROUGHLY DONE ITS WORK
translated_text: She did not stir, and he knew that the sleeping powder had thoroughly done its work.

text: THEN SHE HEARD HIM GO DOWN THE STAIRWAY AND UNBOLT THE HEAVY DOORS WHICH LED INTO THE STORE
translated_text: Then she hurt him go down the stairway and unbolt the heavy doors which led into the store.

text: IT WAS THE YOUNGEST ONE WHO DECEIVED ME CRIED THE ROBBER CHIEFTAIN
translated_text: It was the youngest one who deceived me, cried the Robert Chieftain.

text: PERHAPS YOU CAN OUTWIT HER YET CRIED ANOTHER
translated_text: Perhaps we can outlet her yet, cry another.

text: THE MERCHANT'S DAUGHTER AT FIRST DID NOT ANSWER BUT AS HE KEPT ON CALLING TO HER SHE FINALLY ASKED HIM WHAT IT WAS THAT HE WANTED
translated_text: The merchant's daughter at first did not answer, but as he kept on calling to her, she finally asked him what it was that he wanted.

text: I PROMISE YOU I WILL DO YOU NO HARM
translated_text: I promise you I will do you no harm.

text: YOU SHALL NOT COME INTO MY FATHER'S HOUSE
translated_text: you shall not come into my father's house.

text: PASS THE CHARM OUT TO ME THEN SAID THE ROBBER
translated_text: Pass the charm out to me then," said the robber.

text: WHEN SHE RETURNED HIS HAND WAS STICKING THROUGH THE HOLE IN THE DOOR
translated_text: When she returned, his hand was sticking through the hole in the door.

text: THE CRIES AND CURSES OF THE ROBBERS FILLED THE AIR
translated_text: The cries and curses of the robbers filled the air.

text: THEY TRIED IN VAIN TO BREAK DOWN THE GREAT DOORS
translated_text: They tried and vain to break down the great doors.

text: ALL MY WORRIES ABOUT YOU WERE FOOLISH
translated_text: All my worries about you were foolish.

text: HE HAD LITTLE ENOUGH TO BREAK OR BITE AND ONCE WHEN THERE WAS A GREAT FAMINE IN THE LAND HE COULD HARDLY PROCURE EVEN HIS DAILY BREAD AND AS HE LAY THINKING IN HIS BED ONE NIGHT HE SIGHED AND SAID TO HIS WIFE WHAT WILL BECOME OF US
translated_text: He had little enough to break or bite, and once, when there was a great famine in the land, he could hardly procure even his daily bread. And as he lay thinking in his bed one night, he sighed and said to his wife, What will become of us?

text: HOW CAN WE FEED OUR CHILDREN WHEN WE HAVE NO MORE THAN WE CAN EAT OURSELVES
translated_text: How can we feed our children when we have no more than we can eat ourselves?

text: OH YOU SIMPLETON SAID SHE THEN WE MUST ALL FOUR DIE OF HUNGER YOU HAD BETTER PLANE THE COFFINS FOR US
translated_text: Oh, you simpleton said she. Then we must all for die of hunger. You had better plan the coffins for us.

text: BUT SHE LEFT HIM NO PEACE TILL HE CONSENTED SAYING AH BUT I SHALL MISS THE POOR CHILDREN
translated_text: But she left him no peace till he consented, saying, Ah, but I shall miss the poor children.

text: AND AS SOON AS THEIR PARENTS HAD GONE TO SLEEP HE GOT UP PUT ON HIS COAT AND UNBARRING THE BACK DOOR WENT OUT
translated_text: and as soon as their parents had gone to sleep, he got up, put on his coat, and unbarring the back door went out.

text: AH FATHER SAID HANSEL I AM LOOKING AT MY WHITE CAT SITTING UPON THE ROOF OF THE HOUSE AND TRYING TO SAY GOOD BYE
translated_text: Ah, father," said Hansel. I am looking at my white cat, sitting upon the roof of the house, and trying to say goodbye.

text: BUT IN REALITY HANSEL WAS NOT LOOKING AT A CAT BUT EVERY TIME HE STOPPED HE DROPPED A PEBBLE OUT OF HIS POCKET UPON THE PATH
translated_text: But in reality, Hansel was not looking at a cat. But every time he stopped, he dropped a pebble out of his pocket upon the path.

text: BUT HER HUSBAND FELT HEAVY AT HEART AND THOUGHT IT WERE BETTER TO SHARE THE LAST CRUST WITH THE CHILDREN
translated_text: But her husband felt heavy at heart and thought, it were better to share the last crust with the children.

text: EARLY IN THE MORNING THE STEPMOTHER CAME AND PULLED THEM OUT OF BED AND GAVE THEM EACH A SLICE OF BREAD WHICH WAS STILL SMALLER THAN THE FORMER PIECE
translated_text: Early in the morning, the stepmother came and pulled them out of bed and gave them each a slice of bread, which was still smaller than the former piece.

text: WE ARE GOING INTO THE FOREST TO HEW WOOD AND IN THE EVENING WHEN WE ARE READY WE WILL COME AND FETCH YOU AGAIN
translated_text: We are going into the forest to Hugh Wood, and in the evening, when we're ready, we will come and fetch you again.

text: HANSEL THOUGHT THE ROOF TASTED VERY NICE AND SO HE TORE OFF A GREAT PIECE WHILE GRETHEL BROKE A LARGE ROUND PANE OUT OF THE WINDOW AND SAT DOWN QUITE CONTENTEDLY
translated_text: Hansel thought the roof tasted very nice and so he tore off a great piece. While Gretel broke a large round pain out of the window and sat down quite contentedly.

text: COME IN AND STOP WITH ME AND NO HARM SHALL COME TO YOU AND SO SAYING SHE TOOK THEM BOTH BY THE HAND AND LED THEM INTO HER COTTAGE
translated_text: come in and stop with me and no harm shall come to you." And so saying, she took them both by the hand and led them into her cottage.

text: THE OLD WOMAN BEHAVED VERY KINDLY TO THEM BUT IN REALITY SHE WAS A WICKED OLD WITCH WHO WAY LAID CHILDREN AND BUILT THE BREADHOUSE IN ORDER TO ENTICE THEM IN BUT AS SOON AS THEY WERE IN HER POWER SHE KILLED THEM COOKED AND ATE THEM AND MADE A GREAT FESTIVAL OF THE DAY
translated_text: The old woman behaved very kindly to them, but in reality she was a bigot old witch, who waylaid children and built the breadhouse in order to entice them in. But as soon as they were in her power, she killed them, cooked them and ate them, and made a great festival of the day.

text: THEN SHE TOOK UP HANSEL WITH HER ROUGH HAND AND SHUT HIM UP IN A LITTLE CAGE WITH A LATTICE DOOR AND ALTHOUGH HE SCREAMED LOUDLY IT WAS OF NO USE
translated_text: Then she took up Hansel with her rough hand and shut him up in a little cage with a lattice door. And although he screamed loudly, it was of no use.

text: GRETHEL BEGAN TO CRY BUT IT WAS ALL USELESS FOR THE OLD WITCH MADE HER DO AS SHE WANTED
translated_text: Gretel began to cry, but it was all useless for the old witch made her do as she wanted.

text: GRETHEL SHE CRIED IN A PASSION GET SOME WATER QUICKLY BE HANSEL FAT OR LEAN THIS MORNING I WILL KILL AND COOK HIM
translated_text: Gretel, she cried in a passion. Get some water quickly. Be handsel, fat or lean, this morning I will kill and cook him.

text: DEAR GOOD GOD HELP US NOW SHE PRAYED
translated_text: Dear, good God, help us now, she prayed.

text: CREEP IN SAID THE WITCH AND SEE IF IT IS HOT ENOUGH AND THEN WE WILL PUT IN THE BREAD BUT SHE INTENDED WHEN GRETHEL GOT IN TO SHUT UP THE OVEN AND LET HER BAKE SO THAT SHE MIGHT EAT HER AS WELL AS HANSEL
translated_text: Creep in, said the witch, and see if it is hot enough, and then we will put in the bread. But she intended, when Greta got in, to shut up the oven and let her bake so that she might eat her as well as Hansel.

text: SEE I COULD EVEN GET IN MYSELF
translated_text: See, I could even get in myself.

text: AND SHE GOT UP AND PUT HER HEAD INTO THE OVEN
translated_text: and she got up and put her head into the oven.

text: AND NOW AS THERE WAS NOTHING TO FEAR THEY WENT BACK TO THE WITCH'S HOUSE WHERE IN EVERY CORNER WERE CASKETS FULL OF PEARLS AND PRECIOUS STONES
translated_text: And now, as there was nothing to fear, they went back to the witch's house, where in every corner were caskets full of pearls and precious stones.

text: THEN THEY BEGAN TO RUN AND RUSHING INTO THE HOUSE THEY FELL UPON THEIR FATHER'S NECK
translated_text: Then they began to run and rushing into the house they fell upon their father's neck.

text: NOT HAVING HEARD FROM CAPTAIN BENNYDECK FOR SOME LITTLE TIME RANDAL THOUGHT IT DESIRABLE IN SYDNEY'S INTERESTS TO MAKE INQUIRIES AT HIS CLUB
translated_text: Not having heard from Captain Benedick for some little time, Randall thought it desirable in Sydney's interest to make inquiries at his club.

text: THE SAILING MASTER ANNOUNCED THAT HE HAD ORDERS TO TAKE THE VESSEL BACK TO HER PORT WITH NO OTHER EXPLANATION THAN THAT THE CRUISE WAS OVER
translated_text: The sailing master announced that he had orders to take the vessel back to her port, with no other explanation than that the cruise was over.

text: THIS ALTERNATIVE IN THE CAPTAIN'S PLANS TERMINATING THE VOYAGE A MONTH EARLIER THAN HIS ARRANGEMENTS HAD CONTEMPLATED PUZZLED RANDAL
translated_text: This alternative in the captain's plans, terminating the voyage a month earlier than his arrangements had contemplated, puzzled Randall.

text: RANDAL WAITED A WHILE IN LONDON ON THE CHANCE THAT BENNYDECK MIGHT PAY HIM A VISIT
translated_text: Randle waited while in London, on the chance that Benedict might pay him a visit.

text: HE IS STAYING AT THIS HOTEL TO TRY THE AIR OF SYDENHAM AND HE FINDS THAT IT AGREES WITH HIM
translated_text: He is staying at this hotel to try the air of Saitanam and he finds that it agrees with him.

text: HAD HER BEAUTY FASCINATED HIM
translated_text: had her beauty fascinated him.

text: RANDAL WROTE TO ACCEPT THE INVITATION DETERMINING TO PRESENT HIMSELF BEFORE THE APPOINTED HOUR AND TO QUESTION CATHERINE PRIVATELY WITHOUT GIVING HER THE ADVANTAGE OVER HIM OF PREPARING HERSELF FOR THE INTERVIEW
translated_text: Randall wrote to accept the invitation, determining to present himself before the appointed hour, and to question Catherine privately, without giving her the advantage over him of preparing herself for the interview.

text: AFTER MONTHS OF SEPARATION HE RECEIVED A VISIT FROM HERBERT
translated_text: After months of separation, he received a visit from Herbert.

text: YOU DISTRESS ME HERBERT MORE THAN WORDS CAN SAY
translated_text: You distress me, Herbert. More than words can say.

text: HE DRANK THE WINE GREEDILY
translated_text: He drank the wine greedily.

text: WHATEVER REVIVING EFFECT IT MIGHT OTHERWISE HAVE PRODUCED ON HIM IT MADE NO CHANGE IN THE THREATENING GLOOM OF HIS MANNER
translated_text: Whatever reviving effect it might otherwise have produced on him, it made no change in the threatening gloom of his manner.

text: HE PUT DOWN THE EMPTY GLASS TAKING NO NOTICE OF HIS BROTHER'S QUESTION
translated_text: He put down the empty glass, taking no notice of his brother's question.

text: RANDAL HE SAID YOU KNOW WHERE SYDNEY IS
translated_text: Randall, he said, you know where Sydney is.

text: I WILL DO NEITHER THE ONE NOR THE OTHER
translated_text: I will do neither the one nor the other.

text: YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT IT IS TO BE USED TO SEEING A PRETTY CREATURE ALWAYS NICELY DRESSED ALWAYS ABOUT THE ROOM THINKING SO MUCH OF YOU AND SO LITTLE OF HERSELF AND THEN TO BE LEFT ALONE AS I AM LEFT OUT IN THE DARK
translated_text: You don't know what it is to be used to seeing a pretty creature always nicely dressed, always about the room, thinking so much of you and so little of herself, and then to be left alone as I am left, out in the dark.

text: I'M ALONE DO YOU HEAR THAT ALONE
translated_text: I'm alone. Do you hear that? Alone.

text: I HAVEN'T COURAGE ENOUGH TO DO IT FOR MYSELF
translated_text: I haven't encouraged enough to do it for myself.

text: OH WHY DID I ENGAGE THAT GOVERNESS
translated_text: Oh, why did I engage that governess?

text: I'M AFRAID HE SAID
translated_text: I'm afraid, he said.

text: I TRIED IT YESTERDAY IT SET MY BRAINS ON FIRE I'M FEELING THAT GLASS I TOOK JUST NOW
translated_text: I tried it yesterday. It set my brains on fire. I'm feeling that glass I took just now.

text: HE PAUSED AND PUT HIS HAND TO HIS FEVERED HEAD
translated_text: He paused and put his hand to his fevered head.

text: WAS HIS MIND WANDERING INTO SOME OTHER TRAIN OF THOUGHT
translated_text: was his mind wandering into some other train of thought.

text: YOU CAN'T DO IT
translated_text: You can't do it.

text: LET ME HEAR WHAT IT IS FIRST
translated_text: Let me hear what it is first.

text: I FEEL FOR YOU HERBERT HE SAID WARMLY
translated_text: I feel for you, Herbert. He said warmly.

text: SHE SHALL HAVE YOUR MESSAGE ALL THAT I CAN DO TO PERSUADE HER SHALL BE DONE
translated_text: She shall have your message, all that I can do to persuade her shall be done.

text: LET ME REST A LITTLE HE PLEADED IF I'M NOT IN THE WAY
translated_text: Let me rest a little, he pleaded, if I'm not in the way.

text: HE MENTIONED THE NAME OF ONE OF THE OLD SERVANTS AT MOUNT MORVEN WHO HAD ATTACHED HIMSELF TO RANDAL AFTER THE BREAKUP OF THE FAMILY
translated_text: He mentioned the name of one of the old servants at Mount Morvan, who had attached himself to Randall after the breakup of the family.

text: ON THE NEXT DAY BUT ONE RANDAL ARRANGED HIS DEPARTURE FOR SYDENHAM SO AS TO ARRIVE AT THE HOTEL AN HOUR BEFORE THE TIME APPOINTED FOR THE DINNER
translated_text: On the next day but one, Randall arranged his departure for Sidonham, so as to arrive at the hotel an hour before the time appointed for the dinner.

text: THE NEW NUMBER OF A POPULAR WEEKLY JOURNAL HAD THAT DAY BEEN PUBLISHED RANDAL BOUGHT IT
translated_text: The new number of a popular weekly journal had that day been published. Randall bought it.

text: AFTER READING ONE OR TWO OF THE POLITICAL ARTICLES HE ARRIVED AT THE COLUMNS SPECIALLY DEVOTED TO FASHIONABLE INTELLIGENCE
translated_text: After reading one or two of the political articles, he arrived at the columns specially devoted to fashionable intelligence.

text: RANDAL LOOKED AGAIN AT THE FIRST WORDS IN THE PARAGRAPH
translated_text: Randle looked again at the first words in the paragraph.

text: WITH HIS OWN SUSPICIONS STEADILY CONTRADICTING HIM HE ARRIVED AT THE HOTEL OBSTINATELY BELIEVING THAT THE CHARMING WIDOW WOULD PROVE TO BE A STRANGER
translated_text: With his own suspicions steadily contradicting him, he arrived at the hotel, obstinately believing that the charming widow would prove to be a stranger.

text: MISSUS NORMAN AND HER LITTLE DAUGHTER WERE OUT DRIVING WITH A FRIEND AND WERE EXPECTED TO RETURN IN GOOD TIME FOR DINNER
translated_text: Mrs. Norman and her little daughter were out driving with a friend, and were expected to return in good time for dinner.

text: MISSUS PRESTY WAS AT HOME SHE WAS REPORTED TO BE IN THE GARDEN OF THE HOTEL
translated_text: Mrs. Presty was at home. She was reported to be in the garden of the hotel.

text: HOW NICE OF YOU TO COME SO SOON SHE BEGAN
translated_text: How nice of you to come so soon, she began.

text: SHE ADDED LOOKING AT HIM SUSPICIOUSLY
translated_text: She added, looking at him suspiciously.

text: BUT YOU OUGHT TO HAVE KNOWN THAT WE ARE ONLY HALF AN HOUR BEHIND YOU AT SYDENHAM IN THE MATTER OF NEWS
translated_text: But you ought to have known that we are only half an hour behind you at Sidenham in the matter of news.

text: THE REPORT IS PREMATURE MY GOOD FRIEND
translated_text: The report is premature, my good friend.

text: BUT IF THESE NEWSPAPER PEOPLE WAITED TO FIND OUT WHETHER A REPORT IS TRUE OR FALSE HOW MUCH GOSSIP WOULD SOCIETY GET IN ITS FAVORITE NEWSPAPERS
translated_text: But if these newspaper people waited to find out whether a report is true or false, how much gossip would society get in its favorite newspapers?

text: YOU ARE TO UNDERSTAND THAT CATHERINE IS A WIDOW
translated_text: You are to understand that Catherine is a widow.

text: SIT DOWN SAID MISSUS PRESTY
translated_text: Sit down, said Mrs. Presti.

text: YOU SHALL HEAR HOW MY DIVORCED DAUGHTER AND MY POOR LITTLE GRANDCHILD WERE TREATED AT SANDYSEAL AFTER YOU LEFT US
translated_text: You shall hear how my divorce daughter and my poor little grandchild were treated at Sandy's seal after you left us.

text: YOU WOULD HAVE SEEN HER PINING FOR THE COMPANY OF OTHER CHILDREN AND WOULD HAVE HAD NO MERCY ON HER
translated_text: You would have seen her pining for the company of other children and would have had no mercy on her.

text: HE WAS INTRODUCED TO MISSUS NORMAN AND TO MISSUS NORMAN'S LITTLE GIRL AND WE WERE ALL CHARMED WITH HIM
translated_text: He was introduced to Mrs. Norman and to Mrs. Norman's little girl, and we were all charmed with him.

text: WHEN HE AND I HAPPENED TO BE LEFT TOGETHER HE NATURALLY WONDERED AFTER HAVING SEEN THE BEAUTIFUL WIFE WHERE THE LUCKY HUSBAND MIGHT BE
translated_text: When he and I happen to be left together, he naturally wondered, after having seen the beautiful wife, where the lucky husband might be.

text: AND THE CAPTAIN OF COURSE CONCLUDED AFTER HAVING BEEN INTRODUCED TO KITTY THAT MISSUS NORMAN WAS A WIDOW
translated_text: and the captain, of course, concluded, after having been introduced to Kitty, that Mrs. Norman was a widow.

text: WORSE STORIES HAVE BEEN PRINTED I DO ASSURE YOU WORSE STORIES HAVE BEEN PRINTED
translated_text: Worst stories have been printed. I do assure you worst stories have been printed.

text: BEFORE I CONSENTED TO ANSWER THE CHILD'S INQUIRIES I CAME TO AN UNDERSTANDING WITH HER MOTHER
translated_text: Before I consented to answer the child's inquiries, I came to an understanding with her mother.

text: HONESTLY
translated_text: Honestly.

text: AFTER THAT I HAD HER MOTHER'S AUTHORITY FOR TELLING KITTY THAT SHE WOULD NEVER SEE HER FATHER AGAIN
translated_text: After that, I had her mother's authority for telling Kitty that she would never see her father again.

text: SHE ASKED DIRECTLY IF HER FATHER WAS DEAD
translated_text: She asked directly if her father was dead.

text: THAT WILL DO MISSUS PRESTY YOUR DEFENSE IS THOROUGHLY WORTHY OF YOUR CONDUCT IN ALL OTHER RESPECTS
translated_text: That will do Mrs. Presti, your defense is thoroughly worthy of your conduct in all other respects.

text: RANDAL PASSED THIS OVER WITHOUT NOTICE
translated_text: Randall passed this over without notice.

text: A VERY WISE DECISION SHE REMARKED
translated_text: A very wise decision she remarked.

text: HAVE YOU ANY MESSAGE FOR CAPTAIN BENNYDECK
translated_text: Have you any message for Captain Benny Dick?

text: NOT AT THE HOTEL JUST NOW
translated_text: Not at the hotel, just now.

text: IT WAS A RELIEF TO RANDAL IN THE PRESENT STATE OF CATHERINE'S RELATIONS TOWARD BENNYDECK TO RETURN TO LONDON WITHOUT HAVING SEEN HIS FRIEND
translated_text: It was a relief to Randall in the present state of Catherine's relations toward Benedict, to return to London without having seen his friend.

text: GOOD BY DEAR RANDAL
translated_text: Goodbye, dear Randall.

text: ARRIVED AT THE STATION RANDAL FOUND THAT HE MUST WAIT FOR THE TRAIN
translated_text: Arrived at the station, Randall found that he must wait for the train.

text: WHILE HE WAS WALKING UP AND DOWN THE PLATFORM WITH A MIND DOUBLY DISTRESSED BY ANXIETY ABOUT HIS BROTHER AND ANXIETY ABOUT SYDNEY THE TRAIN FROM LONDON CAME IN
translated_text: While he was walking up and down the platform, with a mind doubly distressed by anxiety about his brother and anxiety about Sydney, the train from London came in.

text: WHAT ARE YOU DOING HERE HE ASKED
translated_text: What are you doing here? He asked.

text: YOU HAVE BEEN TO THE HOTEL HE BURST OUT YOU HAVE SEEN CATHERINE
translated_text: You have been to the hotel, he burst out. You have seen Catherine?

text: WE HAVE BOTH SEEN THE SAME NEWSPAPER OF COURSE AND YOU HAVE BEEN THE FIRST TO CLEAR THE THING UP THAT'S IT ISN'T IT
translated_text: We have both seen the same newspaper, of course, and you have been the first to clear the thing up. That's it, isn't it?

text: NOT SATISFIED WITH GOSSIP IN PRIVATE THE GREEDY PUBLIC APPETITE DEVOURS GOSSIP IN PRINT AND WANTS MORE OF IT THAN ANY ONE EDITOR CAN SUPPLY
translated_text: Not satisfied with Gossipon private, the greedy public appetite devours Gossipon print and wants more of it than any one editor can supply.

text: SUPPOSING THE REPORT HAD BEEN TRUE
translated_text: supposing the report had been true.

text: IN THE MEANTIME AFTER WHAT MISSUS PRESTY HAD CONFESSED THE CRUEL FALSEHOOD WHICH HAD CHECKED POOR KITTY'S NATURAL INQUIRIES RAISED AN INSUPERABLE OBSTACLE TO A MEETING BETWEEN FATHER AND CHILD
translated_text: In the meantime, after what Mrs. Presty had confessed, the cruel falsehood which had checked poor Kitty's natural inquiries raised an insupporable obstacle to a meeting between father and child.

text: HE HAD PROMISED TO DO HIS BEST TOWARD PERSUADING CATHERINE TO GRANT SYDNEY AN INTERVIEW
translated_text: He had promised to do his best toward persuading Catherine to grant Sydney an interview.

text: EVEN THE CHANCE OF SUCCESSFULLY CONFIDING HER TO BENNYDECK'S PROTECTION HAD LOST SOMETHING OF ITS FAIR PROMISE SINCE RANDAL'S VISIT TO SYDENHAM
translated_text: Even the chance of successfully confiding her to Benny Dex protection had lost something of its fair promise since Randall's visit to Sidonham.

text: BE THE RESULTS HOWEVER WHAT THEY MIGHT RANDAL COULD SEE BUT ONE PLAIN COURSE BEFORE HIM NOW
translated_text: Be the results, however, what they might, Randall could see but one plane course before him now.

text: CONSIDERATIONS OF DELICACY SEEMED TO FORBID TAKING THIS LIBERTY EVEN WITH AN INTIMATE FRIEND
translated_text: Considerations of delicacies seem to forbid taking this liberty, even with an intimate friend.

text: WHAT HAPPIER FUTURE COULD AWAIT HER ESPECIALLY IF SHE JUSTIFIED RANDAL'S PAST EXPERIENCE OF ALL THAT WAS CANDID AND TRUTHFUL IN HER CHARACTER THAN TO BECOME HIS FRIEND'S WIFE
translated_text: What happier future could await her, especially if she justified Randall's past experience of all that was candid and truthful in her character, then to become his friend's wife?

text: SHALL I SAY THAT SHE MAY EXPECT AN EARLY VISIT FROM YOU WHEN I SEE HER TO MORROW
translated_text: Shall I say that she may expect an early visit from you when I see her tomorrow?

text: HE ADDED SYDNEY'S ADDRESS IN A POSTSCRIPT AND DISPATCHED HIS LETTER THAT EVENING
translated_text: He added Sidney's address in a post script and dispatched his letter that evening.

text: BUT IT MIGHT PERHAPS BE EXCUSABLE TO INFER THAT THE MARRIAGE HAD NOT YET BEEN DECIDED ON AND THAT THE CAPTAIN'S PROPOSALS WERE STILL WAITING FOR CATHERINE'S REPLY
translated_text: But it might perhaps be excusable to infer that the marriage had not yet been decided on, and that the captain's proposals were still waiting for Catherine's reply.

text: GO DO YOU HEAR
translated_text: Go! Do you hear?

text: BUT IN LESS THAN FIVE MINUTES THE STAIRCASE GROANED BENEATH AN EXTRAORDINARY WEIGHT
translated_text: But in less than five minutes, the staircase groaned beneath an extraordinary weight.

text: AT THIS MOMENT THE WHOLE SOUL OF THE OLD MAN SEEMED CENTRED IN HIS EYES WHICH BECAME BLOODSHOT THE VEINS OF THE THROAT SWELLED HIS CHEEKS AND TEMPLES BECAME PURPLE AS THOUGH HE WAS STRUCK WITH EPILEPSY NOTHING WAS WANTING TO COMPLETE THIS BUT THE UTTERANCE OF A CRY
translated_text: At this moment, the whole soul of the old man seemed centered in his eyes which became bloodshot. The veins of the throat swelled. His cheeks and temples became purple as though he was struck with epilepsy. Nothing was wanting to complete this but the utterance of a cry.

text: AND THE CRY ISSUED FROM HIS PORES IF WE MAY THUS SPEAK A CRY FRIGHTFUL IN ITS SILENCE
translated_text: and the cry issued from his pores if we may thus speak a cry frightful in its silence.

text: D'AVRIGNY RUSHED TOWARDS THE OLD MAN AND MADE HIM INHALE A POWERFUL RESTORATIVE
translated_text: Devani rushed towards the old man and made him inhale a powerful restorative.

text: D'AVRIGNY UNABLE TO BEAR THE SIGHT OF THIS TOUCHING EMOTION TURNED AWAY AND VILLEFORT WITHOUT SEEKING ANY FURTHER EXPLANATION AND ATTRACTED TOWARDS HIM BY THE IRRESISTIBLE MAGNETISM WHICH DRAWS US TOWARDS THOSE WHO HAVE LOVED THE PEOPLE FOR WHOM WE MOURN EXTENDED HIS HAND TOWARDS THE YOUNG MAN
translated_text: Davani, unable to bear the sight of this touching emotion, turned away, and Villafort, without seeking any further explanation, and attracted towards him by the irresistible magnetism which draws us towards those who have loved the people for whom we mourn, extended his hand towards the young man.

text: FOR SOME TIME NOTHING WAS HEARD IN THAT CHAMBER BUT SOBS EXCLAMATIONS AND PRAYERS
translated_text: For some time, nothing was heard in that chamber, but sobbs, exclamation and prayers.

text: WHAT DO YOU MEAN SIR
translated_text: What do you mean, sir?

text: OH YOU RAVE SIR EXCLAIMED VILLEFORT IN VAIN ENDEAVORING TO ESCAPE THE NET IN WHICH HE WAS TAKEN I RAVE
translated_text: Oh, you rave, sir! Exclaimed Villifort, in vain, endeavoring to escape the net in which he was taken. I rave!

text: DO YOU KNOW THE ASSASSIN ASKED MORREL
translated_text: Do you know the assassin? Esmeral.

text: NOIRTIER LOOKED UPON MORREL WITH ONE OF THOSE MELANCHOLY SMILES WHICH HAD SO OFTEN MADE VALENTINE HAPPY AND THUS FIXED HIS ATTENTION
translated_text: Nautier looked upon morale with one of those melancholy smiles which had so often made Valentine happy and thus fixed his attention.

text: SAID MORREL SADLY YES REPLIED NOIRTIER
translated_text: said morale sadly. Yes, replied no to A.

text: THE OLD MAN'S EYES REMAINED FIXED ON THE DOOR
translated_text: The old man's eyes remain fixed on the door.

text: ASKED MORREL YES
translated_text: as morale. Yes.

text: MUST I LEAVE ALONE NO
translated_text: Must I leave alone? No.

text: BUT CAN HE UNDERSTAND YOU YES
translated_text: But can he understand you? Yes.

text: GENTLEMEN HE SAID IN A HOARSE VOICE GIVE ME YOUR WORD OF HONOR THAT THIS HORRIBLE SECRET SHALL FOREVER REMAIN BURIED AMONGST OURSELVES THE TWO MEN DREW BACK
translated_text: Gentlemen, he said in a horse voice, give me your word of honor that this horrible secret shell forever remained buried amongst ourselves. The two men drew back.

text: MY FATHER HAS REVEALED THE CULPRIT'S NAME MY FATHER THIRSTS FOR REVENGE AS MUCH AS YOU DO YET EVEN HE CONJURES YOU AS I DO TO KEEP THIS SECRET DO YOU NOT FATHER
translated_text: My father has revealed the culprit's name. My father thirsts for revenge as much as you do, yet even he conjures you as I do to keep this secret. Do you not, father?

text: MORREL SUFFERED AN EXCLAMATION OF HORROR AND SURPRISE TO ESCAPE HIM
translated_text: Morrell suffered an exclamation of horror and surprised to escape him.

text: THE OLD MAN MADE A SIGN IN THE AFFIRMATIVE
translated_text: The old man made a sign in the affirmative.

text: IT WAS SOMETHING TERRIBLE TO WITNESS THE SILENT AGONY THE MUTE DESPAIR OF NOIRTIER WHOSE TEARS SILENTLY ROLLED DOWN HIS CHEEKS
translated_text: It was something terrible to witness the silent agony, the mute despair of Nautier whose tears silently rolled on his cheeks.

text: BUT HE STOPPED ON THE LANDING HE HAD NOT THE COURAGE TO AGAIN VISIT THE DEATH CHAMBER
translated_text: But he stopped on the landing. He had not the courage to again visit the death chamber.

text: THE TWO DOCTORS THEREFORE ENTERED THE ROOM ALONE
translated_text: The two doctors therefore entered the room alone.

text: NOIRTIER WAS NEAR THE BED PALE MOTIONLESS AND SILENT AS THE CORPSE
translated_text: Nwatiya was near the bed, pale, motionless, and silent as the corpse.

text: THE DISTRICT DOCTOR APPROACHED WITH THE INDIFFERENCE OF A MAN ACCUSTOMED TO SPEND HALF HIS TIME AMONGST THE DEAD HE THEN LIFTED THE SHEET WHICH WAS PLACED OVER THE FACE AND JUST UNCLOSED THE LIPS
translated_text: The district doctor approached with the indifference of a man accustomed to spend half his time amongst the dead. He then lifted the sheet, which was placed over the face, and just unclosed to the lips.

text: THE NEAREST SAID THE DISTRICT DOCTOR IS A GOOD ITALIAN ABBE WHO LIVES NEXT DOOR TO YOU SHALL I CALL ON HIM AS I PASS
translated_text: The nearest, said the district doctor, is a good Italian abay who lives next door to you. Shall I call on him as I pass?

text: D'AVRIGNY SAID VILLEFORT BE SO KIND I BESEECH YOU AS TO ACCOMPANY THIS GENTLEMAN HERE IS THE KEY OF THE DOOR SO THAT YOU CAN GO IN AND OUT AS YOU PLEASE YOU WILL BRING THE PRIEST WITH YOU AND WILL OBLIGE ME BY INTRODUCING HIM INTO MY CHILD'S ROOM DO YOU WISH TO SEE HIM
translated_text: Daverne said Willefort. Be so kind I would see to you as to accompany this gentleman. Here is the key of the door so that you can go in and out as you please. You will bring the priest with you and will oblige me by introducing him into my child's room. Do you wish to see him?

text: I ONLY WISH TO BE ALONE YOU WILL EXCUSE ME WILL YOU NOT
translated_text: I only wish to be alone. You will excuse me, will you not?

text: I AM GOING SIR AND I DO NOT HESITATE TO SAY THAT NO PRAYERS WILL BE MORE FERVENT THAN MINE
translated_text: I am going, sir, and I do not hesitate to say that no prayers will be more fervent than mine.

text: BUT WITH FULL RAVISHMENT THE HOURS OF PRIME SINGING RECEIVED THEY IN THE MIDST OF LEAVES THAT EVER BORE A BURDEN TO THEIR RHYMES
translated_text: But, with full ravishment, the hours of prime, singing, received they in the midst of leaves that ever bore a burden to their rhymes.

text: ALL WATERS THAT ON EARTH MOST LIMPID ARE WOULD SEEM TO HAVE WITHIN THEMSELVES SOME MIXTURE COMPARED WITH THAT WHICH NOTHING DOTH CONCEAL
translated_text: All waters that on earth most limped are would seem to have within themselves some mixture compared with that which nothing does conceal.

text: THOU MAKEST ME REMEMBER WHERE AND WHAT PROSERPINA THAT MOMENT WAS WHEN LOST HER MOTHER HER AND SHE HERSELF THE SPRING
translated_text: Thou makeest me remember where and what, Prosupina, that moment was when lost her mother her, and she herself, the spring.

text: I DO NOT THINK THERE SHONE SO GREAT A LIGHT UNDER THE LIDS OF VENUS WHEN TRANSFIXED BY HER OWN SON BEYOND HIS USUAL CUSTOM
translated_text: I do not think they're shown so great a light under the lids of Venus when transfixed by her own son, beyond his usual custom.

text: YE ARE NEW COMERS AND BECAUSE I SMILE BEGAN SHE PERADVENTURE IN THIS PLACE ELECT TO HUMAN NATURE FOR ITS NEST
translated_text: Ye are newcomers and because I smile, Bikenshi, per adventure in this place elect to human nature for its nest.

text: SOME APPREHENSION KEEPS YOU MARVELLING BUT THE PSALM DELECTASTI GIVETH LIGHT WHICH HAS THE POWER TO UNCLOUD YOUR INTELLECT
translated_text: Some apprehension keeps you marveling, but the song, Delek Tassi, give it light which has the power to uncloud your intellect.

text: THE GOOD SUPREME SOLE IN ITSELF DELIGHTING CREATED MAN GOOD AND THIS GOODLY PLACE GAVE HIM AS HANSEL OF ETERNAL PEACE
translated_text: The good supreme, soul in itself delighting, created man good, and this goodly place gave him as handsel of eternal peace.

text: BY HIS DEFAULT SHORT WHILE HE SOJOURNED HERE BY HIS DEFAULT TO WEEPING AND TO TOIL HE CHANGED HIS INNOCENT LAUGHTER AND SWEET PLAY
translated_text: By his default, short while he's sojourned here. By his default to weeping and to toil, he changed his innocent laughter and sweet play.

text: THIS EVERY OTHER SAVOUR DOTH TRANSCEND AND NOTWITHSTANDING SLAKED SO FAR MAY BE THY THIRST THAT I REVEAL TO THEE NO MORE
translated_text: This every other saver does transcend, and notwithstanding slaked so far may be thirst that I reveal to thee no more.

text: BETWEEN HER STEPS AND MINE WERE NOT A HUNDRED WHEN EQUALLY THE MARGINS GAVE A TURN IN SUCH A WAY THAT TO THE EAST I FACED
translated_text: Between her steps and mine were not a hundred when equally the margins gave a turn in such a way that to the east I faced.

text: NOR EVEN THUS OUR WAY CONTINUED FAR BEFORE THE LADY WHOLLY TURNED HERSELF UNTO ME SAYING BROTHER LOOK AND LISTEN
translated_text: Nor even thus our way continued far before the lady wholly turned herself unto me, saying, Brother, look and listen.

text: NOW HELICON MUST NEEDS POUR FORTH FOR ME AND WITH HER CHOIR URANIA MUST ASSIST ME TO PUT IN VERSE THINGS DIFFICULT TO THINK
translated_text: Now, Helicon must needs poor forth for me, and with her choir, Euronia must assist me to put in verse things difficult to think.

text: THEN BACK I TURNED MY FACE TO THOSE HIGH THINGS WHICH MOVED THEMSELVES TOWARDS US SO SEDATELY THEY HAD BEEN DISTANCED BY NEW WEDDED BRIDES
translated_text: Then, back I turned my face to those high things, which moved themselves towards us so sedately they had been distanced by new-wetted brides.

text: AND I BEHELD THE FLAMELETS ONWARD GO LEAVING BEHIND THEMSELVES THE AIR DEPICTED AND THEY OF TRAILING PENNONS HAD THE SEMBLANCE SO THAT IT OVERHEAD REMAINED DISTINCT WITH SEVENFOLD LISTS ALL OF THEM OF THE COLOURS WHENCE THE SUN'S BOW IS MADE AND DELIA'S GIRDLE
translated_text: And I beheld the flamelets onward go, leaving behind themselves the air depicted and they of trailing penins had the semblance, so that it overhead remained distinct with seven fold lists, all of them of the colors whence the sun's bow is made, and dealias girdle.

text: THESE STANDARDS TO THE REARWARD LONGER WERE THAN WAS MY SIGHT AND AS IT SEEMED TO ME TEN PACES WERE THE OUTERMOST APART
translated_text: These standards to the rearward longer were than was my sight, and as it seemed to me, ten paces were the outermost apart.

text: THE INTERVAL BETWEEN THESE FOUR CONTAINED A CHARIOT TRIUMPHAL ON TWO WHEELS WHICH BY A GRIFFIN'S NECK CAME DRAWN ALONG
translated_text: The interval between these four contained a chariot triumphant on two wheels, which by a Griffin's neck came drawn along.

text: NOT ONLY ROME WITH NO SUCH SPLENDID CAR E'ER GLADDENED AFRICANUS OR AUGUSTUS BUT POOR TO IT THAT OF THE SUN WOULD BE
translated_text: Not only Rome, with no such splendid car, air-gladdened Africanus or Augustus, but poor to it that of the sun would be.

text: THREE MAIDENS AT THE RIGHT WHEEL IN A CIRCLE CAME ONWARD DANCING ONE SO VERY RED THAT IN THE FIRE SHE HARDLY HAD BEEN NOTED
translated_text: Three maidens at the right wheel in a circle came onward dancing, one so very red that in the fire she hardly had been noted.

text: THE SECOND WAS AS IF HER FLESH AND BONES HAD ALL BEEN FASHIONED OUT OF EMERALD THE THIRD APPEARED AS SNOW BUT NEWLY FALLEN
translated_text: The second was as if her flesh and bones had all been fashioned out of emerald. The third appeared as snow, but newly fallen.

text: IN REAR OF ALL THE GROUP HERE TREATED OF TWO OLD MEN I BEHELD UNLIKE IN HABIT BUT LIKE IN GAIT EACH DIGNIFIED AND GRAVE
translated_text: In rear of all the group here treated of two old men I beheld, unlike in habit, but like in gate, each dignified and grave.

text: AND WHEN THE CAR WAS OPPOSITE TO ME THUNDER WAS HEARD AND ALL THAT FOLK AUGUST SEEMED TO HAVE FURTHER PROGRESS INTERDICTED
translated_text: And when the car was opposite to me, thunder was heard, and all that folk August seemed to have further progress interdicted.

text: AND ONE OF THEM AS IF BY HEAVEN COMMISSIONED SINGING VENI SPONSA DE LIBANO SHOUTED THREE TIMES AND ALL THE OTHERS AFTER
translated_text: And one of them, as if by heaven commissioned singing, Vaini Sponsor delibano shouted three times and all the others after.

text: AS SOON AS ON MY VISION SMOTE THE POWER SUBLIME THAT HAD ALREADY PIERCED ME THROUGH ERE FROM MY BOYHOOD I HAD YET COME FORTH
translated_text: As soon as on my vision smoked the power sublime that had already pierced me through air from my boyhood I had yet come forth.

text: TO THE LEFT HAND I TURNED WITH THAT RELIANCE WITH WHICH THE LITTLE CHILD RUNS TO HIS MOTHER WHEN HE HAS FEAR OR WHEN HE IS AFFLICTED
translated_text: To the left hand I turned, with that reliance with which the little child runs to his mother when he has fear or when he is afflicted.

text: TO SAY UNTO VIRGILIUS NOT A DRACHM OF BLOOD REMAINS IN ME THAT DOES NOT TREMBLE I KNOW THE TRACES OF THE ANCIENT FLAME
translated_text: To say unto Vajilius, not a Drachome of blood remains in me that does not tremble. I know the traces of the ancient flame.

text: DANTE BECAUSE VIRGILIUS HAS DEPARTED DO NOT WEEP YET DO NOT WEEP YET AWHILE FOR BY ANOTHER SWORD THOU NEED'ST MUST WEEP
translated_text: Dante, because Vigilius has departed, do not weep yet. Do not weep yet a while, for by another sword thou needs must weep.

text: I SAW THE LADY WHO EREWHILE APPEARED VEILED UNDERNEATH THE ANGELIC FESTIVAL DIRECT HER EYES TO ME ACROSS THE RIVER
translated_text: I saw the lady who airwile appeared veiled underneath the angelic festival, direct her eyes to me across the river.

text: LOOK AT ME WELL IN SOOTH I'M BEATRICE
translated_text: Look at me well in Suith I'm Beatrice.

text: YE KEEP YOUR WATCH IN THE ETERNAL DAY SO THAT NOR NIGHT NOR SLEEP CAN STEAL FROM YOU ONE STEP THE AGES MAKE UPON THEIR PATH
translated_text: You keep your watch in the eternal day so that nor night nor sleep can steal from you one step the ages make upon their path

text: THEREFORE MY ANSWER IS WITH GREATER CARE THAT HE MAY HEAR ME WHO IS WEEPING YONDER SO THAT THE SIN AND DOLE BE OF ONE MEASURE
translated_text: Therefore, my answer is with greater care that he may hear me who is weeping yonder so that the sin and dole be of one measure.

text: BUT BY THE LARGESS OF CELESTIAL GRACES WHICH HAVE SUCH LOFTY VAPOURS FOR THEIR RAIN THAT NEAR TO THEM OUR SIGHT APPROACHES NOT
translated_text: But by the large s of celestial graces, which have such lofty vapors for their rain that near to them, our sight approaches not.

text: AS SOON AS EVER OF MY SECOND AGE I WAS UPON THE THRESHOLD AND CHANGED LIFE HIMSELF FROM ME HE TOOK AND GAVE TO OTHERS
translated_text: As soon as ever of my second age, I was upon the threshold and changed life, himself from me, he took and gave to others.

text: SO LOW HE FELL THAT ALL APPLIANCES FOR HIS SALVATION WERE ALREADY SHORT SAVE SHOWING HIM THE PEOPLE OF PERDITION
translated_text: So low he fell that all appliances for his salvation were already short, saved showing him the people of tradition.

text: CONFUSION AND DISMAY TOGETHER MINGLED FORCED SUCH A YES FROM OUT MY MOUTH THAT SIGHT WAS NEEDFUL TO THE UNDERSTANDING OF IT
translated_text: Confusion and dismay together mingled forced such a yes from out my mouth that sight was needful to the understanding of it.

text: WHENCE SHE TO ME IN THOSE DESIRES OF MINE WHICH LED THEE TO THE LOVING OF THAT GOOD BEYOND WHICH THERE IS NOTHING TO ASPIRE TO
translated_text: Wants, she to me. In those desires of mine which led thee to the loving of that good, beyond which there is nothing to aspire to.

text: AND WHAT ALLUREMENTS OR WHAT VANTAGES UPON THE FOREHEAD OF THE OTHERS SHOWED THAT THOU SHOULDST TURN THY FOOTSTEPS UNTO THEM
translated_text: and what allurements or what vantages upon the forehead of the other showed that thou shalt turn thy footsteps unto them.

text: HE TRANSLATED AT AN EARLY AGE CHIEFLY BETWEEN EIGHTEEN FORTY FIVE AND EIGHTEEN FORTY NINE A GREAT NUMBER OF POEMS BY THE ITALIANS CONTEMPORARY WITH DANTE OR PRECEDING HIM AND AMONG OTHER THINGS HE MADE A VERSION OF THE WHOLE VITA NUOVA PROSE AND VERSE
translated_text: He translated it in early age, chiefly between 1845 and 1849, a great number of poems by the Italians contemporary with Dante or preceding him, and, among other things, he made a version of the whole Vittanoava, prose and verse.

text: THIS BOOK IN ITS ORIGINAL FORM WAS RECEIVED WITH FAVOUR AND SETTLED THE CLAIM OF ROSSETTI TO RANK AS A POETIC TRANSLATOR OR INDEED AS A POET IN HIS OWN RIGHT
translated_text: This book, in its original form, was received with favor and settled the claim of Rosetti to rank as a poetic translator, or indeed as a poet in his own right.

text: THE LIFE BLOOD OF RHYTHMICAL TRANSLATION IS THIS COMMANDMENT THAT A GOOD POEM SHALL NOT BE TURNED INTO A BAD ONE
translated_text: The lifeblood of rhythmical translation is this commandment that a good poem shall not be turned into a bad one.

text: THE ONLY TRUE MOTIVE FOR PUTTING POETRY INTO A FRESH LANGUAGE MUST BE TO ENDOW A FRESH NATION AS FAR AS POSSIBLE WITH ONE MORE POSSESSION OF BEAUTY
translated_text: The only true motive for putting poetry into a fresh language must be to endow a fresh nation as far as possible with one more possession of beauty.

text: POETRY NOT BEING AN EXACT SCIENCE LITERALITY OF RENDERING IS ALTOGETHER SECONDARY TO THIS CHIEF LAW
translated_text: Poetry not being an exact science, the derality of rendering is altogether secondary to this chief law.

text: OFTEN WOULD HE AVAIL HIMSELF OF ANY SPECIAL GRACE OF HIS OWN IDIOM AND EPOCH IF ONLY HIS WILL BELONGED TO HIM OFTEN WOULD SOME CADENCE SERVE HIM BUT FOR HIS AUTHOR'S STRUCTURE SOME STRUCTURE BUT FOR HIS AUTHOR'S CADENCE OFTEN THE BEAUTIFUL TURN OF A STANZA MUST BE WEAKENED TO ADOPT SOME RHYME WHICH WILL TALLY AND HE SEES THE POET REVELLING IN ABUNDANCE OF LANGUAGE WHERE HIMSELF IS SCANTILY SUPPLIED
translated_text: Often would he avail himself of any special grace of his own idiom and epoch, if only his will belonged to him. Often would some cadence serve him, but for his author's structure, some structure but for his author's cadence. Often the beautiful turn of a stanza must be weakened to adopt some rhyme which will tally, and he sees the poet reveling in abundance of language where himself is scantily supplied.

text: AND IF YOU HAVE TIME IT WOULD BE A GREAT SERVICE TO TRANSLATE THE ANALYSES OF THE POEMS WHICH I OMITTED
translated_text: And if you have time, it would be a great service to translate the analyses of the poem which I admitted.

text: ON JANUARY TWENTY FIFTH HE WROTE MANY AND MANY THANKS FOR A MOST ESSENTIAL SERVICE MOST THOROUGHLY PERFORMED
translated_text: On January 25, he wrote, many and many thanks for a most essential service, most thoroughly performed.

text: MY NOTES WHICH YOU HAVE TAKEN THE TROUBLE OF REVISING ARE OF COURSE QUITE PALTRY AND USELESS
translated_text: My notes, which you have taken the trouble of revising, are, of course, quite paltry and useless.

text: IT IS THEREFORE AND ON ALL ACCOUNTS UNNECESSARY TO SAY MUCH MORE OF THE WORK HERE THAN IT SAYS FOR ITSELF
translated_text: It is therefore, and on all accounts, unnecessary to say much more of the work here than it says for itself.

text: THROUGHOUT THE VITA NUOVA THERE IS A STRAIN LIKE THE FIRST FALLING MURMUR WHICH REACHES THE EAR IN SOME REMOTE MEADOW AND PREPARES US TO LOOK UPON THE SEA
translated_text: Throughout the Vita Nwava there is a strain like the first falling murmur which reaches the ear in some remote meadow and prepares us to look upon the sea.

text: A WORD SHOULD BE SAID HERE OF THE TITLE OF DANTE'S AUTOBIOGRAPHY
translated_text: A word should be said here of the title of Dante's autobiography.

text: THIS HAS INDUCED SOME EDITORS OF THE VITA NUOVA TO EXPLAIN THE TITLE AS MEANING EARLY LIFE
translated_text: This has induced some editors of the Vita Nuava to explain the title as meaning early life.

text: THEREAFTER THIS SONNET BRED IN ME DESIRE TO WRITE DOWN IN VERSE FOUR OTHER THINGS TOUCHING MY CONDITION THE WHICH THINGS IT SEEMED TO ME THAT I HAD NOT YET MADE MANIFEST
translated_text: Thereafter, this sonnet bred in me desire to write down in verse four other things touching my condition, the which things it seemed to me that I had not yet made manifest.

text: WHICH THING BEING THUS THERE CAME A DAY WHEN CERTAIN LADIES TO WHOM IT WAS WELL KNOWN THEY HAVING BEEN WITH ME AT DIVERS TIMES IN MY TROUBLE WERE MET TOGETHER FOR THE PLEASURE OF GENTLE COMPANY
translated_text: which thing, being thus, there came a day when certain ladies to whom it was well known, they having been with me at diverse times in my trouble, were met together for the pleasure of gentle company.

text: BUT WHEN I STILL SPAKE NOT ONE OF THEM WHO BEFORE HAD BEEN TALKING WITH ANOTHER ADDRESSED ME BY MY NAME SAYING TO WHAT END LOVEST THOU THIS LADY SEEING THAT THOU CANST NOT SUPPORT HER PRESENCE
translated_text: But when I still speak not, one of them, who before had been talking with another, addressed me by my name, saying, to what end love us to vow this lady, saying that thou can't not support her presence.

text: AND NOW THAT IT HATH PLEASED HER TO DENY ME THIS LOVE MY MASTER OF HIS GREAT GOODNESS HATH PLACED ALL MY BEATITUDE THERE WHERE MY HOPE WILL NOT FAIL ME
translated_text: And now that it hath pleased her to deny me this, love my master of his great goodness, hath placed all my beattitude there, where my hope will not fail me.

text: THEN THOSE LADIES BEGAN TO TALK CLOSELY TOGETHER AND AS I HAVE SEEN SNOW FALL AMONG THE RAIN SO WAS THEIR TALK MINGLED WITH SIGHS
translated_text: Then those ladies began to talk closely together, and as I have seen snow fall among the rain, so was their talk mingled with size.

text: AND I DECLARE THAT WHEN I SPEAK THEREOF LOVE SHEDS SUCH PERFECT SWEETNESS OVER ME THAT IF MY COURAGE FAILED NOT CERTAINLY TO HIM MY LISTENERS MUST BE ALL RESIGN'D
translated_text: And I declare that when I speak thereof, love sheds such perfect sweetness over me, that if my courage failed not, certainly, to him my listeners must be all resigned.

text: WHATEVER HER SWEET EYES ARE TURNED UPON SPIRITS OF LOVE DO ISSUE THENCE IN FLAME WHICH THROUGH THEIR EYES WHO THEN MAY LOOK ON THEM PIERCE TO THE HEART'S DEEP CHAMBER EVERY ONE
translated_text: Whatever her sweet eyes are turned upon, spirits of love do issue thence and flame, which, through their eyes who then may look on them, pierce to the hard-steep chamber everyone.

text: TO HER I WEND ALONG IN WHOSE MUCH STRENGTH MY WEAKNESS IS MADE STRONG
translated_text: To her I went along, in whose much strength my weakness has made strong.

text: SO TO THE ROAD THOU SHALT BE RECONCILED AND FIND THE LADY AND WITH THE LADY LOVE
translated_text: So to the road thou shalt be reconciled, and find the Lady, and with the Lady, love.

text: THE SECOND BEGINS HERE AN ANGEL THE THIRD HERE DEAR SONG I KNOW
translated_text: The second begins here, an angel. The third here, dear song, I know.

text: THE FIRST PART IS DIVIDED INTO FOUR
translated_text: The first part is divided into four.

text: IN THE THIRD I SAY WHAT IT IS I PURPOSE TO SPEAK SO AS NOT TO BE IMPEDED BY FAINTHEARTEDNESS
translated_text: In the third, I say what it is I purpose to speak so as not to be impeded by faintheartedness.

text: IN THE FOURTH REPEATING TO WHOM I PURPOSE SPEAKING I TELL THE REASON WHY I SPEAK TO THEM
translated_text: and the fourth, repeating to whom my purpose speaking, I tell the reason why I speak to them.

text: IN THE SECOND I TELL WHAT IS UNDERSTOOD OF HER ON EARTH HERE MY LADY IS DESIRED
translated_text: In the second, I tell what is understood of her on earth. Here, my lady is desired.

text: THIS SECOND PART IS DIVIDED INTO TWO FOR IN THE FIRST I SPEAK OF HER AS REGARDS THE NOBLENESS OF HER SOUL RELATING SOME OF HER VIRTUES PROCEEDING FROM HER SOUL IN THE SECOND I SPEAK OF HER AS REGARDS THE NOBLENESS OF HER BODY NARRATING SOME OF HER BEAUTIES HERE LOVE SAITH CONCERNING HER
translated_text: The second part is divided into two. Four, and the first, I speak of her as regards the nobleness of her soul, relating some of her virtues proceeding from her soul. And the second, I speak of her as regards the nobleness of her body, narrating some of her beauties. Here, love's say at concerning her.

text: THIS SECOND PART IS DIVIDED INTO TWO FOR IN THE ONE I SPEAK OF THE EYES WHICH ARE THE BEGINNING OF LOVE IN THE SECOND I SPEAK OF THE MOUTH WHICH IS THE END OF LOVE
translated_text: This second part is divided into two. Four in the one, I speak of the eyes, which are the beginning of love, in the second I speak of the mouth, which is the end of love.

text: AND AT THE FIRST IT SEEMED TO ME THAT I SAW CERTAIN FACES OF WOMEN WITH THEIR HAIR LOOSENED WHICH CALLED OUT TO ME THOU SHALT SURELY DIE AFTER THE WHICH OTHER TERRIBLE AND UNKNOWN APPEARANCES SAID UNTO ME THOU ART DEAD
translated_text: And at the first it seemed to me that I saw certain faces of women with their hair loosened, which caught out to me, they'll shalt surely die. After the witch, other terrible and unknown appearances, said unto me, thou art dead.

text: AND SO STRONG WAS MY PHANTASY THAT I WEPT AGAIN IN VERY TRUTH AND SAID WITH MY TRUE VOICE O EXCELLENT SOUL HOW BLESSED IS HE THAT NOW LOOKETH UPON THEE
translated_text: And so strong was my fantasy, that I wept again in very truth, and said with my true voice, Oh, excellent soul, how blessed is he that now look at the pondy?

text: WHEREBY OTHER LADIES WHO WERE ABOUT THE ROOM BECOMING AWARE OF MY DISCOMFORT BY REASON OF THE MOAN THAT SHE MADE WHO INDEED WAS OF MY VERY NEAR KINDRED LED HER AWAY FROM WHERE I WAS AND THEN SET THEMSELVES TO AWAKEN ME THINKING THAT I DREAMED AND SAYING SLEEP NO LONGER AND BE NOT DISQUIETED
translated_text: where by other ladies who were about the room, becoming aware of my discomfort by reason of the moan that she made, who, indeed, was of my very near kindred, led her away from where I was, and then set themselves to awaken me, thinking that I dreamed and sang, sleepin' along her and be not disquieted.

text: WHEN BEING AROUSED I OPENED MINE EYES AND KNEW THAT IT HAD BEEN A DECEPTION
translated_text: When being aroused, I opened my eyes, and knew that it had been a deception.

text: AND MY HUE WAS SUCH THAT THEY LOOK'D AT EACH OTHER AND THOUGHT OF DEATH SAYING UNDER THEIR BREATH MOST TENDERLY O LET US COMFORT HIM THEN UNTO ME WHAT DREAM WAS THINE THAT IT HATH SHAKEN THEE SO MUCH
translated_text: In my hew was such that they looked at each other and thought of death, saying under their breath, most tenderly, O let us comfort him. Then unto me, what dream was thine that it hath shaken thee so much?

text: AND THEREWITHAL SUCH A BEWILDERMENT POSSESS'D ME THAT I SHUT MINE EYES FOR PEACE AND IN MY BRAIN DID CEASE ORDER OF THOUGHT AND EVERY HEALTHFUL THING
translated_text: And therewithal such a bewilderment possessed me that I shut my eyes for peace. And in my brain did cease order of thought and every healthful thing.

text: THEN SAW I MANY BROKEN HINTED SIGHTS IN THE UNCERTAIN STATE I STEPP'D INTO
translated_text: Then saw I, many broken hinted sights, in the uncertain state I stepped into.

text: THESE WILDERING PHANTASIES THEN CARRIED ME TO SEE MY LADY DEAD
translated_text: These willering fantasies then carried me to see my lady dead.

text: THE SECOND PART BEGINS HERE I WAS A THINKING THE FIRST PART DIVIDES INTO TWO
translated_text: The second part begins here. I was thinking. The first part divides into two.

text: THIS LADY'S RIGHT NAME WAS JOAN BUT BECAUSE OF HER COMELINESS OR AT LEAST IT WAS SO IMAGINED SHE WAS CALLED OF MANY PRIMAVERA SPRING AND WENT BY THAT NAME AMONG THEM
translated_text: This lady's right name was Joan, but because of her comeliness, or at least it was so imagined, she was called of many primavera, spring, and went by that name among them.

text: AND IN HIS SPEECH HE LAUGH'D AND LAUGH'D AGAIN THEN WHILE IT WAS HIS PLEASURE TO REMAIN I CHANCED TO LOOK THE WAY HE HAD DRAWN NEAR AND SAW THE LADIES JOAN AND BEATRICE APPROACH ME THIS THE OTHER FOLLOWING ONE AND A SECOND MARVEL INSTANTLY
translated_text: And in his speech he laughed and laughed again, then, while it was his pleasure to remain, I chanced to look the way he had drawn near, and saw the ladies' Joan and Beatrice approach me. This the other following, one in a second marvel instantly.

text: THE SECOND PART BEGINS HERE SAYING BE NOW THE THIRD HERE THEN WHILE IT WAS HIS PLEASURE
translated_text: The second part begins here, saying, be now. The third here, then, while it was his pleasure.

text: HE LIVES THY LOSS HE DIES FROM EVERY LIMB MANGLED BY THEE LIGHTNINGS OF GODHEAD SHINE FROM WHICH THY DARKNESS HATH NOT WHERE TO HIDE
translated_text: He lives thy loss. He dies from every limb mangled by thee, Lightnings of God had shine, from which thy darkness hath not where to hide.

text: QUINCI IMPARA A STUPIRTI
translated_text: Quinci impara astupirti.

text: IN FLESH WAS RAIMENTED HOW HE WAS KILLED AND BURIED FROM THE DEAD HOW HE AROSE TO LIFE WITH VICTORY AND REIGNED IN HEAVEN HOW ALL OF US SHALL BE GLORIOUS LIKE HIM WHOSE HEARTS TO HIS ARE WED HOW THEY WHO DIE FOR LOVE OF REASON GIVE HYPOCRITES TYRANTS SOPHISTS ALL WHO SELL THEIR NEIGHBOURS ILL FOR HOLINESS TO HELL HOW THE DEAD SAINT CONDEMNS THE BAD WHO LIVE HOW ALL HE DOES BECOMES A LAW FOR MEN HOW HE AT LAST TO JUDGE SHALL COME AGAIN
translated_text: and flesh was ramented. How he was killed and buried from the dead, how he arose to life with victory, and reigned in heaven, how all of us shall be glorious like him whose hearts to his are wed, how they who die for love of reason give hypocrites, tyrants, softest, all who sell their neighbor's ill for holiness to hell. How the dead's saint condemns the bad who live, how all he does becomes a law for men, how he lasts to judge shall come again.

text: THIS WORLD'S THICK VAPOURS WHELM YOUR EYES UNWORTHY OF THAT GLORIOUS SHOW BLIND TO HIS SPLENDOUR BENT UPON HIS SHAME
translated_text: The world's thick vapors willm your eyes unworthy of that glorious show. Blind his splendor, bent upon his shame.

text: MONEY IS FALSE AND LIGHT UNLESS IT BE BOUGHT BY A MAN'S OWN WORTHY QUALITIES AND BLOOD IS SUCH THAT ITS CORRUPT DISEASE AND IGNORANT PRETENCE ARE FOUL TO SEE
translated_text: Money is false and light unless it be bought by a man's own worthy qualities. And blood is such that its corrupt disease and ignorant pretence are foul to see.

text: IL POPOLO E UNA BESTIA
translated_text: The popular and the best.

text: THE PEOPLE IS A BEAST OF MUDDY BRAIN THAT KNOWS NOT ITS OWN FORCE AND THEREFORE STANDS LOADED WITH WOOD AND STONE THE POWERLESS HANDS OF A MERE CHILD GUIDE IT WITH BIT AND REIN ONE KICK WOULD BE ENOUGH TO BREAK THE CHAIN BUT THE BEAST FEARS AND WHAT THE CHILD DEMANDS IT DOES NOR ITS OWN TERROR UNDERSTANDS CONFUSED AND STUPEFIED BY BUGBEARS VAIN
translated_text: The people is a beast of muddy brain, that knows not its own force, and therefore stands loaded with wood and stone, the powerless hands of a mere child guided with bit and rain. One kick would be enough to break the chain, but the beast fears, and what the child demands. It does. Nor its own terror understands, confused and stupified by Bugbear's vein.

text: MOST WONDERFUL
translated_text: Most wonderful.

text: THAT PENANCE HATH NO BLAME WHICH MAGDALEN FOUND SWEET PURGING OUR SHAME SELF PUNISHMENT IS VIRTUE ALL MEN KNOW
translated_text: That penance hath no blame, which Magdalene found sweet, purging our shame. Self-punishment is virtue, all men know.

text: ORGAN OF RUT NOT REASON IS THE LORD WHO FROM THE BODY POLITIC DOTH DRAIN LUST FOR HIMSELF INSTEAD OF TOIL AND PAIN LEAVING US LEAN AS CRICKETS ON DRY SWARD
translated_text: Organ of rut, not reason, is the Lord who from the body politic, doth drain, lost for himself, instead of toil and pain, leaving us lean as crickets on dry sward.

text: WELL TOO IF HE LIKE LOVE WOULD FILCH OUR HOARD WITH PLEASURE TO OURSELVES SLUICING OUR VEIN AND VIGOUR TO PERPETUATE THE STRAIN OF LIFE BY SPILTH OF LIFE WITHIN US STORED
translated_text: Well too if he, like love, would filter our horde, with pleasure to ourselves, sluicing our vein and vigor to perpetuate the strain of life by spilth of life within us stored.

text: HEAVEN HELP THAT BODY WHICH A LITTLE MIND HOUSED IN A HEAD LACKING EARS TONGUE AND EYES AND SENSELESS BUT FOR SMELL CAN TYRANNISE
translated_text: Heaven helped that body, which a little mind housed in a head lacking ears, tongue, and eyes, and senseless but for smell can tyrannize.

text: DUE TO THEE THEIR PRAISE OF MAIDEN PURE OF TEEMING MOTHERHOOD
translated_text: Due to the their praise of maiden pure, of teaming motherhood.

text: THOU LIKE ARCTURUS STEADFAST IN THE SKIES WITH TARDY SENSE GUIDEST THY KINGDOM FAIR BEARING ALONE THE LOAD OF LIBERTY
translated_text: Val like Arcturus, steadfast in the skies, with tardy scents, guide us to thy kingdom fair, bearing alone the load of liberty.
